name: Vaporaria
description: Welcome to Vaporaria, a steampunk miniature game where the destiny of the world of Lyzarbhi is in your hands. In this game you will lead a group of steam mechas against terrible alien invaders: the Tripedem. Also, you will live battles and campaigns of this war. There are two types of game: skirmishes or a full campaign. Its a strategic and fun game of action, quick, and easy to learn rules. With a lot of scenarios, a campaign and a rich lore. For two players.

name: Munchkin Triple Play: Set 1
description:
Munchkin Triple Play: Set 1 consists of three Munchkin booster packs previously sold separately:


Munchkin Naughty & Nice: Add some holiday spirit to your Munchkin game!
Munchkin Skullkickers: The hit Image comic comes to Munchkin!
Munchkin Booty: Fish & Ships: More Ships and more Sharks for Munchkin Booty!


As with the individual boosters, Munchkin Triple Play: Set 1 is an expansion for a Munchkin standalone game, not something playable on its own. The cards included are neither collectible nor randomized.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: AT-43 Unit Box: Steel Troopers
description:
There are bad soldiers and good soldiers, and then there are the steel troopers.
Training manual, page 2.

The steel troopers are the pride of White Stars, the symbol of their strength and efficiency. The steel troopers are exceptional professional soldiers equipped with the best weapons made by mankind, they are military efficiency embodied. Their task: lead the White Stars armies from the frontline and pierce the enemy lines to deal fire and death.

Steel trooper units are the base on which the White Stars army is built. In their standard configuration, the five fighters are equipped with laser rifles, giving them one hell of a range to wipe the enemy before he even gets into shooting position. The dreaded missile launcher works marvels against amored vehicles.

For further tactical possibilities, one of them can become a Sergeant.

Contents:
• Box of 6 miniatures + 6 alternative heads
• 3 cards : Steel trooper x2, Steel trooper Sgt.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Action-Mat Football
description:
Action-Mat Football is a tabletop dexterity game themed after American Football. Players advance the ball along the playing surface (a 30 x 65 inch mat representing a football field) by flicking it with their fingers, thus causing it to slide on the playing surface. Each flick of the ball represents a play.

Prior to executing each play the offensive player chooses which type of play to use and determines where on the field he will place the individual members of his team. Simultaneously the defensive player places his individual team members on the field, in an attempt to guess the offensive play. After the defensive player has placed his tokens the offensive player then places his tokens according to the play previously chosen.

As in real football, the offensive player has four general options on each play: passing, running, punting or attempting a field goal.

In order for a pass play to be successful the offensive player must flick the ball, causing it to slide along the playing surface, ultimately contacting one of his own tokens. The player tokens consist of flat cardstock and when the ball token slides over top of them they tend to slide along with the ball token. When the ball stops sliding, if there is only an offensive player's token still caught underneath it, the play resulted in a pass completion. If there are one or more player tokens from each team, the pass was incomplete. If one or more tokens from the defensive team remain under the ball token, with no tokens from the offensive team, the pass was intercepted.

Running plays are not executed by sliding the ball. Instead both players secretly deploy their individual player tokens to any of the multiple eligible running lanes on the field. If the offensive player deployed his ball carrier to a running lane that was left unguarded by the defensive player, then he simply rolls three dice with the result being the number of yards gained on the play. If the lane is guarded by a defensive player, then both players roll a single die, and the yards gained (or lost) is determined by subtracting the defender's result from the offensive player's result.

Punting is performed by sliding the ball token down the field. If the ball slides into the endzone the receiving player can choose to start their drive at the 20-yard line, or attempt to return the punt by rolling dice to determine yardage.

Field goals are made by finger-flicking the ball token into the air and through a set of plastic uprights.

name: Lucca!
description: In the 14th century, the fiercely independent republic of Lucca became the site of bitter rivalries between warring families. But vying for political power wasn't enough. Crammed together inside the city walls, Lucca's noble families built great towers--some spent their entire fortunes--jostling with one another to reach the tallest heights and gain the perfect view of the Tuscan countryside. Build towers to maximize your View of the countryside around Lucca while obstructing the Views of your opponents. The game ends when all of Lucca has been filled, and the player with the most total View wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, City Building, Territory Building

name: Vogel-Würfel-Spiel
description:
Objective: Gain most victory points by achieving valuable parts of a bird, acting by turns.

A beautiful bird (composed of paperboard parts with spots of dice/numbered from 2 to 12) is arranged first.

Active player throws the dice and may take a corresponding part if there are still any; another roll is allowed if first one was successful. Some inner parts may be taken only if all surrounding ones are gone.

Notes:
Likely published before WWII
publishers: Fa. Hugo Schütze, Hugo Gräfe Verlag

name: Pentominoes
description:
Pentominoes was described by Solomon W. Golomb in a talk to the Harvard Mathematics Club in 1953, which was later published in American Mathematical Monthly and in Scientific American. Pentomino puzzles had been described before, but it was Golomb who coined the name and described a game for one to three players. Others have published their own variations, but the game described by Golomb consisted of an 8 x 8 grid of squares and a set of twelve pentominoes. Players take turns placing the pentominoes on the board, taking care not to overlap the pieces or to use a tile more than once. The last player to place a pentomino on the board wins the game.

Note: A separate database page exists for the 10 x 10 grid version of Pentominoes, as published by Taskmaster Ltd.
publishers: (Self-Published), Granna, LuduScience, Project Genius, Pyramo, Springbok

name: POT: The Card Game
description:
Each round, trade and negotiate with other players to collect 7 grams (7 cards) of the same strain of cannabis to obtain the highest amount of points possible. Once all 7 grams are in your hand, yell “Holdin’!” For that round you receive the number of points that strain is worth. If you are "Holdin'!" with the Piece Card, this doubles your points for that round. If you are left with the Seeds Card, this deducts 20 from your points that round. First player to reach 420 points total wins!

POT: The Card Game is a fast-paced, lively game full of frantic trading and bartering with other players. There are no "turns" in POT so you'll never have to wait your turn or forget who went last, etc. It’s hard to believe how fun this game really is, POT will turn any circle or party into a special one and with 52 poker sized cards, including the rules, tucked neatly into one attractive box, you can carry POT anywhere!

name: Kooky Teenage Monster Hunters
description:
Modified from the publisher:

Kooky Teenage Monster Hunters is a lighter take on the Horror genre. In this Fear and Faith supplement, the good guys are on a much better footing. The forces of evil need to fear those among their prey who are willing to risk all to face them in the dark of the night… especially if they fight monsters with a sword in one hand and a pizza slice in the other!

This supplement is a take on a TV shows and movies with groups of uncommonly attractive, angst-ridden teenagers (all with unlikely “relationship problems”) who juggle going to College with fighting a town full of hellish monsters, while still managing to get their assignments done… and of course dealing with the “relationship problems” they will forget about two minutes after leaving Campus!

This supplement contains:
Over 30 new Special Rules compatible with other Ganesha Games products
All new scenarios and battles, compatible with Fear & Faith
Over a dozen setting specific advances to keep your monster hunting campaign from getting too serious
Over 100 new profiles for monsters and monster hunters
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Dotto
description:
Based on the 1958-1960 ITV quiz show of the same name, which in turn was based on the short-lived 1958 CBS/NBC "Scandal-Rigged" American game show of the same name.

Players only get to join dots by answering questions on specific subjects. The harder the question attempted, the more dots the player is entitled to join together on that turn. After joining 25 dots the host sets the first clue to help identify the picture. A second clue was given at 35 dots, and a final clue at 40 dots. These clues should be written by the host and disclosed only to the relevant player.

A player calls "Dotto" if the picture is recognized at any stage of the game. The answer is given and written to the host, undisclosed to their opponent. More points are awarded for earlier recognition as each unconnected dot earned 5 points. A player must give the name of the picture to the host once all the dots are joined. The host announces whether the guess is correct or not. If correct, the second player has one attempt to guess and so draw the game. If drawn the game is repeated.

Alternative games can be played such as double Dotto where the value of the dots is doubled. If a player gives an incorrect answer the game is over. The opponent received no points but is victorious and remains to fight a new challenger. Any number of rounds may be played, at the end of which the player with the highest points scored is the winner.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Trivia, Word Game

name: The Young Queen's Palimpsest
description:
Players are scholars and scribes poring over (studying, scribbling, erasing, more scribbling) an ancient manuscript. By playing cards to the free-form play area and then placing cubes on them to record their contributions, they hope to have their work be recognized by the Queen at story time.

Scoring is similar to Acquire, where the person with the most cubes scores the normal value of a card, and the second-most gets half that value. This scoring is triggered when someone plays a card with a low enough rank -- the more workers on a card, the more likely it'll get scored by a particular play.

The number of workers you place each turn is based on the number of matching suits touched by the card you play. This leads to natural clusters of suits, shaped implicitly by the opinionated nature of the deck.

When the deck runs out, or a player runs out of workers, or a player reaches 100 points, the game ends with a final scoring round. The player with the most points is the winner.

name: A Domino Double Header
description:
A ziplock package containing two games for solo or partication play.

"The Elephant in the Room" by Graham Evans is a cooperative game in which the players take the role of velites (Roman light infantry) trying to kill or drive off a Carthaginian war elephant, controlled by the game system, before it can contact the Roman heavy infantry.

The game lasts about 30 minutes and requires four sets of dominoes.

"Greyhounds in the Slips" by Phil Steele is inspired by Shakespeare's description of the Siege of Harfleur in "Henry V". A variant of the Society of Ancients' game Anno Domino, the aim for Henry is to get his men to storm the breach in the wall of Harfleur, while the French player must attempt to hold him off.

The game requires two sets of dominoes.

name: Impact
description:
Impact is an archaeological card game for two or more players. The main goal of each player is to use game cards inspired by the world of archaeological science and collect so called scientific points.

The first player who reaches the required amount of scientific points wins the game. Obtaining those points depends on the abilities of individual cards (and their combinations), that are used for construction of gaming decks. These cards are divided into five main card types. A player can play artecafts, archaeological sites, scientists, event cards and cards of so called written sources. Cards are also divided in unique and non-unique categories (unique means that you can play a card just once, non-unique cards can be played multiple times) and temporary (especially event cards) and permanent cards. Every player owns his or her own constructed deck, whose construction and the ability to defeat an opponent depends clearly on his or her combinational skill and his or her own inventiveness.
During the game players draw cards from their decks and play them from their hands. They can play cards to support their gaming strategy or to disturb the opponent's game.

The game primarily serves as an instrument of popularization and education in archaeology.

name: Ragondins
description:
"Fed up with being undressed in order to dress the human beings!"

In 1930, after a century of slavery on the cattle farms, the coypus flee. Will they manage to survive in nature? Finding food, building a shelter, resisting floods and mostly avoiding being poisoned by unhappy neighbors: such is the price of freedom!

Ragondins (French for "coypus", a.k.a. river rats) is a trick-taking game. Each round, each player in turn places a card from his hand on top of the first player's card, playing the same color card if possible. Whoever places the highest valued card of this color wins the trick and plays again. The food cards are positive and the shelters protect the food; the flood cards are negative and wash away first the shelters, then the food, from a player's collected cards. Some food is poisoned and costs you points, so try not to grab that! Whoever has the highest score after seven rounds wins.

name: Tile Pile
description:
Get ready to exercise your fingers and your mind. Tile Pile is a Memory / Dexterity game in which players must locate lettered tiles in order to complete words and score points. Simple rules and quick gameplay make this game a fun learning tool for children and excellent party game for adults.

There are 3 Matches in the game. Each Match has 3 Rounds. Players are given cards of varying difficulty. In each Round, players search for letters to complete words of the same difficulty. First to finish hits the bell and the Round ends. Points are scored and tallied and the game continues. After the end of the third match, the game ends and final scores are totaled.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Robinson Crusoe Game
description:
A vintage game (1961 or 1962) for up to four players who move a little boat around a series of Islands in search of Robinson Crusoe and Friday.

On a player's turn he or she spins the arrow and will move either the ship or his pawn that many spaces. The ship moves in a circle around a series of islands stopping at a pier on each island where a player can leave the ship and then move point to point across the island to a location where a counter is placed.

Most counters are blank on the reverse side. There are however two counters (one for Robinson Crusoe, and another for his man Friday). When the player finds both locations, which he keeps secret from his opponents, he must then take the ship back to the starting island and declare where he believes the Crusoe and Friday counters are located.

There are a total of 10 counters placed face down on ten different locations (one on each of 10 islands). The spinner also has two spaces which indicate the player should draw a card instead of move a certain number of spaces. The cards either direct the player to "move the ship to any island", or move the Pawn directly to any island without having to use the ship to carry his pawn.
mechanics: Memory, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ranger: Actions at the Objective Expansion Kit
description:
This expansion is a CD with separate pdf files for each mission for the base game and Sierra & Victor expansions. Each file is a full page with the mission's objective, an enlarged map of the objective, and symbol references specific to the mission. Also included is a mission sequence diagram for the extended patrols.

Examples:

Mission 3
Mission 12


This is a digital collection of existing materials with improved formatting, collated onto individual pages for ease of use.

name: Battle for the Suns
description: Battle for the Suns is a game for The Mystique Deck, in which 2–4 players make cumulative blind bids for suns. Each round, a card is revealed from a deck of suns, then each player secretly selects a card to bid for it. A card's bid value is its face value (1–5) + 1 for each attribute that matches the sun card. There are three turns of bid accumulation each round, after which whoever has the highest total bid takes the sun card; however, players can drop out after the first or second bid, leaving the sun to the last man standing.

name: Whirlwind
description:
Whirlwind is a connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an even-sized square grid (board). The recommended board sizes are between 12×12 and 20×20 points. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white.

At the start of the game, some black and white stones are arranged on the board in an interspersed pattern such that every stone (except those on the edges of the board) is a knight's jump away from four enemy stones and a large knight's jump away from four friendly stones. Only symmetrical setups are allowed. On every board size, two different symmetrical setups exist (see the pictures).



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place one or two stones of your color on empty points of the board. On their first turn, Black can only place one stone.

At the end of your turn, for any two diagonally adjacent stones of your color there must be another stone of your color adjacent to both.

You win by completing a chain of orthogonally connected stones of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color. Draws are not possible.



NotesThe ban on diagonal connections as a means to prevent deadlocks on square connection games was introduced in Corey Clark's Slither.
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Merchant Marine
description:
Merchant Marine is a strategic board game of free-for-all cargo recovery and competitive naval maneuvering. Players race to collect goods from a sinking vessel and return them to the appropriate port, but must stay out of range of their rivals' hungry cannons in the process.

Recovered goods can be returned to any port for a small number of points, or they can be taken to that good's matching port for a large number of points. You can stockpile as many goods as you want before returning to port, but taking on too many goods will reduce your vessel's speed. Players must be realistic about the port they can reach before their rivals are upon them.

The ships in Merchant Marine act like large ships should -- they are hard to stop and cannot turn on a dime. Players must wrestle with these limitations even while exploiting the same weaknesses in their rivals. Run down another player to steal their precious cargo for yourself, or raise your sails in a desperate bid to outrun a more encumbered vessel.

The player with the most points when the final load of goods has been recovered from the sinking ship is the winner.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Spaß am Erfolg: Karriere, Das Millionenspiel, Risiko
description:
Buchclub version: German compilation of Risk, Careers, Das Millionenspiel, all based on editions by Schmidt.

In Risk, players have army units that they place onto a map of the world. On a player's turn, they use their units to attack other players' positions, hopefully with superior numbers. Combat is a simple dice rolling affair that stresses attrition, and reinforcements are given to players who collect sets of cards.

Careers is a game where the players set their own victory conditions. A player may choose to pursue Fame, Happiness, Money, or a combination of all three. The limitation being that the total number of "points" earned in the 3 categories must total 60. eg. 60 Happiness, 0 Fame, 0 Money; 20 of each; or any other combination. The players endeavor to fulfill their goal by going through any number of different "occupation paths". All paths have some prerequisite for entry, and benefits accrue from going through any of the paths more than once. The different occupations are designed to be suited to different strategies, eg. Hollywood is good for fame points, while "Going to Sea" is good for happiness. In the end it is the player (or team of players) who gets to their pre-set goal first who will be the winner, and achieve everything they ever wanted in life.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Perfect Match
description:
The match box was dropped and all the matches are mixed up. The goal of the game is to find as many matching pairs as possible. The game plays similar to the classic memory game Concentration, but there are a few twists.

Half of the cards will be face down and the rest will be face up. The start player will lay down the cards in a 3x3 grid. Each player should look at the cards as they are being put down, as it is important to remember the cards & placement. Just like in the classic memory game, the players try to find a matching pair. Whoever says "match!" gets a try. When the cards match, that player takes the cards, which will score at the end of the game. If 2 different cards are picked, these go to the discard pile and the player receives one of the yellow burning matches. If no one else sees another match, the remaining cards are reshuffled and the next player places them in the grid.

The game ends when all cards have been claimed, or if the 5 burning matches are in play. The player with the most cards wins.

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Old Europe / 51st State
description: Age of Steam Expansion: Old Europe / 51st State is a new pair of expansions for use with the Age of Steam base game. Each expansion features a non-hex-based map for use by experienced AoS players.

name: Dust Tactics: SSU Battlegroup Koshka Starter Set
description:
The year is 1947. The war that started a decade ago has now spread worldwide. The discovery of a crashed alien spacecraft in the Antarctic has led to the development of revolutionary combat walkers that surpass the most advanced tank technology. Old alliances have fragmented and new ones arisen as three major blocs, the Allies, the Axis and the Sino-Soviet Union (SSU) fight the world over for VK, a valuable new resource that power their new fighting machines.

Dust Tactics is a miniatures board game for 2 or more players. The SSU Battlegroup Koshka starter set contains everything you need to start playing Dust Tactics, including 10 highly-detailed plastic miniatures, unit cards, terrain elements, special Dust dice, and the Dust rulebook. Enter the world of Dust and lead your SSU Battlegroup into battle against Axis or Allied Battlegroups.

Note: The rules and cards in this box are based on the version 2 rules, but are slightly different from and not completely compatible with the full Dust Tactics version 2 rulebook.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Magical Circle
description:
The game is involving pattern recognition & building. Players act as students of the school of magic and wizardry, who compete with one another to learn new magic. Each player will join three different magical circles, and determine the number of times of path conversion made within the time limit, to quickly change the magical element into the correct magical circles. It is a game where speed of thought is contested.
The number of times of path conversion is controlled by cards, so players need to be aware whether or not there are suitable cards to use, or if one thinks too fast but lacks a usable card, he or she will have a small price to pay.

name: Trouble Maker
description: Trouble Maker is a pattern building game. Players will exchange game tokens within 8 rounds to get rid of the trouble maker and earn points. When Trouble Makers of the same color form a line, then that line counts as one riddance. If after a game token is flipped over, more Trouble Makers create a line, then the player can continue to flip over more tokens to count as riddance points. The fun of the games is to create multiple lines everywhere and earn very high scores. Trouble Maker is a two player game, so enjoy the fun of continuous good riddance and win points!

name: Mage Wars: Bloodwave Greatbow Promo Card
description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized play

Bloodwave Greatbow

Creature
Cost 12 Mana
Health 11
Armor 0
Defense 9+

Quick Attack (Dagger): Melee, 2 Dice

Full Attack (Greatbow): Ranged 1-2, 4 Dice

When Bloodwave Greatbow is affected by a friendly command spell, his Greatbow attack gains +2 until the end of the round.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Zoophoria
description:
A game of Zoophoria takes place over seven rounds, representing one week. Players start with four animals, three employees and two secret targets. Each day, a new selection of animals, employees, buildings, food supplies, targets and more will be available. Players will draft three items from the 19 available as new additions to their habitat. Strategy and planning must be used to create a habitat that can manage the daily food, virus and trash production. If the growing collection of animals is fed and remain healthy, and the habitat is kept clean, visitors will come to enjoy the zoo.

Over 90 unique animals from around the world available to build your habitat. Earn extra visitors by creating themed exhibits containing mammals, reptiles, birds, endangered species and more.

Over 50 unique employees and buildings are available to provide assistance. Upgrade or add a new Keeper to produce more food. Install trash cans and recycling bins to keep the zoo clean. Enlist Veterinarians to ensure animals don’t get sick. Add restaurants, photo spots, souvenir stands or other guest services to attract even more visitors.

The player who attracts the most visitors to the zoo will win the challenge and earn the title, Director of Zoophoria.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Kingsmen
description:
The King’s brother is looking for a few good men to help him in his cause to be king. Each player is either a loyal guard or an assassin. You must find and work with the other assassin to kill the king or find and stop the assassins.

Each player starts with the same hand but must master how to play it. Each card helps tell a little of what your opponents are up to. As assassin, it’s vital to find your partner and go for the assassination of the king. Or, as guards you must block the assassins. Each round the characters are switched and you have to reread all the players all over again.

A 4 player deduction game without bluffing. The more you play the crazier it gets. As soon as you learn a strategy to beat your opponents the quicker they adapt a new one.

name: Darkest Crusade
description:
This is a relatively fast, simple (introductory) hex-and-counter FREE print-and-play boardgame about the 22Jun41 Axis invasion of Russia, using my 1984 Dark Crusade's popular firing point combat system (also used in my games Tiger Attack! and Eagle Attack!) - upgunned 50% for fewer battle rounds - plus (infantry unit flip-side) fortification. No Zones of Control, per se.

Combat results are unusually unpredictable, making the game good for solitaire play.

There is an abstracted, mini version of the units - order of battle - which I personally prefer.

Because the combat is hex-side, the map should be made at least 22" wide.

It is corps-army level - also with air and naval fleet and air units - having monthly turns with Blitzkrieg/breakthrough possibilities, initially for Germans in Good weather.

It includes the Finnish front, although it is up to the Axis player whether or not Finland becomes active.

The Operation Barbarossa scenario is typically 2-3 hours long - shorter with 4 players. Darkest Crusade can go longer if players wish to continue the game past April 1942
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Kathmandu
description:
The Object

To score the most points after three rounds by arranging the entire hand into melds.

Materials

52 card regular deck
22 tokens in two colors, 5 red and 17 blue
A way of keeping score

The Deck

A 52 card regular deck, ranked A-K-Q-J-10-9-8-7-6-5-4-3-2-A.

The Deal

The dealer shuffles the deck and one at a time deals out face down 10 cards to each player. The rest of the cards are placed face down in the center of the table forming the draw deck. Also each player takes 1 red token and places it in front of them.

Next place the remaining 3 red tokens adjacent to the draw deck and spaced about a card width apart from each other on the tableau. Then draw 2 cards from the draw deck placing them face up and adjacent to the red tokens.

The blue tokens are placed nearby so that both players can easily reach them.

Melds

Melds come in two flavors.

Group – Three or four cards with different suits and the same rank.
Sequence – Three or more cards of the same suit with ranks in sequential order.

The Play

The game is played in three rounds.

The non-dealer starts turns alternate.

A player on her turn must take one of the following actions.

1. Exchange a meld from your hand with a blue token, these cards are placed face down forming a discard pile or

2. Exchange an equal number of cards from your hand with red tokens from the tableau, these cards are placed face up to the tableau or

3. Take all of the red tokens from the tableau, replacing them with an equal number of cards from the draw deck, these cards are placed face up to the tableau or

4. Exchange any number of red tokens in your possession with an equal number of cards to the tableau or

5. Exchange any two cards from the tableau with two cards from your hand or

6. Take a red token from the tableau and replace it with a card from the draw deck, this card is placed face up to the tableau.

Players may have no more than 10 cards in their hands during play.

The game ends when either the draw deck is empty or all the blue tokens have been taken.

Scoring

Each blue token is worth 5 points each. Each red token is worth -2 points each and each card left in a player’s hand is worth -1 point each. Tally each player’s scores per round. Then tally each player’s final scores per round, the player with the highest score wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Flames of War: Great War
description:
Great War is Battlefront's expansion of their Flames of War rules, adapting them from WW2 to reflect combat in WW1, specifically focusing on 1918.

The rules are provided as a 37 page supplement that requires the 3rd edition core FoW rulebook in order to use. Battlefront is supporting the Great War rules with two initial opposing forces: Germans and British. These two armies will be available around the August/September 2014 timeframe and will include infantry centric forces supported by artillery and small sections of armored tanks.

name: Gambit 7: Le Mini Jeu de Démo
description:
Promotional pack of that can be used as a stand alone mini game or as an expension for Days of Wonder's gambit 7.

Contains:
- 1 rule card.
- 7 game cards (#101-107) not found in the base game.

name: Giant
description:
In the fast-moving, easy-to-learn game Giant, players draft cards that can become troops in their army to fight six giants that have attacked the kingdom. The giants are large stand-up boards with punch-out circles representing hits to the head, torso, arm, or feet.

Tokens are shaken in a cup and placed in a pool on the table. One side of the tokens is a color matching each player with a number, and the other side has a magic, weapon, or gold symbol. Players draft tokens With the gold they hire their army, with the magic they fuel their wizards, and with the weapon they activate their fighters. Once a giant is hit, the striking player gets the punch token. When a giant is dead, players roll dice, based on their punch tokens, for victory points or more fuel tokens. If the numbers showing on the tokens when they come out of the cup equal 7 for any particular player, that player has a troop killed in combat.

name: UPGRADE!
description:
An absorbing business strategy game with an IT theme...

Each player receives a set of four business areas with randomly drawn starting user-groups. Now you have just 18 moves to get the very best IT into your company and earn the most business value. Gain influence by extending your user-group size. Use your influence wisely to stay out of debt and progress in your mission. Choose what solutions you want to install in each business area and if/when to integrate them. The clock's ticking, your resources are limited and your opponents may just back you into a corner. Tough decisions and long-term strategies pay off as long as you don't get drawn into foolhardy investments.
mechanics: Action/Event, Simulation, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Bedpans & Broomsticks: Crazy Closets
description:
This official Mayfair promo expansion is included on a tile sheet titled: Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #10, which can be found in issue #175 of GTM.

Includes two closet tiles.

Use all of the rules for Bedpans & Broomsticks with the following additions:

During setup, place the two Crazy Closets tiles by the play area.
When drawing a new tile, a player can opt to draw a closet tile instead.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.K.S. Ning'Tao Klingon Expansion Pack
description:
This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The IKS Ning'tao was a Klingon Bird-of-Prey that was in service with the Klingon Defense Force in the late 24th century. The Ning'tao was one of the five ships in General Martok's raiding party of 2375.

I.K.S. Ning'Tao Klingon Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 15 expansion packs from WizKids Games.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Gran Derby
description:
Game of horse racing up to 9 players (but there are 10 horses).
With the smart card play the player who cuts the finish line first win.
The cards have values ​​of movement from 1 to 7, there are some cards that double movement and others that allow you to stand still waiting for a better time to launch the sprint.
It is not uncommon that a horse can not move or should move in an illegal manner because of the blocks of the opponent and then be disqualified.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Assimilated Vessel 64758 Dominion/Borg Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 3 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, Resistance is Futile.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Bulwark: Refugees from Chthonic Darkness
description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

What slithers in the lightless crevices far underground? These things do, these mockeries of life, these horrors. Fight them as they slip into inhabited territory, fading in and out of sight like smoke and shadows. Feel your very mind assaulted by their presence, even if no blade or magic strikes out at you. Beat them back, or even reason itself might be over-run.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Bulwark: One Shall Stand
description:
From publisher description:

Go It Alone

You don't need friends to cause mayhem on the battlefield. If you like taking a lone Bulwark Hero into battle, then this pack has you covered. It includes three replacement card types for existing decks (Zsuzsa and Sandor from the base set plus the Tower of Secret Lore from Travails of the Arcane) that work better when there is just a single Hero fighting. It also includes 5 solo challenges, custom Foe decks with cards taken from all sets pre-Twisting Passages.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Fight!
description:
A fast-paced 2 player card game of risk and luck. Punch, kick, parry and dodge your way to victory!

Fight! is a 2 player game that can be played with a standard deck of cards. Each of the 4 suits represents a different fighting move, either punch, kick, parry or dodge. Each move beats another move; for example, punch beats dodge, but parry beats punch.

Every turn, both players simultaneously play the card that they think has the best chance of beating their opponent's card. The winner gets some points, and the first fighter to get 13 points wins the round.

The first player to win 3 rounds wins the fight!

Fight is currently a creative commons licensed free game that can be played with a standard deck of cards. A commercial release with expanded rules and a custom deck with original graphics is currently in the works.

name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Guild (Wave 1)
description: We're entering a new world of hurt and this box contains all the guns, swords , and brutality you will need for you to survive your next fight. Inside, you will find every single stat and upgrade card for Guild featured in the second edition book. Now fight for your spot at the top of this twisted food chain.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: Mage Wars: Kumanjaran Leopard Promo Card
description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized play. This is part of the Menace of Runation story arc.

Kumanjaran Leopard

Creature
Cost 13 Mana
Health 10
Armor 1
Defense (Melee) 7+

Quick Attack Pounce: Melee, 3 Dice, Piercing + 1
Full Attack Wild Slashing: Melee, 3 Dice, Doublestrike

Elusive
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: 29 Lets Go!: A Pint Sized Campaign for Chain of Command
description:
29, Let's Go! is the first Pint-Sized campaigns for Chain of Command, designed to be played using the campaign handbook At the Sharp End.

Thirty-two pages long, 29, Let's Go! contains an overview of the planned, and then actual, events on Omaha beach on the 6th of June before then going on to present a mini-campaign covering the advance of the US 175th Infantry Regiment from the initial beachhead in their drive to link Omaha and Utah beaches by capturing the key bridge at Isigny.

The campaign is a total of five game tables with the duration running between five and nine games. Briefings are provided for both sides, along with measurable objectives, period maps, force and support option listings and everything you need to play this campaign through to its conclusion.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Vistula-Oder-Berlin: the campaign in Poland and East Germany, 1945
description:
Vistula-Oder-Berlin: the campaign in Poland and East Germany, 1945 is a simulation for two or more players that simulate the 1945 campaign in Poland and Eastern Germany from January to May.

Historically, the Soviet troops occupied Berlin in May 1945 and the third Reich collapsed. However if the Panzer Army, sent to the Hungarian Front, was defending the capital, the final result could have been different. On the other hand, if the Soviet forces besieging the fortified city of Königsberg had concentrated their fighting power in the center, the fight might have been bigger than historical.

The German army is specialized in mobile counterattacks by armored troops and the Soviet army has excellent breakthrough ability and large concentrating firepower.

Two scenarios: campaign (Deutschland Kaputt! January-May, from the Vistula-Oder operation to the fall of Berlin and Prague) and Der Katastrophe (January-March 1945).

1 turn = 2 weeks
1 hex = about 20 km
1 Unit = German Army: Battalion to Division, Soviet Army: Corps
Number of players = 2
Play time = 6 to 10 hours (depending on the scenario)

Components:

308 pieces (12.5 mm square)
One map (A1 size)
One rule book (12 pages)


(adapted from Japanese website text)


The game system is similar to Hongrie 1944-1945 (Vae Victis #78, Command Japan #100) system.

name: Grill Party
description: It’s a Grill Party and everyone has their own idea about what foods to grill! Place and swap Grill Food Pieces on the Grill to try to match situations depicted on your Grill Food Cards. Be the first player to match all of your Grill Food Cards to become the Grill Master!

name: 30 Years War: Bloodlust Valenstein
description:
Issue game of Double Charge #4.

Designed by Makoto Nakajima.

Covering the 30 years war.
This is a third game of 60 series, using 60 counters or less and playable in 60 minutes or shorter.

The game uses popular "Taiheiki" system by the designer. And the rule is only 2 pages.
Victory is decided by victory points which can be gained by controlling areas or eliminating enemy's leaders.

name: The 2015 Election
description:
A light political game involving vote placement and based on "The 2010 Election" but aiming to cover the May 2015 election. It attempts to model the movement into four party politics and the rise of the SNP.

The two players (Labour and Conservatives) place population markers derived from opinion polls (run by Press Cards) in 32 representative Constituencies. The Constituencies are grouped by type (rural, industrial, suburban) and by the three home nations (England, Scotland and Wales - Northern Ireland is dealt with separately). Other parties are placed according to rules that mimic their strengths and weaknesses by random draw from the Scrabble bag.

In each phase of the game different placing rules apply as you move from placing your hardcore supporters (who tend to be in safe areas) up into the floating voters (who can be anywhere) on Election Night.

At last we abandon further fiddling and offer (for a mere sum of £5 via paypal; to charles.vasey@gmail.com) the next in the series from the 2010 Election. This time we are trying it in advance of the actual event.

The game kit (for it is a mere primitive PNP) is a number of pdfs and spreadies giving you the map of UK represented as blocks of constituencies, the counters, and the press cards. It is pretty much an experience game.

There will be an update after the actual Election.

The pdfs should resize for Letter printing, but if not I'll save in Letter and then copy over.

name: No Lookie, No Peekie
description:
A light pub game for 3 - 12 players reminiscent of classic card games. No Lookie's roots are in the line of games like Golf or Polish Poker but brings a variety of new mechanics that offer the modern gaming experience to a vintage, time-tested archetype.

The objective of the game is to have the lowest score each round. A hand consists of five cards dealt faced down to each player. Without looking at the cards, players arrange their hand into two faced down rows in front of them: a top row of two cards and a bottom row of three cards. The rest of the deck is placed in the center of the table as a draw pile. The top card is turned over and starts the discard pile.

Gameplay follows with draw-discard turns. Players are allowed to look at the bottom-row cards prior to their first turn, but are not allowed to look at their cards again until the end of the round (except when discarding of course). Various action cards may be discarded to trade, swap, or effect gameplay.

At the end of each round, the two rows score points and the player with the lowest score receives a victory point card. For scoring: each card in the top row adds its numerical value to the player’s score; if all three cards on the bottom row match numerically then all the cards in the bottom row score zero, but if all three cards do not match numerically then each card in the bottom row adds its numerical value to the player’s score as they do on the top row.

1 deck plays up to 6 players
2 decks play up to 12 players

73 Cards per deck:

51 Number Cards
2 Wild Cards
13 Action Cards
7 Victory Point Cards

name: Up North
description:
A fast-paced family game of choice and chance

Up North is a linear game for 2 to 5 players, where people of varying backgrounds race to the finish with the most money.

The board is a simple linear style path with a few shortcuts, allowing players to choose a more profitable or quicker path to the finish. Each player has a deck of event cards they draw from when they land on a "tree" space. There is also a universal events deck that is drawn from when a player lands on a "loon" space.

The event decks are themed per the character the person is playing. Some event that may be good for the Outdoorsman may not be good for the Business Tycoon. This provides solid replayability and varied outcomes based on the characters in play.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Warhammer: Sigmar's Blood
description:
From the publishers website:

Sigmar’s Blood is a campaign supplement for Warhammer based on the war between the forces of The Empire, led by Volkmar the Grim, and those of the Vampire Counts, led by Mannfred von Carstein.

This 64-page, full colour, hardback book contains:

Brand new background revealing Mannfred von Carstein’s fiendish plan to turn Sylvania into a realm of everlasting night.
Four new narrative scenarios that can be played in order to follow the events of the story.
Rules for playing games in the haunted darkness.
Extra abilities your characters can earn as a result of fighting in the campaign.
A showcase of expertly painted Citadel miniatures that feature in the campaign.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Europolis Global
description:
A game that continues the series EUROPOLIS;
A variation of Monopoly. The game enables you to make real estate transactions: buy land,villas and hotels that bring rent income or you can own airlines and utilities (water and electricity), also reliable fund resources.
In Europolis global you can become the owner of global airlines or resources. To win the game you have to become the richest and other players to bankruptcy. Through a new graphical presentation of the board, now more realistic, the game contributes to the development of geographical skills.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Put Jane in the Game
description:
A print and play expansion for Jane Austen's Matchmaker offered originally on Jane Austen's birthday December 16, 2014.

Expansion consists of a single card featuring Jane Austen. If a player manages to marry the "correct" gentleman and lady, they can take the Jane Austin Card and add their old maid score to their final score. (A cheat sheet is provided for those who don't know who ended with who.)
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Terrenus: The Game of Gods
description:
In Terrenus, the players become gods playing a game with the mortal world. The game is player in four phases, each a simple mini-game with different rules, but each building where the other left off. Each phase is roughly ten turns per player. The four phases relate to various godly activities:

Creation - The gods build the game world, using a tile placement mechanism. Each god will place ten, and score points based on number of edges connected and terrain features completed.

Population - Each god has 40 tribes to competitively place on the board, usually 3-5 at a time. The finger of god touches an origin square, and life spreads from it. Terrain features limit how many tribes can fit in an area. Points are scored based on how terrain is filled. This phase feels a little like Go.

Construction - With the world populated, the gods migrate tribes together. When enough are in a square, they build a temple to whichever god has a majority in their stack, and leave the board. Rival tribes are captured and converted by this process. Points are scored by using tribes to build temples, and by converting rivals' tribes. This feels vaguely like the city building mechanic from Civilization (original).

War! - The world is now full of temples. The gods each have a monster and a hero to summon from their temples on their turn. Monsters seek to defile rival temples, making them more difficult to summon from. Heroes go to fight rival heroes and monsters, or just vandalize a rival temple. Points are scored for slaying, defiling and robbing. This phase can feel like the endgame of Chess.

Each phase has a method of earning bonus points. At the end of the last phase, the gods total their scores to determine a winner.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Civilization, Fantasy, Mythology, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Io
description: Io is an Othello variant with a more flexible move protocol and a more 'organic' character. It knows neither Othello style compulsory capture nor compulsory passes. It ends when the board is full, the winner being the player with the most territory, and cannot end in a draw.

name: NAVTAC: World War II Naval Miniatures Rules
description: This game is designed for 1:4800, 1:2400, or 1:1200 scale naval miniatures. 1:250 scale aircraft can conveniently be used with the smaller scale naval miniatures. Two twenty sided dice will be needed for play, in addition to the appropriate miniatures. These rules follow the SeaTac game system developed for modern naval combat. These rules, like all our games, attempt to be easy playing and fast, while retaining a great diversity of information.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Silver Dragon Premium Figure
description:
From the publisher:

This fantastic pre-painted premium figure stands several inches tall and towers over all of the other D&D Attack Wing expansion pack miniatures. The perfect encounter for your next adventure, or the perfect ally to your force. The D&D Attack Wing Silver Dragon Premium Figure is a beautiful display piece as well!

The D&D Attack Wing version of the Silver Dragon figure also comes with additional play materials such as Cards, Tokens, Maneuver Dials, and a 6” x 6” D&D Attack Wing base.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Valiant: Core Game
description:
The Valiant is a card-based combat system. In the Core Game are the 6 Heroes archetypes and all of their respective cards. Thematically, the Valiant uses "fantasy" and "role-playing" conventions.

Rather than building a deck with dozens of cards, Heroes in the Valiant are comprised of only 8 cards, all of which begin the game in play In this respect, customizing a hero is more like filling out "action bars" in an MMO than building a deck in a CCG.

Players can use the core game for dueling single heroes or for team combat. With future expansions, the Heroes from the core game can be used to play cooperative scenarios.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Go Fish Yourself:  Naughty Edition
description: Go Fish Yourself is more than just one deck of cards. The Naughty Edition will allow players to keep the nonsense going. It's sure to push some comfort zones. It comes with 52 new cards and challenges. This expansions (or edition) can be played as standalone game or combined with the original. Players will be able to mix and match their favorite pairs from all or any of the expansions to create customized decks.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Nautical, Party Game

name: Ko to leti
description: Ko to leti is a game for 2 to 4 players. On the board is shown sky where there are many aircraft. Each player has one figurine. The figurine represents a fighter reconnaissance plane. The task is to collect markers. That means that the reconnaissance aircraft photographed and recognized the plane. The game lasts until all of the markers are collected. The winner is the player who has the most.

name: Character Quest: Heroes – Goblin Raiders Adventure
description:
Goblin Raiders Adventure intro: The nearby farms are being captured and pillaged! Lead by a Goblin Brute that must be defeated. Player's take turns trying to free Wheat Field locations before Goblin Torchers show up and pillage them. Once the fields have been rescued (or burned), players will then be able to try and defeat the Goblin Brute before time runs out!

A full 50 card hero deck. It has a few heroes from Game Pack #1, a few from Game Pack #2 and a couple heroes from a future Game Pack (sneak peak of the Storm Shaman, Half-Giant Warrior, and Templar)

The full 26 card Goblin Raiders Adventure deck is a spin off of the Goblin Keep Adventure but it also includes a few new cards made just for this demo (mostly to help with the new objective of stopping the goblins from raiding nearby farmlands!)

This introductory set does not use the final art from either Game Pack #1 or #2. The cards also reference 'Raid', this simply means a fight or battle.

A link for downloading this game can be found on the Kickstarter campaign page for Character Quest: Heroes (Tavern Edition).
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Trzciano 1629
description:
Game covers series of three battles - Trzciana, Pułkowice and Straszewo fought between polish and imperial forces against army of Sweden, led by the Gustav II Adolf.

Game was published in the 39 issue of Taktyka i Strategia magazine.

name: Ganymede
description:
Materials
8x8 checkerboard
64 Othello disks

Play
Board starts out empty.
One player plays black the other white.
Decide who goes first in any convenient manner, turns then alternate.

On a turn, you must,

1) Place a friendly color disk in an empty space that is not orthogonally adjacent to an opponent's color disk (diagonally adjacent is fine) and

2) Move another friendly color disk already on the board any distance in a straight line orthogonally or diagonally, without jumping over other disks and ending the move in an empty space. The last disk moved must not be orthogonally adjacent to an opponent's color disks (diagonally adjacent is fine) or

3) Pass

The game ends when players pass consecutively.

Object
The player with the largest connected group of orthogonally adjacent disks, in his color, wins.

name: Formula 1
description: Formula 1 is game for younger players. Each has one figurine. 5 laps are driven. Everyone has to stop in the pit stop twice. Once for changing tires, and the second time to refill fuel. It is important to find the shortest path.

name: Phobos
description:
Materials

25 square tiles that are dark on one side and light on the other
4 Othello disks, two of the disks are marked on their dark and light sides with a red dot at their centers.

Setup

Arrange the 25 tiles, light side up, into a 5x5 grid. Next place the two disks with the red dots light side up on two diagonally opposed corner tiles, do the same for the remaining two disks.

Play

One player plays with the two disks that have the red dots and the other player the two without.

Decide who goes first in any convenient manner, turns then alternate.

On a turn, you must,

1) Move one of your disks one space either diagonally or orthogonally onto an empty tile and then

2) Flip an empty light sided tile that is orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to the disk last moved or remove an empty dark sided tile that is orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to the disk last moved.
Restrictions

- A light sided disk moves on empty light sided tiles and after a move you must flip an adjacent light sided tile to its dark side.

- A light sided disk may be moved to a dark sided tile by flipping the disk to its dark side and after the move you must remove an adjacent dark sided tile from the board. From this point on the disk is a dark sided disk and cannot be flipped back.

- A dark-sided disk moves only on empty dark sided tiles and after the move you must remove an adjacent dark sided tile from the board.

Object

The player last to move wins.

name: Sergeants D-Day: German Fusilier bundle
description:
The German Fusilier bundle comes with two pairs of “Fusilier Assault Troops,” each with one MP40 and one MP44, plus two Fusilier MG Teams.

All eight of the Fusilier Soldiers are trained “Specialists” and come with 16 cards each (normal privates come with 8 cards).

Plus, the set includes a custom Fusilier Sergeant (Leader) Specialist who is armed with an MP40 and has 32 cards. You can name your leader subject to editorial review. (Normal Leaders have 16 cards.)

That totals nine Soldiers, plus the Fusilier Assault Equipment and Tactics Module.

name: Ayoayo
description:
Ayoayo is a Nigerian mancala game, which is played by the Yoruba. It should not be confused with Oware, which is also sometimes called "Ayoayo" when played in Nigeria. Related games are Andada in Eritrea and Endodoi in Tanzania.

Ayoayo is played on a board of two rows, each consisting of six round pits that have a large store at either end. Each pit contains four seeds at the start.

At his turn a player takes the contents of one of his smaller holes and distributes it, one by one, counterclockwise into the following holes, but not in the stores. If the last seed falls into a non-empty hole, its contents including the last distributed seed is continued to be distributed.

The move ends when the last seed falls in an empty hole.

If the last seed falls in an empty hole on the player's own side, the seeds in the opponent's hole directly across and the seed effecting the capture are captured and placed into the store. If the emptied hole contains twelve or more seeds, it is skipped.

When the opponent has no seeds in his holes, he must get some seeds in the next move, if possible. Otherwise the game is over and the remaining seeds are captured by the player who moved last.

The player who captured most counters wins the game.

Description taken from Mancala World.

name: ATS Core Module: Clash Along The Psel I
description:
Clash Along the Psel I: A brand new take on the Battle of Kursk, with Tigers, a contested river crossing ... and Russian counter-attacks. A titanic struggle, recreated in detail down to the last tank ... squad ... and forward observer!

Welcome to the ATS CORE MODULES, all new for 2014. New map, larger, on cardstock, folding with no trimming needed -- did we mention new terrain art throughout AND larger hexes? Perfect for those classic -- YET ALL NEW ATS COUNTERS -- the you'll have on the map deciding history ... all ... over ... again! This module is for owners of the ATS 2014 Color Rules plus ATS Standard Small Markers + Large Markers but may also be used easily by owners of any past edition of the ATS rules. All Special Rules and AFV Cards needed for play are included, along with ALL NEW FOLIO STYLE packaging.
IMPORTANT NOTE: This product contains ALL the combat counters you need to play -- IT IS NOT A COMPLETE GAME. You need small and large marker counter sheets and the ATS Rules Binder/Play Aid set to use this product.

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Bronze Dragon Expansion Pack
description: The Adult Bronze Dragon Quelindritar is the competitive prize for Month 3 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Tyranny of Dragons. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Vuitquatre
description:
A word game, in Catalan, with just 13 letters dice (in different colours, which implies different values). A player chooses between 4 and 8 dice and rolls them (at least two different dice colours must be present). With the result she must find the highest valued word (letters in white dice = 1 point; letters in green dice = 2 points; letters in yellow dice = 3 points; letters in red dice = 4 points). Any dice not used for her word are lost for the next round. The other players also look for the best word.

Once the rolling player has finished with her word, she receives points, while the other players receive points if they have found a higher-valued word. The rolling player keeps rolling (each round with the same dice except for those not used in the previous word) until she has less than four dice. Then is the next player's turn.

name: Cardville
description:
In Cardville players take on the roll of mayor of a developing town, growing it by adding more districts, developing existing ones, and adding landmarks.

On their turn a player rolls 3 dice and allocates the results to increasing their cash reserves and gathering resources, but they must choose carefully because the result of the remaining dice is given to their opponent and used by them to gather resources.

They must also beware of rolling triples, as the result is never good - alien abductions, meteor strikes or riots are just some of the calamities triggered by the wrong roll!

The game uses a deck of cards to represent districts and landmarks that players may purchase and add to their growing town. Coloured tokens are used to record resources and cash, and also to represent areas of the town that have been developed.

Undeveloped plots can generate resources, but developed ones generate victory points at the end of the game.

name: Old Hickory: The Battle for L'Abbaye Blanche – A Pint Sized Campaign for Chain of Command
description:
Old Hickory is the third Pint-Sized campaigns for Chain of Command, designed to be played using the campaign handbook At the Sharp End.

At thirty pages long, Old Hickory contains an overview of US operations in Normandy and beyond from Operation Cobra to the German counter-attack at Mortain, Operation Luttich. It goes on to present a mini-campaign covering the defence of L'Abbaye Blanche, a key position to the North of Mortain where the US 30th Division stood firm against 2nd SS Das Reich, and Der Fuhrer regiment in particular.

The campaign is a total of six game tables with the duration running between three and eight games. Briefings are provided for both sides, along with measurable objectives, period maps, force and support option listings.

Like all Pint-Sized campaigns, it is available for the price of a pint in the publisher’s local pub.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Aliens vs. Predator: Alien Resurrection Expansion Set
description:
The Resurrection has arrived.

Welcome to the Alien Resurrection, the anxiously awaited first expansion to the acclaimed Alien vs. Predator CCG. This expansion adds new excitement to the original game by introducing new play tactics, a new official scenario, and new applications for the original cards.

Available in 9-Card Booster Packs, Alien Resurrection introduces new card types such as Barriers, Battle Conditions, Attachments, and Ammo, along with the Human Rogue and Cloned Alien factions.





Card List:

2 Acid Rounds

73 Lock the Door

75 Low Light Levels
76 Lower Level Living Quarters
77 M220 Uranium Grenade
78 M237 Enhanced Silencer
79 M91 Flamer Unit
80 Medical Lab

83 Newborn Alien

90 Plasma Overcharge
91 Pointman Is Hit Event

95 Purvis
96 Pvt. Distephano

98 Recalibrate Ground
99 Resin Barrier
100 Rig It Up
101 Ripley 8
102 Rogue Assassin
103 Rogue Mercenary
104 Shadow Blade
105 Share the Pain
106 Shortcut
107 Silent Wraith
108 Sporting Chance
109 Storage Facility
110 Strong Arm Tactic
111 Terrorized
112 The Queen is Dead
113 The Water's Fine
114 Thermos Gun
115 Trick Shot
116 Underwater Debris
117 Unexpected Benefits
118 Venom Cloud Module
119 Vriess
120 Waste Tank 5
121 Wrist Guns
122 Zip Gun
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: On the Run
description:
On The Run is a strategic turn-based card game about bank robberies, tampering with evidence, and backstabbing your friends.

You and your crew have robbed a bank and have split the money evenly. Unfortunately, for you and your thieving friends, you've left behind evidence at the scene of the crime.

Each player will take turns trying to remove the evidence, place additional evidence to link other players to the crime, and attempt to steal more money. Win the game by collecting 12 coins and starting and ending your turn out of jail.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mafia, Print & Play
mechanics: Events, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bountiful Booty
description:
Bountiful Booty is a push-your-luck, network-building strategy game for 2 pirate captains in-training.

The board is made up of hex-tiles representing islands that players will raid each turn. By playing cards depicting those same islands, players can add an island to their network and gain treasure in the process. They will try to maintain control of as many islands as they can for as long as they can to maximize their booty.

When raiding an island players will roll their dice to see how much treasure they'll earn. If a skull is rolled they lose a die and gain no treasure.

Each player starts the game with 10 ships and 3 dice. If at any time a player can't place a ship or runs out of dice to roll they have to remove all their ships from the map and they lose all their treasure.

In the end the player with the most booty wins.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Push Your Luck

name: Barricado Revolutions
description:
Barricado is an abstract strategy game of tile placement and area control. Each turn, players choose between influence over the board (by placing a tile) or claiming territory upon it (by building barricades). Barricades can be extended but never crossed. The player with the most barricade segments on the board at game’s end wins.

The layout is always different, and the tactics often varied, as every turn poses new challenges and opportunities. Will you be the one that gets painted into a corner, or will you claim total control of the streets?

name: Svemirski šetači
description:
Svemirski šetači ("Space walkers") is a very simple game for 2 to 4 players. Board has 3D elements.

There are several paths that are intertwined. Shorter paths have more obstacles. The winner is the player who first gets to the finish line.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Balonijada
description: Balonijada is game for younger players. Each has one figurine. Hot air balloons fly over a bay, while flying, they should to make as many photos of birds, ships, .... In this game the most points gets the last player who reach the finish line. Each photo (counter) also brings one point. The winner is the player who at the end of the game has the most points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Skate girl
description:
Skate girl is a very simple game for 2 to 4 players. Board has 3D elements.

Each player has one figurine and move it along paths. There are several paths that are intertwined. Shorter paths have more obstacles. The winner is the player who first gets to the finish line.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Rolerijada
description: Girls ride rollers through a park and collect flowers. Bouquets are represented by counters. Players collect counters by stopping on field next to counter. The player who collects the most is the winner.

name: Moto kros
description:
Moto cross is a very simple game for 2 to 4 players. Board has 3D elements.

Players move figurines in direction of paths. There are several paths that are intertwined. Shorter paths have more obstacles that slow them down. The winner is the player who first gets to the finish line.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: 'FLIP' the Bird & Cat Game
description:
So, you're one of the cats in the back yard and the birds out there are all yours! All you have to do is play your cards right and best those other cats!

The cats all start with the same cards: 1 Catch, 2 Stalk, 1 Play, 1 Steal, 1 Taunt, and 1 Eat. No luck of the draw here, it's entirely up to you! Get as many enjoyment points as possible and win the game! Be clever and anticipate what the others will do so that you can claim victory. Each player will target another cat and a location where a bird is hanging out. They will then select their actions for the 2 rounds of action. All of the cards are revealed simultaneously, they get resolved and when the smoke clears, some cats may have birds and some may not.

The birds will hang out at the bird bath, in the grass, on the fence or in the trees. The bigger birds will need to be stalked before catching them and you will have to time everything just right. Once you do catch your bird you will have a choice to either press your luck and play with the bird to double its enjoyment point value or to just eat it. The longer you play with it the greater the chance of it being stolen by another cat.

Taunt cards allow other cats to distract you and cancel your actions, nothing is safe in this back yard!

name: Flames of War: Bridge At Remagen – The Battle for the Rhine, February-April 1945
description: Bridge at Remagen covers the decisive battles in the Ruhr, Germany’s industrial heartland and centre-stage for the last major fights between US and German forces in the Second World War. American players are presented with US armoured forces, including tank, light tank, armoured rifle, and cavalry companies. German players can field lots of powerful, heavy tanks as well as the fanatical infantry forces of SS-Panzerbrigade Westfalen.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: World Cup Alpine Ski
description:
World Cup Alpine Ski is a print & play, solitaire, statistical replay game on Alpine Ski, featuring individual yearbook for several seasons of the World Cup.
The game permits to replay each event (downhill, Super G, Giant Slalom or Slalom) from that year, and has data for all skiers (both men and women) that got points during that year.
There are two methods of resolution: a very fast one, where for each race you roll three dice for each skier, add his/her racing value, and got a final classification for the race; and a medium complexity one, where you roll for each skier against the average time given for the race (based on historical results) and you get the final classification through the fastest to the slowest ones.
Until now the following Yearbooks have been released: from 1967 to 1988

name: Zpocalypse: Heavy Steam Promo Cards
description:
Three exclusive "Steampunk Themed" promotional armory cards included with the purchase of Heavy Steam during its Kickstarter campaign.


28 - Brass Goggles (Accessory)
29 - Kinetic Atomizer (Melee)
30 - Blunderbuss (Firearm)

name: Cross Hares: Testing Ground – Kickstarter Custom Character Expansion Pack
description:
As part of the kickstarter project for Cross Hares: Testing Ground, four backers got to spend time on the phone with the artist/designer - Jesse Labbe - and help to create custom characters for use in the game.

1A Games produced a number of these sets which are available for separate purchase. The set includes the following four characters along with all the tokens and cards needed to play them in the base game.

- Abe (a Savannah Cat Samurai)
- Bambalam (a Ragdoll Cat Tracker)
- Krystal (a rabbit Scientist)
- Mr B (a Prairie Dog Scavenger)

name: More Wargaming Pioneers: Early Wargames Volume 4
description: Ancient and Medieval, World War II, and Modern battle and skirmish rules by Tony Bath, Lionel Tarr and Michael Korns respectively, edited by John Curry as part of the ongoing History of Wargaming Project.
categories: Ancient, Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: On The Grid
description:
A fresh take on how word games can be quick, semi-cooperative, and fun!
Build a great word search for your temporary partner to find lots of words. 2 letter dice are rolled; all players write those same 2 letters anywhere on their own grid. Repeat until grids are filled, then pass the grid to a neighbor who has a limited time to write down all the words they can find. Both Builder and Finder score together for the same grid!

name: Arcade: Terrain pack
description:
This expansion for ARCADE allows players to create larger maps.

Components:


Two 3x5 terrain tiles
One 1x5 terrain tile
9 'ice' squared walls
20 terrain destruction cards
VHS box


The terrain tiles are made of 3mm thick laser-cut acrylic (lines engraved). The walls are made of 8mm thick 'ice' acrylic.

name: Humans!!! 4: Camp Zombie Lake
description:
Description from the publisher:

Dinner by the campfire! Summer camp is the perfect getaway. It's isolated, quiet, and theres plenty to eat...starting with the counselors and then the campers! The only drawback is something named "Jason" that keeps making your dinner disappear!

Humans!!! 4: Camp Zombie Lake is an expansion for Humans!!! that adds Counselor cards to randomly pick who you encounter and learn what nasty surprises they might have in store.

name: Corrotto
description:
Corrotto is a crime/politics themed market game played with a standard deck of cards. Separate the deck into 3 decks, the draw deck A/2/3/4, the Market Deck 5/6/7/8/9 and the board set up 10/Jokers/J/Q/K. Set up all KQJ10s in four rows of same suits placing Jokers on the tens and randomly draw four face up cards from the market deck below the tens. KQs are the Royal Council and the Jacks separate the council from the marketplace. The draw deck is where you legally earn money by drawing cards, the market deck gets drawn into the marketplace when cards are reserved or purchased. Purchase cards with cards of the same color.

When cards are discarded or spent they go face up into the appropriate decks discard section where market cards become the black market and draw cards become heists. To do illegal actions such as purchasing from the Black Market or perform a heist you must bribe a face card by placing a card higher than previous card of the same suit on the card taking lower bribe into your hand. Anyone can bribe a Jack but you must pay off a Royal for there loyalty. Pay off Queens first which cost 25 Of its suit minus the Jack bribe, same for king but also minus the Queen bribe, place a player marker on Royal. Royal bribes are always scored as end points but the game ends and scores differently in ways of play.

There are 3 different variants of Corrotto: Ladies First, Hot Potato and Rat Race.

name: Heroes of Troy: A Game of the Trojan War for One to Two Players.
description:
INTRODUCTION: Heroes of Troy is a Game set during the Trojan War, according to Homer’s ‘The Iliad’. The game focuses on the man-to-man combat that is so prevalent throughout The Iliad. Players will assume the role of a Commander of either the Achaean (Greek) or Trojan Armies during the Trojan War.

OBJECTIVE: The First player to capture at least two of the three Rear Sectors of their Opponent wins the Game. Alternatively, the Player who scores the most Victory Points (VP) for slaying opposing Warriors during the Turn in which the last Fate Card is Drawn, wins.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting

name: Don't Get Eated
description:
Don't Get Eated is a social game of survival of the fittest. Players take on the role of animals both working together and against each other to survive in the wilds. Failure meet the challenge presented each round results in a vicious attack, until only one animal remains standing.

In Don't Get Eated, each round will call for players to simultaneously play a numerical card from their hand. Players are attempting to meet a specific challenge stated by that round (e.g. play over a certain number, play under a certain number, etc.). Every player that plays the same numbered card is considered on a team for that round, and their played value is increased by the number of people on the team. Any player or team that does not meet the challenge is wounded, and they are closer to losing the game. Players may be knocked out (or eated) by taking multiple wounds.

name: Lembitu: Heavy Cavalry
description: Lembitu: Heavy Cavalry, an expansion for the Lembitu board game, consists of twenty castles that can be used as fortifications, along with six knights; when two blank sides are rolled with the dice of one color, reinforcements arrive for those enemy forces and one knight is placed in front of the chain of enemy units.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Camels Ordinarily Sit Down Carefully
description:
This is a card game where up to six players take turns to evolve fish from the Cambrian era up to the Carboniferous era. The title comes from a geologists mnemonic for the Earth's geological eras.
Players have a hand of cards which depict many aspects of evolution including species of fish; events such as major catastrophes and changes to the plankton species; breeding and feeding; genetic mutations and advantages.
