Each game lasts 6 rounds and players try to evolve the most advanced fish they can before inevitable extinctions reduce their populations to dust.

name: BOOM!
description:
BOOM! is a quick playing cooperative card game. You and a few friends are joining forces to disarm a bomb. Follow the set up rules and a numbered card will be designated as the bomb. The game is spent trying to learn what number that card is.
Guess right and you disarm the bomb and win! Guess wrong... well you know. (BOOM!)

Each turn a player must choose one of three actions. You can either draw a red card, draw a blue card, or guess the number of the card in the case. The red cards are numbered 1-10 and one of these has secretly been designated as the "bomb." The game is spent revealing the red cards to narrow down the possibilities of the "bomb" card. However, the numbered card that was removed has been replaced by a detonation card which has been shuffled in. If this card is drawn from the red deck, the bomb goes off and the game is over.

The blue deck is made up of tools that help you navigate through the red deck without blowing up. There are three special powers that come from the blue deck that let you look ahead and even disarm a detonation. These are meant to help you reveal cards from the red deck because ultimately you can only win by revealing the red cards.

Most games end in defeat, but you'll have a blast losing and want to play "just one more game" each time. When you and your team do win you feel like a million bucks.

name: Empires of the Void: Sirens of Belshar
description:
A free print-and-play mini expansion for Empires of the Void includes a player tableau and planet token for an additional faction; the Sirens of Belshar.

The special ability of the Sirens basically means that they may steal a Starfighter from an opposing player in a space battle, provided that at least one Siren Diplomat ship is present in this battle and the Sirens have an unused Starfighter ship available. If these two conditions are met, the opposing Starfighter is removed and handed back to its owner, whereas the additional Starfighter of the Sirens is placed at the same space and - of course - participates in the battle on side of the Sirens.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Say What Again
description:
Inspired by the classic scene from Pulp Fiction, Say What Again is a push your luck card game where the dealer asks the players their name. If they answer "What?" they get a card. Players want to avoid face cards and bank their cards before it's too late.

Eventually the dealer may ask them to "Say What Again" to raise the stakes a little bit. The player will get more cards, but if they bust, the dealer gets the cards and will score the points.

The game is played until all players have been the dealer.


Postcard released in the January 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: 11 Swing States
description:
11 Swing States is is Easy-Fast-Fun game with 4 sets of Looney pyramids, map and cards.

All players try to become US President investing their funds in ads in 11 Swing States.

At the beginning has every player a lead in some of swing states. (Deal StateCards)

In each of 12 rounds every player invest his/her funds to ads in swing states. (Select MiniCards and place a pyramid.)

Last weeks of campaigning are really hectic. Mood of voters changes quickly. Candidates have no time to monitor and respond to all attacks. (All players place their pyramids simultaneously.)

On Election Day all votes are counted, and the winner becomes the new president. (Players count their electors in swing states.)

11 Swing States is a new version of U.S. President, published in 2015.

There are no changes in rules, just some tweaks to improve a gaming experience.

With 4 sets of pyramids you will go through last 12 weeks of presidential election campaign. With more sets you can experience more weeks and longer game.

To be a president or not to be, that is the question.

Elementary, my dear Watson, just secure absolute majority of electors.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement, Voting

name: NW Europe 1944
description:
A division to corps level operational game from D-Day to/across the Rhine. Half-month turns, 10 mis/16kms per hex. 51 Allied and 42 German division to corps level units.

Relatively fast simple game mechanics expanding on my Ardennes Petite and Patton's Lorraine Minigame game system.

Allied Strategic Bombing, Close Air Support, Strafing, and Air Drops. Waffen SS Ruthlessness (and Consequential GI Rage), German Strategic Reserve, etc.


NOTE: Allied army headquarters units have been added and replace the "truck convoys" for supply. And 3rd Army -supplied units get a +1 shift in attacking combat odds. :-)
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: XenoShyft: Onslaught – Jin Khan
description:
A promo card given out at Cool Mini or Not's booth for buyers of the base game during Gencon 2015.
Also given as a "Thank You" for play testers of the Xenoshyft: Dreadmire stand alone expansion.

Jin Khan is a Heroic Storm Trooper that replaces surviving units upon promotion.

Card Text:
"This Troop may never equip Weapon cards. Each time this troop attacks or advances, it gains +1 power this round. Once per round, deal 1 revealed enemy damage equal to this troop's power."

Power: 2
Life: 4
Cost: N/A
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Zoneplex: Evocation
description:
Evocation refines and streamlines 3-5 player game play and adds a 1-2 player challenge mode!
Evocation comes with 11 new game-tiles and downloadable original soundtrack.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Blucher: The Hundred Days
description:
An expansion for Blucher that covers Napoleon´s final campaign.

A set of 216 cards. These includes unit cards for the French, Prussian and British armies with allies, personality cards for the most important leaders, column markers, counters and objectives.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: The West Front: The propeller rotates and the engine roars
description:
The West Front is the second Volume dedicated to the air struggles between the Italian Regia Aeronautica with its CR42 Falco and G50 Freccia against the Armèe de l'Air Morane 406 and Leo 451, which are trying to bomb the Italian port of Genoa on the Ligure Sea.

The system named "The propeller rotates and the engine roars" (Gira l'elica e romba il motor, an old Italian song on Air Force) will be developed into other volumes, with Voyenno-Vozdushnye Sily (the Soviet Air Force) and Luftwaffe amongst others, being centered on the Italian Royal Air Force (La Regia)
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Skirmish Outbreak
description:
Skirmish Outbreak is a set of rules for miniature wargaming set in the familiar world of the zombie apocalypse, borrowing in particular from the movie 28 Days Later and its idea of the "fast" zombie.

Turn sequence revolves around Action points that are determined each turn and then spent by the players to perform actions such as movement, combat, etc. The game is scenario based, with victory conditions changing from scenario to scenario. Scenarios can be played as one shot or linked in massive campaigns. The zombies in the game can be controlled by a player or by an AI, which makes the game particularly suitable for solitaire and cooperative play.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pocket Adventure
description:
Pocket Adventure is a solitaire adventure game in a compact deck of cards. Gather your things and explore the land, encounter monsters, meet travellers and visit towns. Collect treasure and complete quests. Do it for glory, for fortune or just for the thrill of adventure.

A turn begins by choosing a Location to explore. Each Location has an Explore value (the number of cards you will get to pick from next turn when you explore), and one or more icons. The icons determine what happens to you on your turn. A camp icon means you get to rest, heal and change your equipment. An Event icon means you draw an Event card and follow the instructions (this will be a change in weather or a roadside encounter). A town icon means you generate a town (draw 3 cards) and choose one townsfolk to interact with from the town. A monster icon means you draw a card and battle the monster on it. If you win, you will earn treasure!

Complete three quests before you run out of Resolve or Health and you win. Run out of resolve, and you retire... run out of Health and you will meet an unfortunate end.

The game requires a minimum of 7 pages of cards to be printed and cut out.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.K.S. Amar Expansion Pack
description:
Star Trek - Attack Wing: I.K.S. Amar is part of the Wave 23 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Amar is a K'tinga class ship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Club Zen
description:
East meets West in Club Zen, a relaxing worker placement game where the goal is to plan out your seven-day working vacation in the most Zen way possible. Manage your work and emotional stress, make new friends, attend exciting events such as hang gliding or rock climbing, collect stones for your personal Zen Garden, or take a nap! How will you spend your time at the 5-star Caribbean resort, Club Zen? The most relaxed or "zen" player at the end of their one week stay will be the winner.

Unlike traditional resource management and worker placement games, Club Zen encourages players to visit the same locations together, many times for an increased benefit for all players involved. Because of this, the game features a measure of cooperation and meaningful positive interaction, while still having only one winner. The game is a sandbox of strongly thematic and relaxing environments to explore, with each element tuned to both be strategic and evoke a real sense of immersion.

name: Yokai: Yamata No orochi
description:
Yokai: Yamata No Orochi is the first expansion for the card game Yokai. This expansion add more white cards and the new black Yokai, a new type of cards that give negative points to the players.
The expansion add also a new game modality, the "Orochi Challenge", in this modality all the special powers of the cards and the points value are nullified, the goal of the players is to not make a tricolor trio and make or a monocolor trio for empty the board.

When a player make a tricolor trio, he must draw one of the nine cards that are on the board, in a case of a stall all the players draw a card, if the card is black the player was eliminated.

name: Battle of Durak: Shapeshifter Promo Card
description:
This promo card is part of a special Battle of Durak promotion.

Skill Card Action:
Polymorph - Once all players have chosen their character classes, shuffle all left over skill cards and choose 3 at random. Exchange this card for those skills.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Bulwark: Glassforge
description:
Contains one Location deck for Bulwark.

A town made prosperous by industry and its famous glassware was never intended to be defended from a rampaging army - yet this is exactly what has happened! 'Glassforge offers new uses for Heroism and unexpected ways of interaction with your trashed cards.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: AT-43 Unit Box: Storm Arachns
description:
This expansion includes six Storm Arachn with reaper blades miniatures for the Therian army. There are two different sculpts, five of one, one of the other, and a reference card for each. Both sculpts have the same stats.

These units were not included in any army box but do not include new rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Ascension: Nyxian Corruptor Promo Card
description:
Promo card from Gen Con 2015

Cost: 6 Runes

Void Hero

Gain 3 Power
You may spend 3 runes as thought it was power this turn

3 Honor
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Nightmare Expansion Pack
description: The Nightmare Hordinox is the competitive prize for the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Monthly Organized Play Tournament, Month 1: Saddle of the Cavalier. The prize pack includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pop-Up Pirate! Treasure Island
description: Roll the die, search for the correct key. Use your memory to remember where it was. Unlock the chest and don't disturb the pirate. First to six coins wins.

name: The Art of Bidding
description:
In The Art of Bidding, you are a gallery owner trying to increase the Prestige of your business. Buy and sell paintings by Jackson Pollock, Vincent Van Gogh, Johannes Vermeer, Eugene Delacroix, and Andrei Rublev and become the most Prestigious gallery owner.

In game play, players own three paintings by one of the greatest painters of all time. Each player will auction their own paintings (one of which is a fake) and try to acquire paintings of other masters throughout gameplay. During bidding, players may bid with all assets at their disposal and the player auctioning a painting may accept the best offer and does not have to simply accept the highest monetary offer. Players also can draw Gallery cards that may give investment dividends or may be used as end game multipliers of Prestige points.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trading

name: Eco Town
description:
Build your own town! Complete your very own town with houses, trees, bicycle, recycle bin and rain water tank. The town on each playing board can be joined together in many different ways for more creative play! The perfect dice game for the little ones to learn to save our environment.

Setting up:
1. Each Player takes a board
2. Put all the playing pieces in the center

To Play:
1. Roll the dice
2. Pick up the item that is the same color as the dice and place it on the spot on the gameboard with the corresponding color.
3. Next Player roll the dice
4. If the player rolls a same color as he previously got, he has to place the item at the next player's gameboard.

Winning:
The winner is the first player with all pieces in correct colors and positions, thus completed building an EcoTown!

name: Firestorm Planetfall
description:
Planetfall an explosive, fast paced game that brings ground-pounding, armoured combat to the ever-expanding Firestorm Galaxy.

In this deadly, hard sci-fi setting, hordes of futuristic tanks, agile aircraft and hulking mech-walkers tear each other asunder with high-powered weaponry. Lasers burn across the tabletop, rail-gun slugs smash through armoured hulls and advanced cyber-warfare weapons hack through vital systems – the war zones of the distant future are no place for the faint hearted.

Firestorm Planetfall puts you in the role of a Grand Commander, orchestrating the maneuvers of your chosen army. Each of your Battle Groups will contain several Helixes of stunningly-detailed 10mm scale miniatures, ranging from towering Leviathans to numerous bases of Infantry, all prepared to fight to the last under your command.

Your planetary invasion force will be formed of troops from one of the six core races, who in turn belong to one of two sides: the Zenian League or Alliance of Kurak, vast alliances currently fighting for dominance of the Galactic sector. Each of the six races has its own complex motivations within the conflict, as well as entirely unique vehicles and distinct ways of fighting their battles.


Firestorm Planetfall is a miniature tabletop wargame, set in the Firestorm Armada universe. The game uses 10mm miniatures and dice to reproduce future combat during planet invasion.

Firestorm Planetfall is a revised and updated version of Firestorm Invasion: Planetfall, with significant rules changes.

- Force construction is different and now uses the helix system,
- Reinforced Target Zone markers were removed,
- STAR cards were replaced by TACs (Tactical Action Cards), and - squadron activation no longer uses cards.

The helix system has also been blended into game play, in that you must activate every squadron within a helix before moving to another helix, and the turn structure is also different.

name: Professor Nod and His Turtle Race
description:
"You are racing your turtle to be the first in the Winner's Circle. Howeve, along the way, you must get special instructions from Professor Nod. He can help you win - or lose - so try to please him!"

This is a fairly basic spin-and-move game with the addition of a plastic "Professor Nod" figure which is used to allow or disallow certain actions. If a player wishes to take a shortcut, ends a turn on an opponent's space, or lands on a "Spin Again" space, that player must push a "Question Card" into the base of the Professor Nod figure. If he nods, the move is acceptable, if he shakes his head to the side the move is denied.

name: Halloween
description:
In Halloween, players play the role of dark lords recruiting minions across a graveyard. Whoever recruits the best army of undead will win the game.

MATERIAL

- 80 counters (headstones) in 4 colours (20 each of red, blue, yellow, green).
- 4 dark lords (red, blue, yellow, green)
- A deck of 36 mini-cards with the following structure:

-- The back of the cards shows a closed grave. There are 4 colours of graves (9 each of white, gray, black, brown).

-- For each grave colour, there are these fronts: 2 zombies (4 points each), 2 skeletons (3 points each), 2 ghosts (2 points each), 3 will-o'-the-wisp (1 point each).

GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW

Shuffle the whole deck and place the 36 cards facing down forming a 6x6 grid. This is the graveyard.

Players take turns moving their Dark Lord and claiming graves. When claiming a grave, the card is turned facing up. Players can also use their will-o'-the-wisps to inspect unclaimed graves.

The game ends when all cards have been revealed. Each player then adds up the value of his claimed cards. The highest score wins.

name: Schäferstündchen: Rumpelstilzchen
description:
Promo Role

From the card:

Bewegung 3
Kampf 2

Anstatt eine Vergabekarte auszuspielen, darfst du eine zweite Egoistenkarte ausspielen.

Movement 3
Fight 2

Instead of playing an Allocation Card you are allowed to play a second Ego Card.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Racing

name: Ice Fisher
description:
The cold wind blows across an expanse of lake frozen solid by the subzero temperatures. You gather your equipment and begin the journey to find the perfect location to set your shelter on the perfect patch of ice. Will you land the trophy catch or will you go home empty handed?

From the first cracks of the ice to the excitement of catching the prize fish, Ice Fisher recreates the experience. Variable settings to simulate differing ice thickness provides scalable playing time.

Players alternate turns. On a player turn they will need to strategically choose a location to attempt to catch fish. Utilizing deduction and hidden information analysis they will try to end their turn with a successful catch. Each failed casting on the line provides information about fish habits and should be considered on future turns.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Set Collection

name: Letter Playing Cards
description:
A high quality deck of playing cards made up of letters. With it, you can play hundreds of word games and card games. Instead of numbers, sets and runs, you use letters and make words.

Letter Playing Cards are for all ages. Whether you’re just starting out learning your letters and words in pre-school, or a scholar of the English language, fascinated by words. Whether you're a backpacker travelling light and meeting new friends, or a parent with too much luggage.

It's a whole new dimension on the phrase ‘Let’s have a game of cards’.

Here’s the short list of some of the more popular games you can play with Letter Playing Cards.

Word Poker; Texas Spell ‘Em; Rummy / Gin Rummy; Brag (3,4, 5 card or 9 card!); Patience / solo games; Hangman; Snaffle - the letter grab game; Old Maid; Murder (or Mafia); Word Black Jack; Letter Cheat; Word Speed or Spit; Go Fish; Hearts; Indian Word Poker; Moogle; Spoons; Letter Whist; Anagrams; Crosswords; Ghost; Flash Cards, Spelling tests, Word Bridge.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: Card Quest: Kingdoms
description:
2015 Solitaire Print & Play Contest entry description:

Adventure awaits you in Card Quest: Kingdoms, a solitaire card game you can play almost anywhere. Play as one of four heroes, each with different abilities. Each kingdom Quest card offers a unique challenge requiring different strategies to win. The journey is treacherous. Even the most experienced will fall to its dangers. Emerging victorious requires keen knowledge of the cards, timely use of gear and hero abilities, and a bit of luck. Card Quest: Kingdoms is easy to learn, but always a challenge to win.

Players take on one of five quests by defeating monsters, collecting their loot, and equipping gear. Each card serves multiple purposes, allowing for a lot of variety while only using a small deck of cards. If the player can successfully complete their quest without dying, the hero is triumphant and they can test their skill in another quest or try to improve upon their completion time.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Piranhaz!: Go Fish With Teeth
description:
From the publisher:

Piranhaz! Go Fish With Teeth is played in traditional "Go Fish" style, with a twist. If you have the head of a fish, you play it in front of you rummy style. Whoever has the next piece of that fish, may on their turn steal it and place that fish in front of them. Fish continue to grow and swim around the table until they are completed from head to tail. At that point a fish is yours to keep - UNLESS... someone plays an Oil Spill on you and makes you throw back your catch, Pollutes Your Catch, makes you lose a turn by making you Forget Your Bait, Checks your Fishing License and looks at the cards in your hand, Catches Everyone in the Trawling Net and everyone has to trade hands, or worst of all they play the PIRANHA and devour your catch as their own! Unless of course you already Stuffed & Mounted it to protect it! Everyone can enjoy this game where fortune can change in one round. Piranhaz! Go Fish With Teeth is a sure family favorite.

name: Crack of the Bat Baseball Dice Game
description: Crack of the Bat (COTB) Baseball is a dice driven baseball game that uses player and pitcher cards with realistic stats to simulate the game of baseball. A single roll of four 10-sided dice (red, blue, green and white) provides almost all the play resolution. Different combinations of these dice (blue-white, red-white and green-white) determine if the result is read from the pitcher or batter card, and whether the result is a hit or an out. All aspects of the game - fielding, stolen bases, hit location, strikeouts, etc. - can be simulated with the COTB system.

name: Kings of War: Destiny of Kings
description:
From the publisher's site:

The Destiny of Kings is a campaign supplement for the fantasy mass combat game Kings of War. A copy of Kings of War is required to use this book.

Within this 64 page softback book you will find:

Map-based Campaigns
Narrative Campaigns
The Quest of the Necromancer Campaign
New Heroes

Mortibris the Necromancer cursed and spat in the dust as he saw the host which awaited them. Leave it to the Elves to meddle in matters which did not concern them. With the Dwarfs and possibly the Basileans soon to be at his back, he could ill-afford further distractions here. No matter. The Elves facing him had no idea of the power he could unleash. Not even the blighted maiden at their head, whose essence he recognised readily enough… Madriga!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Ossetia 2008 & 2015
description:
Game covers first european war of the XXI century - conflict between Georgia, Russia, and the Russian-backed self-proclaimed republics of South Ossetia and Abkhazia. The war took place in August 2008 following a period of worsening relations between Russia and Georgia, both formerly constituent republics of the Soviet Union. The fighting took place in the strategically important Transcaucasia region.

Game contains three scenario - historial one and two hypotethical, including 2015 conflict with NATO's units involved.

Game was published in 41 issue of the "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine, in both Polish and English editions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Castle Poker
description:
In Castle Poker players use one standard deck of cards with 6 special cards added. Players also have a castle card each with 3 vacant spots on the bottom, where cubes are placed, to represent their progress building their castle.

5 cards are dealt to each player. Then in order,from the left of the dealer, players may discard to The Moat, as many as three from their hand. When all the players have discarded, hands are refilled to 5 cards.

Then in order from the left of the dealer players may make one bid of stones (cubes) from their supply. When each player has made ONE bid, all hands are revealed.

The player with the lowest poker hand looses their bid back to The Quarry. All other player get an extra stone from the Quarry to their supply. They also keep the stones they bid.

The player with the highest poker hand may place half the stones (rounded down) they bid onto their castle if they also bid the most stones.

The special cards include a messenger, a trebuchet and barrels of supplies. The partymeeple version also has a Bishop.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Battlegories
description:
Players each pick a card with several possible categories, and select one that becomes their "category" for the game. Before the game is announced, the players go around twice to say what their category is, after which everyone's responsibility is to remember everyone else's categories.

During the main phase of the game, cards numbered one to eight are dealt out to each player. Whenever a card JUST placed from the deck matches one on the table, the two players whose stacks have the matching numbers go head to head: whoever says something from the other person's category first wins both cards (each category member may only be used once). There are also a small number of "Rambo" cards, which when played start an all-player race to say the "Rambo" player's category first (including that player). The winner of the Rambo round gets the Rambo card.

There are various other rules to ensure that no players reveal others' categories, help other players, etc.

name: Legacy at Sea
description:
Given few options, many choose a life of plunder and strife. Life aboard a pirate ship is anything but easy. Cramped quarters, storms, rats and infested food, most will be lucky to survive. A few could even find fortune. Be skilled and your name may live on in history. How will you be remembered?

Features of Legacy at Sea

Each turn, choose to sail to look for loot or dock at port to find prospects.
Easy but interesting conflict resolution. Decide the method in which you would like to plunder.
4 different Pirate Ship types.
Upgrade your ships – You may add cannon, crew, and officers.
Story Cards – Each card affects the entire theater. The world is bigger than you and Europe is reacting to the pirates.
Based on historic events as you play from 1716 to 1718.

name: Scout: Mein erstes Taschengeld
description: Today the kids have money to spend once again, and in Scout: Mein erstes Taschengeld the players decide for themselves how to spend their money and what to save. Whoever wisely divides up their money, compares prices, earns coins on their own, and feeds their piggy bank wins!

name: SOURCES
description:
In this ultimate battle card game, powerful SOURCE wizards face each other in a spell casting show down! Two to four players move around the play area, made up of hidden Spell Cards, collecting and combining sets of cards to make powerful spells to unleash on the other wizards! The aim of SOURCES is simply to defeat your opponents - the last wizard standing wins!

Spell Cards come in four types, representing the power Source for each wizard – Fire (red), Earth (green), Water (blue) and Air (yellow). In each of these four Sources there are seven spell types (Molten Rock, Fist of Air, Acid Spray, Cone of Cold, The Orb, Sound Wave and Concussion Bolt). Combining these together in sets of one Source, or one spell type (eg. Molten Rock), creates spells that cause damage. Even more powerful spells can be made by combining specific sets of spell types in one Source colour.

Players start with 20 Life (indicated by a d20), a hand of four Spell Cards, and the play area is laid as a 4 X 4 grid of Spell Cards that start face down, with the remainder of the Spell Cards set aside as a draw pile.

Each turn, players can perform a number of different actions once each:
- Take a Spell Card from the draw pile if they have a hand of fewer than four
- Move their wizard avatar from one Spell Card in the play area to another adjacent card

Reveal the Spell Card their avatar is on, choosing whether to trade this with one in their hand or not (either way a Spell Card has to be replaced back in the play area)
Attack another player by discarding a set of three Spell Cards. There are three types of attacks:


1- Source attacks - three Spell Cards from the same Source colour, this type of attack only does 2 damage
2- Basic spell attack - three Spell Cards of the same spell type (eg. Molten Rock) from any of the four Source colours, doing the damage indicated by the spell type (1 to 7 damage)
3- Advanced spell attacks - each Spell Card has a combination attack written on it, consisting of three different spell types (all in the same Source colour). These attacks are the hardest to collect, and do the most damage (8 to 12 damage).

name: Captaincy
description:
Captaincy is a miniatures game of ship-to-ship combat. The rules track the changes in technology and tactics over the entire era of fighting sail in Europe, from the Renaissance to the Napoleonic Wars.

Each player controls 1-3 ships. Ships alternate rolling dice to move; big numbers increase speed, but trigger undesirable effects like heeling and drifting. There are no written orders.

The game includes ship and fleet information for the British, Dutch, French, and Spanish navies, extensive examples of play, and an index.

Captaincy is now available on Wargame Vault.
categories: Age of Reason, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Phase Order

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Nalfeshnee Expansion Pack
description: The Nalfeshnee Morblatt is the competitive prize for Month 2 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Rage of Demons. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dragon Ball Z: The Miniatures Game
description: Dragon Ball Z: The Miniatures Game is a tabletop miniatures combat game based on the popular fighting genre. The game features vs. modes (PVP) as well Boss modes. It can be played on its own, or characters from this game can face off against those in the Mortal Kombat X: The Miniatures Game and/or Street Fighter: The Miniatures Game as all three games use the same "Universal Tactics System," specifically developed to integrate multiple fighting worlds.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: F.U.B.A.R.: Bringing out the worst in America's best
description:
A Cards Against Humanity style game targeted at veterans and members of the military. The game is composed of 100 black Prompt cards and 285 white Response cards.

Description from the publisher:

FUBAR can be played by 4-20 people, and is compatible with the Cards Against Humanity base game.

The deck was designed for all four real branches of the military and the Coast Guard so there’s enough hate to go around.

You guys know how this works. Prompt (black) and response (white) cards. Every player starts with a hand of ten response cards.

One player draws a prompt card and reads it aloud. The others each play a response card(s) they think is the most appropriate, amusing, or horrible. The player reading the prompt card shuffles the response cards, and chooses the one they like the most. The winner of the round takes the prompt card for a point, the answers are discarded, everyone draws to fill their hands, and the person clockwise reads the next prompt card.

If your cards suck (unlikely), or you’re not funny enough to win a round (more likely) and you’d like to redraw, just swap a prompt card for a new hand. If you’re really hurting for wins you can also swap a prompt card for the opportunity to play two answers cards at once during the next round. If that doesn’t score a point then maybe you consider stamp collecting.

Whoever has the most prompt cards at the end, or is the last one conscious wins fame, fortune, and everlasting glory.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Modern Era Core Rules
description:
From the publisher:

Lock 'n Load Tactical Modern Era 1960 - Present: Core Rules Manual v4.1 is the latest set of guidelines and regulations for the Tactical level wargame system written by Jeff Lewis, Lead Developer of the Lock ’n Load Tactical Series.

These rules present the core rules for the game system for modules taking place from 1960 to present. Now with all the core rules for your favorite games in one book, playing the game is easier and faster than ever.

Notable changes from previous versions of the rules (v3.1 and earlier) will be presented in BLUE text. This new edition of the rules can be used with previously published modules.

PLEASE NOTE: There is a difference between the Living Rules PDF Edition and the Printed book, the printed book does have tables and reference charts not available in the PDF. They are more of a general reference then module specific as comes in the games.

This printed book was designed with the hard core Lock ’n Load Tactical fan in mind or for those that have the older games in the series but wanted to have a hard copy set of the new rules in their hands.

name: Shadowfist: Dark Future
description:
Dark Future was an expansion set sold as boosters for the Shadowfist game. The story takes place in the future juncture of the Secret War. The Reascended are introduced: the Ascended reborn using High Tech. Also, a new faction debuts: The Purists are masters of magic, math and paradox.

From the booster box:
The Architects' iron rule weakens as they fight a civil war masterminded by Homo Omega, who uses the distraction to plot humanity's destruction. It all comes to a head in the year 2062, as heroes die, a new faction is born, and the world spirals closer to a Dark future.

name: Chickamauga: Bloody September, 1863
description:
Chickamauga: Bloody September, 1863 (CBS) is volume four of Paul Koenig’s Bloody Civil War Series. It is a two-player wargame simulating the second bloodiest battle of the war and the biggest defeat for the Union in the West. As the Confederate player, you are in the rare position of outnumbering your enemy. On the first day you must take Thomas' initial blow, and then knock him back, setting up for
the decisive battle on Day 2 after the arrival of Longstreet. As the Union player, you must hope that Thomas can be the Rock of Chickamauga once again. Your army arrives slowly, and you will be hard pressed to hold back the Rebels.

name: Fighting the Islamic State
description:
Fighting the Islamic State was researched and designed to show why the war in Iraq and Syria is causing so many refugees, who is fighting and why, and what outcomes may occur. The game covers the period 2014-2017, and so projects into the future. In order to accommodate that, we'll update the rules and charts periodically online to reflect what is happening in the field.

The game counters (playing pieces) include combat units for: the Islamic State ("ISIS," "ISIL," "Daesh"), the Syrian Regime (including Russians), the Syrian Rebels, the Kurds, the Iraqis, the Iranian-backed forces (Shia Militia and Hezbollah), and the US/Coalition forces (USA, France, Britain, Turkey).

The map covers all of Syria and Iraq and the border areas. Depicted are the power plants, dams, oil fields, refineries and archaeological sites that the Islamic State exploits for cash. The map is color-coded to reflect the primary religious sects that divide loyalties there: Shia and Sunni Muslims, plus "Tolerants." Fighting in an area that matches your Faction's religion helps you; fighting in the other areas helps your opponents.

The game is for 2-6 players. "Momentum" is a key concept - the player with Momentum starts and ends each turn. The Islamic State also commits "Acts of Terror" every turn that increase the likelihood for Intervention, mostly from the U.S.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Reliant Expansion Pack
description:
This ship is the competitive prize for Month 1 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, The Classic Movies. It is a Miranda Class ship.

The ship is distinct from the retail variant, being a part of the Independent faction and coming with all new cards.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: TRENCH SOLDIERS: A Solitaire Game of Combat in the Trenches of the First World War (1914-1918).
description:
INTRODUCTION: TRENCH SOLDIERS is a solitaire game of Combat and Survival in the muddy trenches in France or Belgium during World War I. The player assumes the role of an Infantry Soldier during the grueling and miserable tour in the Trenches. As a Soldier, you are a member of a Rifle Platoon responsible for securing your Sectors of Front by successfully taking enemy positions and defending yours with the least amount of casualties. As you survive and gain experience, your Soldier will improve his attributes and gain skills to help him further survive the horrors of War in the Trenches.
GAME OBJECTIVE
The objective of TRENCH SOLDIERS is to successfully survive a Tour in the trenches along the Western Front during World War I. A Tour consists of a number of Rotations in the Trenches. The Player can play a Short Tour (1 Rotation), an Average Tour (2 Rotations) or a Long Tour (3 Rotations). Each Rotation consists of making a Rotation Deck of 20 “Trench Life” Cards and once all Trench Life Cards have been drawn and resolved, the Rotation is over and the Player totals his Rotation VP and adds it to his Tour VP. Once all Rotations have been completed, the Player totals his Tour VP and then compares it to the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success. Players can choose to play as the Germans, French, Commonwealth (British, Australian/New Zealanders or Canadians) or the Americans.

GAME FEATURES: TRENCH SOLDIERS features plenty of colorful Game Counters and Game Mat. The Game provides plenty of grim themes associated with the War in the Trenches. Counters include Infantry Soldiers, HMGs, Flamethrowers, MK-IV Tanks, A7 Tanks, FT-17 Tanks, Pillboxes, Aircraft, Sub-Machineguns and Light Machineguns from the various Combatants. In addition to the standard Western Front Campaign Scenario there is, also, a Gallipoli/Palestine Campaign with supporting Terrain Markers and Counters for the Ottoman Turks.

TRENCH SOLDIERS can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Vortium
description:
Vortium is a collectible card game in an alien science fiction Universe. You are one of the Eternal, immortal and powerful beings that influence entire civilizations, and use them in their struggle with other Eternal to decide the fate of the Universe. You will open vortex in space, and through them you'll bring beings, devices, relics, ships, or use the energy to play actions, changing the course of the battle. Choose your allies between Shyr (reptilian fighters), Atlantis (aquatic humanoids), Meraq (gray geneticists), Al-Tuban (draconian conquerors), Tzabekh (humanoids) or the mysterious Nishtya.

You build two decks from your collection of cards: One of 50 cards, containing beings, devices, relics, ships, and actions from different civilizations, and another with 15 nexus cards, which you will use to open and enlarge vortex to different civilizations that will allow you to play the other cards.

Summon from their homeworlds different beings, enhance them with devices, or have them to pilot spaceships. Use relics from the Eternal to change the battlefield. You can attack your opponent's vortex with your beings and ships, trying to close them. Shut down all your opponent's vortex and you'll win the game!
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Le due piramidi
description:
The old pharaoh Ah-ledria-anar is going to deal with Anubis and his kingdom, he already knows, will be disputed by his old sons Saèl-ke-speta and Esarian-ka-ora.

"Who will build me the best pyramid, following the absurd canons that soon I will tell you (apt to make work the little game that would avoid bloodshed in my people), he will be rewarded my throne and all the troubles associated with it!"

Players will be Saèl-ke-speta and Esarian-ka-ora and they will build their pyramid contending and placing, in each round, the 5 boulders that his father will provide them from his royal cave. When the pyramids are completed each candidate to the pharaohness will have to choose 2 colors and score them. The player with the highest score will, of course, win the challenge.

name: Young Wizards
description:
CREATE your wizard deck from a combination of spell, race & treasure cards.

ADVENTURE board game or RPG-style!

IMPROVE your wizard deck with epic loot and advanced spells.

---

Young Wizards is a card-based tabletop RPG/board game where each player assumes the role of a... Well... A Young Wizard.

Each player constructs a deck of cards representing their spells, equipment and other features (like race). That deck can grow more powerful over time as the player adventures into twisting caverns and dark forests, discovering treasures & gaining experience.

All of that sounds great, and can be done with other tabletop RPGs. How does Young Wizards differ?


The game can be played without a Game Master(GM)/Dungeon Master for a more "board game" feel.
If played with a GM, setting up adventures & encounters is a breeze, leaving you more time to focus on your story.
More schools of magic than you can shake a wand at. Deck-builders rejoice! (of course, we have deck pre-constructions for the wee ones)
The card-based approach provides the perfect "bridge" between younger players and the deeper world of tabletop RPGs / board games.
mechanics: Acting, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: 2 Count!
description:
Hey Yo, listen up chico. 2 Count! is a pro wrestling micro card game for 2 players. Players are trying to get the biggest "pop" from the audience by performing the better move/hold.

Each player takes a deck of 9 cards that make up their wrestlers moves set. These moves all have a numerical value that indicates how valuable that move is to the wrestler. These decks are shuffled and then each player will draw 2 cards.

After drawing cards players will assess what they have and potentially what the other player has and then choose 1 crowd reaction card. Crowd Reactions are used as a "bet" and go to whomever wins each round.

On a count of 1, 2, 3 each player slaps down one of their 2 wrestler cards and the higher value wins the round.

The catch (can) is that the highest moves in a wrestler's deck all have a different back to them so the opponent knows when you draw these cards. There is a also a hidden cheat card that each player has that will beat any of the higher valued cards.

After 8 quick rounds the wrestler who garnered the most crowd reaction is the ultimate winner.

2 Count! uses a mix of betting, card counting and reading the other player to create a fast playing card game for any wrestling fan.

name: Bad Moon Rising: The Fight for Fire Base Illingworth, April 1, 1970
description:
April 1st, 1970 was a nightmare that was not supposed to happen. The strategy of using Fire Bases (also termed Fire Support Bases) was created as part of President Nixon’s “Vietnamization” of the conflict in which US forces were gradually withdrawn and the bulk of the fighting turned over to the ARVN (Army of the Republic of [South] Vietnam). General George Casey, Sr. developed the Fire Base strategy in which US Artillery and other battlefield support assets were deliberately deployed in forward areas to disrupt the Communists’ lines of communication and supply, thereby inviting them to attack. Once the enemy was in the open and engaged the US forces would then call in massive amounts of air and artillery support to wreak devastation upon their foe. A Fire Base was only to be in one location 3 to 5 days, and extensive fortifications were not possible as everything had to be removed and redeployed by helicopter in a matter of hours. By April 1st 1970 Fire Base Illingworth had been in place for 11 days, allowing the NVA to completely map-out the American’s positions, size up the garrison, and determine its weak points. Adding to Fire Base Illingworth’s woes was the arrival of thousands of 8 inch artillery rounds on March 31st. The garrison had only hours to provide rudimentary protection for the new ammo dump by the time of the NVA’s attack.

The survivors of Alpha Troop and Charlie Companies who were garrisoning the fire base thought they had reached a place of refuge where they could rest, recuperate, and train their newly arrived replacements (FNGs as they were derisively termed by the veterans). However, the NVA saw the opportunity to exact revenge upon the Americans grow with each passing day Fire Base Illingworth remained in place.

name: MindTrap Audio Mystery Edition
description: An audio-only game (no board or other pieces) in the MindTrap series. Players listen to one of the eighty short mysteries on the two tapes, then rewind it and listen again for more clues. After discussing the solution among themselves, one person checks the answer book. If they are correct, congratulations! If not, the rest of the group asks questions of the reader, who answers "Yes", "No", or "Irrelevant" until they guess the answer or everyone gives up.

name: Rock'n Rodeo: Spiele-Messen-Metaller
description:
"Spiele-Messen-Metaller" is a promo for the German board game Rock'n Rodeo.

"Spiele-Messen-Metaller" does not want to camp near Hippies but wants to camp near other Metal fans.
mechanics: Hand Management, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Jindur: Pirates Gold
description: A Trick Taking Game with a pirate theme! Multiple ways to play and with a dice option, this game is fun for everyone! The game is for 1-4 players, it consists of 54 cards and 2 dice. To start the game, you shuffle the deck, draw 5 cards and roll the dice.To win the hand, you must either equal the number rolled or get as close as you can without going over. If there is a tie, you continue to play out your hand until there is winner.

name: Bulwark: Magistra Kuwanyauma
description:
A new hero deck for Bulwark.

Contains the following cards:

1x cover
7x Heroism 1
2x Heroism 2
1x Heroism 3
2x Feat of foresight
4x Obsidian Shard
4x Native Orichalcum
3x Shield of Living Stone
2x Open Palm Strike
2x Heavy Boot
2x No Way
2x Ultimate Fist
2x Tao to Tao
2x Rude Aquakening
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: The Exodus Of Israel
description:
A quick historical family game for all ages.

The Exodus Of Israel is one of the most well known and preserved events of ancient times, being found in many sources, including the Old Testament writings acknowledged by the Islamic, Judaic, and Christian faiths. It follows the story of the tribes of Jacob, having relocated to Egypt during a severe famine. Initially welcomed due to the favor earned by Jacob's son Joseph, generations later forced into slavery by a Pharaoh who no longer remembered or cared for the growing nation of outsiders. The God of Jacob (re-named Israel before his death) hears the plight of the nation, and delivers them out of the hand of Pharaoh through a series of plagues which break down the hardened will of Pharaoh as well as show His power in the eyes of the region. Led by the prophet Moses, the Israelites are granted their freedom, and immediately make their migration (Exodus) back to the land promised them by God. The journey was not a pleasant one. Being in the desert with stressed resources, it often led to complaining, and sometimes outright rebellion against Moses and God Himself despite leading and providing for them.

This game is for 2-4 players, and at essence is a roll-and move game suitable for children. However there are also several elements of choice involved, and anyone with an interest in the Exodus story would enjoy following the path of the Israelites and being re-acquainted with the joys and pitfalls experienced along the way. The game can accommodate non-readers and readers alike, and has been designed to be playable independent of direct parental supervision. The winner of the game manages to make the journey from Egypt to the Promised Land with the most amount of points.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Table Air Combat: Spitfire II
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.
Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.
Each aircraft is sold separately. Only pay for the ones you want, and print out as many copies as you need to create your own epic WWII air battle.
This set contains the Spitfire II, which was used in the Battle of Britain.

name: Table Air Combat: Ju-88
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability. The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the Ju-88, which was used in the Battle of Britain and the remainder of World War II.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II

name: Table Air Combat: F6F-5 Hellcat
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability. The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the F6F Hellcat.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II

name: Fool of the Feast
description:
The King is holding a great banquet and demands the kingdom’s best entertainment possible. Therefore he has invited all Troubadours and Fools around to audition their best show. The winner will become Fool of the Feast and well rewarded.

Fool of the Feast is a light pocket card game for 2 - 4 players where you try to put on the best show for the King. Only three cards are played in a game round, but with split cards and special actions there is a more complex strategy to explore.

The second time a players show gets the king’s favour - that player wins. A show consist of three rounds. Each round a card is played. First the entertainer presentation, then a fist act and lastly a second act. During the game the King reveal what he likes to see - and players now have to use the different card actions to make their show fit the Kings wishes.

The show with the most points total wins the king’s favor that round. The crown icons on a card is basic points you will score for act. So more crowns means a better act. This will be modified by what themes the king like and don't like. So if the king laughs at your rivals "juggling monk" - you might need to mess that show up.

The goal is to become the king’s fool - so basically everyone wins.

This game was originally a submission for the 18 card contest 2015. It was one the 18 finalists.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Medieval, Print & Play

name: CleptoMania
description:
CleptoMania is an exciting game of memory and concentration for the whole family.
Play it solo or as a gang of thieves – at the various crime scenes, you are looking for loot and demonstrating your skills. You need to be careful and quick, because if an alarm goes off or the site is surrounded by police, the game is over. Only if you master all the challenges will you be a true master thief.

In CleptoMania, every player is a thief. You can play on your own or in a team. The cards are laid face down on the table, are then mixed and arranged. The complete array of cards represents the scene of a crime. One player takes the first turn and flips over 2 cards. If two cards are turned over that are the same, something is activated, acquired, opened or the turn ends, depending on the cards. If two different cards are turned over (the exceptions are the alarm and the handcuffs), both cards are placed face down again and the turn ends. Once a player has finished his or her turn, the police, who are on the game board, move one space closer to the thief or the team. Then it is then next player's turn moving clockwise. If all the treasure and lock cards have been taken and the scene of the crime abandoned before the police have caught the thief or the team, the raid has been successful.

name: Sergeants: Hell on Wheels – M8 Greyhound
description:
The M8 Greyhound identified hostile units and reported their strength, composition, disposition and movement. While on the march making and remaining in contact with the enemy demanded an emphasis on speed and agility.

The Sergeants Hell on Wheels Vehicle Modules are playable with either Sergeants D-Day or Sergeants Miniatures Game. The M8 Greyhound Vehicle Module requires Sergeants Hell on Wheels for play.

Average Vehicle 32 VP
Number of Crew 4
Average Crew Total 18 VP

The M8 Greyhound Vehicle Module comes with:
•Vehicle Tactics Panel - cut into 6 parts for easy storage
•48 cards for the 4 crew with their action cards and special training cards
•16 cards for Armored Reconnaissance Tactics
•32 cards for the vehicle itself and various tactics cards as options
•Vehicle Flats - to use for play with Sergeants D-Day: In Action, Burning and Knocked Out
•Sighting Markers for the vehicles crew sighting targets
•Status Markers for "dismounted" crew and 2 hasty minefield markers
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Sergeants: Hell on Wheels – SdKfz 250-1 Halftrack
description:
SdKfz 250-1 was the reconnaissance vehicle of the used by the German panzer forces to scout for enemy positions and maintain contact with enemy forces.

The Sergeants Hell on Wheels Vehicle Modules are playable with either Sergeants D-Day or Sergeants Miniatures Game. The SdKfz 250-1 Vehicle Module requires Sergeants Hell on Wheels for play.

Average Vehicle 17 VP
Number of Crew 2
Average Crew Total 8 VP

The Sdkfz 250-1 Vehicle Module comes with:
•Vehicle Tactics Panel - cut into 6 parts for easy storage.
•32 cards for the 2 crew with their action cards and special training cards.
•16 cards for Armored Assault Tactics
•16 cards for Armored Reconnaissance Tactics
•32 cards for the vehicle itself and various tactics cards as options
•Vehicle Flats - to use for play with Sergeants D-Day: In Action, Burning, Knocked Out and Tracked
•Sighting Markers for the vehicles crew sighting targets.
•Status Markers for "dismounted" crew, mines and panzerfausts.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: SNCF: Transcontinental Railroads
description:
A new map for SNCF, designed by Anthony Fryer for HeavyCon 2016. It was given away (with the permission of Winsome Games) free to attendees of Heavy Cardboard's annual convention.

It features mountain hexes and rivers, both of which cost an extra cube for building. Three companies start on the west coast, the other three on the east coast. The game now also ends when a transcontinental connection has been made.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Factory Filler: The Filler Game
description:
In this filler game, filled with luck and logic, all players try to store their factory stock the most efficient. Especially the pipelines in different lengths make it a challenge to fit everything in your storage hall.

Each player has a different storage hall, which is a grid with a pillar in the middle and lots of stuff already stocked. Each round a new thing must get stored on your floor. One die roll determines for all players if this is a 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6 spaces straight pipeline to store. Players use a pencil to draw it on their floor.
As soon as you can't place the new piece, your game ends and the unfilled spaces are your minus points.
But you have 4 "escapes":

Once you can bend a new piece and store that.
Once you can break a new piece and store the 2 parts.
Once you can crunch a new piece to store it as a compact piece.
Once you can refuse a new piece.


The game consists of storage hall sheets, pencils and 1 die. With enough pencils, the number of players is unlimited, making it a filler game for each filler situation.

name: El Favor del Faraón: Momia
description:
Promotional tile from the Spanish edition

Roll 1 die (specials included) and 1 instant die.

Remove 1 scarab to each player
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Changeling: A Print-and-Play Pony Game
description:
Changeling is a hidden-identity game in which a small team of Changelings has infiltrated Ponyville to prepare the way for the invasion of Queen Chrysalis. The Pony team attempts to keep Ponyville intact through 5 Episodes, using teamwork, while the Changeling team wins by causing disasters and sowing 10 tokens worth of Mistrust.

Changeling's twist on other mafia-style games is the use of Character cards, which serve as both pass/fail votes and as special abilities. Players can call upon more than 60 of My Little Pony's most well-loved characters to aid them during negotiations. Even outed Changelings can swing the outcome of the game if they can use these powers to cause chaos.

name: Game of Words and Sentences
description:
The game consists of more than 300 small cards, each about 3/4" square and bearing a single capital letter. The letters are distributed by frequency, ranging from six Q, X and Z to 24 E. The rules say to place all the letters in a box from which players draw blind.

In the Game of Words, players draw one tile at a time. The first two players put their letters on the centre of the table, forming a pool. Each turn thereafter, a player tries to use the letter in his hand to form a word from the letters in the pool. If he succeeds, the word is placed in front of him. Players may use their letters to add to another word to create a new, longer one, and "capture" that word from another player. They also may add their letter to one of their own words. Letters in a word may be rearranged. Unplayable letters are added to the pool. Players draw a new tile to end their turn. The player with the most words at game end wins.

In the Game of Sentences, players draw two tiles per turn and again try to form words. Words of only one or two letters are allowed, as are proper names, place names and possessives. The winner is the first to use all of his words to form an intelligible sentence of an agreed length. The rules suggest that five to 10 words forms a pleasant game.

The rulebook also contains rules for two more games, The Block Game of Words (where letters are face up and players can choose) and The Game of Alphabets (where each player thinks of a word, gathers the necessary letters and passes them to his neighbor, who then must try to figure out what word those letters spell).

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Brotherhood of Evil Mutants Starter Set
description:
From the publisher:

This game is a small scale skirmish level game where Superheroes and Villains face off against each other in a 3D tabletop set up. It could be a city, the Wakandan desert, the Savage Lands, the blue area of the moon or anything you like. In Marvel they fight anywhere.
It is played on a 36" x 36" board so will fit on most tables without a problem.

In a game you will usually have between 4-7 characters on your team. Each of these characters act individually using their own Power to carry out different attacks and use Special Powers.
Many can help or hinder each others though with boosts and actions like a Fastball Special.

The aim of the game is to win set scenarios by completing different tasks and scoring Victory Points. These could be anything from take down / save the highest Level model in the team or rescue and keep a Cosmic Relic.

Each character comes with their own Stat Card which shows everything they can do. Attacks, Defence, Skills, Power, Damage and such.
These are then used in a 2 D8 mechanic during the game. For example, 2D8 plus Attack Stat vs Defence Stat or 2D8 against your own Agility.

Magneto formed The Brotherhood of Mutants as a group dedicated to the cause of mutant superiority over humans. Throughout its various incarnations, the Brotherhood's agenda has gravitated towards either subjugating the human race to the will of mutants or eradicating humanity altogether.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Fruit Case
description:
In Fruit Case, players attempt to collect sets of fruit to fill their baskets. Points are awarded for complete and partial sets.

The game contains 108 cards with identical backsides. On the front are the following:

12 each of six different fruits
24 baskets with two fruits (blue background)
4 wild pineapples (purple background)
2 baskets with 3 fruits (purple background)
2 bombs (purple background)
1 rotten apple with a worm (purple background)
3 tree cards (brown background)


The tree cards are laid face up in the middle, with at most one less than the number of players. Each player receives a two-fruit basket to start with and all other cards are shuffled. The starting dealer lays out, face up, a number of cards equal to the number of players. In turn, beginning with the dealer, each player chooses a card and places it in front of them. A player not wishing or unable to take a card instead takes one of the trees (if one is available in the middle). This tree may be returned to the center on a subsequent turn in order to take any fruit from the discard pile (instead of taking a card from the middle).

Each basket starts with two or three fruits already in it. A fruit card can only be added to the basket if that fruit is not yet present. Once a basket has all six fruits, all of its cards are stacked and turned sideways. Any number of baskets can be worked on at one time, but a fruit cannot be taken without a basket to go in.

The pineapple is a wild fruit, but each basket can only have one. If the bomb comes up in a deal, the entire turn is skipped and all cards from the middle are discarded. The rotten apple results in the dealer discarding one entire incomplete basket of theirs, if one exists.

After each round, the dealer role passes to the left. The game ends when there are not enough cards to fill the center. 5 points are awarded for each complete basket, with 1 point for each fruit card added to an incomplete basket.

Rules are also included for longer and shorter variants.

name: Master Maze
description: Maneuver each of the five marbles ("Mazarbles") through the maze to get the highest score.

name: The Illustrator
description:
This is a paper-and-pencil game, clearly a "beer and pretzels" game since it promotes the witbier (white beer) produced by the Belgian brewer Hoegaarden.

There is a deck of 124 cards, each of which has six words in both French and Flemish. There also are two pencils, a pad of square drawing sheets and a bag of blue and white chips.

As in charades but on paper, players are challenged to pick a word on their card and try to draw an image that will prompt the correct response from their partners or teams.

name: GOP Nominee
description:
Description from the publisher:

The 2016 Republican Primary was one of the most polarizing and exciting events to happen in American Politics in the last decade. The wildly different personalities of the candidates suddenly transformed the nomination process into a civil war of fundamental differences. In GOP Nominee, you will take on the role of one of the four major candidates running for the Republican Nomination.

GOP Nominee is an asymmetrical game played over 6 Rounds where each round represents 1 Month of the Primary Elections (Including Super Tuesday which counts as its own Round). A 7th Round is possible if the game goes to a Brokered Convention.

In each Round, Support Cubes may be gained or lost to Candidates and Actions will be played in an effort to increase the probability of your Support Cubes being drawn during the Voting Phase of the Round. However, Mud Cubes will also be gained by Candidates, decreasing their number of Support Cubes added to the drawing. Voting results determine which Candidates gain Delegates and get that much closer to winning the game.
mechanics: Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: At Villers Cottérêts
description:
World war one conjures up images of trenches, attrition, and overall stalemate. Indeed, much of the war beginning around 1915 was static and miserable with little hope of any decisive battle that would immediately end the war, but that was not the case in 1914.

The German Schlieffen Plan intended to outflank the French fortifications by moving through Belgium. The price was a British entry into the war to fulfill the international guarantee of Belgium's borders. Apart for some delay outside Liege, the German advance through France was nearly flawless in overwhelming the French & Belgians in key opening exchanges which caused the BEF to avoid encirclement through a long retreat. At Villers Cotterets portrays the desperate rearguard action near Marne in which the British managed to severely wound a much larger force all while successfully withdrawing to fight another day, one of the first times the Germans had seen any kind of delay.

AVC portrays the desperate rearguard action nearing the end of Mons in which the British managed to severely wound a much larger force all while successfully withdrawing to fight another day. History is unclear about who really “won” the conflict, but you can settle it here and now, although 102 years later. AVC is a Grand Tactical game meaning units will have ranged capabilities and are rewarded for sophisticated planning towards a shared objective.

Players active regiments via random chit pull, maneuvering battalions on the board. The inactive player can interrupt the active player's maneuvers unleashing lead during their advance. The limits of historical doctrine & command resulting in stacking/firing limits accurately reflect unit frontages and individual unit initiative. Events dropped into the activation pool can realistically dramatically change the course of the game.

No two games of AVC will ever be the same. The situation lends itself to a naturally competitive scenario with an adversary, but the mechanics are intuitive as to compliment solo play. Action moves quickly back and forth between the two sides, but the game also rewards careful planning. AVC recreates the excitement of the young men off to war during the guns of August with the tactical realities of early 20th century warfare without having to charge into a machine gun nest in the open.

Product Information:
Complexity: 6 out of 10
Solitaire Play – 7 out of 10
Time scale: Sixteen thirty-minute turns.
Map Scale: .3 miles per hex
Unit Scale: Battalion, Cavalry Squadron, Company, Batteries, Brigade HQ
Players: 1 good for historical play, 2 best for competitive play.
Playing Time 3-5 Hours

name: Indago
description:
A game of investigation in the Middle Ages. In an ancient kingdom where the vice-king has been murdered and the king asked to his faithful (are they?) dignitary to solve the mystery and find the guilty.
Every single player (from 4 to 6) will trade for clues with the others deciding who is loyal and who is not. For every correct guess, they will gain clues, but betrayals are behind the corner.
Will you be smarter than the other players, charming them to give you the correct cards and fooling them giving the wrong ones?
20 to 60 minutes to discover it! And remember, if you will collect the least amount of clues you will be condemned as a murderer: shame on you!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Medieval, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation

name: LOLZ: The Gift of Laughter! – The Family VOL 1
description:
The Family VOL 1 expansion adds 50 additional kid-friendly playing cards to your existing collection of LOLZ: The Gift of Laughter!

Gameplay in LOLZ: The Gift of Laughter! is team based. A player from each team will place a "Mouthies" around their lips, pulling their lips back and making pronunciation difficult. That player will then attempt to reach a few words from the card they have drawn. They may repeat themselves as often as they would like and must get their teammate(s) to correctly guess the words they are trying to pronounce within 30 seconds. Afterwards the opposing team takes a turn. The first to five or ten points wins!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Battleblade
description:
Battleblade is a skirmish-level fantasy wargame. Usually using less than 10 figures per side, players pit their party of warriors against their opponent's in one of several objective-driven scenarios.

Battleblade uses the same Command & Cohesion mechanic introduced in Laserblade but shifts the focus more towards close combat as well as adding rules for magical attacks, all driven by the roll of a single D10.

Offering a point-based system for character creation, players are free to create the battling party that best matches their playing style.

With games lasting as little as 20 minutes a time, it's possible to complete a whole campaign in an evening, or to play a quick warmup game before settling down to play your mass-battle game of choice...

name: Xēko Mission: Costa Rica
description:
The Mission: Costa Rica Starter Set comes in a cigar box made from recycled paper. Includes an oversized playmat with an eco-map on the back, 43 cards (4 Endangered, 14 Rare, 23 Common, two limited-edition sketch cards) for a 2-player game, giant learn-to-play cards, bonus CD, and a rulebook Xeko cards are printed on recycled paper with eco-friendly inks. Xeko donates 4% of game net sales to Conservation International.

Additional Mission: Costa Rica cards could be purchased in 9-card booster packs from displays. Mission: Costa Rica added a total of 96 new cards.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Environmental

name: Morphos
description:
IntroductionMorphos is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It's played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square board. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white.



DefinitionsTo flip a stone means to replace it with a stone of the opposite color.

A vulnerable black stone is a black stone that is part of at least one of the following two patterns or their translations, rotations or reflections:

a) Black stone on b2 and white stones on b3, a3, a2 and b1.

b) Black stone on b2 and white stones on a4, a3, a2, b1 and c1.

Likewise, with colors reversed, for vulnerable white stones. In all cases, the colored edges of the board count as lines of stones of their respective colors, with a length equal to that of a normal row or column of the board. The status of any points outside those patterns is irrelevant.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On their turn, a player must either place a stone of their color on an empty point of the board or flip a vulnerable enemy stone.

If a player has no moves available on their turn, they must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed. There will always be a move available to at least one of the players.

If, at the end of a player's turn, there is a chain of orthogonally adjacent stones of their color touching the two opposite board edges of their color, that player wins. Draws are not possible.



Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means that White will have the option, on his first turn only, to change sides instead of making a regular move.



VariantsThe following mutators can be used (together or separately) to alter the character of the game:

a) Both vulnerability patterns have the stone in the top left corner removed from them. This results in a game reminiscent of Crossway, but somewhat slower and free of illegal moves on empty points. All other mutators on this list work best when combined with this one.

b) A stone that was flipped by the enemy on their latest turn still counts as a friendly stone for flipping purposes. In this case, the winning condition must be checked for a player at the start of their turn instead of at the end of it, and it's illegal to flip a stone if the opponent could flip it back on their next turn.

c) On their turn, a player must either place up to two stones of their color on empty points or flip one vulnerable enemy stone.

d) When a player captures (flips) a stone and there are empty points on the board, the captured stone is placed next to the board, and the opponent must place it on an empty point of the board before making a regular move.

e) Before the start of the game, the board is filled with stones forming a checkered pattern. This results in a game very similar to Metamorphosis but without draws.
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: 100,000 Blind Dates
description:
Chinese people are very stressed and busy due to the high cost of living. As a result, a lot of young people don't have much time to meet people and start a relationship, which leads to blind dates being a popular way to find the other half of their lives.

In many situations, young people don't know how to start to talk on a blind date, so this game is a helpful tool for them to show their charm right from the beginning.

100,000 Blind Dates is based on Chinese research on the experience of one hundred thousand blind dates. The game uses the keywords from the research to help people talking on blind dates.

The game is very easy. Players use the keyword cards and event cards in their hands, along with the charm keyword cards on the table, to profess their feelings to the people in which they're interested. Then, both people score accordingly.

At the end of the game, the player with the highest score wins, and they might be the most successful mate with whom others will want to start a relationship...

User summary (Chinese):
是一款支持3-8人的欢乐聚会桌游，游戏时间在15-30分钟，适合玩家年龄在14岁以上，
大家在游戏中分别扮演拥有四个不同魅力属性的角色，玩家们会因为彼此角色的魅力属性而心生爱慕，从而进行表白和各种针对表白的反应动作。游戏中，玩家有很多方式来获得暧昧分数，暧昧分数被视为真诚，勇敢，魅力和智慧的象征，在游戏结束时，拥有最高暧昧分数的玩家获得胜利，他被视为是在相亲情场上最成功的人。

如果你喜欢一个人，应该和他玩《十万次相亲》，在游戏里，你可以向他表白；
如果你不喜欢一个人，应该和他玩《十万次相亲》，在游戏里，你可以拒绝他的表白；
如果你不了解一个人，也应该和他玩《十万次相亲》，在游戏里，你们可能是相爱的；

name: Dungeons of light and darkness
description:
Somewhere in the tunnels of Dungeon of Light and Darkness, lies famous Fountain of Knowledge. Many have tried to find it, but none succeed. And no, there are no monsters in this dungeon.. But the light goes on and off in its chambers in mysterious ways, and this is enough to drive explorers crazy and forever lost. Can you become the first man in centuries to drink from the long lost fountain?

Dungeons of light and darkness is a push your luck tile and dice placement game of exploring a dungeon in search for the Fountain of Knowledge.
