With the Pirates mini-expansion, choose one of these charismatic commanders, build your fleet according to specific rules, explore new capacities like “stealth” and challenge the domination of the "Hegemony of Amycles" and the "League of Phoebe".
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame

name: Halo: Fleet Battles – Covenant CPV-Class Heavy Destroyer
description:
Description from the publisher:

As the war progressed the crews of the CPV's found a newfound purpose as executioners and heralds, wielding excavation beams with deft hands and claws to carve meaningful sigils into cleansed worlds and leading battle groups against remnant UNSC forces judged unworthy of meeting the fleet's Supreme Commander. Veteran crews also found a new currency of honor in using their well-practiced skills to assist the artifact hunting fleets that scoured former human worlds for Forerunner relics and war trophies, with many turning quasi-mercenary and offering their services to Ministry leaders eager to one-up each other with treasures and baubles recovered from the glassed ruins.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Fantastiqa: The Soul-Soothing Spring of The Mystical Mina Promo Card
description: Promo card for Kickstarter of Fantastiqa: Rival Realms. Used with Fantastiqa. After setting up the game as usual, this card is placed next to the WETLANDS Region, and remains in play for the entire game. Alternately, it may be placed next to any region. Card allows players to spend 1 Gem to reclaim any card from their discard if they end their turn in this Region.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection

name: Loot the Body!
description:
Description from the publisher:

Explore, collect treasures, and change fate with the help of a little magic. Loot the Body! is a strategic family game for 2 - 5 players. Gameplay is a competitive cooperative style with players working together to survive while trying to out do each other and collect the most loot.

Every game is different with a central dungeon built from 36 different cards. Dungeons always include 3 boss monsters and a random selection of 12 other cards.

Players take turns revealing the central dungeon card. All players simultaneously play an action card and draw their hands back up. After all players have placed a card, the Action cards are revealed and effects take place. Players that are last to draw a new card always suffer a small penalty. Monsters that aren't destroyed get to fight back.

Loot the Body is full of fast action and split second decisions that keep everything moving and fun no matter how many times you've played before. The base game also includes some rule variants for players that want even more chaos as they fight to survive and gain loot.
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Hand Management

name: Pokamates
description:
Grab your friends to begin this addictive, fun generating, family game, combining a splash of poker, topped with a taste of Scrabble. An exciting new poker board game for the whole family, played by 2 to 4 people.

Players take turns, arranging poker hands, either horizontally or vertically on the board.

Features a funky felt playing board
Four Double Score and four Triple Score indicators
PokaMates playing cards, 80 PokaMates chips, Score sheet and Instruction sheet

name: Velvet
description:
A plush-your-luck micro-Legacy game of hand management and adventure for 2 players.

The Plush Seers of your homeland have found the location of the fabled “Threads of Destiny” - an ancient artefact with the power to strengthen and preserve. There is only one problem: the threads are hidden in your rival’s homeland!

Players take turns sending plush stuffed-animal “Velvets” into their opponent’s homeland: seeking out their Threads of Destiny.

Each set of Velvet contains 2 lots of 12 cards (8 Velvet stuffed animals, 3 Obstacles, and 1 Threads of Destiny). Each player takes 1 lot of 12 and uses the included stickers to customise the look, stats and abilities of their Velvet plushies over the course of three games, to form the most powerful party of adventurers that the Plush Homelands have ever seen!

On your turn, you may Invade, Retreat, Scout or Explore your opponent's hand. The order of a player's hand cannot be changed once the game begins, and once a player reveals and Explores their opponent's "Threads of Destiny", they win!

A micro-Legacy game designed to be played in convention lines, Velvet is part Battleship, part dungeon crawler.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Exploration, Fantasy, Humor, Memory

name: The Bloody Triangle: Drive on Dubno, 1941
description:
Issue game in Command Magazine Japan #120

On June 22nd 1941, the German army began operation Barbarossa, the biggest ground operation ever in history, and overran the western Soviet armies immediately. Soviet troops withdrew after fighting back, and their mechanized corps counterattacked in front of Dubno.

The Bloody Triangle: Drive on Dubno, 1941 is a two-player game on the capture of Dubno by the German 48th armored corps and the Soviet army counterattack.

Based on the "Panzer korps" system, this game reproduces the clash between the Soviet mechanized corps relying on heavy tanks and numbers, and the skilled German Army superior in combined arms. Which side will be victorious in one of history's biggest tank battle?

Components:
rulebook (12 pages)
map (A1 size)
counters

name: Bacon, Letters and Tomatoes
description:
Description from the designer:

The word-building, burger-stacking card game!

It's the lunch rush at Elisabeth's Diner! Tables are waiting for their food and it's up to you to feed those hungry customers! Use letter Ingredient Cards to build word burgers, fulfill tables, and collect tips. Be quick: if your fellow chefs feed more people than you, your shift might end before you realize!

Two to four players use Ingredient Cards to build word burgers, fulfilling the Guest Checks. The first player to fulfill 3 Guest Checks ends the game, and the player who has earned the most money at the end of the day is the winner.

name: Dust 1947: Chinese Army Starter Set – "Battlegroup PLA"
description:
The People's Liberation Army (PLA) comes from the Far East to help the tide of the Red Revolution cover the world! These fierce fighters are lead in battle by siblings who have developed a unique fighting style, who is gaining tremendous popularity in the Motherland. Expanding far from the South-Asia region, PLA forces can now be found all over the world, wherever the SSU fights. This new force will surely shake up the war and lead the Bloc to victory.

The PLA Battlegroup contains the following units:
- The Dragon (SU501)
- The Phoenix (SU502)
- PLA Assault Squad (SU531)
- Nina (TSH) (SU532)
Everything you need to start a new glorious PLA Faction Army is included in this Battlegroup! Please note that the Dust 1947 Starter rules, a durable neoprene gaming mat, terrain, dice, etc. are included in this Starter Set.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dragonfire: Druid Half-Elf Promo Card
description: Half Elf Druid demo/purchase promo from Gen Con 2017, front and back. It is dual-classed, allowing for one more red card for one less green card in the starting equipment. Dual-classing is available for other characters through in-play abilities.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Beneath Nexus: Myths and Monsters Mini Expansion
description:
The Myths and Monsters Mini Expansion introduces 7 new cards to Beneath Nexus to expand the base game, 5 new monsters, 1 new Relic, and 1 new Cursed Relic.

Dy-Buk - Souls of the dead that lurk in the shadows of Nexus. They have long forgotten who they are and spend their days in fear, hiding from the more powerful denizens of Nexus.

Amano-Jaku - Evil spirits that have been drawn to the dark power of the Ether Well. The power of the Blight has turned them into the embodiment of curses and ill intent.

Aketeko - Fiendish little monsters that appear to be an animated hand of a red ape. They graft themselves on to corpses and use the stolen bodies to harrass unsuspecting heroes.

Dark Construct - Once powerful battery constructs that helped scholars and mages in their research into ether, the Dark Constructs now serve as vessels for spreading the power of blighted ether.

Kappa-Hama - Wise men of Bara-hama that came to Nexus to cleanse it, their faith in the Holy Fire was not enough to protect them from the corruption of the Blight.

Muramasa - The greatest sword ever made by the greatest swordsmith who ever lived, it was forged with spite and ill intent. Able to rend any foe, it deals as much harm to its wielder as its victims.

Masamune - Made to atone for the creation of the Muramasa, the Masamune was made to defend, not attack. Every stroke channels healing power into the allies of the wielder.

The expansion includes:
- 12 total cards
- 5 new Monster cards (2 copies of each)
- 1 new Relic
- 1 new Cursed Relic
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Mr. Whiffle Promo Card
description:
Apocrypha Adventure Card Game by Lone Shark Games can be played as a cooperative card game or a role-playing game set in a pre-apocalyptic world. Their own Patrick Rothfuss contributed to the storytelling. Impress your friends with this horribly awesome Mr Whiffle card!

All proceeds go to Worldbuilders.

Body Gift
Discard: Boost Body.
Support - Slot: While Slotted,
-active saint Donate to Charity: Draw 1 new Omen. If it is an Omen of Doom, sacrifice Mr. Whiffle.

Keywords: Dreamer, Ally, Tool, Charm
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Galacta: Galactic Rebellion
description:
Publisher Description

Galactic Rebellion is an adventure game--played with miniature figures--which simulates futuristic combat during the great Rebellion against the interstellar Galactan Empire. Here is a realistic game in which you choose the troops and weapons you wish to use, and then command the attack (or defense).

Included in Galactic Rebellion are stormtroopers, rebel adventurers, alien octopoid troopers, planetary striker troops, and two types of robots.

User Summary

A Galacta series game from Heritage USA's Paint 'N' Play line.

The Paint 'N' Play games all featured Heritage miniatures along with paints and painting instructions. Unlike the other Paint 'N' Play games, which featured a board, the Galacta series games were straight miniatures rules designed to be played directly on the tabletop.

The contents included metal miniature figures, paints, a brush, "adventure game rules", and a 12-sided die. Heritage sold additional Galacta 25mm figures that could be used with the games.

name: Black Lion's Roar: The Battle of Cantigny, May 27-31, 1918
description:
During their Spring offensive, the German 82nd Reserve Division captured the crucial crossroads town of Catigny. The newly arrived 1st US Infantry Division was rushed to the front and its 28th Regiment, nicknamed the Black Lions, was ordered to retake and hold the town. Although the Americans quickly took the town from the disorganized and ill-prepared defenders, the Black Lions had to then endure days of increasingly desperate and violent counter-attacks that decimated the ranks of both sides. The outcome of the battle would be a telling indicator of America’s new role in the Great War.
—description from the publisher

name: The Scroll
description:
The Scroll is a deck building game where players compete against each others, and against the game itself. Players incarnate heroes with unique abilities, expanding the powers on their quest to collect the Tears of Power - the artefacts needed for the ritual summoning the Scroll - and become the ruler of the Sacred Lands."

Each player starts the game with a hero (with unique powers to use through the game), a starting deck of crystals (the in-game currency), and a secret quest. Each hero has also a specific thematic and colour, corresponding to the type of crystals they use.

Four card stacks - one for each corresponding crystal colour - are used to get new cards. Players start only buying cards from their own crystal colour, until they gain new abilities allowing them to get cards associated with the other crystals.

To win the game, two Tears of Power must be collected. One is obtained by accomplishing the quest (requires a deck optimisation); the other is obtained by successfully summoning Rhaluyne the Wise (requires enough crystals and a dice roll).

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Batman the Animated Series Promo Cards
description:
From the critically acclaimed Batman animated series, these 3 Dice Masters cards depict Batman and his allies. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for DC Comics Dice Masters contains three cards:


Batgirl: Carrying the Mantle (Alternate Art for card from DC Comics Dice Masters: Batman)
Batman: "I am the Night"
Robin: Reckoning


Batgirl and Batman use the dice from DC Comics Dice Masters: Batman, Robin uses the die from DC Comics Dice Masters: World's Finest.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Yogi: Free demo version
description:
Given away for free at GenCon and other events.

Features 8 cards - 4 from the full Yogi game, 4 with flipped art and unique instructions.

There is also an advert card and an instruction card.

The intention is for 1 player to try to do all 8 things at once.

name: Sixth Fleet
description:
Sixth Fleet is a two-player, strategic-level wargame of the struggle for the Mediterranean set during a hypothetical Warsaw Pact versus NATO war during the 1970s and 1980s. It is primarily a naval-air conflict, with some elements of power projection using ground forces. The game map represents various sea zones (or zones) within the Mediterranean, as well as adjoining land areas. Critical bases for both sides, including neutral nations are also depicted.

Aircraft units represent one to six squadrons, with the counter displaying the primary type of aircraft. Ship units represent one fleet aircraft carrier or battleship and “divisions” of four cruisers or nuclear-powered submarines with destroyers being represented in squadrons of six to eight destroyers or non-nuclear subs. Other ship types are represented at the division level and represent various numbers of ship types. On the map, each inch equals 20 miles. Each turn represents from one day to one week of activity, depending on the level of activity. Sixth Fleet is based on Red Dragon Rising. Changes have been made based on the situation in the Mediterranean during the Cold War.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Simulation
publishers: Decision Games (I), Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社)

name: Grunts N' Gold
description:
It is a time of War!

Great battles rage and are being fought across all the lands!

Small groups of rogue soldiers, called Grunts, have broken away from the fighting having heard tales of gold, lying untouched and forgotten, around the war ravaged kingdoms.

Lead your team into 4 fantastic locations - where only the most skilled and daring of players will achieve victory against their opponents in the quest for Fortune, Glory and Gold!

Grunts N' Gold is a 2 - 4 player action strategy game where players roll dice and collect and use cards to move and fight there way through the battlefields to get to the Gold. Every team is made up of 4 Grunts and 1 General and the objective is to get your General and 1 of your Grunts into the Gold position and hold off your opponents for 1 turn while you seize it. Weapons can be found and used by collecting loot cards from the battlefield but this comes with the risk of springing booby traps so these must be collected with caution. Greed is bad but Gold is good!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Guild Ball: Season 3 Plot Card Deck
description: Guild Ball isn’t just a sport, but a political arena in which the guilds fight for influence. Players are often given special instructions before a game, their actions preventing the seizing of power and settling old grudges. The Guild Ball Plot Cards provide a representation of this intrigue in the game, an unexpected card foiling even the best laid plans.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Tell a Tale
description:
In Tell a Tale, three to ten players use words from cards in their hand to make a story that correlates to the genre for each given round. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Using the Word cards in their hands, players need to think of a book title and synopsis that fits the Genre revealed. Each card has a word that fits its category. A player can use up to five cards from their hands to come up with the title, as well as any additional words from the Genre card. The player can change the words into adjectives, nouns or verbs as needed.

Players can also use any conjunctions, determiners, prepositions and/or pronouns they want (these don't score points at the end). Once each player has selected their cards and words for the book title, starting with the first player, everyone in order tells the title out loud and after that describes the synopsis for their book.

name: Africa/Asia Aflame Update Kit
description:
This contains two extensions for World in Flames, Africa Aflame and Asia Aflame.

Components:

400 counters (WiF Countersheets 14 & 15)
map of Africa (Pacific scale)
map of Scandinivia (Pacific scale)
WiF Charts


(adapted from the cover and ADG webpage)
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Tiki Toast
description:
A fun and exciting real-time party game where you work to discard all your cards by matching with other players and performing island themed actions.

At the same time, everyone flips the top card of their deck face-up and shouts the name of their card searching for another player who has the same card. If more than two players shout the same action the first two players to connect with each other complete that action and then discard their cards to the center of the table. They each flip their next card face-up and shout that action looking for a match. Players can match with any other player, even if they’ve already matched before. If you can’t find a match with another player, move your top card to the bottom of your deck and flip over a new card. Continue playing until one player has discarded all their cards and says “Mahalo!” They are the winner!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Pie Rats of the Carob Bean Farm: Curse of the Farmer's Wife
description:
It was only a matter of time before the farmer’s wife figured out what was happening to her delicious pies. Now she’s out for revenge. She has started poisoning the pies. But which pies? Will it be too late by the time you find out? To win the game, you’ll have to take the risk!

The first expansion for Pie Rats of the Carob Bean Farm adds some interesting new ways to distract your fellow thieving rat captains.

Each pie that is looted has the potential of being poisoned. The poisoned pies have dastardly surprises.

The three blind mice crew have a unique synergy and if you can recruit all of them to your crew they allow you to immediately loot a pie!

With the new rats that have joined the farm and the farmer's wife catching on... will you be able to beat the other captains?
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Vae Victis
description:
Rome is going to hell. Redneck barbarians are raiding the borders, the economy is in freefall, and the sewer workers are on strike...again. To top it all, mercenaries and slaves have delusions of grandeur (they want to be paid, for Jupiter's sake!), while those petty pencil pushers at the Senate indulge in never-ending rhetoric displays. As a wealthy patrician, you're pretty sure it is expected that you lend your help to Rome in this dire time of need, but then again will your "friends" do the same? The Ides of March are around the corner...'

Vae Victis is a semi-competitive game of decline and treachery for 1 to 6 Roman patricians. The phrase "Vae Victis" — Latin for "woe to the vanquished" or "woe to the conquered" — suggests that those defeated in battle are entirely at the mercy of their conquerors and should neither expect nor request leniency. Keep that spirit in mind when playing this game. Players take turns alternatively, and on their turn, they must go through three phases:


Doom phase: The player rolls the three doom dice, eliminates one of them, then applies the result of the remaining two dice.
Support phase: The player can take up to two actions in any combination in the action spots LIMITES, AERARIUM, or DOMUS PALATINA, possibly pushing their luck!
Influence phase: The player can take up to two actions in any combination in the action spots THERMAE, FORUM, or CURIA.


After this, play passes to the next player. Play continues until a winning condition is met, with the conditions being as follows:


All players lose if one of the wars is lost or one of the tracks reaches the final space. No player can decide to lose a war or make a track reach its final space if they can avoid it — unless they are the traitor (see below).
A player loses at the end of any turn if they've run out of coins.
A player wins at the end of their turn if they simultaneously fulfill the requirement of their goal card "SENATE" and their goal card "WAR".
A player wins at the end of any turn if all other players have lost.


Note that any player can be a traitor to Rome, and they win if a condition is met that results in all players losing the game.

name: Snowbirds: Sunset Sky
description:
Sunset Sky expands Snowbirds with 18 new Map cards, introducing 4 new location effects, offering a whole new landscape for your flock to explore. In addition to new bonuses and hazards, it also provides a new deck of Actions and rules to adapt the solitaire experience into a 2-player game. With a second flock in the sky, you can compete to see who can better manage the long journey south with their limited actions and resources. Players willing to take greater risks can gain an edge in an already tense race for survival. Can you bring your birds home?

This expansion requires the base game to play.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Captain's Chair Resource
description:
The Captain's Chair Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in the "Chronological Chaos" Organized Play Event.

When used, it can only be assigned to a ship that has a Captain with a printed Captain Skill of 5 or higher.

During the activation phase, once per round, the ship to which it is assigned may remove a disabled token from one of it's cards if it performed a non-Red maneuver.

It is considered a resource and costs 3 squadron points.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Frontline Retrofit Resource
description:
The Frontline Retrofit Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in the "Resource Rumble" Organized Play Event. It is considered a Resource, and costs 3 Squadron Points.

When using this resource, it may only be assigned to a ship that has a printed Hull Value of 3 or less. The assigned ship increases it's Shield Value and Captain Skill by 1 each, and adds an additional Tech slot to it's Upgrade Bar.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Dados de fútbol
description:
Football dice.
Play soccer with 4 dice.
You can throw your dice 3 times and choose wich one to get or to reroll. You need results with the color of your team, and one die with corner, penalty or goal symbol. After 3 throws, your turn is over.
You must take notes fo the scorings. The player who scores most goals will be the winner.






























Juega al fútbol con 4 dados.
Con toda la emoción del fútbol. Goles, penaltis, córners y faltas.
Juega con tus amigos y amigas creando vuestras propias ligas. Es muy divertido. No podrás parar de jugar. Se venden con una bolsita para que se puedan llevar cómodamente a cualquier parte y no se pierdan.

name: Pokémon TCG: EX Deoxys Expansion
description:
EX Deoxys is an English-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion Clash of the Blue Sky.

The expansion includes 108 cards.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tracks on Mars
description:
Early colonization efforts of Mars have been successful. With dozens of outposts scattered across the surface, a new challenge awaits: providing infrastructure to the red planet and moving goods to where they are needed most (while making a tidy profit of course). Fortunately the abundance of precious metals will help with this task by allowing upgrades to the transport vessels over time.

Tracks on Mars is a light-weight family crayon rail game. It has been designed specifically for two players. Drawing the tracks, loading goods onto the pawns, and over sized dice all work together to make this a very tactile experience. Luck is a major factor but can be mitigated by re-rolls and catch-up mechanics. On a strategic level, players have to balance network building, transportation, and equipment upgrades.

The core mechanics are Yahtzee-style dice rolling and resource allocation. Matching dice rolls are converted to currency which is then used to either claim new routes or move the player's pawns to pick up and deliver goods. Victory points are ultimately scored depending on the distance that goods have been transported. Players have to decide whether they want to make multiple short runs for few VPs or spend turns building a long route for fewer high value transports.

This is a print & play title comprised of five dice, 40 resource cubes, currency token cards, an 18" x 18" board, and four 3D printed pawns.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Pickett's Charge: The Last Attack at Gettysburg July 3, 1863
description:
Easily the most famous engagement of the Civil War, Pickett’s Charge was the high-water mark of the Confederacy. A frontal attack across open ground by 12,000 - 15,000 men against the center of the Union line in the teeth of withering artillery and infantry fire, Pickett’s Charge was the defining moment of the battle of Gettysburg and, although militarily futile, represents to many the courage and glory of the Confederate soldier.

Pickett’s Charge: The Last Attack at Gettysburg July 3, 1863 is a beer-and-pretzel, solitaire simulation at the brigade level of the historical events of July 3, 1863. The Player commands the Confederate side while the Union side follows solitaire rules. Besides the historical scenario, there are four other scenarios: Effective Confederate Bombardment, Culp's Hill Coordinated Attack, Additional Infantry Support, and J.E.B. Stuart's Cavalry.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Agricola: Pelts
description:
Promo card on Lookout spiel website

For each animal that you slaughter and return to the general supply, you may place 1 Food from your personal supply in 1 of your rooms. You may have a maximum of 1 Food in each room. You cannot use these Food any more, but each is worth 1 Bonus point at the end of the game.

name: Nerd Fest: The Comic Convention Game
description:
Nerd Fest is a humorous dice and card game for 2-4 players. It takes about 10 minutes to learn and 30 minutes to play. Ages 7 and up. The game contains 12 Character Cards, 54 Luck Cards, 64 Swag Cards, 1 Convention Center Card, 2 dice & 4 colored game tokens in a full color box.

To start the game each player chooses a Character Card. The characters are based on the classic types that you find at a comic convention.

Each character has an amount of Swag Cards they need to collect.

On each turn, players choose a part of the con to visit and then based on a dice roll, they can collect Swag Cards.

To mix things up, players have a hand of Luck Cards. You play your Luck Cards to take extra turns, get bonus rolls and other effects.

The first player to collect the correct amount of Swag Cards wins the game!

name: Districts: Barcelona
description:
Districts: Barcelona is a game for up to 4 players about the different interests and tensions that transforms a city over time and how they are related. The City works as an ecosystem and its citizens try to adapt and transform it to match their needs. Sometimes, such changes come as a by product of some direct actions, some other times it comes from direct developments that come through the administration or private investments.

We assess that it’s not possible to witness such changes and transformations as a neutral witness: everyone is biased by its own experiences and perspective. Due to that, we have developed the different factions as how they perceive themselves. That is, portraying each of them per their own self-defined virtues and what they consider works best for most of the citizens, when not for everyone. Of course, as after all this is a game, for the sake of game balance we have adjusted certain values and actions to provide a better playability.

The game is designed for 4 players (but rules are provided for 3 and 2 players) and the city map is divided in districts. Each district has an array of values that describe its economic and population statistics. These values are a common pool for all the players, this means that your actions deplete some values to increase others, but doing so you might enable a 2nd player to play its actions in that district.

The game has no luck component whatsoever, players' actions have a basic effect no matter where they play them, and an additional effect if certain values are matched. Each faction consumes certain resources and generate others, and not a single faction is autonomous: each of them requires at least one resource they can not generate.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Guerra de mitos X: Legión Romana
description:
Guerra de mitos X: Legión Romana expands Myths at war, a card game set in a fantastic world where different mythologies coexist. It is a different, dynamic game designed to be able to build different decks with very distinct and varied strategies, and each installment increases both the number of available mythologies and the game possibilities.

The game contains 150 cards split with Rome mithology

Legión Romana is the second expansion of the third age of the game.

Each player in Guerra de Mitos (War of the Myths) needs to build his own deck of at least 51 cards (1 pantheon / 20 gods / 30 designs) of his choice, and each installment increases the diversity of characters, actions and strategies you can use in order to achieve victory.

Each player has to bring into play the cards his oracles offer him and play actions from the designs deck both in the influence phase (where the gods plan from their pantheon) and in the confrontation phase (where the characters who decide to go to battle fight to decrease the opponent’s power) to obtain supremacy or consign the opponent to oblivion.

—description from the publisher

name: Desert Campaign:  North Africa 1941-42
description:
Free print-and-play.

Division and independent brigade level - few units and fast play - 7.5mis/12kms per hex which is larger than AH's Afrika Korps. Campaign game has 4 11x17/A3 component mapsheets perfect for the scale. Campaign game has 45 half-month turns - IIFeb41-IIDec42 - and could be long, but many turns may be spent just fortifying and rebuilding, as historically.

There are also excerpted subgames - gamelets - of individual battles with individual maps for half-hour lunch games.

Features a preliminary tank vs. (anti-)tank combat (table) *matrix* customized against the German/Italian panzer/tank regiments/division constants by Allied tank types. (Allies get to start with British A13 cruisers. :-) ) Of course, if the 88s score a hit on defense - first, with their long range - they can (Disrupt or) kill any tank/armoured brigade indiscriminately, especially if it isn't supported by a support group's 88-suppressing artillery.

Previously Disrupted (during tank/anti-tank phase) panzer/armor units forced to retreat from their battlefield in the following general combat are not recovered - are instead lost/eliminated.

Otherwise, game is classically simple/abstracted - no airpower (necessary). Supply is abstracted as well and also modeled by unit replacement/rebuilding abilities.

Axis units hidden (except when engaged), unless/until they get to Alamein at which time Monty takes control and the intelligence advantage is reversed.

Simple strategic withdrawal/bugout - "Gazala Gallop," "Matruh Stakes" - rule.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Super Hazard Quest: Single-Player and Ghost House Expansion
description:
This expansion contains Single Player Mode (SPM) as well as a new Dungeon Card. The Spooky Study Dungeon Card is not exclusive to SPM and may be played with MagiBot, or in a standard multi-player game.

Designed for SPM and Co-Op mode, MagiBot 2.0 takes turns with his opponent(s) and plays to win based on the information in the included instructions.

MagiBot seeks the same goal as every other player. That is, he attempts to defeat a Crystal Mini-Boss and deliver that Crystal to the matching Scrambler. Like other players, MagiBot has his own turn but always goes last.
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Maze, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Romulan Pilot
description:
This card is the "flex" prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "Trap Travesty."

Romulan Crew (2 SP)
As a free action, you may discard Romulan Pilot to place a Scan token beside your ship and perform a green maneuver.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Gone Flippin'
description:
In this FREE print & play, you can live the dream of being a Flip the Table panelist and play cheesy, weird, and obscure board games in your quest to be the first to score 10,000 POINTS! On your turn, you might buy cheesy games at Flip's Thrift shop! Or risk all your hard-earned quarters at The Professor's Lazer Arcade! Or possibly go to Jared's Wrestling Academy and fight for the world title! Or even use Chris's Editing Bay to manipulate time and space! Play the games and get the points, but until you sell them when you pass go, the points might be taken from you! And as always, beware of Soviet Russia...because in Soviet Russia, TABLE FLIPS YOU!

And did we mention it's a roll-and-move game? SURPRISE!!!
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bleaktrick
description:
Bleaktrick is a trick-taking game for 3 or 4 players that can be played with a standard deck of playing cards. 40 cards are used: Aces to 10's in each of the four suits. At the start of each round, 36 of the 40 cards are dealt equally to the players and each player exchange one card face-down with both of its neighbors. In a 3-player game, each player also discards a card from his hand.

The dealer leads the first trick and play proceed clockwise until all cards are played. Normal rules for trick-taking games apply: players must follow suit, otherwise they can play any card and the highest card of the leading suit wins the trick (there is no trump suit). When a player wins a trick,
he takes only the card that won the trick (the rest of the trick is discarded), puts it in his winning pile and leads the next trick.

The twist in Bleacktrick game is this: Every time a player takes a trick with a card of equal or lower value than a certain threshold, then this card becomes the "bleak" card. The starting value of the threshold is 7 but it changes each time to match the value of the last "bleak" card. There's an exception though: if you are already the "bleak" card owner, you can win tricks with cards of smaller value without lowering the threshold. The goal of the game is to score the most points without ending up with the "bleak" card in your possession.

At the end of the round, each player scores points according to the cards in his winning pile, except from the "bleak" card owner who scores negative points. The lower the numerical value of a card, the more points it scores (for both the positive and the negative case). So, it's preferable to win tricks with low value cards but also more risky as you may end up with the "bleak" card. The player who won the last trick is the dealer for the next round, while the owner of the "bleak" card can have a peek at 2 of the 4 unused cards of the next round. The game ends after a prearranged number of rounds or when a player reaches a prearranged number of points.

—description from the publisher

name: Beyond the Edge
description:
Ancient enemies at war have brought ruin to the galaxy. A final act of desperation has caused the folding of space and time, destroying all but a small starfield of systems. Within that star field, on the free planet of Orion, you have been recruited to stem the tide of pirates who have blockaded their small sector of space. However, it is what lies beyond those pirates that will change your destiny — and the universe — forever.

Beyond the Edge uses a gaming system called "Evolve/Beyond", an innovative method of allowing you to keep all that you have obtained during each game for the next, allowing you to have individual stories that are specific to your character and which progress independently of your allies.

Beyond the Edge has an easy-to-learn cooperative game system in which rules and story develop as you play, allowing casual players to learn as they go. However, for gaming veterans, the faction system of Beyond the Edge creates a dynamic play experience in which the races and groups you ally with not only change your objective, but which special abilities and upgrades you have. What's more, with the "Dry Dock" system, you can even take your ship, captain, and missions and jump into other players' games, creating an ever-evolving gameplay experience.

name: Goblin Stole My Chicken
description:
That's right, Goblins are stealing chickens, and it's your job to stop them.

Each player is a farmer trying to keep their fences up to keep the goblins out.

Of course, sometimes it's easier to send goblins to your neighbors ... and maybe burn down his fence!

Each turn you will play cards to fend off goblin attacks and find ways to make things uncomfortable for your neighbors. Hire town guards to protect your farm, release the hounds to scare goblins away, burn your neighbors fences, place signs to send goblins to your neighbors farm.

When one person is out of chickens, the person with the most chickens left is the winner.

name: Deadly Concoctions
description:
Deadly Concoctions is the lethal card game in which you mix heart-stopping, madness- inducing, soul-crushing potions, in an effort to kill your opponents.

How To Play
Separate the "Life" cards (Mind, Heart, Spirit) from the deck and give one of each to all players, who are to set them face-up on the playing surface.

Shuffle the deck and deal each player 6 cards. Set the deck face down between all participants. The player left of the dealer takes the first turn.

For each turn, a player draws up to the hand limit of 7 cards [from any combination of atop the deck or discard field), and discards 1 card into an open field of cards on the playing surface (concluding the turn). If, prior to discarding, a player matches a "Potion" card with the 2 "Ingredient" cards shown on it, the 3 cards may be played on any opponent's Life card. When this occurs, set aside all 4 cards to remove them from play. If one loses all life cards, he or she is dead and out of the game. A player may attack only once per turn, and only the Life form targeted by a potion. "Secret Ingredient" cards are wild. Use them in place of ingredients needed to mix a potion. The "Serum X" card is a complete potion that, by itself, may attack any Life form.

The sole surviving player, wins!
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Operation: Paperclip
description:
In post-World War II Germany the scramble is on to mete out the fate to the Reich's most brilliant -and infamous- technical minds. Play as the Americans or Soviets racing to assemble the superior scientific team. Or you can play as the Nakam vigilante group hunting down the worst perpetrators of the war. Lastly, you can play as an ODESSA Network operative trying to smuggle high value German officers to safety in South America.

Players take simultaneous turns in a frenetic division of characters that have a range of values, special powers, and bestow infamy tokens. That infamy has to be carefully managed as it can be important information that boost your score, but too much much infamy will tank your score.

—description from the publisher

name: The Abstractionist
description:
The Abstractionist! is a game set against a backdrop of the art world in the first decades just after the turn of the 20th century. As a young aspiring artist you find your motivation in the avant garde abstract art movement and the contemporary art scene of the time. Your aim is to become a celebrated artists. You want to become the true abstractionist of this era. At the same time your limited resources and lack of supplies hinders your goal, your work and pursuit of fame and status.

The goal is to make color placements and color combinations in such a way that you end up with the highest score in the end. Every color added to the canvas is a potential scoring opportunity that will move the scoretrack pawn one or several (1-4) steps. If at any point during the game a player reaches the score of twenty (20) points or above, the Endgame Exhibition is triggered and the final scoring begins. Some color tile combinations scores extra during the scoring and you could score points for your chosen favorite color as long as no one else chosen the same.

name: The Nut Game
description:
Each season a great game is held to determine who will rule the kingdom on Squirrel Island. You are in this game. Your goal is to gather more nuts than the others, and the name of the game is The Nut Game!

In The Nut Game, players takes turns using their stamina to play Squirrel- and Tool cards and take other actions. Each player builds up his or her own army of squirrels that helps them gather more nuts and secure their own win or their opponents demise. Players can also hide nuts to secure a boost in the scores for the end of the game. It's a game of one-upmanship that can suddenly turn on its head in an instant when one of the devastating event cards are drawn!

Players draw cards from the same pile and when that pile is empty the game is over. Players count how many nuts they've collected, including their hidden ones, and the one who has gathered most nuts wins!

name: Panzer Orders Western Front
description:
Welcome to Panzer Orders Western Front, a World War 2 card game. This is a stand alone game for solitaire and two-players and is fully compatible with the other Panzer Orders games and expansions.

The game is quick to setup and play, it takes around 30 minutes to play a game and comes complete with everything you need. Each card has a points value based on the card characteristics and special rules. The players agree a point based battle and then build their decks, spending points on specific cards.

Each player must form three columns of any mixture of vehicles, tanks, or infantry and then attack the opponents columns. The first player to defeat all three columns or force the opposing player to draw their last card, wins the game. During the player turn you can choose to dig and defend with your card, moves cards from one column to another or attack with ling range or close combat. Non of these are without their risks and weighing up the risk vs the strategic gain is part of the decision making elements of the game.

Combat is fast, simple but very brutal with all the dice rolls required on the cards - no charts or looking up in the rules. Damaged cards are suppressed first before being removed from the game and can still make a free saving throw on the dice to keep in the fight.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Malifaux (Second Edition): Rules Manual
description:
Based in an alternate Earth, Malifaux uses gothic, steampunk, and victorian horror with a dose of the wild west to inject fun and depth into the magical lawlessness of a world rife with monsters, necropunks, man-machine hybrids, gunslingers, and powerhungry politicos. Actively using character-driven stories to define the world of Malifaux, seek your fortune in this fast paced and brutal 32mm tabletop miniature skirmish game. Assemble your crew and stake your claim!

This rules manual includes an expanded index and provides all of the rules which you need to play Malifaux Second Edition in one compact volume. Grab your Fate Deck, it's time to cheat fate or lose your soul...

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Fazes
description:
Fazes is a card game for 3 – 8 players. It has rules similar to Rook, Phase 10, Hearts, and other rummy like card games. The object of the game is to get the least amount of points by the end of the game. There are 6 fazes, each with its own set of rules. The last faze called “madness” combines all of the rules from previous fazes. Fazes is a fun and challenging card game for all skill levels.

Starting Fazes
Each player is dealt an equal amount of cards. The player with the green 2 begins play in each faze by leading with that card. Play continues in a clockwise direction. Players must play the color that is led. After everyone has played a card, the highest numeric card of the color played will take the hand.

Trump
Players who are out of the color led will have to play a trump card if they have it. Red cards are TRUMP in fazes 1 & 6 and when a red card is played it wins the trick. For example, if a player leads with a yellow card and the next player is out of yellow, they have to play a red card, if they have it, which trumps the trick. If two or more players have to trump any trick, the highest numeric red trump card wins the trick.

Faze 1 : Red Trump
Each red card is worth 5 points. If a player is out of the color that is led and they have a red card, they must play it, which trumps the trick. Once all of the tricks are won, count up each red card, and write down your points. Shuffle and deal all the cards for faze 2.

Faze 2: Tricks ‘R Pointr
Each trick worth 10 points. Trump is not active in this faze. The highest numeric card of the color led wins the trick and 10 points.

Faze 3: Yellow Pointers
Each yellow card is worth 10 points. Trump is not active in this faze. The highest numeric card of the color led wins the trick. Each yellow card in the trick is worth 10 points.

Faze 4: 13’s
The #13 in each color is worth 25 points. Trump is not active in this faze. The highest numeric card of the color led wins the trick.

Faze 5: Last Trick
The person who wins the “last trick” get’s 50 points deducted from their score.

Faze 6: Madness
Each objective and rules of fazes 1 -­‐ 5 are in play! Red cards (5 points each) are trump and have to be used if you don’t have the card that is led. Every trick is worth 10 points plus the value of pointer cards that could be included in the trick. Yellow cards are 10 points each. The 13’s are 25 points each. Special note -­‐ the red 13 is worth 30 points (5 points for being red, 25 points for being a 13). The yellow 13 is worth 35 points (10 points for being yellow, 25 points for being a 13). And finally, whoever wins the last trick get’s minus 50 points from their score! The player winning the last trick must still account for any points within the trick itself.

SHOOT THE MOON
If a player wins all of the points in any faze they have “Shot the Moon!” The reward for
“Shooting the Moon” is all other players receive the total points of that faze! For example, if a player in faze 4 receives all four 13’s, then all other players have 100 pts added to their score!

The object of the game is to have the lowest score at the end of all 6 Fazes.
mechanics: Hand Management, Trick-taking, Variable Phase Order

name: Skyline 54
description:
Cities in America at the turn of the century are racing to be the biggest and the best cities across the country! Their skylines are growing with buildings so tall they appear to touch the sky - skyscrapers! Players act as building companies in these different cities, trying to build up their own city's skyline to be the best and most diverse.

Each player is building a skyline of skyscrapers using cards from a standard 54-card deck. On their turn, players have three options: Draft cards into their hands; Play cards to their tableau (their "skyline"), or Pass (for the rest of the game). Cards played must follow certain rules, and only optimal placement will net players the most points!

The game ends once all players have passed (usually after the draw deck has run out and player have no more cards in-hand to play). Players then earn points for tallest towers, widest skyline, most towers, and any mid-game bonuses they achieved, but lose points for any cards left in hand, or face-down "City Street" cards they played. After totalling up all scores, most points is the winner!
categories: Card Game, City Building, Print & Play

name: Legend of the Five Rings: A Matter of Honor
description:
In the provinces of the Lion Clan, the peace of the plains is shattered by the appearance of an oni, a monstrosity from the Realm of Evil. Once the beast is defeated, at the cost of many samurai's lives, the Lion's ire turns to the Crab Clan. Are the Crab not the guardians who protect the Empire from such nightmares? Surely such a terrible thing would never have occurred if the Lion had stood guard over the Carpenter Wall. Ill will turns to bold words, and bold words soon turn to bloodshed. With the two greatest armies of the Empire at one another's throats, who will emerge victorious?

A Matter of Honor is the ultimate Learn to Play Set for the Legend of the Five Rings Collectible Card Game, featuring the streamlined and comprehensive rules of Ivory Edition. Discover the game and delve into its rich history as a member of the stalwart Crab Clan or the proud Lion Clan, and in doing so get ready to face the challenges that lay ahead of the samurai of the Emerald Empire of Rokugan in the years to come! In this set you will find:


2 Ivory legal and ready to play L5R CCG decks (one Crab, one Lion)
4 Ivory legal boosters to improve your deck
A 16-pages story book detailing the events that led to the war
A comprehensive and fully illustrated rulebook
An envelope containing secrets to be discovered at your own risk!

name: Decrypto: AI Serial – Bruno Cathala 01
description:
This is a set of 8 promo cards: 7 code cards and 1 card with the rules to play them solo or cooperatively designed by Bruno Cathala.
As in the regular game, players are trying to intercept twice the code from this artificial intelligence (AI).

This small expansion was initially provided as a promo with the first copies of the game.

The words on these cards are different from those on Decrypto: AI Serial – Rob Daviau 01
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Où est mon doudou ?
description:
Où est mon doudou ? is a very good first board game for the children. It's a cooperative game. The goal is to find a plush that is hidden in the different rooms of the house before the end of the day.
In your turn, you throw a die to know the color of the room where you can go and search for the plush.

name: Zombie Crisis
description:
Zombie Crisis (ゾンビクライシス) is a two-player asymmetrical cooperative card game in which one player takes the role of scout and the other the role of fighter. The goal of the game is to complete the story, all the while surviving the zombie horde.

Each turn, three cards that may be zombies or humans are drawn and lined up face down against the barricades. The scout then looks at 1–3 of these cards, telling the fighter a limited amount of information. The fighter then decides to either attack the current horde by placing weapon cards on the different columns of enemies, or to defend, strengthening the barricades and pilfering for more weapons.

The scout's cards on hand are various scenarios, with fulfillment conditions. Whenever these are fulfilled, they are played, and the scout draws a new card to hand. The scenario cards get harder and harder to fulfill, and when the team has fulfilled six of these, the game ends in victory.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Red Dragon Inn: First Mate's Lime Juice
description:
This card is a promotional item included in The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Pirates!

+ 2 Fortitude. Discard a card from your hand.

"So that's why Remy's always so sour!" - Bryn
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Flapjacks & Sasquatches: Mound of Bacon Die
description:
Mound of Bacon Die

This is used instead of a regular die.

For each slick of bacon that shows up you get one chop. These are in addition to any you would get from a chopping roll. But if you roll the zzzzz you ate too much bacon and fell asleep and don't get your chopping roll that turn.

name: Pocket Air War: Mediterranean Front
description: Expansion game of the Pocket Air War series including 14 new planes and the North African and the Italian Theatre of operations
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Pattern Building, Simulation

name: Street Fighter: The Miniatures Game – Street Fighter Alpha Character Expansion
description:
Street Fighter Alpha adds 4 characters and battle decks to Street Fighter: The Miniature Game.

Karin, Sakura, Dan, and R.Mika join the fight to become the World's strongest street fighter.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Haut les pattes!
description:
The goal is to be the first to win 20 hazelnuts.
One can win hazelnuts by mimicking correctly and the right orders the gestures of Billy the hamster and Jean-Claude the worm on cards.

One after the other, the players draw cards that they place in front of them. They can stop drawing cards whenever they want (with a minimum of one card). When they think they have enough cards, they stop and say "Bandit servi !" ("The bandit is served!"). Then they have one second per card to memorize the gestures and the order of the cards. At the end of that time, the player closes their eyes and must mimic the gestures correctly and in the right order. If the player is correct, they win the amount of nuts on the cards, if not, they don't win or lose anything.

There are three types of special cards:
- double ration: if the player is correct, they win double the amount of nuts;
- double temps (double time): the player has two seconds per card to memorize the gestures;
- haut les pattes ! (paws up!): every player must rise their hands and say "paws up!", the first one wins one nut from the bank.

Components:
- 48 cards (including 8 special cards)
- 35 nut tokens: 20x 1 nut tokens, 10x 5 nuts tokens, 5x 10 nuts tokens

name: Starlight Stage: Expansion Card Set 4
description:
A new Starlight Stage Expansion set was released in May 2018.

This expansion includes 34 cards of 4 types: 11 idol cards, 8 produce cards, 12 event cards, 3 update card.
publishers: シュレディンガーゲームズ (Schrodinger Games)

name: RB8 Retro Baseball 8-bit
description:
Remember the good old days of 8-bit video game Baseball? Watching those amazing 8-bit fireworks shoot off as you round the bases after that big Home Run. Things were just simpler it seemed. Now you can relive that nostalgia all over again in RB8 Retro Baseball 8-bit the Board Game.

RB8 is a real Baseball Simulation brought to you in the retro look of a classic 8-bit experience. Play with one of the 16 complete teams out of the box or draft and build your team based on a point value player system with custom player cards. Will you build your team with big sluggers, dominant pitching, tough defenders, speedsters, or a well-balanced machine? The choice is yours as you get to manage and make the strategic choices.

RB8 features a custom draw deck called Rally Cards with random events that happen during a baseball game, as the team manager you must decide when to strategically use them. You have full control of your team. Make the big manager decisions that can influence the game.
RB8 also features player cards with ratings and special abilities, two six-sided dice, special custom pitcher and batter control dice, baseball field board, batter and runner markers, scoreboard with markers, and your dice key cards.

RB8 Retro Baseball is Played over the course of 9 innings in a single game or a best of series. On a turn both Pitcher and Batter will compare their ratings factoring in any special abilities and roll off to see who will get control of the at bat. This is called the “On Deck Phase”. Whoever rolls higher factoring in all special abilities will try to maintain control by rolling their custom Pitcher or Batter die. If they maintain control they will then roll dice and compare the result with their respective key to find out the results of the at bat. Players can also decide to play Rally Cards which could also affect the outcome of the play.
Whether you’re a fan of baseball, board games, or both you’re going to love the feel and excitement of reliving the good old days in RB8 Retro Baseball!

Will you have what it takes to manage your team to victory?

-description from publisher

name: Fistful of Lead: Horse & Musket
description:
Fistful of Lead: Horse & Musket was designed as a quick set of tabletop wargame rules for skirmishes in the age of Black Powder. The rules can be learned within a couple of turns and still keep the flavor of the period.

What separates Fistful of Lead from most tabletop miniature games on the market, is the unique card driven turn mechanism. This leads to snap decisions and tense moments where all the players are involved.

For Fistful of Lead, we wanted the play to be fast and furious, with a Hollywood flair to it. For that reason, record keeping is kept to a bare minimum.

In most games, each player can control up to 5-6 miniatures without much trouble. Games can have up to 8 players without slowing down the game. Now, you can try out different periods within the Horse and Musket era without spending a ton of money.

Experienced wargamers and new players alike will enjoy this game. It's perfect for convention games and just one on one skirmishes.

To play Fistful of Lead: Horse & Musket you’ll need: this rule book (or, after a few games just the Quick Reference sheet), several 10-sided-dice, an ordinary deck of playing cards, a place to play, a measuring tape, and the miniatures representing your favorite troops. Markers to represent whether your models are Wounded or need to Reload can be found in this rule book.

Eight-sided and 12-sided dice may also be needed for some of the advanced optional rules.

Fistful of Lead: Horse & Musket was written with 28mm figures in mind, but you can easily use models ranging from 15mm to 54mm without any changes.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Age of Reason, American Civil War, American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Point to Point Movement

name: Dice Tiles
description: Dice Tiles is a tile placement and dice placement game. Once tiles are placed, Dice may be added or removed to maximize points. Whom ever has the most points when the final die is placed is the winner.

name: Quilterful
description: Quilterful is a 2-player card-laying game where both players contribute to a growing Quilt of cards. On each turn, a player can either cleverly play cards to the Quilt to draw cards or score a patch of colors from the Quilt. Play well, and you'll be able to fill your hand with useful cards and score big. But be careful not to let your opponent score before you get the chance!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Matem o Rei
description:
The Tyrant must be eliminated! In Matem o Rei, you must kill the King by moving your assassin among the guests of the masquerade. Using poisons, daggers, and bombs, you need to be the first to depose the Despot. But beware, the other players may stop you by changing the direction of the dance!

Matem o Rei contains 48 cards, 17 masks and a board. During their turns, the players can use their cards to move the guests of the same color and same mask around the board, making a way to the King or hindering other players. Knowing which cards to keep, which to use and which to discard can be the difference in the victory. Players can also attempt to murder the King. But beware! Each player also has a bribed Guard, which can protect the King.

Players don't know each others identity, neither of the Guards. Use this to your advantage, moving your assassin in secret until the right time. You can also change your mask or weapon better suit your strategy.

The first player to assassinate the King wins the game.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Envyra: Equilibrium
description:
The expansion package Equilibrium consist of 9 cards and provides additional ways to gain points thus making Envyra even more diverse and strategic. Adding expansion into the base game is very easy and Equilibrium immediately feels like a natural part of Envyra game.

This optional mini-expansion package can be incorporated in the base game in three ways:
A. At the beginning of the game, two Equilibrium cards are selected at random and placed visibly next to the Playing Grid. Whichever player is the first to capture all Tiles with the depicted symbols immediately gains the corresponding Equilibrium card. When the game ends, victory points depicted on the gained Equilibrium card get added to the point total.
B. At the beginning of the game, each player picks one Equilibrium card. This card remains hidden from the rest of the players until the end of the game. If during the game player collects the Tiles with symbols depicted on his card, he can add the Equilibrium points to his victory point total.
C. Players can agree to incorporate both variants A and B together for even a greater potential to gain Equilibrium points.

-description from publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Deduction, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: The Pretty Penny
description: An event card for the Traveller CCG that is a memorial for Andrew Boulton.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Ranke's Razor
description: An event card for the Traveller CCG that is a memorial for Hans Ranke.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Shipping
description: An event card designed for people who wanted to help defray the cost of shipping for the Kickstarter.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Shipping & Handling
description: Similar to the Traveller Customizable Card Game: Shipping card, this event card was designed for international backers that wanted to help defray the costs of shipping and handling. Has a different effect than the Shipping card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Norah Wells
description: A Kickstarter-exclusive expansion card contained in the Traveller Customizable Card Game: Collector's Edition and also offered as an add-on.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Supplemental Deck
description: A 60-card deck that contains new cards as well as additional cards from the ship decks that come only in a single copy.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Don McKinney
description: An event card that is a memorial for Don McKinney.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Hunter Gordon
description: An event card that is a memorial for Hunter Gordon.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: La Isla del Tesoro
description:
The pirates has arrived at Treasure Island and Kico the parrot will help them to take the loot.

Every turn, move the parrot in a straight line placing him on a doubloon that has the same number of spaces you moved, using the squares which has doubloons and ignoring the empty ones. Keep that doubloon.

When there is no place to move, the player with the most doubloons is the winner of the game.

name: Arcanem
description:
Quick mage battles in magical arena. Each combat round lasts 5 minutes, in total there are 4 rounds that take place in a magic arena that levitates over boiling lava and that each turn is falling apart. Each player controls a magician with their own powers and abilities, your magician enters with 3 charged spells that when used are exhausted but can be recharged during the battle, each round is exchanged wizards and you start a new round with a different wizard until you try them all.

—description from the designer

name: Rack Patrol
description:
Rack Patrol is a solitaire, tactical-level, card-driven submarine war game. You take on the the command role of a single Gato-class submarine during WWII, on the hunt for Japanese targets in the Pacific.

The game is entirely card-driven. The operation cards are held in your hand or set on the table as a draw deck. You will be instructed frequently to draw a card from the operation deck in order to determine the outcome of a given action or to gain other information. You earn victory points at the end of a patrol based on the ships you have sunk during that patrol.

A single patrol (round) only takes about 10 minutes to play. However, due to the round/patrol-based structure, and because every patrol is an independent session of play, you can easily play longer, campaign-style games across multiple sittings. The game can be entirely packed up and put away between patrols. Simply record your running score at the end of any patrol and resume the game later.

There are many great submarine games out there already; what makes Rack Patrol unique is its size and portability. The entire game is played with a single deck of cards and one small player board. It takes up extremely little surface space. In fact, you could play the whole game while laying in your rack, whether that means you're aboard a submarine, or your sleeping partner already rolled over and knocked out, and you still want to get some gaming in.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: Dark Side Of The Mine
description:
Dark Side of the Mine takes place in the near future, where mining corporations compete to extract resources from nearby asteroids. Order your mining robots to secure the richest mineral deposits and score more points than your competition before the asteroid deck runs out.

In Dark Side of the Mine, a series of cards are laid out to represent the asteroid. A certain number of cards are placed face down (depending on the number of players), representing the area where players cannot send a communication signal to their robots -- the dark side. Each turn, players flip over the left-most face down card to reveal a new mineral deposit. They will then issue orders to their robots, draw a card, and, finally, place a card from their hand face down on top of the right-most face down card. This represents the dark side moving as the players orbit the asteroid. Slower robots may get trapped on the dark side of the asteroid, lose contact with the company so they cannot receive orders, and must wait until the dark side passes by so communication can be restored.

On a player's turn, they have two out of four actions to perform:


Prospect - play a card and order the mining robot to secure the next mineral deposit of that type moving clockwise;
Upgrade - play a card and permanently increase the mining capabilities of the robots;
Communicate - Move counter-clockwise around the asteroid until you find another robot and share information with them about the asteroid;
Recharge - Draw a new card into your hand.


Dark Side of the Mine is a deep strategy game in a small package. Every card can be used for multiple purposes, whether to prospect the next mineral deposit, mine that deposit, upgrade your robots, or take advantage of the work other companies have done. Careful hand management and planning will ensure that you are the most successful mining corporation in the galaxy.

—description from the publisher

name: Wargame The Jacobite '45
description:
Bonnie Prince Charlie and the Jacobites try again to restore the Stuart monarchy and overthrow the redcoat army of the Hanoverian King. Highlanders, lowlanders and all the panoply of the British army can take to the field once more in this, the final title of the series.

The miniatures are drawn and coloured by Peter Dennis, the well known face behind Osprey books, many illustrations and Martin Wallace's games. The buyer photocopies or scans the images provided, folds and cuts them out to make armies.

name: Vikings Gone Wild: Magic's Corner Promo Card
description:
A promo card from Bower's Game Corner Presents: Gen Con Video Bonanza 2017 Kickstarter Campaign.

This hero from Odin's Path costs 3 beer. When played, it allows the player to transform 1 element from one type to another.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Bad Doctor: Gen Con 2018 Promo Pack
description:
Bad Doctor Promo Pack from Gen Con 2018

Includes:

1 new Patient Tile called CON CRUD which has two "WILD" sides

1 new Treatment Tile called GEN CON BALLOON MASSAGE that has two "WILD" sides and allows the visiting doctor to Draw one additional Treatment Tile.

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): The Damned Damsels – Chaos Cheerleading Squad
description:
The Damned Damsels are the dedicated cheer squad of the Doom Lords, summoned from the Chaos Wastes by the dark prayers of the team’s coach. Murderous creatures dedicated to the Ruinous Powers, each Damned Damsel is a daemonic soul bound into the body of a willing victim. This union of warp-born entity and human host means the Damned Damsels radiate Chaos energy and killer dance moves (quite literally), their eyes blazing with etheric fire as they scream out their devotion to the Dark Gods – and if this means the odd fan spontaneously turns into Chaos spawn then all the better!

This resin kit contains all the components necessary to assemble The Damned Damsels, a Chaos Chosen cheerleading squad. These are 4 horned, tailed and furious-looking cheerleaders, who have eschewed the traditional pom-poms for a more spiky approach – each holds a metal ring in each hand, covered in vicious-looking metal points. More like fearleaders, eh? Eh? (you’re fired. – ed)

These models are supplied with 4 32mm Blood Bowl bases, and rules for using cheerleaders in games can be found in The Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac.

description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Folklore: The Affliction – Huntress Promo Card
description:
This is a promo card for Folklore: The Affliction.

This promo adds a new Militia card to the game. The huntress has the following ability: "Attacks with her longbow (1d4 Damage) once per round. Arm for +1 Damage"

This promo has card id "CO#FP02".

This promo was included in Game Trade Magazine #222 (August 2018).

This promo was also included in the Folklore Missing Card Pack (GNEFL47).
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Vikings Gone Wild: Masters of Elements – Man vs Meeple Promo Card
description: A promo card made for the Man vs Meeple Kickstarter project 2018.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Mythology, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Ruthless: Meerjungfrauenhorn Promo Card
description:
Promo card for Ruchlos, the pirate-themed deck-building game.

Immediate effect: Trade — Take Coins from the supply equal in value to number in the icon.

Effect when in deck: Rescue + Trade — Choose any 1 Pirate or Powder Monkey in your discard pile and add it to your hand. If there are no Pirates or Powder Monkeys in your discard pile, the action has no effect. Take Coins from the supply equal in value to number in the icon.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: The Metagame: Deep Cuts Booster Pack
description:
The game expansion booster pack is a love letter to tabletop games - written and curated by the merry pranksters at Shut Up & Sit Down. Codenames to Cosmic Encounter. Twilight Imperium to Ticket to Ride. Warhammer 40,000! Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective! You know you want these games! The deep cuts booster pack rounds out your Metagame with inappropriate amounts of boardgame goodness.

This expansion adds thirteen cards to the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Siege Pong: The Party Game for Gamers
description:
A fantasy card-and-cup castle defense game that mixes casual party fun and adaptive strategy.

Siege pong is a fast paced party game with a depth of strategy that gamers can sink their teeth into!
When two rival kingdoms have become locked in battle, you and your friends must become the engineer-commanders of a brutal siege. Build yourself a castle then enhance and defend it from attack. March knights into battle. Imbue throws with deadly power. Lay fatal traps for your opponents. Boldly maneuver the winds of fate and manage your kingdom's flow of coin. Work together with your allies to combine your talents and cards to utmost effect.
Balance skill of hand and skill of mind as you build a monument to your might and lay your enemies in ruins.
Siege pong provides competitive gameplay for 2-6 players and a typical siege lasts 15-45 minutes.
A uniquely physical on-your-feet tabletop game that plays like a party!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Fantasy, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That

name: Singin' in the Game!
description:
This goal of the game is to allow people to discover and sing every title from every famous artist.

Hand 1: Find from 1 to 6 titles or songs from an artist.
Hand 2: Find the name of an artist using the clue-titles (and sing them).
Hand 3: Find more titles of an artist than the other players.

—description from the designer
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Tavern Masters: Dockside Expansion
description:
Tavern Masters: Dockside Expansion is the latest expansion for Tavern Masters.

Tavern Masters: Dockside adds in a fourth main Drink type: Rum, and brings in more Sailor-type Patrons and Staff, as well as a new host of regulars and some fun new Goods!

This new Dockside Expansion adds in 30 new Tavern cards and 30 new Patron cards, as well as 12 new Dirty Deeds cards, a 40 card Song deck, and a 20 card Port deck; for a total of 132 new cards!

The Tavern Masters: Dirty Deeds Expansion is not required to use the Dockside Expansion, however the Dockside Expansion also comes with a few patrons, goods, staff and Dirty Deeds that you can choose to include in your game. To include those particular cards, you must use the Dirty Deeds Expansion.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Negotiation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Blood Red Skies: Soviet – Tupolev ANT-40 (SB-2) Bomber
description:
