Although an advanced design in the 1930's the Tupolev SB-2 was rapidly becoming obsolete when hostilities began in 1941. Over 6000 had been built, but a few survived the first year of invasion and the survivors were withdrawn from the front line service in 1942.

Contains:

3x Soviet Tupolev SB-2 Bomber
3x Decal sheet
3x Advantage Flying Base and extension
3x Double-sided Pilot Skill discs
1x Aircraft Card
1x Assembly instruction leaflet
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Entanglement
description:
Entanglement is inspired by the Entanglement browser game by Gopherwood Studios.

Entanglement:

Place tiles to create the longest path possible in the game of Entanglement!

Create an elaborate garden labyrinth by placing one tile at a time, connecting a meandering path of twists and turns. How far can your path go? You'll have to see for yourself!

You're creating a spacious garden surrounded by Sakura trees, but you have a limited number of tiles to play. Create a longer path and a larger garden by winding through Sakura trees: each pass acquires additional tiles for your expanding garden.

Should you risk your limited tiles to set up a valuable move, divert your opponents' paths away from the Sakura trees, or focus on an easy path through another Sakura tree? Weighing what to pursue when provides a mental challenge for those who hope to master it.

How is it different than the web game?

A few game rules deliberately changed to fit better for table play, but all the components are there if you really just want to experience a real-life version of the digital game. Here are the major changes:
The board game focuses on the limited-tile play of the Sakura-flavored Entanglement maps, not the boundary-based maps of classic Entanglement. This change makes initial setup much easier and prevents pre-placed tiles from shifting off-grid when they're not adjacent to other tiles.
Sakura tiles are dealt into players' hands instead of being pre-placed on the board. (This is for the same reason given in #1, and also adds a little more strategy and variety.)
Scoring is based on the total length of completed lines instead of on the length of individual moves. This change helps the game move a bit faster, since tallying scores like the web game isn't terribly fun to do manually.
The lines are thicker, and they don't glow. The thin lines were confusing to follow visually, and I didn't want the game to be radioactive.

Components: Box; 72 Hex Tiles; Rules Document; 6 (different colored) Pawns
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Spellcaster: the Frostgrave Magazine #1
description: Contains optional rules for Frostgrave and Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago, including black powder, horses and Knightly Orders.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Minuteman
description:
Company level American Revolution wargame rules.

A5 Booklet of 51 pages, plus the 4-page Card Playsheets in the centre of the booklet.

These rules carry on from 'Ranger', used for the French-Indian Wars and have similar sections to 'File Leader', again by Pete Berry. Players who have played either of these two games will be familiar with the rules system.

Standard D6 used throughout.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: 4tec
description:
4tec is a classic 3D 4 in a row board game that was invented by John Dunne. The aim of the game is to match 4 counters of the same colour in a row in any direction diagonally, vertically, or horizontally. The first person to match 4 in a row wins the game. Like chess and checkers, this game is an instant classic and although new, it will feel very familiar. The game has 32 red and 32 yellow counters included. It is easy to assemble, easy to play, and there are billions of combinations to get to 4 in a row. This skillful game will provide you with hours of fun and entertainment.

It is also known as Qubic and its various versions.

name: Monsters' Party
description:
In Monsters' Party, players will invite all kinds of cool and cute monsters to the party! Players will use their fingers to identify the secret code of each monster so that they may send out the correct invitations. Try your best to send out the most invitation letters to win!

Monsters' Party is a pattern-recognition and speed game and it can be played in cooperation or competition mode. Each monster cassette has 4 corners hiding 4 monsters with protruding dots forming different shapes. Use your fingers to find them out!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination
publishers: Kang Hsuan Educational Publishing Corp, Muduko

name: Anarchess
description:
Anarchess takes place in the land of Chess long before the enemy White and Black kingdoms were formed. Back when the land was not ruled by kings and queens, neither structured armies with bishops, knights and rooks existed. The world was unexplored and amorphous and it had not been squeezed yet into the rigid cast of the contemporary chessboard. There were just 2 proud tribes constantly struggling to expand their territories to ensure survival in a barren and harsh land. And those who today we (somewhat degradingly) call "pawns," were free entities with dreams, fears and hopes who defined their own destiny.

The game is played with 32 light- (‘white’) and 32 dark-colored (‘black’) square tiles and 8 light- (‘white’) and 8 dark-colored (‘black’) pawns.

Update: Anarchess has now been playtested and confirmed to also be highly playable and fun with 3 and 4 players. In a 3-player game each player gets 6 pawns, while in a 4-player game each player gets 5 pawns.

It takes just 5-10 minutes to learn how to play. A game lasts about 30-60 minutes.

On a turn, a player can perform 2 actions:
A. Tile Placement
B. (Optional) Pawn Action (placing a new pawn, moving or attacking)

The game ends after a player places the last available tile. Players earn points by controlling areas (i.e., having the most pawns in them) comprising two or more tiles. The player with the most points wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Tile Placement

name: Biff!
description:
Biff! is a lighthearted, quick-fire, take-that boxing game for 2-6 players. Easy to learn, easy to play and ultra-portable – Biff! will have you bopping and blocking your way to becoming the ultimate Biffing Champion!

Outwit your opponent with your mind, brawn and moves until they can no longer respond and win the round. The player with the most points after 12 rounds win the game!

Each player shuffles their deck and draws 2 cards. In turns, play a card from your hand into 'the ring' (according to the card chart) and draw a card. If you can't play a card you're knocked out of the round.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That

name: unPerfect Heroes: Battle Lines
description:
Imagine standing at the back of a line that you really need to reach the front of… urgently. The line to the buffet two minutes before closing time or the port-o-poop line at the all-day chili cookoff for instance. Welcome to unPerfect Heroes: Battle Lines, the game where you move members of the misfit Waple family against various Bad Guys who have the same goal as you.

You can play unPerfect Heroes: Battle Lines by sharing one deck of 52 cards (consisting of 20 Heroes, aka Waple family members, 20 Bad Guys and 12 Random Crap cards) or each player can have their own deck. Players start by choosing a scenario board and character pieces. The person trying to cut in line plays a Hero card against another player and rolls up to 8 dice to try to fight or bribe his way further up the line. When the odds aren't too good, he may try to chicken out and get a bonus for his next try.

Win by getting your piece up to the finish line first and making your opponents have to wait, "just like you did".

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Bad Day Wilderness
description:
Print & Play!!!

Nature is fantastic. Amazing vegetation. And, the fauna... wildly untamed. Being a freelance explorer takes risks. Today, isn’t the exception. Your heart pumps harder and danger hits you with adrenaline wich wild beast can smell from far away. Tigers in Malasia; Piranhas in the Amazones; Hammerhead Sharks in the Pacific; Grissly Bears in Northamerica; and many other animals are on the prowl, defending their territory and offsprings agains any threat. After getting the amulet you were looking for, you became that threat...

Objective: be the only explorer alive or with less body wounds at the end of the game, by attacking the opposite player with the most dangerous animals in the world.

—description from the designer

La naturaleza es fantástica. La vegetación alucinante. Y, la fauna... salvajemente indómita. Siendo un explorador freelance, te gusta correr riesgos. Hoy, no es la excepción. Tu corazón bombea cada vez mas fuerte y el peligro te inyecta esa adrenalina que las fieras huelen desde lejos. Tigres en Malasia; Pirañas en el Amazonas; Tiburones Martillo en el Pacífico; Osos Grissly en Norteamérica; y muchos otros animales están al acecho, defendiendo su territorio y crías contra cualquier amenaza. Tras conseguir el amuleto que buscabas, te convertiste en esa amenaza...

Objetivo: ser el único explorador con vida o con menos partes del cuerpo heridas al final del juego, atacando al contrario con los animales más peligrosos de la naturaleza.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Best Candy on the Block
description:
Best Candy on the Block is a trick-taking card game with a Halloween trick-or-treating theme. Gameplay is similar to many traditional trick-taking games, but there are 10 treat suits and treat cards can have one, two, or three suits on them. Additionally there are prank cards, non-treat cards, and the king size card.

At the start of each hand, each player gets to pick a treat suit to be their favorite which can award them bonus points at the end of the hand. One suit is also revealed to be trump. At the end of the hand, players look at all the cards they've taken and gain 1 bonus point for each card matching their favorite candy suit, unless they take too many tricks and get a belly ache, then they cannot score bonus points.

Pranks are worth -1 points and change the leader of the next trick. Non-treat cards can be played off suit, and the king size bar is wild and the only rank 13 card in the deck.

—description from the publisher

name: ...and then we died.
description:
A group of us have all died together...somehow. Before we can pass on to the other side, we need to remember the circumstances of our demise. All we have to work with are our fragmented memories and the subtle influence on the tarot cards. If we successfully tell our tale in ...and then we died., our spirits are set free.

—description from the publisher

name: Posthuman Saga: Settlements Mini-Expansion
description:
Kickstarter exclusive mini-expansion.

The Settlements Mini-Expansion adds 16 tiles, 4 per terrain type, that are added to your normal deck of Terrain Tiles in any game. They function like normal tiles aside from the following rules:

When you place them on the map you also add a token of the resource indicated on them. When you Move onto these tiles you collect that token.
Unlike normal tiles, Settlements do not have a Scavenge Site icon on them, meaning you cannot match a Scavenge Site token with that icon for an XP like you do with ordinary tiles.


The Settlement tiles thus add another variable when considering which tiles to bid and Map for. They are, of course optional.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Storytelling, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Trick with Occulites
description:
The Occulite Tribes are expanding and alliances between them are fluid as you work to accomplish your objectives.

A trick-taking game with several interesting and engaging twists set in the Occulite universe. Select a number of different Tribes (suits) to play with depending on the number of players, each with their own unique effect on the game. Use the tribes' alliances to play on suit, or use card effects to give you the advantage going forward as you play your hand to achieve the objective that you select each hand.

Played as Every Eye for Themselves, or in Alliance mode, The Trick with Occulites is a fresh take on a well loved genre.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Party Bugs: Blind Date
description:
"Party Bugs: Blind Date" consists of 6 cards that are printed on the last page of the Abacus Spiele games catalogue Autumn 2018.

During set-up each player receives one Bling Date card face-down. Each Blind Date card shows two bugs. Once per game you may discard those bugs when having them in your display.

-description from publisher

name: 精霊回路ドライヴ拡張セット第１弾「夜天術式」 (Seirei Kairo Doraibu Kakutyou Setto dai1dan 「Yaten Jutsushiki」)
description:
Publisher's summary
精霊回路ドライヴ拡張セット第１弾「夜天術式」 (Seirei Kairo Doraibu Kakutyou Setto dai1dan 「Yaten Jutsushiki」) Spirit Circuit Drive Expansion 1 "Yaten Jutsushiki" is the first expansion set of Spirit Circuit Drive.

Fifteen new unit cards are added to the base game. These units have the abilities that are automatically activated when upgrading and powerful abilities that can be used at specific timings.

Three new Boss cards will be added with the optional "hard mode". Thus, there will be "hard mode" cards in addition to the total of 7 Boss cards (3 Boss cards in this expansion and 4 Boss cards in the basic set).

This set can be said to be an orthodox expansion compared to later ones.

「精霊回路ドライヴ」の拡張セット第１弾。
新しくユニットカードが１５枚追加されます。
これらのユニットは、レベルアップ時に自動発動する能力や、タイミングに限られる代わりに強力な能力を持っています。
新しいボスカードは３枚追加されます。
またボスカードには高難易度の「ハードモード」が導入されます。この夜天術式で追加された３枚のボスと、基本セットの４枚の合計７枚に、通常難易度と別に「ハードモード」用カードが追加されます。
以降の拡張セットと比べると、オーソドックスな拡張と言えるでしょう。
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): The Elfheim Eaglettes – Elf Cheerleading Squad
description:
If you think the Elfheim Eagles have some moves then you haven’t seen their cheerleaders the Elfheim Eaglettes in action. Recruited from some of the most talented wardancers and blademaidens to grace the forests and islands of the collected Elven nations, they give a whole new meaning to the term ‘dance off’. So impressive are the acrobatic antics of the Elfheim Eaglettes that even Jim and Bob once famously spent an entire game commenting on the cheerleader’s routine, only afterwards realising that the Elfheim Eagles had won the game 9-0!

This multipart resin kit contains the components necessary to assemble the Elfheim Eaglettes. a 4-model Elf cheerleading squad. Slender and lithe, much like the team they support, they each have the standard pom-poms you expect from a cheerleader.

These models are supplied with 4 32mm Blood Bowl bases, and rules for using cheerleaders in games can be found in The Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac.

-description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Reykholt: Brettspiel-Tischdecke Promokarte
description: The card gives the option to move a farmer 1 table backwards, which allows you to take resources of your choice.

name: Die Legenden von Andor: Die verschollenen Legenden – Launische Waldgeister
description:
Promo for Die verschollenen Legenden.

It is a single card expansion and increases or decreases the difficulty.

It was offered at the SPIEL '18 fair during the signing sessions of the designers.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Perdition's Mouth: Abyssal Rift – The Cannibal's Howl
description:
Mogba'gh is a feared shaman, a ju-ju man with unparalleled powers and even here, far away from the nature spirits of the ancestral forest, Mogba'gh wields abilities beyond normal comprehension. It's said that he is not an albino by birth, but rather became one due to a botched witchery. It's not known by anyone but Elisa why Mogba'gh is here or what he aims to do, but so far everyone has been very content with the idea of having another magus in their midst, even one as strange as him.

Mogba'ghs pointily filed teeth, his general behaviour and dark stories about culinary pleasures have formed a reputation of a repugnant, barbaric cannibal that he seems to enjoy and cultivate at every possible moment.

Mogba’gh offers a versatile and unique hero addition to your Perdition’s Mouth. A close range magic user with a wide variety of spells, you can make very effective Special combo’s with him.

For quite some time, our fans have asked for Mogba’gh to be made available again. We listen to our fans.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: Krobs
description:
Krobs is a quick card game that has a scientific theme: germs we encounter on a daily basis. It is a contract game for the Institute of Microbiology of the University of Lausanne, Switzerland.

The game is meant to increase the awareness of the general public that some germs can be found in unexpected places, that some activities are pretty harmless, while others carry various degrees of risk.

For those who are interested, the scientific content of the game can be found on a dedicated website –www.krobs.ch– or at the back of each card where a RQ code leads you to the appropriate page.

It is however a game first, where you try to complete 3 columns of cards in front of you, each adding up to 15. You try to achieve this before your opponents, and sometimes also try to slow them down with microbes cards if they are careless.

On their turn players may play up to 2 cards before drawing only 1. Those cards can be Activity cards that bring you closer to your goal (3 columns of 15 points) or Microbes cards that attack the opponents who have "risky cards" showing on top of their own columns. Sometimes a turn consists of only refreshing one's hand.

If a player is attacked, they have to reveal a disease card of the corresponding color and see how severe the attack was. Sometimes you're lucky, sometimes you're sick for a while, and every so often you may even die on the spot...

The first player to completes their columns secures the victory, a mix of good timing and lucky draw.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Protectors Shadow Sun Syndicate Monster – Zor-Maxim
description:
The Shadow Sun Syndicate’s biomorphic and cybernetic nanotechnology is nowhere better represented than with Zor-Maxim, one of the leaders of the zors. These highly skilled and augmented humans wear high-tech armored suits capable of morphing their wearers almost instantly into gigantic fighters employing a destructive combination of martial arts and energy weapons. Despite his augmented size, Zor-Maxim displays acrobatic finesse as he evades his enemies and closes in for the kill, then teleports away in a flash of light to pursue the next enigmatic goal of the Syndicate.

—description from the publisher

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Shadow Sun Syndicate Unit Expansion 1
description:
S-Type Shinobi are skilled operatives chosen for their skill at covert intrusion and mastery of
ninjutsu or ninpo, aptitudes augmented by experimental technologies that include advanced
cloaking systems built into their fighting suits.

Interceptors are ground vehicles that use a proprietary propulsion system to achieve great speeds
regardless of any irregularities in the surfaces they cross. They possess the capacity to deliver
assets like Shinobi or Shadow Gates where they are most needed but are also sufficiently armed
to engage their foes directly.

Contains:

S-Type Shinobi (4)

Interceptor (1)

—description from the publisher

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Shadow Sun Syndicate Unit Expansion 2
description:
Sun fighters are highly maneuverable fighting jets dispatched by the Shadow Sun Syndicate to
engage the flying forces of their enemies; they are engineered specifically for air-to-air
engagement.

One of the greatest breakthroughs linked to the Shadow Sun Syndicate is their teleportation
technology, hardware they have modified for the battlefield through the versatile Shadow Gate,
which gives them a tactical edge by redeploying their fighting forces in a flash of light and
ozone.

Contains:

Sun Fighter (4)

Shadow Gate (1)

name: BAKENEKO: Soul Reaper
description:
BAKENEKO is a funny card game where you must release student´s soul trapped from an evil demon cat: the Bakeneko.
You must find amulets, dolls, talking with Shinigami and Kitsunes
avoiding fall in traps to escape from there.
The most fearless players will be able win the game, while the evil wraith cat dont appear three times."

Aim of the game: pass and score your sets played before 3 Bakenekos appear. Game duration: 3 rounds (about 30 minutes).
Setup: Deal 5 cards each player, and deal 5 more to set a central display. Then take the remaining deck and include the 3 bakeneko cards, shuffle and the game begins.
Start player is who is closer a door.

In your turn, you choose one of three options:

Take a card from the display. When you take a card from the center, you deal a new card face up in the display, available for the next player. You can play 1 set each turn, and several sets until round is finished.
Play a set of 3 same colored cards (3 blues or 3 purple cards in a row) for sitting face up in your personal area
Pass and save your score from cards sets played.


When every player has passed, they sum their scoring: 2 points for blue sets, and 3 points for purple ones. If 3 -bakenekos appear in a round, each player loose any set played and gain nothing in the round.
The game go on 3 more rounds. Every player sum the acumulated scoring along three rounds. Winner is who more pints have taken.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Borel
description:
Borel is a board game dedicated to the intriguing world of probabilities.

Think about this: 'Roll three 6-sided dice. Will you roll some number at least two times?' The game involves a series of experiments using various objects, like dice and pouches with colored balls. At first a question is read out-loud to the players. They bet on the outcome based on what they think the odds are and how they feel their opponents will bet. After betting, the experiment is performed to settle the bets.

The winner is the player with the most money after the last experiment.

name: Deities
description:
Deities is a strategic board game where you assume the role of a Deity. You, along with rival Deities, will vie for control over a brand new world. Terraform the landscape, populate the world with your followers and imbue them with the power to destroy your rivals.

Deities relies on seven elements that dictate gameplay. What actions you take are heavily influenced by these elements. During play your goal is to fill the game board with terrain tiles and creatures that match the elements of your Deities. Actions are taken by drawing and utilizing energy cards that allow you to shape the game board as well as use the powers of your Deities. Once all 25 spaces on the game board are filled with terrain tiles the current round is played out and the game finishes with a scoring phase. The player who shapes the world into matching their Deities the most is the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Rushmore Original
description:
Rushmore Original is an adult party game designed to get you to waste time with your friends rather than on your phone. Learn things about your friends you never knew, and probably never wanted to know while you list, argue and BS your way into being crowned the winner.

Playing is easy. There are three types of cards, Category Cards, You Choose Cards and Debatable Cards. Each player takes turns picking a card from the pile and reading it aloud. The players each answer the question until there is only one person left with a correct answer. That person wins the card. For Debatable Cards players share their thoughts on, for example, What is your Mt. Rushmore of Most Annoying People? The person with the best answer wins by popular vote. The first person to collect 10 cards is the winner-winner chicken dinner.

It is the perfect Party Game for couples, Girls Night Out or Man-Cave games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Sports, Trivia

name: 72 (ななじゅうに) (72 Demons of Goetia)
description:
Publisher's summary
72 (ななじゅうに) (72 (Nanajuuni)) 72 Demons of Goetia is a trick-taking game designed with "take that" elements.

To succeed the throne of King Solomon, the players battle using the 72 demons evoked by the King. Each card has a special effect to attack and defend each other during the trick-taking game.

One game ends in 5 minutes. There is also an advanced game ruleset, which incorporates drafting.

「直接攻撃要素のあるトリックテイキング」をテーマにして作られました。
各プレイヤーはソロモン王の後継者となり、彼の扱った72柱の悪魔を使い王座を争います。
各カードには固有の特殊効果があり、トリックテイキングをしながらも、ライフや手札を攻めたり守ったりしながら戦います。
1ゲーム5分で終わります。
上級者用ルールとして、ドラフトルールもあり、やりこみ要素があります。

name: Sundae Slingers
description:
In Sundae Slingers players are competing sundae restaurants, attempting to create the most spectacular sundaes and construct the best restaurant, while attracting the right clientele for their menu.

Each round, players will bid for the opportunity to choose first from each of restaurant layouts, toppings and customers individually, then laying out their toppings and customers according to their placement selection. This creates a neat and satisfying tile laying puzzle powered by a simple auction mechanic. TASTY.

Sundae Slingers is the third in the ITB Lunchbox Series

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement
publishers: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)

name: Bologna 1945
description:
The Battle of Bologna, fought in April 1945, was the last battle of the Polish 2nd Corps. It was the end of the Second World War, however, Germans were not eager to surrender, especially to the Poles. They defended each of their positions fiercely, often using mines and traps. But the determined attack of the Polish soldiers freed Bologna, ending the combat trail of the Polish forces in Italy.

This game uses Taktyka i Strategia's 2nd World War "WB95" system. The game is in Polish, but translations of the rules are available form the publisher and are made available upon request (if they are not sent right away).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Squadron Strike: Traveller
description:
In the tradition of Squadron Strike, this boxed set is a complete game released after a Kickstarter fulfillment of 2 years.

The Wars of the Third Imperium are handled in High Guard for large fleet actions. There are plenty of other battles that require a finer scale with more detail per ship, and Squadron Strike: Traveller provides that detail, while bringing Traveller space combat into fully realized 3D vector movement.

The boxed set contains everything you need to play Traveller ships in the Squadron Strike engine.
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Arkham Horror (Third Edition): Arkham Nights 2018 Promotional Character Card Set
description:
One new, official, Investigator, given to attendees of the Arkham Nights event held on 19-20 October 2018.

Consists of the following items:

“Ashcan” Pete Investigator Sheet
“Ashcan” Pete Investigator Token
Dark Dreams Talent Card
Duke Ally Card
Pete’s Guitar Item Card

Promo included in the Expansion Under Dark Waves
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Hexdominomega
description:
Hexdominomega uses the Double-seven binary-coding hexdominoes by Nestorgames. This set ncludes 36 tiles (with numbers from 0 to 7) composed of two adjacent hexagons. Instead of the standard ‘pips’, this set uses a special concentric binary representation. A central pip equals 1, a small circle equals 2 and a big circle equals 4.

Hexdominomega is a game for exactly 3 players derived from Dominomega, by the same designer. It is the result of applying the multiplicative scoring of OMEGA to this dominoes set.

Each player has an allocated symbol (pip, small circle or large circle). Before the game starts, shuffle all tiles face down. Each player draws one tile (don't show it to the other players).

Starting with the 'pip' player, players take turns (pip - small circle - large circle) placing their tile on the table and adjacent to at least one previously placed tile if any, so that the tiles fit into an imaginary hexagonal grid, then drawing a new playing tile from the supply (if possible). The values of adjacent tiles don’t need to match.

Once all the 36 tiles have been placed, players calculate their score:

To calculate your score, multiply the sizes of all groups of hexagons (half tiles) containing your symbol. Notice that some half tiles contain several symbols (example: the number 7 contains all three). Notice also that each symbol is present exactly 36 times. The player with the highest score wins. The maximum possible score is 531441.

Variant for 2 players: The small circle is not allocated to any player (but still can win!).

—description from the publisher

name: Hexdominimum
description:
Hexdominimum uses the Double-seven binary-coding hexdominoes by Nestorgames, that includes 36 tiles (with numbers from 0 to 7) composed of two adjacent hexagons. Instead of the standard ‘pips’, this set uses a special concentric binary representation. A central pip equals 1, a small circle equals 2 and a big circle equals 4.

Hexdominimum is a derivative of Mystique Energy and Dominimum (by the same designer) that can be played with this dominoes set. Hexdominimum is for 2 to 4 players.

To set up, shuffle the tiles face-down on the table. Each player then draws a tile without showing it to the other players, looks at it, then places it before them so the other players can’t see it. If both symbols are the same (i.e. it is a double tile) then discard the tile to the supply and re-draw until you get a tile with two different symbols; then reshuffle the supply. This is your "mission tile". Each player then draws a second tile; this is your "playing tile".

The first player places her playing tile on the table face-up. Then, starting with the second player, players take turns in anticlockwise order, placing their playing tile on the table adjacent to at least one placed tile so that the tiles fit into an imaginary hexagonal grid, then drawing a new playing tile from the supply (if possible). The values of adjacent tiles don’t need to match.

The game ends when the last tile has been placed on the table, and each player then calculates her score. For each of the two symbols on your mission tile, find the largest contiguous, connected group of that symbol. Count the number of hexagons in that group. Once you have counted the largest group for each of your two symbols, multiply these two values to determine your score.

The player with the lowest score wins. In case of a tie, the tied player who played her final tile first wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Shitty City Lights Committee
description:
You work for the council in a small town, and this year have 'volunteered' to organise the town's Christmas decorations. It's important to do a good job, to cheer up the townspeople as we head into winter... but it's more important to ensure that more people turn up to your lights switch-on ceremony than those of other towns around the county - your job could depend upon it!

In Shitty City Lights Committee, 2-4 players take turns to move a marker around a central rondel to select a role that everyone performs, raising funds, buying up decorations and lights, and installing them around town. The catch is that before the rondel selection is made each round the active player rolls some dice, and these are drafted by players to determine the efficacy of their actions - sometimes determining the cost, sometimes the order of play, sometimes the specific pattern they can draw onto their personal town layout.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Syphax – Lion of the Desert: The Battles of Tispara, 213, Siga & Tingis 212 BC
description:
This is GMT's Battle Scenario for SPQR, published in RBM's C3i Magazine Nr. 20.

Midway through the Second Punic War, the Scipio brothers commanding Rome's forces in Spain decided to open a new front against Carthage in her own backyard. They convinced King Syphax of the Masaesulian Numidians to rise in revolt. The rebellion featured three major battles: at Tispasa, 213, Syphax led his new model Numidian army to victory over a punitive expedition dispatched from Carthage, then, at Siga, 212, Hasdrubal Barca retirned from Spain and joined with the young Masinissa to rout Syphax' growing army. Finally at Tingis, 212, Masinissa cornered the retreating Syphax in the far west and defeated his hastily raised levies. THree small, quick-playing scenarios are presennted here for your wargaming entertainment.


Syphax Setup Card.
23 new counters.


Expansion module for the Great Battles of History (GBoH) series game SPQR.

—description from the publisher

name: Roku-Roku Shogi
description:
Roku-Roku Shogi means 6-6 Shogi and is a Shogi variant using a 6x6 board and 12 standard shogi pieces for each player: 6 Pawns, 1 King, 1 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Knight, 1 Lance, and either 1 Rook or 1 Bishop.

Pawns start at second and fifth rank.
Players take turns placing their non-pawn pieces, one at a time, at the first and sixth rank, respectively.

When all pieces are on board (and the left over Bishops or Rooks are returned to the box) play starts according to standard Shogi rules.

Published 31th July 2018 in newspapers and the web in in Tendo, Yamagata Prefecture, Japan.
Designed by the Tendo branch of the Japan Shogi Association in cooporation with Prof. Michio Matsuda.

For anyone further interested in Roku-Roku Shogi google:
66 将棋
or
ろくろく 将棋
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid

name: Everyday Player Football
description: Everyday Player Football is a football simulation game. Based on the old Vince Lombardi Football game, many new facets have been added to more accurately represent each player's skills. Players are individually rated to create team offensive and defensive ratings. These are compared to an opponent to generate ratings for that current game. Dice drive all play results, and the game has rules for solitaire play.

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Lustria
description:
Warhammer: Lustria is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is a campaign sourcebook, enabling Warhammer players to recreate the battles in the jungles of Lustria on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Wood Elves
description:
Warhammer: Wood Elves is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Wood Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Nwanyi Iga
description:
It’s a folklore of the Igbo culture meaning Proud Woman. Players compete as
soothsayers to save her from her untimely demise.

name: Safe Journi
description: Safe Journi chronicles the journey of a traveller on a Nigerian road. Your fellow players use the obstacles encountered in a Nigerian road to prevent you from reaching your destination. Your task is to manoeuvre the obstacles and get to your destination unharmed.

name: Adventure Post: 2018 Holiday Teaser
description:
You are a hero, a person with great abilities, good temperament, a strong heart, and an even stronger love for spiked eggnog. As you sit in your favorite fur-covered, sheep wool-padded chair, alone in the solitude of greatness, you hear a series of thuds on your roof, followed by what sounds like scratching against the roof tiles. Your neighbor must have lost their gryphon again. You decide to round it back up and, hopefully, you will not need a finger reattachment from the cleric again...
You walk out of your cottage, it is winter but there’s no snow on the ground. Not yet. Climate change has seemed to shift the snow into the early months of the new year (and they say it’s a hoax?). Anyway, the towering buildings of the bustling city can be seen in the distance to your right, it is strange though… you are clearly part of a fantasy world, but the cityscape looks quite modern, like New York, Seattle, or Portland. There’s no time to dwell on the finer details though, you have a gryphon to catch!
When you look up on your roof, you do not see an eagle-lion at all. Rather, to your aghast, you see a very different creature! Above you, holding a bag full of wrapped parcels and decorated from wingtip to tail, is Kringle Klaws! You didn’t even believe in Kringle but here she is, right in front of you. A sack full of gifts and all. What a sight to see! Not only are you shocked that you are beholding Kringle Klaws but you are nearly floored when she starts to speak to you.
“Adventurer,” she says. “Something terrible has happened and I have been forced to seek your aid. I have known of your deeds since that very first piggly-wiggly you saved over in Yazoo and I need your skills. Only you can save our holiday.”
Knowing that you are too stunned to speak, she continues. “Another godly being has come from the land of the Vikings, the fiend calls himself ‘Kris.’ He has stolen my Red Globe of Illumination and I need you to get it back before the sun sets. Without the globe, I cannot deliver the gifts to your fellow humans.”
You have only the whit to ask “Where?”
“I watched him place the globe into a chest strapped to one of his reindeer,” she says. “I was able to follow the furry beast to a fort in the hills not far from here. There, the hooved menace passed by a large illuminated tree and disappeared down some stairs. We need to hurry, I am running out of time.”

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Elekt: Gremlin (Karta Promo)
description:
4 additional cards for players who purchased the game in pre-order.

The card delivers new action: After increasing your Żar you can put 1 violence token OR 1 authority token on this card.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: PRESIDENT-LY
description:
The aim of the game is to be elected President by the majority. This means getting the necessary votes to win more than half of the seats in the National Congress.

In order to get the votes, everything is allowed. Deals with other political parties, buying judges, cheating... but you also need to take into account the other political parties and luck!

You can also choose your lifestyle and what proposals you are going to invest the money from your campaign into. Also you need to decide what you are going to do during your time as President to ensure you win the elections for the following year.

Each turn, players will roll the dice and move their token on the track - either clockwise or counter-clockwise. They then draw a card from a pile corresponding to the colour of the space they landed on. Each colour has its own actions associated with it: Green for political expertise, black for family life, purple for business, gold for bribe and deals.

During the game, several elections are held. During each elections, players invest money - which buys them votes. These translated in positions in congress, which will give back money. There are also special positions, which will give you different advantages. A player wins the game if he manages to get a majority during the elections (50%+1).

Players can negotiate alliances, which allows them to share the benefits of special positions - though it is not possible to win together.
categories: Bluffing, Economic, Mature / Adult, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game, Trading, Voting

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Nurgle Rotspawn
description:
From the publisher:

Nurgle is ever-generous with his gifts, bestowing them upon his followers with reckless abandon. If a player receives too many gifts, or is granted them too quickly, their body may be warped too far and their mind affected, causing their form to constantly twist and writhe with new mutations and leaving their sanity shattered. Rotspawn of Nurgle are such cursed champions. They can no longer understand a game plan and need careful handling, but they are kept around for the strength they bring and the disruption they cause.

The Nurgle Rotspawn is not just a brawler, but a lynchpin of the line of scrimmage. Its combination of Tentacles and Disturbing Presence can lock down the centre of the pitch by disrupting your opponent's actions, and Foul Appearance can confound their attempts to take it on directly. And it hits like… well, a bloated mass of muscle and tentacles!

The Nurgle Rotspawn is a high-quality resin kit comprising four parts and supplied with a 40mm round plastic base.

Key Features
-A key member of Nurgle's Rotters team
-Able to dominate the line of scrimmage with high Strength and powerful skills
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Catacombs Conquest: Angga promo card
description:
Promo card for Catacombs Conquest.

Skull Team

Arachnid - Climb: Place your Character Disc on top of any Obstacle Disc. Must be knocked off to be damaged.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Monumentum
description:
Monumentum is an adventure and exploration game. Players each have a set of 12 tiles, each tile has two actions. When player choose them, they can either do one or both of the actions. Three tiles are chosen by each player secretly, then players reveal their actions and take turns executing them. They move over a map board, discovering resources, magic tokens, strange monsters, and reclusive monks that teach new skills. Players can use magic tokens to learn spells, enhance their attributes temporarily and control monsters to hamper other players. Each player attempts to complete 3 honor tasks, to build 4 monuments, build one gold monument, and slay the dragon. The first player to complete these tasks wins. If no player completes all three, the winner is the one with the most points. Points are gained by completing numerous smaller missions during the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Blanc-Manger Coco: Salade, Tomate, Oignon
description:
Additional food-themed Blanc-Manger Coco deck.

Mix the cards or not with the other games in the range: you decide.

Contains 160 reply cards and 40 question cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Blood Red Skies: Bf 110 Squadron
description:
This is an expansion set for the WWII aircraft miniatures game Blood Red Skies by Warlord Games and designed by Andy Chambers. This expansion includes a squadron of German Messerschmitt BF110 fighter bombers and additional accessories to add to the core game.

The Messerschmitt Bf 110, also shortened to Bf 110, is a twin-engine heavy fighter and fighter-bomber in service for the German forces. Armed with 2 20mm cannons and 5 machine guns, it made up for its lack of agility with armament and advanced tactics. Its debut had a large amount of success serving in Poland, France and Norway. Even after, it continued its service until the end of the war.

Components included in this expansion are:
6 Bf110 Twin-engine Fighters
2 Aircraft Cards
1 Doctrine Card
7 Trait cards
6 Advantage Flying Bases
1 Waterslide Decal Sheet
1 Punchboard with Double-sided Pilot Skills Discs and Chits
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Traveller Ascension: Imperial Warrant – Expansion 1
description:
An add-on that was originally available during the Traveller Ascension: Imperial Warrant Kickstarter campaign.

This is the 3-4 player expansion for Imperial Warrant, including all the components to add 2 more players and a scenario book of 3 and 4 player scenarios. Contains 4 new factions (006 through 008).

Contains enough system tiles to build an additional 7 star systems with 88 additional system panels to represent those systems. Includes 32 more Action cards, 7 more Secret cards, and additional Ship and Asset cards. 10 Additional scenarios have been added so you can immediately jump into a larger engagement.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Grim Reaper The Card Game
description:
Grim Reaper The Card Game is a darkly comic competitive game where 2-5 players compete to become the new Grim Reaper by collecting the most souls within a 20 minute period.

Each player is dealt 7 cards and must have 7 cards in their hand at the beginning and the end of their turn. These cards will be either Soul Cards, which have a positive number in the right hand corner indicating their value, or they will be Action Cards which have a negative value in the top left hand corner but can be played against other players to, for example, change or swap their current hand.

Each player takes a turn picking up a new card and either discarding a card or playing an Action Card; these Action Cards can swap cards, force other players to change hands, or allows a player to look at another players hand.

At the beginning of the game a timer is set to 20 minutes and then hidden from view; the game commences in turn order, clockwise from the first player, until the timer indicates that the 20 minutes has elapsed. All players add up the total number of souls on the cards in their hand deducting any Action Card values and the player with the highest number of Souls wins.

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Berserker Brew
description: The SlugFest Games Season 5 Organized Play Kit includes [...] 6 copies of the Premium Promo: Berserker Brew (3 for each tournament) and 40 copies of the Participation Promo: Malt of Invention (20 for each tournament) [...]
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Malt of Invention
description: The SlugFest Games Season 5 Organized Play Kit includes [...] 6 copies of the Premium Promo: Berserker Brew (3 for each tournament) and 40 copies of the Participation Promo: Malt of Invention (20 for each tournament) [...]
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: IJN Naval Academy Cadet Kill Squad
description:
The Empire of Japan uses all the forces of the Nation to fight in the War, including brave young women who joins the Imperial Japanese Navy Cadet Corp. These fierce soldiers are trained to use modern and traditional weapons at the same time, making them deadly opponents. Their bravery on the battlefield is unmatched.

This reference comes with one Dust 1947 unit card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Pixel Glory: Light & Shadow – Pets Expansion!
description:
Pets are introduced to Pixel Glory: Light & Shadow!

This expansion comes with five new pets, one for each element, and four 10 strength auction cards.

Pets are dungeon companions to help you defeat the monsters. Instead of going into your deck, pets stay out in front of you and have abilities that trigger based off SP requirements.

Pets are drafted as the 10th and final card during the Town phase.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Ironbow: Strongbow
description:
This is a web-published game that is free to download and play.

Strongbow will allow you to create the armies that clashed anywhere in France or the British Isles- from the brow of Senlac Hill in 1066 A.D. to the bridge at Irfon in 1282. You can run down Norman invaders in forests of Wales, trample Kerns in the green fields of Ireland, turn naked Scots spearmen into pincushions in North Yorkshire, have mailed knights crash headlong into each other in the Norman Vexin, overthrow Albigensians in the Occitan valleys, and hear the snapping of Flemish pikes on the field of Bouvines.

•New special rules that allow for Shieldwall tactics, Mixed Spear units, Clan Ambushes, Huscarls’ last stand, and more, and new options for visual casualties from shooting and melee.

•A new Quick Reference Summary sheet that includes these changes, along with a revised Order Sheet, and new Status Cards for the new status types in Strongbow.

•48 new unit cards that cover the clans of Ireland, Wales, and the Scots Highlands, Lowland Scots, Late Vikings, Islemen, Saxons, Normans, Southern and Northern French, the Low Countries and more.

•19 Army lists that cover the armies of the troop types mentioned above, including special lists for conflicts like the Anarchy and the Baron’s Revolts.

•213 commander counters, including 96 historical commanders (like Harold Godwinson, Harald Hardraada, William the Conqueror, Robert Curthose, Somerled, Diarmait Mac Murchadha, Philip II Augustus, Richard the Lionheart, William Marshall, Simon de Montfort, Edward Longshanks and of course- Richard de Clare- AKA “Strongbow”) and 117 generically-named commanders… underlings to fill in the lower ranks, and die for their liege lords!

•5 Historical scenarios- the battles of Wilton (1143), Coleshill (1157), Clashacrow (1169), Gisors (1198) and Largs (1263)

•Full notes that explain all the items above, and a comprehensive guide to creating your own commanders, units, armies and battles of the era.

Note: Ironbow is required to play Strongbow.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: I'm Going Down
description:
I'm Going Down (IGD) is a print-and-play solitaire game about survival deep in enemy territory.

You play as a Pilot whose attack aircraft has been shot down during a routine mission. Now, you have to evade enemies and survive the elements long enough to scrounge together a search and rescue beacon to summon help. Your time on the ground will not be easy. The odds are against you.

You may also be able to turn your misadventure into heroism if you can capture enemy intelligence, destroy some of their installations, or maybe find other MIA allies and return to safety with them.

Or maybe you'll get eaten by a bear while trying to hide from a storm in a cave.

IGD is a solitaire game driven by tables and cards. Inspired by games like Ambush! and Ranger, you will see the narrative of your Pilot's exploits unfold in front of you through a combination of cards drawn and tables rolled on. Careful planning and choices will be pitted against the vagaries of fate, and the wide range of available Event cards mean games can feel drastically different from one another. One game will be a ruthless hunt as you flee from dogged pursuers, another may be a battle against rains, wildfires and errant bombing runs, and the next may see the tables turned as you attack enemy installations with captured weapons.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Hindsight
description:
Hindsight: 2020 is a real-time cooperative dice-drafting puzzle game for 1 to 4 players. On your turn, you will select two dice of the same color from a grid of 36--the first, the ACTION DIE, determines your main action by its position and your bonus action by its value; the second die, the POWER DIE, determines the strength of first action. You will use the actions to manipulate the puzzle tiles, to alter the dice in the grid (for future turns), and to manage the timer. The adjustable difficulty level will keep you on your toes for play after play as your team gets better at solving the puzzle quickly. Thinky and frantic, saving the world has never been so fun.

Theme:
The apocalypse is upon us! If only we’d seen it coming. Luckily for the rest of humanity, you’ve just finished the prototype for your new time-intervention device. Alas, it’s a little unstable and unreliable--it is a prototype, after all. You’ve figured out what intervention is needed to stop the apocalypse, but it takes some tinkering to get the machine aligned so your operatives can make those changes. You have just a couple minutes to find the right configuration of your machine to send back our intervention agents and save the world. Can you finish before the apocalypse arrives? Time to find out.

Saving the world, as fast as you can. The game has two play areas, a 6 by 6 dice grid, and a tile tableau. The dice grid has twelve actions you may take, one for each row and one for each column. At the top of the tile area are six “keystone” tiles numbered 1-6, representing the code you need to match. In an array of 36 tiles below the keystone line are columns of similar tiles.

When you select your Action die, you place it at the end of either the row or the column, indicating which action you intend to take. Then you select your Power die, another die of the same color, and place it on the Power die space outside the grid. The action you selected is augmented by the Power die, and allows you to manipulate the tile tableau or the dice grid. After you take your main action, you get a secondary action determined by the value of the action die you took. These secondary actions allow you to flip the sand timer and add more dice to the grid, among other things.

To solve the puzzle, you need to manipulate the tiles so that the top of each column matches the keystone number above it. When the number matches, you can “lock” that combination in place, triggering the bonus (or penalty) card attached to that column. You win if you are able to lock all six columns before you run out of dice or timer flips. Of course, if you ever let the timer run out, you also lose.

This is how the world ends:
Accompanying Hindsight: 2020 is a thematic website that uses your six-digit keystone code to reveal what happened to cause the apocalypse, and how your team did or did not succeed in preventing the end of the world.

-description from designer

name: Vector Wars
description:
Vector Wars is set in a Tron-style universe where the world has run dry of resources and clans fight in a virtual arena to gain one of the last remaining energy sources for their people known as Zetta Orbs. Vector Wars is a 2-player area domination game based on a 9 square board known as The Grid. You place one of your 9 character cards face-down, which gives little to no information to your opponent as to the strength of the card placed. These cards flip to give you an individual flip ability, which you may use to battle to keep control of the grid. Your job is to try and gain the most victory points by maintaining a tactical advantage over your opponent, which will ultimately gain you the victory.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Cookie Chaos
description:
It seems way to simple at first ...but after a game or two, it becomes apparent that theres a sophisticated strategy based on an aweseome food group - COOKIES!!

Cookie Chaos is a Euro-style tile laying game. Beginning with the start tile, players choose a tile and add to the "wild start" tile. Match 1 cookie, then collect 1 cookie. Match 2, then collect 2, match 3 then collect 3. There are symbols on the tiles that active actions when you match a cookie, such as: crumble - to send another players cookies back to the tray. Burn - to send everyone's cookies back to the tray. Rolling Pin - to steal another players cookies. Cookies can be protected by using your oven mitt. Players earn their oven mitt by collecting one of each cookie variety. Once earned, place on a single stack/variety to protect them. However, the stack is frozen as well, you cannot collect that variety! Oven mitts can be moved following the game rules, and other players mitts can be moved by drawing a tile with an oven mitt symbol and matching at least one cookie.

It's an ever changing scramble of matching, collecting, stealing and protecting.

The game ends once the last tile has been drawn, played and scored.

The player with the most cookies wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Children's Game, Humor, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Queue, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Techno Bowl: Legacy League
description:
The Legacy League Expansion is your chance to take a team, turn it into a franchise, and attempt to build a dynasty over several seasons. As owner, manager, and coach, you’ll be making all the decisions.

The expansion includes rules for:


Player Development
Trades, Selling Contracts, and Free Agency
Seasonal MFL Draft
Offensive Packages
Defensive Packages
Special Teams
Stadiums, Fields, and Broadcasting Upgrades
Weather Effects
17 new players skills!
Premium Skills
Franchise Players
All new active PLAYMAKER abilities
Bowl Games
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Sports, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Role Playing, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Anacund
description:
The game board in Anacund is composed of 17 wooden slats; fifteen of these slats have an ideogram at either end, with these ideograms representing the numbers 1-6. Shuffle these slats, then place them in a row, then place the remaining two slats (each with three ideograms) on either end to create a single path of 36 spaces. One of these spaces is colored red and dubbed the "bonus square". Each player takes 18 of the double-sided tokens, then places them in three groups of six, with their color face up.

On a turn, you must place three of your tokens on the game board. The space that you place a token on must equal the number of tokens in the group before you placed that token. Thus, at the start of the game, you take a token from a group of six tokens, then place that token on a 6 space. Your next token must be placed on a 5 (if taken from the same group) or a 6 (if taken from one of your remaining two groups).

If after placing a token, you have sandwiched one or more of the opponent's tokens, those opposing tokens are flipped over and placed next to the spaces they once occupied. These spaces cannot be played in again. If you would create a sandwich with yourself in the middle, then your own pieces are captured — unless you have simultaneously sandwiched the opponent at the same time, in which case you capture them instead.

Once all the pieces have been placed, players tally their scores. Each piece showing your color, whether on the board or next to it, is worth 1 point; whoever has a piece on or next to the bonus space scores 5 points. Whoever has the higher score wins.

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Building – Martian Command Post
description:
Proving they might have more interest in sticking around on Earth at least until every resource is consumed, the Martians have erected a number of peculiar command posts in urban regions. The interior activities of these are largely unknown, but it is suspected these buildings help coordinate invasion efforts utilizing quantum-based communications arrays.

—description from the box

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Building – G.U.A.R.D. Defense Base
description:
G.U.A.R.D. soldiers and pilots can’t be out fighting alien horrors every hour of the day, and the defense base is a place where they can coordinate their efforts, fill out necessary paperwork, and enjoy a bit of coffee before the next battle. As these bases are often deployed in forward regions, each is heavily fortified and during emergencies can activate a bunker mode where vulnerable segments are withdrawn, during which it can sustain considerable punishment.

—description from the box

name: Requiem: Vampire Knight – Hellfire Club
description:
The secret police is watching you.
Use inspector Kurse for ranged attacks...
Contains the Hellfire Club faction, 14 faction cards, 8 minis and a rules sheet.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Pirates, Zombies
mechanics: Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Destroyers Martian Menace Monster – Ares Mothership
description:
The Ares Mothership is a large Martian vehicle propelled by unknown means, and it represents the first extraterrestrial construct to enter Earth's atmosphere in recorded history. Its devastating lasers immediately answered the question of whether alien intelligence would be friendly or hostile. As the vanguard of the Martian invasion of the planet, Ares Mothership prosecutes a campaign of destruction across the globe, securing valuable resources that it can transform into new Martian assault craft.

—description from the box

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Protectors Terrasaurs Monster – Terra Khan
description:
Of all the great beings defending the planet, Terra Khan is perhaps the most terrifying, a gigantic reptilian creature that embodies the rage of nature itself. His roar can send saucers falling to the ground, and his step can provoke high-magnitude earthquakes. The destruction left in his aftermath is an inevitable price required to obliterate those threatening all life on Earth. Yet no monster fights with more determination than Terra Khan - he has been seen stepping on fleeing civilians as well as moving to shield beleaguered G.U.A.R.D. forces.

—description from the box

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Destroyers Martian Menace Unit Expansion 1
description:
Often the first sign of the invading Martian Menace is the eerie glow of an approaching saucer—just before a paralyzing beam emerges from its underside to kidnap a hapless victim or to deliver a power pod to facilitate the invasion.

Martian power pods are an ominous sight, each a simple but effective device that siphons energy from human cities at a prodigious rate to feed the greater host vessels.

The silent Hunter is an effective aerial killer, leveraging advanced Martian technology to attack on the approach from a great distance well before the enemy knows it is there.

—description from the publisher

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Destroyers Martian Menace Unit Expansion 2
description:
Vanguards make up the bulk of the attack force sent by the Martians against Earth, swift fighters that fire disintegration beams to obliterate the defense forces trying to stop them.

The silent Hunter is an effective aerial killer, leveraging advanced Martian technology to strike on the approach well before the enemy knows it is there.

—description from the publisher

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Protectors Terrasaurs Unit Expansion 1
description:
Though dwarfed by greater monsters like Terra Khan, carnidons are among the greatest apex predators on the planet, capable of hunting in packs and possessing claws and fangs that can easily rend metal and concrete.

While other Terrasaurs close on prey to attack them directly, the cagey spikodon destroys from a distance, launching armor-piercing bony projectiles from its tail with surpassing accuracy.

—description from the publisher

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Protectors Terrasaurs Unit Expansion 2
description:
Among the swiftest and most agile of Terrasaurs are the raptix, smaller but still lethal carnivores that are noteworthy for their powerful legs and leaping ability, allowing them to intercept low-flying aircraft.

Brontox are herbivores and among the gentlest of Terrasaurs, bringing instead a stoic disregard and virtual immunity to small weapons fire, protected by thick hides and muscle mass. Brontox are sent forth to expand Terrasaur nesting grounds, protecting eggs until they can mature.

—description from the publisher

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Building – Power Plant
description:
Everyone needs power, whether to run entertainment systems, to illuminate the night, or to be siphoned by invaders from Mars and thereby facilitate the conquest of Earth. Power Plants are particularly favored targets by many of the oversized creatures menacing the planet, and they explode spectacularly when stomped upon.

—description from the publisher

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Building – Communications Array
description:
Modern society would be lost without the steady and constant flow of information made possible by a solid Communication Array, as useful for coordinating military strikes as streaming entertainment to the masses.

—description from the publisher

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Building – Industrial Complex
description:
While an industrial complex isn’t pretty, would any city be without a place for the thriving masses to work endless hours trying to create goods and services for others to consume, all the while oblivious to the approach of titanic horrors?

—description from the publisher

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Building – Corporate Headquarters
description:
A Corporate Headquarters is a large and impressive building where decisions get made and a variety of middle managers seek to one-up one another in an endless quest to get ahead, none of which will matter when the city burns.

—description from the publisher

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Building – Downtown Highrise
description:
The Downtown Highrise is a fancy establishment and a great place to live for the young urban professionals, offering good closet space and an excellent view…until such a time as the city is overrun with giant bloodthirsty monsters.

—description from the publisher

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Building – Skyscraper
description:
Some buildings are taller and more impressive than others, and these ones are all that and more. Reach for the sky, Skyscraper, but do not be surprised when a rampaging Terrasaur knocks you down.

—description from the publisher

name: 南方作戦1941 (Southern Gambit 1941)
description:
December 8, 1941. One hour and 20 minutes prior to the attack on Pearl Harbor, the Imperial Army's open battle code "Hinode wa yamagata" was issued. As a result, the landing operation on the northern part of the Malay Peninsula was started, and the three-year and nine-month long Pacific War had begun. A new battleship, the Prince of Wales, overwhelms the ocean, the B-17 Flying Fortress covers the heavens while MacArthur swears revenge. The three great fortresses of Singapore, Hong Kong, and Corregidor stand in front of the Japanese army. Will you be able to lead the south operation to success in a hundred days ?

Time scale: ?
Unit scale: Regiment/Brigade
Game period: December 1941-April 1942
Counters: 198
Map: A2 (42 x 59.4 cm)
Cards: 32

(translated and adapted from publisher's Japanese description)


Published in Game Journal #69.
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: 三ツ星ショコラティエ (Three-Star Chocolatier)
description:
In 三ツ星ショコラティエ (Three-Star Chocolatier), which bears the English title of Apprentice's journey to a 3-star chocolatier, players roll dice to produce chocolate according to the pips, possibly using topping cards to create chocolate flavored like strawberry, banana, and other flavors. Your goal is to sell chocolates to customers, who want particular arrangements and flavors of treats. Skill cards can help you gain additional abilities during the game.

As you satisfy the demands from customers, you receive stars, and the first player to collect three large stars wins.

name: Unicorn Rescue Society: The Card Game
description:
Join the Unicorn Rescue Society in its mission to protect the world’s legendary animals from danger!

The Unicorn Rescue Society Card Game is a fast-paced, easy-to-learn game for 2-8 people that takes about 10 minutes to play. Race to rescue mythical creatures by matching them to their native habitats. Score big points by finding homes for the rarest creatures.

Each player begins the game with five cards, which are a mix of creatures and habitats. Using the cards in their hand and three face-up cards on the table, players take turns rescuing creatures by matching them to their native habitats, scoring points based on the value of the creature. If a player can't make a match, they draw a card. The game ends when a player has no cards left in their hand. The player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Mythology

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Destroyers Planet Eaters Monster – Rogzor
description:
Those who thought they had seen the worst the Planet Eaters had to offer when they had witnessed Gorghadra had yet to behold the terror brought by the one called Rogzor. Its footsteps have changed the course of rivers, and its raw power has leveled mountains. It cannot be reasoned with or understood and seems motivated solely by the desire to bring about the utter disintegration of the Earth and its inhabitants, siphoning power from everything it turns to ash. Woe to any man, machine, or beast that stands in Rogzor's path.

—description from the game box

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Building – Void Gate
description:
Where the Lords of Cthul stride into battle, reality warps and bends before tearing asunder. Void Gates are like wounds in the very fabric of the time-space continuum, and through them come otherworldly horrors to ravage the Earth. It is a top priority of all of Earth’s defenders to eradicate these unnatural structures as rapidly as possible.

—description from the publisher

name: Show of Force
description:
Show of Force (SOF) is a war themed competitive card game for players of all experience levels. SOF mixes the fun-for-everyone aspect of a party game, with the strategic gameplay of a trading card game.

To win you must kill your opponents by bring their Health Points to zero. This is done with the uses of 5 card types: Attack cards to do damage; Benefit cards to gain Health points; Utility cards to gain an edge; and Instant cards to be played any time for combos and defensives. Event cards are the 5th type and are randomly chosen and scattered throughout the main deck. When drawn they can be good or bad for players.

Strategy is very important because you can only play 1 card per turn, but at any moment an Event card can still ruin you plans. Gameplay types include free-for-all and team play, giving plenty of variety to a 88 card game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Gibbering Haremite
description:
Promo vermin resource card that were included with the Easter Pinup Twilight Knight, which is not part of the game.

The Easter Pinup Twilight Knight is a delightful vernal version of the icon Pinup Twilight Knight. In gorgeous new packaging for 2019! Now includes a promo vermin resource to add to your vermin deck.

Enclosed in a handsome new box, the Pinup Easter Twilight Knight includes:

1 x Hard Plastic Pinup Easter Twilight Knight
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm base and scenic insert
Large matte art print
Gibbering Haremite promo vermin resource
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: ケーキをつくろう (Let's Make A Cake)
description:
Publisher's summary
ケーキをつくろう (Kēki o tsukurou) (Let's Make A Cake) is a children's game from Japan.

Players bake some cakes, and the player who bakes the most delicious cake is the winner. A delicious cake is one that either has all the same fruit on the cake, or all different fruits on the cake.

Players pick fruits from a bag and put them on their cakes. When putting fruit on the cake, you should look at the cakes the other players are making. You can try to work out which fruits are more likely to come out of the bag, by seeing what has already been made. This will help you win!

This game is made for children from 6 years up, younger children can play if someone helps with the scoring. In fact, even five-year-olds were playing in the test play, it was very exciting.
publishers: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

name: Blood Red Skies: German Ace Pilot – Eduard Tratt
description:
This is an expansion set for the WWII aircraft miniatures game Blood Red Skies by Warlord Games and designed by Andy Chambers. This expansion includes German ace pilot Eduard Tratt and additional accessories to add to the core game.

Eduard Tratt began the war in BF 110s, accumulating thirteen victories by the end of 1940. He pioneered the use of fighter-bombers for pin-point attacks over England before transferring to the Eastern Front. In 1943 Tratt was assigned to command a special unit evaluating the new Me 410 against USAAF heavy bombers. Tratt would eventually be killed attacking B-17s of the 91st Bomb Group in February 1944. He had achieved 38 victories, including six heavy bombers and eight P-38 fighters, across 350 combat sorties.

Contents:
1 Me 410 metal Plane
1 Advantage Flying Base
1 Double-sided Pilot Skill Disc Set
1 Aircraft Card
2 Aircraft Trait Cards
2 Ace Skill Cards
1 Eduard Tratt Ace Card
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: OverBattle: Rise of Kings
description:
As Knights engage and armies scatter, the King's advance on other's Castles in this quest of trust, loyalty and cunning treachery.

Based on the OverBattle game system, the cross-genre mechanics of worker placement, area control and engine building are seamed together in a classic-yet-new format in a battle for lands that won't be forgotten.

The OverBattle: Rise of Kings experience starts with stunning visuals, classic gameplay and all new excitement. Revolutionary elements of territory, terrain changes and confrontation meet with co-op game play and more!

CASy enabled, 3D terrain and more creates a depth of gameplay consistent with Syther Gaming's OverBattle themed games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Economic, Exploration, Farming, Medieval, Negotiation, Territory Building, Wargame
