name: Wasteland Express Delivery Service: One-Eyed Vito
description:
Was part of the pledge level for backing the Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter campaign.

An ally card.

Text says:
Take 1 damage and discard this ally to defeat a raider truck.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Coffee Dice
description:
Coffee Dice is an euro game, with dice, in this game you will play the roll of an coffee entrepreneur, who is tryng to manage a coffee plantation.
Every turn, roll your dices and modify their values to do the action related to this value, the actions you can take are: to plant, to harvest, to process, to toast, to ship and to sell.
Take advantage of your opponent's dice to boost your own actions, and try to sell to customers with good rewards, take the customer card to your playing area to score in the money track around the main board.
the game ends when the pile of customers is empty, and you cannot replace with a new one.
The player with the most money wins the game.

—description from the designer

name: Comic Creator
description:
Comic Creator is an engine-building dice game about the difficulties of being a manga creator.

Collect skill cards to increase your dice pool or use your dice more effectively, and recruit Assistant cards for their special abilities. You want to spend dice to get Experience Points (victory points), but the more you can spend at once the more effective they are... should you spend your dice on your engine and save up for a big card or spend them now for a sure thing?

Striking a balance is tough enough without worrying about printer's deadlines!

—user summary

name: MONSTER MUTATION
description:
IT TAKES A MONSTER TO CREATE ONE.

Monster Mutation is a very simple game to learn and can be played by 2 to 4 players. The age mark is 5 years of age, but even more feeble minded creatures will be able to simply have a lot of fun creating their own unique
and gross mutations.

GOAL
The goal of Monster Mutation is to earn points by assembling
disgusting monsters. When the game ends, you will be awarded points for monsters with most eyeballs, most fins, longest monster, largets monster ect.

CARDS
There are three types of cards:

1. Missions: There is a total of 10 mission cards that each layer are fighting over during the game. The mission cards decribe what type of monster combinations might give you points at the end of the game. Each mission card has its specific requirements on how to obtain its one point value. There is a total of 10 different missions. See details on the back of each mission card.

MONSTER PARTS
There are various monster part cards:
A. Red/weapons Allows a mutation to eat meat.
B. Green/mouths allow a mutation to eat plants.
C. Blue/Finns allow a mutations to swim.
D. Purple/Legs allow a mutation to run.
E. Yellow/Eyes allow a creature to see better.
F. Connecters have multible open endings and allow you to build larger creatures.(Size matters).

3. Hourglass: This card can be used to define when the game ends.

SET UP THE GAME
All monster part cards are placed in a single pile in the middle of the table, it is referred to as the monster part pile. The mission cards are all placed face up, next to each other so the possible missions can be seen.

START THE GAME
Place the hourglass card face down some where in the lower half of the monster part pile. The more players you play the further down in the pile you should place it. You can also choose to exclude the hourglass card, and simply play until the monster card pile is empty.

EACH TURN
1. Draw 2 cards from the monster card pile.
2. Place the monster cards face up on the table in front of you.
3. You may connect monster parts that fits together (as shown below).
Note that you may only have a maximum of three unfinished monsters at the same time. Once a card has been put together with another, they are locked in place and may not be separated.

FITS TOGETHER In order for two monster parts to fit together, their open endings must have the same size. Thin part endings cannot be connected to thick part endings, vice versa.

UNFINISHED MONSTER A unfinished monster is one who has one or more open endings. A single part also counts as a unfinished monster.

GAME ENDS The game ends when the hourglass card has been drawn.
All unfinished creatures instantly dies, and are put away.
As they may not be included in the final score.
WINNER The winner of the game is the one who earns the most mission cards. If two or more players has reached the same amount of a spescific mission card requirements the point goes to no one.

Are YOU a MONSTER?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Building – Harbinger Comet Shard
description:
Fragments of the Harbinger Comet broke off at regular intervals during its approach and subsequently survived reentry to impact in countless locations, including several deep within populated cities. Initially thought to be random, these strike locations are now seen as part of a deliberate pattern. Composed of alien materials, these structures are resistant to conventional weapons and contain within them slumbering forces awaiting the call to feast upon the world.

—description from the publisher

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Building – Shadow Sun Industries Building
description:
The Shadow Sun Syndicate’s corporate efforts touch on countless high-tech industries as well as providing secret support to just as many criminal or quasi-legal operations, and its facilities can be found across the globe. Some of these are geared toward facilitating military intervention, garrisoning interceptors and sun fighters as well as servicing shinobi and zors in the field by restocking volatile mutagenic agents and calibrating nanite control systems.

—description from the publisher

name: Sheets & Giggles Game
description:
The Sheets & Giggles Game is a party game for adults with 4 rounds of hilarious, inappropriate, action-packed word play and innuendos considered offensive by most. You and your team will describe outrageous words and phrases, act them out, give one-word hints, then act them out again under a sheet. Score points by quickly getting your team to guess cards correctly while using the rule for each round.

FOREPLAY: SETTING UP
Step 1:
Split into teams– ideally 2 teams of 3 to 6 people.

Step 2:
The game should consist of about 45 cards total. To start, everyone gets 10 random cards and places a few of their favorites face down in a pile until there are enough.

HINT: Don’t share your cards with anyone, even the other players on your team!

HINT: The number of olives indicates the dirtiness of the card. The more olives, the dirtier it is.

Step 3:
Combine and shuffle all chosen cards from both teams into one pile & put them face down on a table, in a bowl, or in the box. All cards, regardless of who chose them, will be used by both teams.

Step 4:
Choose your least favorite people to keep score and time.

DOING IT: HOW TO PLAY
Each Sheet Head gets a 60 second turn to try to get their team to guess as many cards as possible using the rule for that round. Once a card is drawn, it must either be guessed correctly or returned to the pile when time expires. Teams take turns guessing cards – every member of a team should take their turn as Sheet Head before any teammate repeats.

Each of the 4 rounds end after all cards are guessed correctly. To start the next round, reshuffle all the cards and continue in the order you left off.

HINT: If your memory sucks, read the cards aloud after the first round.

THE POSITIONS
Round 1: Sheet Talking
Sheet Heads get their team to guess the card without saying any part of the words on the card.

Do’s: Speaking – Like texting, but with your mouth.

Don’ts: Act, gesture, rhyme, spell, abbreviate, say any part of a word on the card.

Round 2: Be Charade, Be Very Charade!
Sheet Heads get their team to guess the card by acting. This should sound familiar.

Do’s: Act, Gesture, Point.

Don’ts: Talk, make noises, spell with your hands.

Round 3: The S-Word
Players get their team to guess the card by saying only ONE word. This is more challenging than you Sheet Heads think.

Do’s: Say ONE word, use different Inflections, use accents.

Don’ts: Say another word, mouth other words, gestures, rhyming, Use a word or part of a word on the card, suck.

Round 4: Sheet Show
The Sheet Head puts a sheet over their head and acts out the clues.

Do’s: Act out the card under the sheet, you Dumb Sheet.

Don’ts: Talk, come out from under the sheet, make noises.

THE CLIMAX: HOW TO WIN
The team with the most correctly guessed cards after all 4 rounds wins. We don’t care how you keep score, but tally scoring or collecting correctly guessed cards does the job.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Area Movement, Memory, Team-Based Game

name: Combat Commander: Europe – C3i #24 Scenarios
description:
Two scenarios fron C3i magazine #24:

Scenario 111: The Scheldt, Canadian vs German forces, Scheldt Estuary, October 1944 (requires CC:E and CC:M)

Scenario 112: Sonnenwende, German vs Soviet forces, Arnswalde, February 1945
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Euclio
description:
Euclio is a snappy combination of card drafting and worker placement where players vie to earn the most trophies by claiming and manipulating various scoring boards, but beware! Only players with scoring markers on each board will gain its payout, but that won't stop the other players from using cards that alter it!

Euclio is played over three game rounds that involve drafting cards, playing them to manipulate the boards and claim scoring opportunities, and finally scoring the boards themselves. Players can enter into pseudo alliances with players who share their scoring boards, while other players may play (or withhold) cards that hamper your plans.

By only using a subset of the scoring boards, every game will be different as the boards determine what suit cards are in play with varying effects. Even among the same boards, their arrangement changes scoring timings for even more strategic variety!

Simple rules make game-play itself very straightforward: on your turn either play a card face up for its effect, or face down to lay claim with a scoring marker. It's important to set your scoring markers on the most lucrative spaces before they run out of room, but doing so reduces your control, as without unused scoring markers, you must play cards face up for their effects, even if they help your opponents, and the earlier you commit your scoring markers, the less certain you can be about the final state of each scoring board.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Wherewolf: Promo Cards
description:
These 4 promo cards were made for fairs and presentations and include:

La Sensitiva - An alternative role to the Seer. (Illustration of Levente Peterffy)

The Celtic set. A set of 3 roles inspired by the traditions of the Sidhe (The Fair Folk):
La Sidhe
Il Leprecauno
Il Goblin
(Illustrations by Francesco Acquaviva)

The cards can be found through the publisher, Raven Distribution.

name: Son of Kark
description:
This game is developed to be played with the Green Box of Games game system.

You are Kark, a successful merchant seeking to expand your trading empire by issuing orders to your sons. Place tiles on the table and add your cubes to them to score points. Three different placements are possible: Market, City or Crossroads, and each score in a different way.

The game is obviously inspired by Carcassonne (Klaus-Jürgen Wrede, 2000), but adapted to fit the components of the Green Box of Games. Basic gameplay is like the original game, you draw a tile, place it, and then choose whether to place one of you pieces on it in order to score points.

Markets (cubes placed in the center of a symbol) score based on the number of tiles with the same symbol on the board.
Cities (cubes in the center of face down tiles) score based on the number of different market symbols around it.
Crossroads (cubes placed on the intersection of four tiles) score at the end of the game, when players sum up who has the most influence over each of the six symbols plus cities.

—description from the designer

Grand Alliance - Order is a guide to the armies and factions devoted to Order in Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

This book contains 156 warscrolls and 19 warscroll battalions allowing players to field armies both mortal and mystical drawn from the forces of Order, including;

name: Sophisticuffs
description: A collectible 2-person card game with simple 2-second battle rules: each player secretly chooses a combatant card from their collection. The combatant cards are then held head-to-head, so that lines of colored numbers at the top of each card align. In the column where the colors are the same (there will always be exactly one), the combatant with the higher number wins.

name: Euclio Extra!
description:
The first expansion to Euclio, Euclio: Extra! adds five new boards and accompanying suit cards to make your games even more varied and interesting.

Some of the new boards are a bit more complex, therefore recommended for Euclio veterans, but all retain the general simplicity of play Euclio has always had.

Euclio: Extra! adds auctions, more opportunistic play, and even a board/suit that benefits if you DON'T place your scoring markers! Get ready to twist your brain navigating the new difficult decisions inside. Simply add to your Euclio box and experience a new mixture of boards and suits!


Expansion! Euclio Required to play!**



-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Monopoly: University of York
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
Founded on principles of excellence, equality and opportunity for all, the University of York opened in 1963 with just 230 students. In less than 50 years it has become one of the world's leading universities, carving out a reputation as an academic powerhouse where a clear focus on excellence has secured national and international recognition alongside longer established institutions.
A member of the elite Russell Group of universities, it is a dynamic, research-intensive university committed to the development of life-saving discoveries and new technologies to tackle some of the most pressing global challenges. There are now over 30 academic departments and research centres and the student body has expanded to nearly 16,000.
Located within walking distance of York city centre, our safe and attractive Heslington campus is home to our nine colleges and most of our departments. We also have several departments located in the city centre at the historic King's Manor. In recent years, our £750m campus expansion has seen the opening of seven new buildings, increasing our capacity for student numbers and providing more world-class facilities for the 21st Century. Sustainability plays a key role in this ambitious development.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Dust 1947: PLA/Red Army Sarnai and Grom
description:
Captain “Red Lightning” Sarnai
Hero of the Sino-Soviet Union – 1946
Hero of the Soviet Union – 1944
Order of Lenin – 1944
Order of the Patriotic War – 1943
Order of the Red Star – 1943
Born 1921 in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, Sarnai is one of the most famous and decorated pilot of the VVS (Voyenno-Vozdushnye Sily), the Sino-Soviet Union Military Air Forces. With her father being one of the rare pilots in her home country, Sarnai learned to fly at an early age. A natural talent, she started flying between her hometown and Irkutsk, carrying love letters, precious merchandises and shady characters. When her country officially joined the war effort against Axis powers, she then joined the newly formed Mongolian Arat Squadron, in 1943. Her impressive skills soon proved to be invaluable and she was transferred to the 46th “Taman” Guards Night Bomber Aviation Regiment (the “Night Witches”). Accumulating an impressive score of victories, she was tasked to form the 179th Guards Assault Aviation Regiment that she now commands. It was the first unit to receive the “Grom” (thunder in Russian)in the Red Air Force. The Mil Mi-47Z “Grom” Tesla Assault Helicopter is the latest addition to the already impressive arsenal of the VVS. Quickly catching up with their German counterparts, the Soviet engineers have miniaturized their VK generator enough so they can fit inside the tight fuselage of an attack helicopter. This gives the aircraft a tremendous firepower, almost without equal on the planet. It takes incredible piloting skills to hit anything with Tesla guns from the air, but the results are devastating: the whole enemy aircraft shuts down, its controls (or pilot...) fried.

This reference comes with three Dust 1947 unit cards. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: TKG ARENA: The Arcane Scribes
description:
The Arcane Scribes

The Arcane Scribes are the trusted aides of the mighty Magi. They are tasked with channeling the necessary mystical energies from the Elemental Oinks to awaken the runic manifest arriving from the various realms so as to inscribe powerful spells into scrolls ready to be cast by their prodigious masters at the snap of fingers during deadly battles of magic. Are you good enough to win the minion of the month award?

TKG ARENA: The Arcane Scribes is a game set up for 2 to 4 players.

Components required for this game:

FULL SPELL DECK: 1
WORLD TILES: 48
OINKS: 2 from each element for each player (Default)

Winning Condition

The player with the most victory points at the end wins the game.

The Arcane Scribes consist of a group of world tiles representing the sources of an array of available spells furnished by a FULL SPELL DECK, symbolizing the runic manifest. Players take on the role of an arcane scribe choosing and inscribing spells onto their master’s scroll by activating the required number and type of Oinks. The value of the collection of spells scribed depends on the strategic choices made and can be measured in terms of victory points.

Victory points are tabulated as follows:

1. The victory points from each spell card scribed are equal to the FACE VALUE of the spell card. E.g. A Telegate spell is worth 8 victory points.
2. The victory points of each spell card of an element double if all other players have less spells of that element in terms of number of spells scribed.

3. Reserved spells that are not scribed are worth 0 victory points.

Ending Condition

The game will end immediately when there are less spells cards than the number of players in play.

Setup

Players start the game by each drawing a card from the top of the common shuffled FULL SPELL DECK. The player with the highest number starts first and the players get their turns in a clockwise manner. The drawn cards go back to the bottom of the FULL SPELL DECK. In the case of ties, the tied players draw again till the turns are resolved.

Players then draw 5 world tiles from a stack of shuffled world tiles faced up from topmost first. The world tiles are put adjacent to each other in a row side by side faced up. 5 spells cards are drawn from a re-shuffled FULL SPELL DECK and placed on each of these world tiles from left to right. The rest of the spell cards in the FULL SPELL DECK remain face down as a pile.

Additional Notes

Each player may only have a maximum of 5 Oinks (of any type) in their possession. Any above this limit must be immediately discarded back to the common supply. Players may choose what they want to discard whenever this limit is exceeded. Whenever the common supply is not able to fulfil any needs, the need will be unfulfilled.

Game Flow

During each turn, players can do one of these four actions:

1. Take 2 Oinks of different elements from the common supply.

2. Exchange 1 Oink for up to 3 Oinks from the common supply. The Oink must be of a different element from the 3 Oinks traded. The 3 Oinks must be of the same element type.

3. Reserve a spell card and place it face down in the respective player’s personal playing space till it is scribed at the normal cost. For 1 – 4 players, up to 2 spell cards can be reserved at one time.

4. Scribe a spell card and pay for the cost depending on the FACE VALUE of the spell card. 1 Oink of any element is required for each unit of the FACE VALUE. E.g. for a FACE VALUE of 9, 9 Oinks must be expended and returned to the common supply. If the Oink used is of the same element type as the spell card to be scribed, it will count as 2 Oinks for this purpose. E.g. An ASHW spell of FACE VALUE 9 can be scribed with 4 ASHW Oinks and 1 Oink of any other element.

When a player either reserve or scribe a spell card and the spell is moved from the world tile to the player’s personal playing space, the elemental insignias on the world tile will be revealed and a follow up effect for the rest of the players occurs.

1. If there is only 1 elemental insignia on the world tile, the rest of the players get an Oink of that element from the common supply.

2. If there are 2 elemental insignias on the world tile and they are different, the rest of the players can choose to get 1 Oink of an element from either element but not both. If the 2 elemental insignias are the same, there will be no choice.

3. If there are 3 elemental insignias on the world tile, the rest of the players can chose to exchange 1 Oink for up to 3 Oinks of elements matching the elemental insignias. The Oink that is traded must be of a different element type from any of the elemental insignia(s) on the world tile.

4. If there are 4 elemental insignias on the world tile, it is an ARENA world tile and players can choose to take 1 Oink of any of the 4 elements present from the common supply.

After this follow up effect, the world tile is discarded and a new world tile is drawn from the stack to replace its position and anther spell card is drawn from the FULL SPELL DECK to replace the spell card that has been just scribed or reserved. The ending condition is then checked to see if the game should end and victory points calculated according to the winning conditions to determine a winner. When there is a tie, the player with a greater variety of spells scribed in terms of element types wins, If there is still a tie, the player with more Oinks in his/her possession wins. If this does not break the final tie, let the players rejoice in their joint victory.

Adjustment for more players

The game can be adjusted to accommodate up to 8 players if there are sufficient Oinks to satisfy the component requirements. For 5 - 8 players, only 1 spell card can be reserved at one time.

name: FiveCore: Skirmish Gaming Evolved 3rd Edition – 20th Century. Modern and Futuristic Skirmish Campaigns
description:
Welcome to FiveCore 3!
FiveCore is a set of generic war game rules, suitable for 20th century, near future and science
fiction conflicts.
This is a skirmish game, aimed at groups of 5-15 figures on each side though many players run far
larger forces.
The rules aim to provide a fun, tactically sophisticated game that provides plausible outcomes
that are slightly on the more cinematic side of things.
Whether you prefer historical scenarios, imaginary conflicts or science fiction, FiveCore will let
you create interesting characters and follow them in their adventures.
If you don't enjoy campaigns, fear not as you also get systems to set up quick, random encounters.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Siege Songs: Battle of Xuzhou
description:
圍城楚歌：抗戰之徐州會戰 ("Siege Songs: Battle of Xuzhou") is a two-player board wargame that simulates the battle of Xuzhou, Dec. 26, 1937 to June. 9, 1938. "Siege Songs" is the second game in the War of Resistance series.

Each turn represents 1 week and each hex is about 10-12 km across. One player commands the Imperial Japanese Army （大日本帝國陸軍） and the other player commands the National Revolutionary Army （國民革命軍）.

In Siege Songs, each player uses operation points to activate Army HQ to lead combat units to move, barrage, combat. In each turn, each player draws tactic markers respectively and roll for initiative. The units include infantry, artillery, cavalry, and tank, etc. The NRA side needs to defend Taieruang and Xuzhou in different scenarios to win the game.

The components includes two 22*34 inches map and 3 5/9 inch die-cut counter boards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: MATCH: Ruthe Cartoons
description:
Two player duel-game in creating rows vertically or horizontally. Illustrations by Ralph Ruthe.

The game consists of illustrated cubes from Ruthes cartoons in a 5x5 Matix. Both players are getting two cards. At the beginning one cube must pushed out and the starting player uses this cube to push another one out. With this action he tries to get 5 identical cartoons in a row. If he gets a row, the players need to check if the other player has the cartoon wich is shown in the row on one of his cards, then he gets points. If not, the player, who has the row gets points. Additional points if he has the card, too. After some rounds, the player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

name: Middara: The Collector
description:
The Collector Bounty Pack contains a Bounty Book, multiple new Initiative cards, two new Combatants, a new Boss Monster, new Monster Loot, and hidden Item cards for you to uncover. This Bounty Pack expansion will require Act 1 to play.

The Collector and his collection of that which he values most will keep you on your toes as your party ventures to purge the lands of Elenia from this scourge to humanity. Beyond where even the most venerable warriors dare stray. And whether you end up living triumphantly as heroes, or rotting away as dead memories written on the pages of history books. One way or another, Bounties will earn your party fame in Middara.

PERFECTION THROUGH ADVERSITY
Bounty Packs expand the Adventure Mode with insanely hard and uniquely diverse side quests. These Side Quests can be attempted at lower levels than the intended difficulty recommends for an even hard challenge.

Each Bounty Pack adds a side quest that can be attempted during specific moments of the Adventure Mode. The Bounties of Elenia line of Bounty Packs represent all of the horrible monstrosities that threaten the realms of Elenia.

Each Bounty Pack contains a plethora of new content. New tokens, a new Bounty Book, new miniatures, new tiles that expand old sets, new unique loot, new upgrades, as well as optional content to change the possible combatants that might spawn in the Unintentional Malum Core Game and Adventure Expansions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Huns: Soutien opportun
description:
This promo card was distributed by boardgame stores when the game was released and distributed at some conventions.

Text on the card:
"Vous pouvez immédiatement expédier un de vos Chariots sur lequel il y a au moins 3 Richesses."

name: Vikings Gone Wild: Tantrum Gate Promo Card
description:
Available from Tantrum House Season 5 Kickstarter campaign.

Cost: 3 Beer
Spend 2 Water elements to Pick 1 UNIT card from your Discard Pile to your hand.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: StoneRow
description:
StoneRow is a medieval-themed, hand-management card game with a bit of Take That and Set Collection mechanics. The objective is to accumulate points and become the player with the most points by the time the tower is built in order to be declared the winner.

The game is tracked by the building of a 5-6 card tower. During the game, players have the opportunity to steal or break points.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: The North: The Tower Array
description: This is a 13-card expansion for The North, featuring four new Ancients.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Rangers of The Protection Forest
description:
'Rangers of The Protection Forest' reservation for Spiel '19: https://shepherdkit.pse.is/Spiel19SK

--

Rangers of The Protection Forest is a semi-co-op environmental protection project collaborated with the Forestry Bureau, Taiwan. In the game, players act as forest rangers, whose ultimate goal is to re-build the protection forest.

The game includes a mix of set collection and tile placement with grid movement features. By tree nursery, forestation, and performing rescue missions, players can re-build the protection forest and provide a natural shelter to defend natural disasters.

Each player round is divided into three steps:

Step 1. Collect Sapling Resources: Each player can either collect a mixed type of 3 sapling resources, or collect all of one single type of sapling resources from the table.

Step 2. Forest Tile Placement: Draw a hexagonal forest tile and place it on the table. Should the tile indicate an incident, then draw an incident card and activate.

Step 3. Forestation: Use the player's sapling resources for forestation. If the resource required for a tile is fulfilled, then a tree meeple is placed on the tile along with a player token.

The game ends when all the tiles are drawn. Scores are calculated by the achievement of basic missions and special missions.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Admiral Zheng He
description:
Trade and travel with the Chinese fleet in the 15th century Indian Ocean.

You are a Chief Trader in this fleet, which carries costly cargoes for you to exchange for gems, incense, medicine, pearls, resin, spices, textiles, fine woods and fauna.

You decide which of these products to bring to trade with foreign ports, and using the knowledge that you alone possess, which ports to visit. The one who brings home the treasure that most impresses the Emperor wins. Includes board, 150+ cards, 24 cubes, 20 arrow chits, 3 fleet tokens, rules book with extensive background material.

A basic round of play:

Draft Trade Goods.
Vote on where to sail next.
Adjust prices per the port card.
Auction off available commodities.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Voting

name: Pike & Shotte: To Kill a King
description:
168 pages of colour rich information with an introduction by writer Charles Singleton, this supplement for Pike & Shotte describes the history, armies, personalities and battles of the English Civil War. Included are detailed scenarios based on some of the most famous battles, complete with maps and orders of battle/army lists for the main protagonists.

Crammed full of detailed background information, including:

The Early Reign of Charles I
The Bishops’ Wars and the Short Parliament
Rebellion in Ireland
The First Civil War
The Second Civil War
Another War with Scotland
Plus a comprehensive Civil War Timeline and detailed look at the armies of the civil war who were the infantry, the cavalry and artillery, how were they organised and fielded.

The author then takes you on through the tactics of the Civil War and the military revolution of the period where the Dutch and Swedish systems were learnt and employed, and indeed explained here in detail along with more Civil War tactics.

Profiles of the Royalist and Parliamentarian Commanders.
Full colour guide to the colours used by participants in the Civil War.
Early war army lists for the Scots Covenanter Army of the Bishops’ Wars.
Bishops’ Wars Scots Royalist and English Pre Civil War Army.
The Royalist Army Lists

The Early Royalist Army
The King’s Oxford Army
The Early Oxford Army
The Late Oxford Army
The Royalist Cornish Army, 1643
The Royalist Western Army, 1644
The Royalist Northern Army
Welsh Marshes and the Anglo-Irish
Royalist Army
Battle Scenarios include:

The Battle Of Brentford 12 November 1642
The Battle Of Chalgrove Field 18 June 1643
The Battle Of Adwalton Moor 30 June 1643
The Battle Of Lansdown Hill 5 July 1642
plus a battle report for the battle of Nantwich 24 January 1644

The Parliamentarian Army Lists covering:

The Army under Lord Essex
The Armies of Sir William Waller
Fairfax’s Northern Army
The Army of the Eastern Association
Clubmen Army
The New Model Army
Specific Battle Scenarios include:

The Battle Of Cheriton 19 March 1644
The Battle Of Omskirk 20 August 1644
The Battle Report Of The Second Battle Of Newbury 27 October 1644
The Battle Of Wistanstow 8 June 1645
The Battle Of Torrington 16 February 1646
The Scottish Army Lists include:

Scots Covenanter
The Scots Royalist Army of the Marquis of Montrose
The Scots Royalist Army of 1644
The Scots Royalist Army of 1645
The ‘Traditional’ Montrose Army
Further battle scenarios look at:

The Battle Of Aberdeen 13 September 1644
Battle Report For The Battle Of Inverlochy 2nd February 1645
The Battle Of Benburb 5 June 1646
The Battle Of Winwick Pass 19 August 1648
The Irish Army Lists Include:

The Irish Catholic Confederate
Anglo-Scots Army
Ormond Irish Royalist Alliance Army
Plus

Special 'Period’ specific rules
’Late Misery of War' 8 pages of detailed campaign rules
10 pages of glorious siege rules
Concluding with the storming of Cirencester
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Boneyard Rummage
description:
When 2 dogs broke into the Boneyard, the Skeleton's bones were scattered and lost. Compete with your friends to find and rebuild the Skeletons while the Dogs roam the Boneyard looking for something to chew on.

The game takes place on a 2 layer, 4x4 grid of tiles. On your turn you will flip tiles and look for Bones. There are 10 Skeletons and each has 3 Bones. You will earn points by combining the Bones in matching or mixed sets, and in sets of 2 or 3 Bones. End your turn by moving the Dog tiles and blocking the next player from specific bones. By the end of the game, the player with the highest score of assembled Skeletons wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Children's Game, Horror, Humor, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Memory, Set Collection, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Flesh-eater Courts
description:
Victims of an ancient and terrible curse, the mordants of the Flesheater Courts believe themselves to be noble knights engaged in a battle against evil, when in fact they are cannibalistic monsters who prey upon the mortal races to satiate their ravenous hunger.

Slaughter your way across the Allpoints for honour, glory and feasts of flesh with this card pack! Combined with the core rules and your miniatures, this set lets you bring the deranged Flesh-eater Courts to your skirmish battles. An abilities card allows you to unleash deadly in-game tactics and powers, while a set of fighter cards provide profiles for Crypt Ghouls, Crypt Flayers and Crypt Horrors.

This set contains an abilities card in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian, as well as several fighter cards. Please note that a copy of the Warcry Core Book is needed to use this set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Battleplan Cards
description:
Generate awesome battleplans in moments with these decks of battleplan cards! With these three decks, you’ll be able to create new scenarios for your warbands in mere moments, featuring a host of different deployment maps, objectives, twists and more. This set contains:


36 deployment cards


Shows different examples of where to set-up your warbands


36 victory cards


Details 36 different victory conditions


36 twist cards


Special rules that are used for the duration of each battle.

Combine these with terrain cards, and you’ll be able to play millions of potential battleplans – no two need be the same!

Please note – you'll need a copy of the Warcry Core Book to use this set, plus any of the Terrain decks featured in Warcry Ravaged Lands sets or the starter set. These cards are also included in the Warcry Starter Set – if you have a copy, you won't need these!

—description from the publisher

name: Euclio Tricky!
description:
The second expansion to Euclio, Euclio Tricky! adds five new scoring boards and accompanying suit cards to make your games even more varied and interesting.

These new boards are a bit more... tricky, and therefore recommended for Euclio veterans, but all retain the general simplicity of play Euclio has always had.

Euclio Tricky! adds a risky new chip type, more calls to have points on hand, and a surprise behind door number 2! Get ready to sweat bullets staring down these tricky new suits. Simply add to your Euclio box and experience a new mixture of gameplay possibilities!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: TRK Hockey
description:
TRK HOCKEY is an action-packed, fast moving, easy to play table game that will bring professional hockey action into your home!

You will be owner, general manager and coach of your own team. You set the line-ups, you make the line changes, you coach your team!

Each player's statistics from the previous system have been computed and displayed on 2" x 2 3/4" cards. His skating, shooting, passing and puck handing skills are all represented on his individual card. Even his tendency to commit penalties and his durability are represented.

Your decisions as coach will play an important roll in the outcome of each game. If you chose the right combinations your team will play up to its potential. Your ability to match up lines against your opponents lines is crucial.

TRK HOCKEY can be played both solitaire or by two or more players.

—description from the rulebook

(This is a spiral bound paperback book with perforated cards, 16 to a page.)

name: Palaeo Diet: Fireside Tales
description:
Fireside Tales is a narrative campaign expansion for Palaeo Diet: Eat or Be Eaten. Join Herc, the last of his people, as he regales a new tribe with tales of his heroic exploits, makes excuses for his torn clothing, and remains rather vague about exactly what happened to his old companions....

Fireside Tales includes the following:

Five new, linked scenarios with primary and secondary objectives
Four new beast profiles with reaction tables
New optional rules for unwashed hunters
Guidelines for hunting juvenile beasts


You need a copy of Palaeo Diet: Eat or Be Eaten to use this supplement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Wargame

name: Galactic Conquest
description:
Galactic Conquest is a simulation of a galaxy where young civilizations are beginning to explore the void of space and expand their scientific knowledge. The game is designed to give the player the maximum amount of flexibility in almost every section, so that the player can fully use his imagination . . .

The judge's manual is a guide for the player chosen to be the judge. All the values listed may be changed, they are merely given as a recommended point of reference . . .

The object of the game is: For each player and his allies, if any, to gain mastery of the galaxy, or a predominant portion thereof. This however can be altered by the judge, considering the type of campaign desired.

—description from the publisher

The game consists of two digest-sized books: a 12-page Referee's Manual (blue cover) and a 28-page Player's Manual (yellow cover).

The Referee's Manual begins with rules for creating the referee's hex map of the galaxy. The map is randomly populated with solar systems and gas clouds. In addition to the player-controlled solar systems, which are all inhabited by technologically advanced "spacegoing" civilizations, non-player systems are generated by the referee. These non-player systems vary by industrial level, military resistance, and spaceflight capabilities (if any). Spacegoing non-player systems have randomly determined race and culture characteristics which serve to impact the War Roll (a die-roll determination of whether a meeting between opposing spacegoing forces is peaceful or results in conflict). The War Roll is also impacted by the government types of the involved civilizations. Finally, the Referee's Manual includes rules for research and technology that allow solar systems to advance and develop more powerful weaponry and spacecraft, including improvements in spacecraft propulsion ranging from sublight to hyperlight speeds.

The Player's Manual explains the various planet types, the process for planetary industrialization, and the planetary installations that players can construct. The details of spaceship construction and associated costs are set forth for the game's two general classes of vessels: warships and merchants. Three classes of troops are available to the players: combat troops, engineers, and android troops (also referred to in the rules as robot troops). The Player's Manual includes the game's rules for movement and combat. These rules cover both tactical space battles (with distinctions for sublight and hyperlight vessels) and man-to-man land battles. Both types of battles rely on tabletop-miniatures-style rules, with movement being simultaneous based on written orders. The game also allows for "strategic combat" on the galaxy map in the form of minefields laid in space.

In addition to the rules booklets, the game requires hex sheets, paper/notebooks, pencils, two to four 20-sided dice, one (?) 10-sided die, and an unspecified number of six-sided dice.

—user summary
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Kashmir Crisis
description:
Kashmir Crisis is a simple card-based game for two players, on the aftermath of the February 2019 suicide bomber attack at Pulwama.

Offered for free print-and-play in the vein of "gamer-citizen journalism", it takes about 15 minutes to play. You need to print out the rules and player aid card, and optionally the player mat to help keep things organized – you also need a deck of ordinary playing cards, with one Joker.

During each game turn, players will begin by revealing the Event Card that will be in effect during that turn. Then, both players will receive a number of cards from a deck of ordinary playing cards, and play them onto Diplomatic, Information or Military Fronts (or keep them in a Reserve, for a later turn). After this, players will compare the totals of cards played to see if one player will score Victory Points on a given Front, and whether one or both players will lose cards and Victory Points. Game has a variable end point.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Modern Warfare, Political, Print & Play, Wargame

name: A Pleasant Journey to Neko: Penguin Habitat 3
description: Penguin Habitat 3: Once per round during the Action Phase, discard an interference tile and take one discarded dice from the main board.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: El Maestro: Paquet promotionnel 1 – Cinéma
description: This promotional deck of cards add 12 new cards representing movies. The Maestro can draw and Air Draw one of these cards, like any other card of the base game.

name: Scene It?: 007 Super Game Pack
description:
Add Bond clips, trivia cards and tokens to any Scene It? game OR play as a stand alone game!

Contains DVD and Trivia Cards from original James Bond game.

The official Bond trivia game with real movie clips!

Hosted by John Cleese!

Enter the amazing world of 007 with the James Bond Super Game Pack. It's a great add-on to any full Scene It? game.

Meet Bond, James Bond. Experience his incredible adventure. . . get close to his beautiful women . . . discover his lethal gadgets. . . and challenge your family and friends to answer Top Secret trivia about the world's most remarkable secret agent.

From the novice spy to the Bond aficionado, the Super Game Pack has the golden touch. Enjoy scenes packed with the best of 007 - for your eyes only. Any way you play, the James Bond Edition of Scene It? will leave you shaken and stirred.

—description from the box
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Counter Surge
description:
Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2020 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
The Counter Surge deck focuses on green and black energies.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: The Portable Wargame
description:
A set of simple miniatures wargame rules designed to be played quickly on a small board with a square or hex grid and using only a small number of figures. There are specific rules for two periods within the book: a nineteenth century 'Colonial' warfare set and a set for the first half of the twentieth century.
The book contains some mechanisms for playing the game solitaire and some designers' notes.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Turn Order: Random

name: Muse: Game Boy Geek Season 7 Kickstarter Promo Card
description:
Available from the Game Boy Geek Season 7 2019 Kickstarter.

New card to mix in with the base game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: 18NC
description:
18NC is an 18xx game about operating and investing in the historic railroad companies of North Carolina beginning in 1835 with the Wilmington and Raleigh Railroad being chartered (later to become Wilmington and Weldon).

Three to five players represent investors in these railroad companies attempting to increase their own net worth while avoiding the costly liabilities of a failing railroad. Careful manipulation of the State’s share ownership can be advantageous to avoid personal liability.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Market, Network and Route Building, Ownership, Stock Holding, Tile Placement, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Ninth Doctor & Companions
description: This expansion adds the Ninth Doctor and some of his companions to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes five miniatures, five faction cards, and seven new adventure cards to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Titan Dice: The Fires of Olympus
description:
From the publisher:

This expansion allows a 5th player to join any game of Titan Dice.

Components:
1 Player Board
5 Creature Cards
5 Creature Markers
6 Titan Dice
1 Player Aids/Attack Cards
2 Wound Markers

Requires Titan Dice to play.
categories: Ancient, Animals, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology

name: Shadowrun: Sprawl Ops – Dice Tower Kickstarter 2019 Promo Cards
description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes 2 promo cards:
Loaded Dice - set any one die to any result after rolling
Break in on the 42nd Floor
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: Call to Adventure: Name of the Wind – Friends & Mentors Kickstarter Exclusive Card Pack
description: Kickstarter backers also received the "Path of the Adem" cards (Warrior, Lethani, and Wise Master).
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Cosmic: The Iliad
description:
Cosmic: The Iliad is a strategic dexterity game which will launch you into the depths of space, to conquest for galactic domination. Only the best use of strategy and skill will push you to victory. Yet victory may become obsolete, when confronted with the creatures that lurk in the abyss.

The game has a campaign mode and a skirmish mode.Players build fleets of ships and eliminate enemy ships. The campaign mode consists of 3-5 individual battles, between which players can upgrade their ships, purchase captains and ships, or purchase space for a larger fleet. Each battle is in a different environment, some filled with asteroids, others with beasts roaming around the map.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Flicking, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Socks
description:
Socks is a card game that is simple to start, yet challenging to master. It can be played with other people, or by oneself, competitively or cooperatively.

In Socks, each card contains 1-6 socks in fixed positions (six positions, in every sock is in different color).

All players compete simultaneously and try to claim "match" of cards in a single pass through the deck. A "match" consists of a set of three cards where all the socks are paired up.

Lay out twelve Socks cards, face up. Whoever spots a match first, says "Match!" and lets the other players check. If the three cards have all the socks in them paired up, then the spotter gets a point. If some of the socks are not paired up, then the spotter loses a point.

If all the players agree that there isn't a match on the table, lay out three more cards face up.

Continue playing until the deck runs out.

Whoever has the most points wins!

—description from the designer

name: Infludance classic
description: You are trying to get your animal across the game board. However, the only rule is applied: Don´t go forwards! If you jump into the next puddle, you will splash the other animals. Sometimes you will splash yourself which is the right way to reach the target. You will learn to identify the animal footprints in this Indian detective game. Whose footprints are on the board and which direction do they keep?

name: Rush M.D.: Essen 2019 Promocard
description:
A New patient that was given for free at Spiel 2019 in Essen.

It's a red patient that requires an operation and needs as well a kidney, heart, bone and lung. She will grant you 2 VP when you succeed.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Medical, Real-time
mechanics: Action Timer, Cooperative Game, Real-Time, Worker Placement

name: Settlers of Catan Scenario: The Volcano
description:
Brave the hazards of the Volcano's fury to fill your coffers with gold!

The Volcano tile replaces the Desert tile and during the game the volcano may erupt! When it does, settlers who are unfortunate enough to be in the path of the lava will be swept away!

During setup, a number is placed on the Volcano (it cannot be 7). When the number on the token that was placed on the Volcano is rolled, the Volcano erupts!

Special Rules
Setup
During the initial construction turns, no player may place either of his two starting settlements on an intersection that borders the Volcano.

The Volcano
When the Volcano erupts, roll a die to determine the direction the lava will flow. One of the six intersections on the Volcano tile will be affected. If there is a settlement on the selected intersection, it is destroyed!

Remove it from the board (its owner may rebuild it later). If a city is located there, it is reduced to a settlement! Replace the city with a settlement of its owner's color. If he has no settlements remaining, it is destroyed instead.

The presence of the Robber on the Volcano hex does not prevent the Volcano from erupting.

Gold Variant
Important: This is an optional rule. All players must agree to this rule if it is to be used.

Volcanoes tend to be rich in valuable minerals such as gold or gems. If the players desire, the Volcano can produce resources when its number is rolled.

This "gold" is distributed in the same manner as the Gold River hex in the Seafarers expansion: Each settlement that is adjacent to the Volcano when it erupts may produce any one of the five resources it's owner desires.

Each city adjacent to the Volcano may produce any two resources. This resource production is taken before the results of the volcano eruption are resolved. Note that while the Robber can not prevent the Volcano from erupting, he does prevent any player from producing resources from the Volcano hex if he has been placed there.

-Playing with the Seafarers Expansion
When playing the Volcano scenario with the seafarers expansion, the Volcano tile can replace any desert or sea tile that all players agree on. The only restriction is that whichever tile is replaced by the Volcano must be adjacent to at least two other resource-producing land tiles.

-Krakatoa Variant
This variant is for use only with the Seafarers expansion. For this variant, form an island from three Volcano tiles. Place resource number tokens 4, 5, and 6 one on each Volcano.

This variant should only be used with the Gold Variant described above.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Metro Lines
description:
Metro Lines is a 1 to 2 player tile placement game where you or "you and your opponent" are city transit planners and your job is to create the longest metro line route from station to station across the city.

GAME PLAY - SOLO PLAY
The object of the game is to play all sixteen cards to create a continuous visible Metro line route using all the cards and having each station color used at least twice. The game consists of 16 turns with each turn representing "one card being played". The game ends when the last card is placed on the table.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, City Building, Print & Play

name: Oom-Pah!
description:
Oom-Pah is a competitive speed game that combines Klondike Solitaire style columns, with snap style 'first in best dressed', with music theory.

You get a deck of cards with notes on them. You put four of them in front of you, as your 'Arrange Columns'. You put aside 8 of them as your 'Score Stack'. Finally, the remainder are placed next to your columns as your 'Impro Stack'. You draw from your Impro Stack in groups of 3 cards like Draw 3 in Klondike Solitaire. When there is a card in your Impro Stack or Score Stack that is the card under one of the ones on the top of your columns (like E is to F), then you can place the card there. Alternatively, if one of your cards in your Arrange Columns, Score Stack or Impro Stack is the next note in the Chord/Interval/Progression/Scale that you're playing with in the joint Compose Stacks, (like C is to A if you were playing Am (A-C-E)), then you can place it in the Compose Stack. It is not turn based - you work as quickly as you can, meaning that the faster player can place their card before the other. When a player empties their score stack, they yell 'Oom-Pah!' and get 10 points. Then each player gets points per the amount of cards that they played to the Score stack.

The game comes with 10 templates which have on them musical theory bits like Scales, Intervals and Chords. You can choose from any of them to play with, depending on the level of difficulty required, or what the players are trying to reinforce. So, for instance, you could play G Major, and require that players build G-A-B-C-D-E-F# in the score stack.

The game also comes with beginner, intermediate and expert rules which allow tailoring the experience.

From the publisher
Oom-Pah! For music nerds & legends… or those who wanna be! An addictive, fast-paced, brainfrying music theory card game that cleverly sneaks music knowledge into your brain!
For 1-4 players, think classic card games like Speed/Spit (if challenging friends), or Patience/Solitaire (if playing solo), but instead you build musical sequences!
Oom-Pah!'s unique colour-coded learning tools help you understand music concepts systematically. So whether you're an absolute beginner or musical maestro, you can compete at a level playing field.
With over 1,700 different game options to choose from you’ll always be engaged, entertained, & highly entertained! Other than making you really smart and an awesome musician, the best thing about playing this game is the thrill of shouting “Oom-Pah!” when you win!

—description from the publisher

name: Munchkin Pathfinder: Hero Pack
description:
We added 12 new cards to the third printing of Munchkin Pathfinder Deluxe. These cards are illustrated by Lar deSouza, and bring the 12 iconic heroes from the 2018 Pathfinder Playtest Set into Munchkin Pathfinder.

We know lots of you already have Munchkin Pathfinder, so we've made these cards available separately.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Lanterns Dice: The Legendary Lakes
description:
Contained in Level Up Loot 2.

A new pad of 4 differents lakes

you can use this new pad of scoresheets instead of the standard pad.
The new pad has multiples lake arrangements (labeled 1,2,3,4) and each lake has multiple turn bonus sequences (labeled A,B,C,D).

Make sure that all players are given the same number scoresheet but with different letters.

name: Unternehmen Rösselsprung: Caccia a Tito – Drvar 1944
description:
"Unternehmen Rösselsprung: Caccia a Tito - Drvar 1944" is a tactical wargame which simulates the operation Rösselsprung (Knight's Move), codename for the avio operation acted by 500th SS Para Battalion to chase Marshal Tito in May 1944.
Each point is 40-50 men and each turn is about 2 hours each.

This wargame was sent as a gift to the subscribers of the wargame magazine "Para Bellum".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control
publishers: Acies Edizioni, Banana Games, Lumaca Games

name: Ninja Squad: Madoushi
description:
The Madoushi miniature is a substitute option for any Ninja at the start of the PvP Dawn Escape game. It was originally offered as a reward for certain backers of the Dized Kickstarter campaign in December 2018.
Madoushi has disguised himself as a Ninja in the Midnight Raid and now shows his true self to use his magi and steal the glory.

House Rules – who gets to play him (First or last Ninja on the Roof in the Midnight Raid etc.):
Simply replace your Ninja Miniature with the Madoushi miniature and swap your 3 Wana Tokens with the 3 Magic Cards.
Like the Wana Tokens, the Magic cards are single use and each should be discarded once used.

Magic Cards:

Yadoku (Poison Dart): Causes target to double up in pain and fall back to their last location.
Makaze (Evil Wind): Opponent is lifted high into the air and moved by the Madoushi two tiles in any direction.
Kyūketsu (Blood Leech): A vile flying leech conjured by the Madoushi will always find its target, even if in cover or not in line of sight. Effect: Knock-back (1 tile)


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Network and Route Building, Take That

name: The Edge: Dawnfall – Rha'zack Destiny Titan Resin
description:
Huge, resin miniature together with expansion. Not meant for PvP games, only for Solo play!

Product Description:
Important!
These bossess are NOT the same as bosses from the plastic expansion - they are not meant to be playable in PvP mode. The models are also bigger in scale - the same ones as in the first Edge print.

Highest Quality resin
Huge sculpt (up to 15 cm high!)
Perfect for collectors
Comes unpainted and un-assembled
Brings additional solo gameplay

INCLUDES:
High Quality resin miniature
5 AI cards
2 additional scenario
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Mum-Mum Margaret: Bronze Leaf
description: Mum-Mum Margaret: Bronze Leaf is a two-player game that is semi-handmade by a team of artisans. Each player takes turns to draw colorful petals and place them onto a spot with the same symbol. If you follow a certain order to put petals, you can place multiple of them in one turn for more points. Billy the honey bee will fly around each turn from a flower to another. Placing a petal onto the spot where he is stopped will activate special effect(s) depending on the definition of the flower he is stopping. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Tilly's Very Bad Day: Fast Play Rules for the 30 Years War
description:
Recently Brett Simpson pointed me at a simple set of rules for the English Civil War called Rupert's Very Bad Day: Battle of Marston Moor (1644 AD): Fast Play Rules for Students by Matt Fritz. Rupert's Very Bad Day relies on lots of bases and base removal so isn't very friendly with my big bases and Thirty Years War units with both pike and shot on the same base. But I liked the simplicity, saw considerable potential, and really liked the name. So I immediately began writing a version that would suit my pike and shot for the Thirty Years War which are based on big bases (80mm x 40mm). My initial draft started very close to Matt Fritz's work, and I remain heavily indebted to him, howeverthe rules have evolved quite far from the original. The biggest similarity to the original rules is probably the name although even there "Rupert" became "Tilly". I have introduced more types of stand (light horse, pike+shot, rabble), single stand units (hence pike+shot), a new concept called "resolve" to replace stand removal, morale rules based on resolve, terrain including the option to allow infantry to "defend the hill", distances based on base width, a more complex interplay of shooting and charging to reflect different national and unit attitudes to these combat options, increase purpose for commanders, optional troop quality (superior, ordinary, inferior, rabble) and hence an optional point system, and probably other things. Despite these additions, and the complexity they bring, I think the rules still allow "fast play". Although I've got the Thirty Years War in mind "Tilly's Very Bad Day" should be applicable to the Eighty Years War and English Civil War.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Fences: Seasons
description:
Seasons is a nine-card expansion for Fences by Bearded Board Games. Each of the seasons alters the base game in a small way. Add one or more Seasons to tweak the game play and add replayability.

—description from the designer

name: Mortals
description:
Be the final survivor in this post-apocalyptic action game. On a dying planet, two teams battle the clock, stealing time from each other to live longer. It’s the final countdown! Who will prevail? Oh, and watch out for the Zombies!

Mortals is a fast-paced turn-based strategy game played with Blinks.
Each Blink (tile) starts with 60 seconds to live and players take turns stealing life from opponents tiles.

If a tile moves alone it goes into attack mode and with each move, it can steal life from opponents connected tile.
The attacking piece gains 5 seconds per connection.

An attacking tile will steal from every tile including its own team. Sacrificing one tile to prolong the life of others is a common tactic.

Turns proceed into all Blinks are dead.

As each Blink begins to die, each tile becomes a zombie and drains life from any connected tile.

The last surviving Blink is the winner.

This game is played with Blinks, the world's first smart tabletop game system.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Elapsed Real Time Ending, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: De Reuzendans
description:
De Reuzendans ("The Giants' Dance") is a family game for 2-5 players from the age of 8. The theme is the European tradition of the Giants of the Guilds.

Dendermonde, a Belgian city, is the proud owner of three Giants. These Giants are not only famous for their beautiful looks, but also because of their graceful dancing. Believe it or not but each giant is carried by a porter.

In this game you are a Giant and go around in the city of Dendermonde. At the famous squares you try to outclass the other Giants with your best dance. Each turn you play a card to make a 'move' and you can play cards to 'dance'.

Because every player had the same stack of cards, you can only win with a good timing of your moves, a bit of luck and you have to pick your battles, your dance battles.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Once Around, Track Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Set-up

name: Rock Paper Switch
description:
In this twist on the classic game of Rock, Paper, Scissors, it takes more than luck to overpower your opponents. Strategy is key as you move your rock, paper, and scissor pawns. Be the last player with at least one of each pawn and you win the game!

Each pawn moves in a specific direction on the board and - per tradition - rock captures scissors, scissors captures paper and paper captures rock.

—description from the back of the box

name: Hour of Need: Redemption
description:
A kickstarter exclusive pack included in the pledge levels.

This pack allows you to play as the 3 villains (Dowager, Punchline and Curtains) of the game as heroes including hero decks for them.

name: Billy Yank
description:
Billy Yank is a miniatures wargame ruleset for the American Civil War.
Designed for 20/25mm minis

Sequence of play:

Orders phase
Rally phase
Command phase
Action phase (charges, melees, maneuvers, stationary units fires...)
in motion units firing phase


Scale:
Base unit is the regiment (~400 men / ~20minis)
1 step (2.5cm) = ~50m
1 mini = ~20 men
1 game turn = 15 min

Published in French in Vae Victis magazine.

—user summary
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: 惑星たちの帰り道 (Planet Go Round)
description:
惑星たちの帰り道 (Wakusei Tachi no Kaeri Michi) (Planet Go Round) is a Japanese memory game.

"God of our universe has drunken oveeeer!?"
Each player is the god of other various universes.
Let's hand the planets around between players and get them back to their own solar-system!

An easy memory game, which children aged five can easily play. Designed for children, but adults can also play seriously.

Planet Go Round is an open memory game. As cards are turned up from the deck, all the players get to see them. Then the card is given to a player's hand. There are four cards in each of seven suites. If a player receives a duplicate card into their hand, the paradox damages the Universe. They pay a penalty chip to the person who gave them the card.

The player with the fewest chips at the end is the winner. So players are trying to distribute the cards to other players without drawing a penalty to themselves. This means they must remember what cards others are holding or have discarded.

There is a Challenge mode too, if a player can get all seven suites into their discards.

「私たちの宇宙の神様が酔いつぶれちゃった〜！？」
各プレイヤーは様々な別の世界の神様です。
みんなで橋渡しをして、惑星たちを太陽系にもどそう！

5歳からでも出来る、お手軽メモリーゲーム。
キッズ向け、でも大人も本気で遊べます！
メカニズムとしては各プレイヤーの手札と捨て札を暗記しながら、7種各4枚あるカードを重複しないように渡していく全公開の暗記ゲームです。
publisher's summary

Easy instruction of the rules:
Each player draw a card from deck in his turn. The player should reveal this newly drawn card to all other players. Then the player must give this card to any other player.
If that player already has same card of given in his hand...
... a paradox happens and his universe explodes!
Then the player who gave that card gains meteor token.
When the meteor token in the token pool runs out, the game ends and the player who has the fewest tokens wins!

However, what you can do when there is no one safe to give it to? Indeed! If you suspect every player already has same card which you have to give, you can discard it instead of giving. Additionally, a player can hold only two cards in his hand, therefore, when a player who already holds two cards is given a card, he must discard the oldest card. For this reason, surely you will be confused if the card you saw before has been discarded, or not...!

Additionally, you can perform a 'challenge!' before draw a card. When you try a 'challenge', check a player's discard pile. If all 7 suits are included in the discard pile, you pass the test, and you can return a meteor token back to token pool. Do your best to memorize each players' hands and discarded cards!

Background Story:
This universe is in danger! Specifically, it explodes!

One day, the Gods have come to hold a party. The guests of honor of this party are the planets that the gods brought up under their own care. So, the party became lively! It was good so far, but ...

The god of solar-system, your universe, has drunk too much and fallen asleep. Oh my gosh, good heavens, the planets cannot get back to their proper places without their god. Under this situation... you are the gods of other universes.

Please, players must co-operate, and let the planets go back to their solar-system by handing over the right planets among the players. But beware, if a god bears same two planets at a time, a paradox happens, and one of universes explodes, the planet becoming a meteor. So, which god performs best in this accident?
user summary

name: Red Hatchets and Black Powder: A Fistful of Lead – Horse & Musket Supplement for the French & Indian War
description:
Red Hatchets & Black Powder allows you to play a small scale wargame in the woods and wilds of North America during the French and Indian War.
You'll take on the role of a Captain or War Leader, either leading a troop of brave soldiers, stalwart Rangers, terrified militia or stealthy Natives.Red Hatchets & Black Powder is supplement to Fistful of Lead: Horse & Musket, and is not a stand alone game. You will need a copy of Fistful of Lead: Horse & Musket to play.
Included are 10 scenarios, special rules for the French and Indian War, as well as rules for building your forces.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Indian Wars, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Play the Italian Wars of Independence
description:
Play the Italian wars of Indipendence

Project made possible by the great and beautiful collection of Gianpaolo Bistulfi, who in many years of modelling career has personally painted thousands of toy soldiers. Now these soldiers will be at your disposal to obtain, with little effort, entire armies of battalions of infantry, squadrons of cavalry, batteries of cannons, houses and buildings, trees and much more material needed to create the scenes of your battle. We also explain tricks and modes for a good assembly of the pieces, as well as the official rules for playing wargame. All in 50 pages full of hundreds of soldiers supplied in the standard scale of 25/28mm that you can, for personal use only, photocopy on thicker cardboard and thus get armed with the desired size. So what are you waiting for? Wear the general commander’s shoulder pads, equip yourself with a capable table, a practical ruler to measure, a pair of dice and get ready to lead hundreds or thousands of armed in epic and exciting battles of history!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Warfighter: Modern PMC Expansion #46 – And More Money!
description:
Adds 56 cards to your PMC core game! Includes a little bit of everything from PMC Soldiers to Action cards!

-description from publisher
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: 1815: The Hundred Days – Six Wargame Scenarios for General d'Armee
description:
1815, The Hundred Days is a scenario supplement for General d’Armee penned by game designer Dave Brown. Here Dave provides us with six iconic actions from the Waterloo campaign, including The battle for Gilly, Quatre Bras, the fight for St Amand at Ligny, the attack on Mont St Jean at Waterloo, the Prussian attack on Plancenoit and the final last ditch attempt by the Imperial Guard to sweep Wellington off the ridge at Waterloo.

This 45 page PDF contains an illustrated historical introduction to the campaign followed by six scenarios which are easily printed out for the game you wish to play and contain complete army lists with unit and commander ratings as well as deployment notes and a breakdown of the terrain.

If you are looking to game this iconic campaign then look no further.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Gloomhaven: Return of the Lost Cabal (Promo Scenario)
description:
This is a digital, single-scenario promo item for Gloomhaven.

The scenario was made available as a reward for backing the Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast Kickstarter 2019 campaign.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: The Singular Obsession of Heinrich Wilhelm Ernst
description:
You are Heinrich Wilhelm Ernst, aspiring composer and violin virtuoso. You live in the shadow of your idol, the legendary Niccolo Paganini. To gain the respect of your hero and cultivate an audience for your own work, you have taken it upon yourself to follow Paganini as he tours across Europe, attending his performances and renting adjacent rooms in the boarding houses where he stays with an ear to the wall to eavesdrop on his infrequent rehearsals.

Follow Paganini from city to city. If Ernst can uncover every excerpt of Pagani's piece before the tour's end, you win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rate of Fire: AFV Supplement
description:
Rate of Fire AFV Supplement is an expansion for the Rate of Fire

This 48 page book covers tanks, soft vehicles, halftracks, SP guns, artillery, anti tank as well as infantry guns and weapons.

New rules cover:

vehicle hit locations,
specific crew positions and survival roles,
special ammunition types,
HE and small arms against soft targets as well as
artillery against AFV’s.


Inside you will find over 500 separate vehicle data sets for

German,
US,
British & Commonwealth,
Japanese,
Russian,
Polish and
Italian forces.


Each vehicle has details of its main and secondary weapons, front and sides/rear armour factors for hull and turret, three speed brackets, crew numbers, positions and tasks as well as special notes and equipment.

This Rate of Fire AFV supplement has plenty of information that can be used with other WWII games but it is not a complete set of rules on its own. You’ll need a copy of the main Rate of Fire WWII Skirmish Rules to gain the most from this supplement.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Big Bad Fables
description:
Big Bad Fables is a fairy tale themed deckbuilding game intended for new players to the genre. There are 4 variations of the game, 3 competitive that slowly introduce players to deckbuilding mechanics and 1 cooperative version that can be played solo.

Your goal is to build straw, wood, or brick houses to earn victory points. The game has two currencies; Cheese for persuading fable characters to your side, and Hammers for building houses.

In advanced gameplay, specific card combinations can earn you bonuses called Story Actions. Throw in an occasional explosion of Fairy Godmother magic that turns the mechanics on it's head and Big Bad Fables has something for novice and seasoned players alike.

Game time runs 30 to 60 minutes depending on variation played.

—description from the designer

name: The Lost Worlds of Josh Kirby: Space Opera
description:
This addition to The Lost Worlds of Josh Kirby expands your game into an epic space opera with a legacy-style campaign mode. As you save or conquer worlds, you'll permanently change sectors of the galaxy using your faction stickers — unlocking special powers that stay between games.

Do you have what it takes to make your mark on the galaxy?

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Legacy Game, Variable Set-up

name: City of Ruins
description:
City of Ruins is a solo game playable with ordinary playing cards, together with three dice and a token, usually a pawn. Black cards represent rooms, which are added one at a time using special "docking" requirements. Red cards represent either treasures or monsters: even-numbered cards are treasures and odd-numbered cards are monsters.

In addition, rooms, treasures and monsters are classified as either Physical or Psychic. Clubs and Hearts are Physical, while Spades and Diamonds are Psychic. Two of the dice are used as point trackers for Physical and Psychic attributes.

To win the game you must explore each room and defeat each monster without running out of either attribute.

Each card has a description given in the Card Guide. Here are examples to give an idea of the flavor:

"4: Room of Eerie Whistling: The walls are covered in what looks like ancient paper wasp nests. Wind blows out of the holes in keening chords."
