Features 10 action packed scenarios from 1823-1849 covering the fighting in the Punjab and Afghanistan.

Naushera, March 14, 1823 The Afghans attempt to retake Peshawar
Jamrud, April 30, 1837 Last fight of the “Murat of the Sikh Army"
Mudki, December 18, 1845 The Sikhs’ surprise attack on the British Army
Ferozeshah, December 21, 1845 The attack of General Gilbert’s Division
Cornes’ Convoy, January 21, 1846 Quartermaster Cornes & 30 men vs. 1,000 Sikhs
Aliwal, January 28, 1846 General Harry Smith’s “Perfect Battle”
Sobraon, February 10, 1846 End of the Akalis (the Sikh Holy Warriors)
Kineyree, June 18, 1848 “No Englishman can be beaten on the 18th of June” Lt. Herbert Edwardes. C-in-C, Allied Army of Pashtuns, Daudputras and Sikhs
Sudoosam, July 1, 1848 The rebel Mulraj’s last hope for victory
Multan, January 2, 1849 Into the breach with 1st Bombay Fusiliers a.k.a. “the Bombay Toughs”


The scenarios are organized to be played with The Sword and the Flame, but can be easily adapted to any rule set.

Other Sections Include:

Campaign Histories
Detailed Uniform Information
Bibliography
Campaign Rules
Campaign Map

name: Mind Bullets: Psionics for Five Parsecs from Home
description:
This expansion pack offers Psionic powers to Five Parsecs players, letting you add a psionic crew member to your squad, develop their powers and buy Psi-related items.

Also includes notes on risk factors and suggestions for using AI Psionics (though this is still optional at the time)

A must for any player wanting to expand their Five Parsecs experience.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Nuts N Guts
description:
Nuts N Guts is a highly entertaining & aggressive casual variation of poker made with original deck of cards combining both hand cards and wild cards. Nuts N Guts was originally invented to spice up a group of friends's weekly poker nights when crazy side bets were just not enough.

Components - Total 83 cards: 63 hand cards, 20 wild cards

BEFORE THE GAME

Decide the Ante
Decide on the betting levels
Decide the Forced bet amount
Decide how Nuts N Guts joker card is played

HAND CARDS

Hand cards are the actual cards you play with to win the game. The deck contains 63 cards ranked from High Card to Royal Flush.

WILD CARDS

Wild cards are the key in Nuts N Guts. they can change the game play completely, so make sure to use them wisely. The Deck contains 20 wilds cards. The Deck contains 14 attack cards, 2 advantage cards and 2 jokers.

ATTACK CARDS

Mind Reader - 2 cards
Forces a specific player to show you (ONLY) a single card from his deck. Note which card he chooses to show you and think about what is not showing. Slide the card face down, also return it face down.

Forced Bet - 2 cards
Forces a player to make a bet in your behalf from his stack. Forced bet limit needs to be decided pre-game.

Trash Talk - 2 cards
Forces a player to replace his deck card mid game, changing his game plan. He must draw a new deck from the reserve cards. Use wisely, since it can improve your opponent’s hand.

Switch - 2 cards
Forces deck switch with a specific player. Use card carefully and only if

Bare Naked - 2 cards
Forces a player to play with his cards open the remaining of the game, allowing other players to bluff him with weaker hands. The bare naked player has the challenge to detect the bluff or fold.

Shark Attack - 2 cards
Forces a specific player to fold his hand. Make sure you can identify the strongest hand to use it against.

ADVANTAGE CARDS

Lucky Draw - 2 cards
Allows a player to draw two cards from the deck, increasing his chance to get a strong hand.

DEFENSIVE CARDS

Poker Face - 4 cards
Card has the ability to stand against any attack card. Nothing can touch you.

Joker Card

Nuts & Guts - 2 cards
Nuts N Guts wild card can be played in various modes depending how wild you wish to get.
We recommend using it as a substitute for any wild card.
As an alternative you can play with it as a hand card and position it anywhere between any hand level.
Or just be creative and invent your own rules for it.

GAME PLAY

-Each player places an ante. The size of the ante should be decided in advance
-The dealer shuffles the deck and deal each player 2 cards face down, one card at a time.
-First round of betting take place. Like normal poker each player can check, call raise or re-raise.
-If you have a wild card, you should use it prior to your bet.
-After the first round of betting is over and starting with the first player, each player select if he wishes to draw and replace one of his cards.
-If a wild card is used in the first round, a player is eligible to get an additional card from the deck.
-If two wild cards were used in the first round, player is eligible to get only one additional card before the second round.
-If used, lucky draw card allows to draw two cards from the deck.
-Second round of betting takes place. Like normal poker each player can check, call raise or re-raise.
-Wild card can be used at any stage of the second round, but prior to any bet, call or reraise.
-Showdown - remaining players left get to show their cards. Highest ranked hand wins the pot.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Command Cards, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Marvel Battlebooks: Spidergirl
description:
Two cards were bound into the comic book. One listed the rules and identified the features of the game. The second card was the character's Maneuver Card which listed the actions the character could take in combat.

Gameplay was similar to Lost Worlds. Each player picks a character and game books are exchanged so each player has a book that depicts POV illustrations of the opponent attacking. Maneuvers are simultaneously selected and the matrix encoded into the books determines the results of each exchange.

Spidergirl was #12 in the series.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel Battlebooks: Elektra
description:
Two cards were bound into the comic book. One listed the rules and identified the features of the game. The second card was the character's Maneuver Card which listed the actions the character could take in combat.

Gameplay was similar to Lost Worlds. Each player picks a character and game books are exchanged so each player has a book that depicts POV illustrations of the opponent attacking. Maneuvers are simultaneously selected and the matrix encoded into the books determines the results of each exchange.

Elektra was #2 in the series.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Fly or Not
description:
Can a bird fly? What about a bird tied with chains?? Or a bird tied with chains, with a jet-pack on its back, trapped in a cage which has balloon on top of it???

Fly or Not is an action/dexterity game in which players need to act quickly to grab the right answer to the question "whether the subject is flying or not?" from the table before anyone else can. On each turn players:

Reveal a card; each round a card reveals which shows an animal that may fly or not!
Roll dice; roll 1-3 dice based on the difficulty level which will affect the result.
Grab the answer; if the result of "card+dice" flies, grab the "fly" marker (blue). If not, grab "not fly" marker (orange).
Score points; Players may gain or lose points based on the marker they grabbed.


The first player to achieve a certain number of points (based on the number of players) wins!

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Real-time

name: Battlespace: Navy SEALs Expansion
description:
Battlespace: Navy SEALs expansion takes your fireteam on a manhunt from one dangerous place to another.
With each successful mission the team is closer to confronting the warlord of the Umbato militia in the war torn country of Mogona.
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Psychic Awakening – Saga of the Beast
description:
Book 6 of the Psychic Awakening Series

When the Great Rift tore open across the galaxy, the Orks saw it as a conduit to even greater conflicts and battles. Ghazghkull’s Great Waaagh! rapidly grew in size and strength with each fresh conquest as the greenskins instinctively mustered for war. The Grand Warlord’s hordes were further swollen as the visions of Ork Weirdboyz compelled their warbands to join the Great Waaagh from light years away.

Meanwhile, the Rune Priests of the Space Wolves received visions of their own, foretelling the unification of the greenskin race. Determined to intercede before such an eventuality could befall the Imperium, Logan Grimnar took decisive action, sending his Great Companies across the Sea of Stars in a bid to defeat the Orks before they became unstoppable and finally rid the galaxy of the threat Ghazghkull posed.

In the sixth instalment of the Psychic Awakening, you'll read how the Space Wolves engaged the Orks wherever they could be found – and what happened when Ragnar Blackmane tracked Ghazghkull to his base of operations on Krongar. Meanwhile, a vast set of rules expansions enhance your armies of Space Wolves and Orks with name generators, updated datasheets and much more besides.

Inside this 80-page book, you'll find:

Riveting background that reveals the sheer magnitude of the gathering Ork threat
Missions that allow you to recreate some of the most pivotal battles that took place when Wolf met Beast
Expanded army rules for the Space Wolves – including the deadly new Primaris version of Ragnar Blackmane
Expanded army rules for the Orks – including the new datasheet for Ghazghkull Thraka (who is not just back, but more powerful than ever!) and his plucky grot banner bearer, Makari


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Psychic Awakening – Engine War
description:
Book 7 of the Psychic Awakening series

The epic Psychic Awakening series continues with Engine War. This campaign book features a host of new rules for the Adeptus Mechanicus, Imperial Knights, Chaos Knight and Chaos Daemons. The campaign book also tells a sweeping narrative detailing the impact of the Great Rift on Mars, and how the Adeptus Mechanicus' power and sway began to wane in its wake. This resulted in Mars taking action and launching numerous Reclamation Fleets, to once again be at the forefront of power within the Imperium.

Inside this 104-page book, you'll find:

Exciting background information on the immediate aftermath of the formation of the Great Rift and the events that transpired on the once-loyal forge world of Ordex-Thaag – now controlled by roving packs of savage Chaos Knights – while fell technology was developed beneath the surface to tear down the veil of reality
Missions that allow you to recreate some of the most pivotal battles during the conflict, and war zones that let you bring your battles to some of the most distinctive sites that were fought over
Theatre of War rule for Hazardous Fumaroles, representing the battlefields where nefarious forces operate beneath the ground, and even within the planet core itself
Expanded army rules for the Adeptus Mechanicus and Imperial Knights, including Warlord Traits, Stratagems, Relics, rules for creating your own Forge World Dogmas and Household Traditions as well as datasheets for brand-new Adeptus Mechanicus units
Also includes expanded army rules for the Chaos Knights and and Chaos Daemons, including Warlord Traits, Stratagems, Relics, rules for creating your own Household Bonds, as well as updated datasheets for a selection of Chaos Daemons units and even rules for fielding Exalted Greater Daemons!


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Psychic Awakening – War of the Spider
description:
Book 8 of the Psychic Awakening series

The epic Psychic Awakening series continues with War of the Spider. This campaign book features a host of new rules for Chaos Space Marines, Death Guard, Talons of the Emperor and Officio Assassinorum. It also includes background on the web that Fabius Bile spins around the devastated Cadian system as he is pursued by the Death Guard, Adeptus Custodes, Sisters of Silence and multiple teams of Assassins. Will they catch him, or will he escape to continue his twisted experiments?

Inside this 80-page hardback book you'll find:

Exciting background on how Fabius Bile brings his experiments to the already devastated worlds around the Cadian Gate. Meanwhile, the Death Guard hunt him, seeking to reclaim a mysterious artefact that he stole from them. In the midst of this, the Talons of the Emperor and agents of the Officio Assassinorum seek to end the Spider's reign of terror for once and for all.
Missions that allow you to recreate some of the most pivotal battles during the conflict, and war zones that let you bring your battles to some of the most distinctive sites that were fought over
Expanded army rules for Chaos Space Marines, Death Guard, Talons of the Emperor and Officio Assassinorum, including Warlord Traits, Stratagems and Relics
Includes a new datasheet for Fabius Bile


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Second Edition): Codex – Ultramarines
description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


Codex Ultramarines contains History of the Ultramarines Chapter in the Warhammer 40,000 Universe, the structure of the companies of the chapter, their special rules and army list. Also provides painting guides for models of the Ultramarines and many other generic Space Marine Chapters. This version was released at the time of the second edition of Warhammer 40,000.

Contributor's Description.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Moons and Stars
description:
Moons and Stars is a handmade strategy board game by an artist using wood, campfire-hardened clay, canvas, and stones from the shores of Lake Ontario. It is based on a game that exists in his book series. It resembles a rustic game made by strange beings from another imaginary world. It plays like a combination of stratego and chess while capturing the randomizing excitement of being dealt a hand of cards.

It begins when you roll all 16 of your 6-sided "ballit" game pieces, creating one of over 20,000 possible combinations. Gain victory by one of two paths: capturing all your opponent’s Moons and Stars, or reaching your opponent’s Treasure Stone. Use Paths, Safes, Pits, and Traps to change how Moons and Stars move around the board. Once the board is set, choose from a number of Deity Figurines that progress along notches in the board and unlock a variety of bonus abilities. The player with the best strategy wins.

-description from designer

name: Hollywood Producers
description:
A competitive deck-building and resource management game for 3-6 players in which those players take on the roles of new movie producers in Hollywood. They will be tasked with hiring performers and directors as well as sourcing the best scripts for their projects.

The game consists of six years, with each year containing four seasons (which are represented on the board, thus a full game moves around the board six times). During each season, play proceeds through three phases:


Progress films towards release (each film takes two years from launch to release). If the film reaches the final stage and is released, it will then be scored using the cards that make up the film (script, director and performers) as well as any other bonuses that have been applied. Dice will also be rolled, which may impact the final score.



Take actions. Primarily these will be used for gathering resources such as money, directors, performers and scripts. Other actions include trading with other players and playing special cards that provide bonuses.



Put films into production. Each film requires a script, director (whose genre matches that of the script) and a minimum of two performers (a maximum of four performers).


Points and additional advantages are generated when a film scores well with the audience, award ceremonies, critics or simply makes a lot of money. However, lower scores in any of those categories will be penalised.

After six years, the player with the most points is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Highest-Lowest Scoring

name: 1811: Albuera
description:
1811: Albuera simulates this battle in lavish historical details using the "Fix Bayonets!" tactical system. The map was carefully drawn based on multiple historical sources while the unit counters sport the colors of the uniforms that were worn by those combat units that day. Two decks of Leader cards help you determine the order of activation of each of the armies' formations. Fix Bayonets! is a system simulating combat at the battalion level between the armies of the Napoleonic Wars. The rules include an emphasis on Command and Control, a card driven initiative activation system and limit the use of informational markers. The combat resolution system differentiates between the effects of fire, infantry assaults and cavalry charges. While not overly difficult, learning the game can be a challenging but rewarding experience for all wargamers.

This is Volume I of the Fix Bayonets! system, simulating combat at the battalion level between the armies of the Napoleonic Wars. The rules include an emphasis on Command and Control, a card driven initiative activation system and limit the use of informational markers. The combat resolution system differentiates between the effects of fire, infantry assaults and cavalry charges. While not overly difficult, learning the game can be a challenging but rewarding experience for all wargamers.

Counters are (mostly) Batallion (infantry), regiment (Cavalry), battery (artillery) & Leaders
Game System "Fix Bayonets!"
Hexes are 100m

-description from designer
mechanics: Command Cards, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Simulation, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fifth Edition): Codex – Grey Knights
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fourth Edition): Codex – Tau Empire
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Armageddon
description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


User summary:
Codex: Armageddon is an expansion codex book for Warhammer 40,000 3rd Edition. The book details the planet of Armageddon and the epic battles which swept across it during the Third Armageddon War- one of the largest in the Imperium's history. The codex covers details of the planet and conflict as well as providing army lists for the forces involved. Notably This book also marks the appearance of the Ork Speed Freeks army list.

From the back cover:
Armageddon is a world torn apart by the largest Ork invasion in Imperial history. Inside you will find:

Four Army Lists: Four army list variants allow you to field a force of Ork Speed Freeks, Armageddon Steel Legion Imperial Guard, or Space Marines from the Black Templars and Salamanders Chapters.

Forces of Armageddon: A full-colour guide to the many forces battling for supremacy on Armageddon, as well as numerous examples of the ravaged battlefields being fought over.

The History of Armageddon: Full background and history of Armageddon, including detailed information on the mighty Ork horde of Warlord Ghazghkull and the Imperial forces opposing him.

ISBN: 1-84154-045-5
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Flames of War: Bagration – Soviet Forces on the Eastern Front 1944
description:
During the calm weeks leading up Operation Bagration, the Soviets had amassed their armies for the greatest offensive yet undertaken on the Eastern Front. Three years after the German invasion, the Red Army stands as battle-hardened troops, ready to finally push the fascist invaders out of Mother Russia! A screaming barrage of shells and rockets signals the beginning of Operation Bagration, and Soviet Rifle Corps charge forward to capture the fortress towns of Vitebsk, Orsha and Mogilov. The Red Army smashes through German Army Group Centre’s front line and then relentlessly advances westward across Byelorussia to threaten Minsk. The Red Army’s goes on the offensive all across the front, from Finland and Estonia in the north to Poland, Ukraine, Romania, and eventually across Hungary to lay siege to the city of Budapest.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Himo Ōji to Niito Hime
description:
The princess was hopelessly untidy. All her favourite things were lost in her messy room. She was a NEET with a bad personality and she got angry often. Although she was proposed many times, she refused to get married. One day the princess had an agreement with the king, her father, that should there be a prince who could find all her treasures scattered in her room, she would finally get married.

Kept Prince And NEET Princess is a Japanese Karuta style real-time dexterity tabletop game for 2-6 Players. It plays for around 10-20 mins. Roll the three dice, find the correct cards the fastest and collect enough cards to win the game. Make too many mistakes and you're out for good!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Memory, Party Game, Real-time

name: Legends of the Ancient World: Terrors of the Night
description:
Terrors of the Night includes three programmed adventures using Dark City Games' Legends of the Ancient World rule set. These rules provide gameplay very similar to that of Melee and Wizard from Metagaming. This adventure is compatible with those games as well.

Battles are fought with counters on a hex map that is included with the game.

—user summary

There is a new evil in Redpoint. Citizens disappear at an alarming rate. Every day, people from all walks of life report their missing loved ones, and the town watch suspects that they are being abducted. The watch has evidence to indict a notorious wizard of ill repute, but the watch lacks the resources to bring him in. This is where you come in...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: More River (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description: It is presumed that these 11 tiles were the base of the official river II expansion
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Million Dollars, But... The Game 80's Expansion Pack
description:
Million dollars, but... The game 80's expansion pack with 100 new cards to either play standalone, or combine with your core game to expand the fun. This totally radical expansion pack has 80's-tastic scenarios for like, a totally bitchin time!

Components:
75 new gold rule cards
25 new black trigger cards
1 game rules card for standalone play

name: War Games Through the Ages: Vol.4 1861-1945
description:
4th volume of "War Games Through the Ages", series of 4 volumes covering wargaming in different periods of history.

This volume begins with the American Civil War, up to the end of WW2 (but not WW1)
Offers some rules, wargaming suggestions as well as a look at the armies, wars, history and tactics of the period.
categories: American Civil War, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame, World War II
publishers: Stanley Paul & Co Ltd, The History of Wargaming Project

name: Trok
description:
Trok is a horror themed Living Card Game for two players, who pitch their armies against each other. Cards are either tangible (such as creatures) or intangible (such as spells or curses) and can be placed either in the attack area or the defence area of a player's layout, determining which of their stats will come into play. The goal is to reduce the opponent's life points from 20 to 0.

There are various expansion decks in addition to this base game.

name: We Shall Meet in Vienna: 1813 in Germany – The Spring Campaign to After the Armistice
description:
We shall meet in Vienna includes everything you need to begin recreating the two phases of the War of Liberation in Germany: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

During the passionate negotiations of the spring of 1813 between France and Austria, Napoleon would dismiss Metternich by declaring, We shall meet in Vienna! threatening to repeat the capture of the Austrian capital as he had done in 1805 and again in 1809.

Desperately short of cavalry, having just raised a new army of largely raw recruits, rallying around a cadre of survivors from the invasion of Russia, Napoleon took command of La Grande Armée in the spring of 1813 determined to turn back the coalition forces seeking to dismantle the French Empire.

We shall meet in Vienna offers nine scenarios covering The Spring Campaign and the period After the Armistice:

1st Möckern
Lützen
Bautzen
Großbeern – and a second scenario for Blankenfelde
Katzbach
Dresden
Hagelberg
1st Kulm


250 pages, The Wargaming Company’s largest Campaign Guide to-date.
Additionally, We shall meet in Vienna offers a late war uniform guide with over 1500 uniform plates, all in full color, covering every unit featured in the scenarios.

We shall meet in Vienna, 1813 in Germany is compatible with Et sans résultat! (both ESR Original Edition & ESR Second Edition), and nearly any other Napoleonic tabletop wargame. Orders of battle provide detail down to the battalion level and maps are offered in scale miles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Monopoly: Koers-Course
description:
Cycling, where heroism, passion and fighting spirit come together. Meandering roads through rolling landscapes, history, symbolism and solidarity among the fans make cycling probably the most beautiful sport.

Riders who suffer, looking for the finish line. Worn-out bodies on wretched cobblestones and slopes, weave their way between the rows of thick supporter mass towards eternal fame. That is cycling!

Monopoly Koers-Course is the ideal way to relive the most famous passages of your favourite spring classics. Just think of legendary duels on La Redoute, the marches on ‘De Muur’ or that one flat tyre at Carrefour de l’Arbre. Visit the Kwaremont square, go for a spin on the Vélodrome of Roubaix, climb the Poggio and get a victory bonus! This Monopoly edition brings you to all of the beauty that the spring races have to offer.

Monopoly Koers Course will be released in a limited edition of just 2000

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Trading

name: Naramata
description:
Set within the titular region within Okanagan Wine Country, in Naramata, the players assume the roles of tour bus operators ferrying visitors to the various wineries nuzzled within the ten-minute drive along the Naramata “Bench.”

Players will attempt to satisfy as many customers as they can through a day of operations, all the while earning prestige (equating currency), which can be spent to upgrade operations or influence the wineries throughout a tour route. Tourists are gratified through tastings, cheese, photos of the beautiful vistas, along with wine pairings and purchases.

THE GAME
Naramata is a medium-complexity board game involving point-to-point movement, set collection, time tracks, and variable player powers.

Players will move across a game board representing an exaggerated depiction of the Naramata region, stopping at wineries to complete various actions to satisfy the tourists attached to their vehicle.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Phoenix Command: Heavy Metal – Power Armor Sourcebook
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


HEAVY METAL is the complete sourcebook for Power Armor, and is fully compatible with both the Living Steel Adventure Game and the Phoenix Command Combat System. The capabilities of eleven different types of Power Armor from the Seven Worlds, the Starguild, and the Dragoncrests are described, as well as dozens of weapons and a set of special rules for tracking damage to Power Armor suit systems. Included are:- Power Armor Capabilities and Systems
- Special Power Armor Glancing, Hit Location, and Damage Rules
- Status Sheets for all 11 Power Armor Types
- Flechette, Slivergun, Gauss Gun, Lase, and Explosive Weapon Battlepacks
- Over Two Dozen Auxiliary Packs
- Neemis Enterprises' Templar Power Armor
- Unique Dragoncrest Equipment, Capabilities and Systems
- And full data for both Living Steel and Phoenix Command

HEAVY METAL enhances the firepower and survivability of all types of Power Armor, and makes an ideal companion to Living Steel and to High-Tech gaming using Phoenix Command.

-from the back of the book
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Phoenix Command: Advanced Rules for Small Arms Combat
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-toman skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


The Advanced Phoenix Command Supplement expands on the rules provided in the Phoenix Command Combat System, allowing players to handle a wide variety of special situations. Each section is modular, making it easy for players to use the appropriate rules, and to select the exact level of game detail desired. More than 20 different sections are included, among them:Blunt Trauma: When Body Armor stops a bullet, it only stops the penetration; it does not necessarily stop the severe bruising and possible broken bones which may result from the bullet's impact. The wounds caused by non-penetrating rounds, called Blunt Trauma, are fully discussed.

Smoke: A common factor on many battlefields, Smoke provides vital protection from the enemy during dashes across streets and open areas, towards hostile positions, and during retreats. The full effects of Smoke are explained including the duration of Smoke clouds generated by Smoke Grenades, the effects of wind on the cloud, and the partial visibility possible while the smoke clears.

Blind Fire: The standard response to enemy Smoke screens, Blind Fire (firing without being able to see the target) can also be vital in house-to-house fighting, when pinned by enemy fire, or providing harassing fire against unseen opponents.

Among the other sections included are: Ballistic Accuracy; Weapon Reliability and Weapon Damage; the Three Round Burst; Explosive Ammunition; Permanent Disabling Injuries; Effective Minimum Arc; Optical Scopes; Spotting; Cover Generation; Large Scale Battlefields; Leadership; Ground Burst Explosions; Mines and Traps; Time of Flight; Evasive Action; Recoil Recovery; Off Hand Fire; Free Actions; Skills; Training; and Experience.

-from the back of the book
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Flames of War: Bloody Omaha – Ace Campaign
description:
Bloody Omaha is the first in a series of Ace Campaigns, a narrative-driven system of Flames Of War battles.
Ace Campaigns are extremely flexible in allowing players to tailor their campaign to fit their playgroups needs.
There are three different modes that you can play the campaign in:

Story Mode,
Extended Mode, and
Aces Mode.


Story mode is your shortest campaign that only uses the Story and Reward cards, while Extended allows you to play longer campaigns by adding in side missions.
The Aces mode can be used with Story Mode or Extended Mode an allows players to create their own unique commander with special abilities that will give them an edge during the course of the campaign.

Contains 18 Story Cards, ten Side Mission Cards, 16 Ace Cards, 20 Reward Cards and one Ace Campaign Rule booklet.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Reimraupe
description:
Reimraupe is a German memo game with rhymes.
Reimraupe ist ein Memospiel mit Reimen.

name: Questeros
description:
Questeros is a fun, strategic, trick taking card game using a fantasy based 78 card tarot deck combined with elements of classic RPG gaming.

Players will have 10 cards each round, over a series of 10 rounds. Each round involves ten turns of each person playing a card. Each card has a value and a ranking, the highest ranking card will earn a "Quest."

At the beginning of each round each player must announce how many quests they expect to complete. If the correct number of Quests is achieved a player earns 100 Gold per Quest.

If a player earns too many or not enough Quests they will earn less gold, or have to pay gold.

The card ranks consist of four suits of cards numbered 1-14. The first card led in a turn becomes the Preferred Class,which other players must follow suit if they have one in their hand.
There are 22 Prestige cards which outrank all standard suits, and each has a unique ability that can influence the turn, the round, and even the game.

At the end of ten rounds of play, the player with the most Gold wins the game.

The deck is designed for the card game, but also has the divination properties of a Tarot deck. Guidelines for a Fate system will be provided for RPGs.

-description from designer

name: Why You Lying!: Duel
description:
Why You Lying! is a party game based on the classic Liar's Dice gameplay with some hilarious twists: legs and wings!

In this game, each player has a deck of 30 Animal cards consisting of 5 each of Cricket, Spider, Fish, Chicken, Rabbit, and the almighty Mascot Worker!
Players shuffle their deck and draw 5 hand cards at the beginning of each round. The start player will announce whether they will play with legs or wings in the current round by saying "I bet there are X (number of) Y (animals) with Z (amount of) legs (or wings) among all animals in all players' hand cards."
And players take turns to raise the bet by increasing X, Y (animals' hierarchy), or Z, OR they can call the previous player BLUFF!

Play smart with the information in your hand, and play cunning when you raise the bet. But beware, don't let the Mascot Workers fool you!

Why You Lying! Duel is a small box with 2 decks of cards for 2 players to enjoy. You can also combine it with the base game to have a epic 5-6 players bluffing war!

name: CyberStrategy
description:
CyberStrategy is an asymmetric, educational strategy board game in which 2 teams face each other: (1) a Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) tries to protect the bank's corporate network and its assets with security measures and (2) one or more hackers attack it trying to reveal the master password.

The CISO wins when he successfully fends off the attacks and reveals the identity of the hackers (all hackers lost all 3 identity tokens) or the hackers run out of bitcoin to fund their operation. In the other case, the hacker with the highest individual score (bitcoin) wins; which creates some healthy paranoia amongst the hackers.

The CISO starts with (at least) one defence card ("security measure") per type of attack and a starting budget in euro. Each hacker starts with 3 attacks of their choice, 3 identity tokens, and a starting money stack in bitcoin.

Each player also has a hidden goal for the game, which - when completed - gives them a leg up.

The game plays in 3 phases per round:

(1) the EVENT phase:
(a) the CISO receives his budgets (which depends on the number of hackers) and
(b) both CISO and hackers draw an event card (which is resolved as indicated on the card)

(2) the PLANNING phase:
(a) the CISO can spend budget to purchase additional security measures (= draw cards) and can deploy security measures (= ready cards)
(b) the hackers can learn additional attacks (= draw cards, up to a hand limit of 4) and can plan attacks
(3) the ATTACK phase:
(a) the hackers declare (joint or separate) attacks on the assets of the bank, starting with the assets at the outer rim of the corporate infrastructure (ATM, router,...) and pay for the attack (in bitcoins)
(b) the CISO then checks if they security measures they put in play are sufficient to block the attack
=> if the attack succeeded (defence value is lower than total attack value), the asset is hacked and the hackers receive a bitcoin reward for the successful attack
=> if the attack failed, the hacker leading the attack hands over 1 identity token to the CISO
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Events, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Renegade Scout 2: Bleeding Edge Retro Gaming
description:
Welcome to Renegade Scout.

What is Renegade Scout? Other than 206 pages jammed full of gaming goodness?

This is a set of science fiction miniatures rules aimed at not only recapturing the spirit and feel of old school science fiction gaming, but presenting it in an updated and improved form, combining familiar mechanics with the polish and elegance expected in a modern game.

Using this system, you can command everything from tentacle aliens to squads of futuristic troopers, tanks, walkers, dinosaurs and more. Rules include off-map support, supernatural powers and a host of strange terrain features and world conditions to fight among.

If you are looking to revive some of your favorite old miniatures, note that Renegade Scout is profile compatible with the two first editions of the most popular gothic scifi wargame, allowing troops and weapons to be used as is, but with sleeker and more elegant mechanics.

If you want a fully fledged space opera setting to dive into, you can explore the worlds of Unified Space, where a host of alien species battle for supremacy, from the blood-stained cyborg troops of the Converted to the proud K'Erin and mysterious Engineers.

If you want to just open the book and play, we include 8 Battle Scenarios ready to play with your own armies, as well as the Objective Battle letting you fight an unpredictable encounter with randomly generated objectives.
Scenario driven gaming more your speed? An array of tools and mechanics cover everything from radio communications to barricading doors.

The Army Builder allows you to construct a huge range of forces for any of the included troop types, for pick-up games using an army list and a fully fledged points system lets you build your own custom forces.

Want something a bit bigger? Why not start a Persistent Game where your troops gain experience from battle to battle. Perfect for campaigns or league play.

In short, almost whatever it is you are into and whatever scale of miniatures you enjoy, Renegade Scout has something for you.

Note that this is a fully updated 2nd edition of the rules, featuring much expanded content, material from several supplements, brand new options and far more pick-up-and-play possibilities than before.

If you are an experienced player, please enjoy this new edition generously funded by the fan base.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Word-O
description:
The Word-O box contains a set of 13 alpha dice, a sand timer and a dice cup.

On a turn a player rolls all the dice. Sets the timer and then tries to make the highest scoring "mini" crossword before the time runs out. Like scrabble, each letter is worth points related to how difficult it will be to use. Some of the die have a wild symbol on them that can be used for any letter (at zero points).

—user summary

name: Dragon Dice: White Dragons Expansion
description: White Dragons - White dragons are much tougher that normal dragons. They have double the health (10) and do twice as much damage. In other words, Claws do 12 points, Wings do 10 points, Tails do 6 (and reroll), Jaws do a whopping 24 points! Even the Treasure is twice as much, allowing 2 units to promote. However, there is a price for this; a white dragon replaces 2 normal dragons and takes twice as much magic to summon. So in a 36-health game, you could either bring 2 normal dragons or 1 white dragon. Any color dragon summoning spell can summon a white dragon, however, it takes 14 points of magic instead of 7. See the rules for more information.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Dragon Dice: Acolytes of Eldarim Expansion
description:
The mysterious Eldarim have begun to teach their singular elemental skills to a few chosen Acolytes, who have abandoned their species traditions to become a new species in Esfah. Your battles will be enhanced by using the powerful Dragonmasters and Dragonhunters, the single-element Acolytes of the Eldarim, and the protective Dragonkin whose elemental nature links them with the Eldarim.

This kicker pack contains Acolytes of Eldarim: 6 small 16mm Acolytes, 3 medium 18mm Acolytes, and 2 large 20mm Acolytes; in a random assortment of types and colors.

Champions of this species are sold separately.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Dragon Dice: Battle Chest Expansion
description:
As the generals of Esfah scramble for an edge in their battles, mystic items, each tied to one of the five elements of Esfah, emerge from treasure troves scattered throughout the land. Mighty weapons and shields, fleet footwear, and magical charms find the hands of those willing to wield them. Now you can harness the power of items and artifacts to assist your armies in their efforts to vanquish your foes.

Each Battle Chest contains a random assortment of 6 single-colored 4-sided items of 5 types and 5 colors in 3 different sizes. It also contains 2 single-colored 10-sided artifacts of 5 types and 5 colors.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Dragon Sets Expansion
description:
This is for all 6 color combinations of Hybrid and Ivory Hybrid dragons that match the options picked

Hybrid Dragons:
These dragons are hybrids of the elemental dragons. Composed of two elements, they have both elements in their very makeup. They generate breath against 5 health of the defending army and both elements of army breath effects against the army. However, the dragons are affected by both elements as well. A Dragon Summoning spell of either element will summon them to a terrain. Eldarim Champions that match either element can affect them normally. Dragon Staffs and Dragonkin Champions of either element also affect them normally. Dragonkin of either matching element cannot be rolled when attacked by an Hybrid dragon. Hybrid Dragons fight all dragons (except pure ivory dragons and ivory hybrids with a matching elemental) that do not match their elements exactly. Elemental and White dragons fight all Hybrid Dragons.

Ivory Hybrid Dragons:
These dragons are hybrids of the elemental dragons and an ivory dragon. Composed of one element and ivory, they have that element in their very makeup, plus all the attributes of the ivory dragons. They generate breath against 5 health of the defending army and the elemental army breath effect (if any) against the army. A Dragon Summoning spell of any element (reflecting their ivory nature) will summon them to a terrain. Eldarim Champions of a single element that matches the dragon’s elemental can affect them normally. White Eldarim Champions affect them normally. Dragon Staffs and Dragonkin Champions of the same element as the dragon also affect them normally. Just like pure ivory dragons, dragonkin cannot be rolled when attacked by an Ivory Hybrid dragon. Like the pure ivory dragons, once summoned to a terrain, no ivory Dragon Summoning spell can move them. However, a Dragon Summoning spell of their element can move them. Ivory hybrid dragons, like pure ivory dragons, always attack the army at the terrain. However, they are attacked by all hybrid dragons that do not have a matching element. Elemental dragons not matching the ivory hybrid dragon’s element and white dragons attack all ivory hybrid dragons.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Dragon Dice: Eldarim Expansion – Dragoncrusader / Dragonzealots
description:
Dragonzealots- These powerful warriors are strong enough to control the wild dragons. The Crusaders protect their armies with their mighty shields. Five colors-black, blue, gold, green, and red. This item is for a set of each of the five different colors, plus the white Dragoncrusader.

These are the champions of the Eldarim species. See the Acolytes of the Eldarim kicker for more information.

name: Dragon Dice: Eldarim Expansion – Dragonlord / Dragonmasters
description:
Dragonmasters - Dragonmasters are 4-health units that are part of the Eldarim species and come in five different colors, but are virtually identical to the Dragonlord. They have several advantages and disadvantages when compared to the Dragonlord. The Dragonmaster can only cast magic of the same color as itself. Dragonmasters can carry medallions and magical items matching their color. A Dragonmaster can tame dragons of the same color if it rolls its SFR Logo during the dragon attack. During the retreat step of a reserve movement, a Dragonmaster can "ride" a tamed dragon to any other terrain. A Dragonmaster's logo acts as a 2-point ID.

A Dragonlord can do all the same as a Dragonmaster, but it works on any color dragon (including white dragons). It can cast any color of magic. It's logo does nothing in a normal army roll.

These are the champions of the Eldarim species. See the Acolytes of the Eldarim kicker for more information

name: Dragon Dice: Eldarim Expansion – Dragonslayer/Dragonhunters
description:
Dragonhunters- These secretive warriors live to battle the evil dragons. Not just powerful fighters, the Hunters can protect the armies with which they seek glory. Five colors-black, blue, gold, green, and red. This item is for a set of each of the five different colors, plus the white Dragonslayer.

These are the champions of the Eldarim species. See the Acolytes of the Eldarim kicker for more information.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Dragon Dice: Medallion
description: Medallions- The mystic medallions are metallic magic items which can be carried by any unit. They provide powerful abilities to the army fortunate enough to hold one. Three alloys-gold, silver, and bronze.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Monopoly: Riverdale
description:
Welcome to MONOPOLY: Riverdale, a place where nothing is as it seems. Buy, sell and trade your way through the town from Pop’s Chock’lit Shoppe (home of milkshakes, meetings and murder) to the mysterious Sisters of Quiet Mercy (the mysterious locale with secrets all its own). Choose from custom sculpted tokens like Archie’s Guitar or Veronica’s Pearls, and show your inner Blossom trying to bankrupt your friends and win it all!

Includes
Custom Game Board
6 Custom tokens: Archies’s Guitar, Veronica’s Pearls, Betty’s Diary, Cheryl’s Spider Brooch, Jughead’s Hat, Pop’s Milkshake
Houses and Hotels
Community Chest and Chance cards
Custom Monopoly money
Rules

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Máxima Definición
description:
Máxima Definición is a free print and play board game, a simple game in which we will pretend to be playing a soccer game which has ended up tied, after extra time everything will be defined in the penalty shootout. Each player will intersperse roles as goalkeeper and as a player who kicks the penalty, they will have to choose carefully the different pieces to save and score ... who will win this match?

The game has a solitaire mode playing against an AI, the other mode is 2 players, but even more players can be played each pair with a copy of the game. Build your penalty tournaments and become the Maximum Definition champion.
The language independent game as the components only have icons.

—description from the designer

name: Airfix Presents Blood Red Skies: Battle of Britain
description:
Battle of Britain – Tactical Level Air Combat Tabletop Game for Two or More Players

Warlord Games’ fantastic new collaboration with Airfix marries the fantastically fluid Blood Red Skies gameplay with the exceptional 1:72 aircraft of the venerable model manufacturers.

Written by Andy Chambers, Blood Red Skies is a tabletop miniatures game where you take command of a force of fighter aircraft in battle. The emphasis in Blood Red Skies is on action and the game is fast-paced, with no pre-plotting or book-keeping required. A game of Blood Red Skies with two planes per side can be fought in twenty minutes or less.

The Airfix Presents Blood Red Skies box set comes complete with everything you need to get playing the game, and four aircraft: two Supermarine Spitfire Mk IIs and two Messerschmitt Bf109-Es, in 1:72 scale.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Permute
description:
Permute is an abstract strategy game inspired by the Rubik’s Cube. In Permute, two players take it in turns to twist 2x2 sets of pieces on the board, attempting to 'solve' together connected groups of their pieces. The player who builds the bigger solved group wins the game – but at any time, the opponent can step in and twist your groups apart again!

How to play:

Permute is played on a square board filled with orange and yellow playing pieces in an alternating checkerboard pattern. Orange always plays first. Players take it in turns to select a 2x2 area of the board, called a ‘face’, and twist the pieces within that area 90 degrees clockwise or counterclockwise, as if rotating the face of a 2x2 Rubik’s Cube. After twisting, the active player must flip over or ‘bandage’ one of her pieces in that face; bandaged pieces may not be part of any more twisting moves for the remainder of the game.

Over the course of the game, the accumulating bandaged pieces eventually make any further twists impossible; at that point, the game is over. Players then count up their largest connected ('solved') group of pieces of their colour; pieces only count as connected when they are horizontally or vertically adjacent. The player with the largest solved group of pieces wins the game. If the players are tied for the largest group, then the second-largest groups of each player are compared to determine the winner; if those are also tied, then the third-largest groups are compared; and so on.

Permute is a scalable game and can be played on any board size.
Playing on a 12x12 board is recommended for casual play, and a 16x16 board for deeper strategic contests. A typical game on a 12x12 board will last 40-50 turns; a 16x16 game will last 70-80 turns.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Fish Flip
description:
It’s finally the weekend! You and your friend head down to the stream to enjoy nature, catch some fish, and have a friendly competition. Players will be catching the six different species of fish, tactically flipping them in order to catch the fish in-between the same type of fish. The player who catches the most fish plus does the best on the bonus for the game is the winner!

In this two-player game players will be flipping fish in a stream which the goal of manipulating the stream so that larger fish of the same type surround smaller fish of a different type in order to catch them. Doing their best not to set up their opponent for the next turn.

Fish Flip is a very tactical competitive puzzle game that plays in about 20 minutes.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Enclosure, End Game Bonuses, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Building, Variable Set-up

name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition Gastronomie
description:
Awaken your taste buds with this new edition of the special Gastronomy Trivial Pursuit!
1800 questions and answers around the kitchen spread over all categories: Geography, Entertainment, History, Art & Literature, Science and Nature….
And surprises

Content: 1 board, 300 question-answer cards, 2 card boxes, 1 die, 6 pie charts, 36 colored marker triangles.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: 18CH: Chilean Railways
description:
18CH is a railroad-building and investment game set in the country of Chile, in South America. 18CH is a game in a series of loosely-related games collectively known as 18xx games, originated by Francis Tresham with 1829.

18CH features a government railroad — The Empresa de los Ferrocarriles del Estado Railway (EFE) — a long narrow map, and five small narrow-gauge railways called "nitrate corporations", which were built to connect the mines with these resources to major Chilean ports.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Captain Esperanza
description:
Captain Esperanza is a strategy boardgame based on draft mechanics.

Each player drafts 5 five cards and then compare with other player to progress and earn gold and treasures. That all will give influence point at the end of the game.

Once a player reach Calicut, the game end and the player with the most influence point win the game.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Stronghold: Undead (Second Edition) – Courage Cards
description:
Set of 12 Courage cards which rewards the Defender for keeping the Panic level low.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Silicon Saga: Wreck of the Andromeda
description:
Silicon Saga: Wreck of the Andromeda is a sci-fi dungeon crawl/exploration game set aboard the floating wreck of a space research station. Players take on the roles of members of a crew of space marauders looking to strip the station of valuable resources. Unfortunately, the station is not quite as abandoned as they had hoped. They will be faced with lurking dangers and struggling survivors. The goal of the game is to collect a determined amount of silicon from the ship and return to the hanger with the silicon before the game ends. There are variable play modes which allow players to compete against each other or to play cooperatively.

The game is played on square tiles with players drawing and placing tiles as they explore the ship. Players move and interact by playing cards. The game is broken into rounds with each player drawing a number of cards and performing a number of action during the round. Players take turns, performing actions one at a time. They have a chance to add new cards to their deck or hand each round or to gain additional actions.

While exploring the Andromeda, players will find resources such as crafting components, ammo, food and their true goal, silicon. They may also find survivors, dangerous threats or face random events. Interaction with survivors or threats are handled through a chit-pull system. Each player has a bag and a set of different markers, each with a different effect. Throughout the game, the cards they play will have them add markers to their bag to form a pool. When interacting with entities, they can play cards that let them draw markers from the pool in an attempt to cause different effects. Players may face hostile encounters or peaceful encounters. Each marker type has a different effect depending on the type of encounter.

In addition to interacting with entities encountered onboard, players can interact with one another. They can steal from or sabotage other players to take or force them drop any carried silicon.

Silicon Saga can be played by a group or by a single player. For solo play, the game can be played using the base game mode. The rules will also include additional solo player challenges.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Events, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Pieces as Map, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Operation Battleaxe
description:
August, 1941. Rommel has driven the Western Desert Force all the way across Cyrenica. But the Tiger Convey has just arrived bringing tanks, airplanes, ammunition and supplies. General Wavell now has what he need to drive the Germans back, and seize initiative on the North African front.

The Player who best executes combined arms stands the best chance - you need to integrate all aspects of the North African Desert Space. The game is played in alternating turns. Each players forces will be under double digits as this is tactical game that includes basics like Line of Sight, Elevation, Opportunity Fire, Indirect Fire and armor overruns!

Operation Battleaxe is the third of Dark City Game's Combat Boots series of tactical wargames. Each piece is a squad or section of infantry, an individual vehicle, gun, or aircraft. The scale of the board is 50 meters per hexagon, and each game turn covers only a few minutes.

name: Swingin' Shoes
description:
A Topsy-turvy, point wranglin' challenge!
Players take turns tossing horseshoes to try and ring them onto the suspended pole and platforms. Score a SITTER, a RINGER, or best of all, a HANGER, all while the whole thing swings more and more with every toss! Do you have the skill to score the most points and win?

name: Tutankhamun: A Pharaoh's Gift
description:
Mini-expansion promo for Tutankhamun. This pack features 5 new tiles that can be added to the base game. These tiles include 1 new artifact tile and 2 new gods, each with 2 tiles.

Included in the pack are 6 reference cards that explain the abilities.

Falcon Pectoral artifact tile - This is a single artifact tile that immediately scores two points. Deposit it in the tomb as usual when scored.

Set God Idol tiles (2) - Move up to 2 Artifact tiles from the Underworld to the end of the Nile next to the Tomb, extending the river.

Sekhmet God Idol tiles (2) - Swap an Artifact tile in your collection for any other Artifact tile in the Nile that has an equal or lesser point value printed on it.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Go monkey go
description:
Crazy climbing action game.
Wanna get funky?
Do the monkey!
Race your monkey up the tree!
Dump all your marbles into the trunk to win!

Every player starts with 5 coconuts, the first player to run out of coconuts wins. Use the ropes to make your monkey climb the palm tree and pour a coconut on top of the palm tree, the cononut will fall into a player tray at ramdom.

name: When Pigs Shall Fly
description:
Just before the days of aviation, human flight was a rumor- a whisper in the wind. Somewhere, someone was aiming for the clouds. Hoping to take advantage of these rumors and boost its image, your city is planning a contest: build a flying machine, and find someone foolish enough to fly it.

Now, you know a publicity stunt when you hear one, but the idea has intrigued you. You may be a humble farmer, but you have assets that others may not- a working knowledge of mechanics, determination, a hard work ethic, and… animals. Lots of animals. A grin slowly spreads on your face. “When pigs shall fly, they say,” you mutter to yourself. “Well then, let’s take to the skies!”

When Pigs Shall Fly is a family weight dice-drafting game in which players prepare for the city’s flight contest by researching the importance of the various theories of flight, designing a flying craft, training a pig to pilot their craft, and improving their craft’s materials to make it as light as possible. Along the way, they must also try to generate publicity and utilize the other farm animals to help them in their quest for aviation greatness. When the big day arrives, players will have a chance to see the fruits of their labor by flying their craft in the contest, and hopefully, become locally known as the farmer with their head in the clouds!

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Aviation / Flight, Dice, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Finale Ending, Line Drawing, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Sprinkle
description:
Sprinkle — a.k.a., このみしぐれ (pronounced "Konomishigure") is an area-control game from Japan themed on "forest creation". The Japanese title could be translated to mean "sprinkle of fruits and nuts", which is what you hear falling from trees in autumn.

You each take on the role of a different tree species and use three different actions — grow trees, move flying squirrels (to spread the seeds), and move the clouds (to sprinkle water) — to gain victory points in the photosynthesis phase, which takes place several times during the game. The victory points you gain depend not only on the number and size of the trees, but also on the weather in the area where the trees grow.

You can also plant trees in each area to gain the "evolutionary power" of that area. By using such power effectively, you can achieve more, such as increasing growth efficiency and generating more victory points.

•••

『このみしぐれ』は、「森林の形成」をテーマにしたエリアコントロールゲームです。
各プレイヤーは、それぞれ異なる《樹木》の種族となって、①樹木の成長、②ムササビの移動（種の散布）、③雲の移動（水の散布）の3つのアクションを使い分けながら、ゲーム中に何度か訪れる《光合成》フェイズで、より多くの勝利点を得ることを目指します。
プレイヤーたちが得られる勝利点は、樹木の数や大きさだけでなく、その樹木が生育する地域（区画）の《天気》によっても左右されます。
また、プレイヤーたちは、各地域にいくつかの樹木を置くことで、その地域特有の《進化能力》を獲得できます。
進化能力を活用することで、成長の効率を高めたり、より多くの勝利点を生み出すことができるようになるでしょう。
publisher's summary

name: The Tragedy of Othello
description:
"The Tragedy of Othello" is a Tragic and Treacherous Shakespeare-themed card game In The Tragedy of Othello, you and your opponents are actors auditioning for the lead role of the villainous Iago, trying to impress the casting director with your ability to embody Iago’s treachery and deceit! You will play script cards from the cast of characters to gain points as you advance Shakespeare’s script, and play staging cards to disrupt the play of your rivals. Also play intrigue tokens, character coins and spotlight tokens to strategically improve your position. When you control the lead character, Iago, your opportunities to gain points increase.

Alas, opportunities also exist to steal points, so take heed: opponents playing the other characters as 'The Company' may try to upstage you! The actor who accumulates the most points at the end of Act V wins the game by stealing the spotlight and landing the role of Iago!

No Shakespeare knowledge required.

-description from publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Interrupts, Take That, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Plamo vs Plamo
description:
Plamo vs Plamo (abbreviated to PvP) is a tabletop combat game where players design their own mecha combatants and bring their creations to the table to fight. From building to battling, players are given freedom to design and play with units that reflect their personality. Create a model that expresses your style, customize it to fit your needs in-game, and challenge your friends to a game!

PvP's game system is designed to keep players engaged at all times. Whether you're playing one-on-one against an opponent in a duel, playing a scenario requiring careful coordination of your team to complete an objective, or a chaotic six-player battle royale, downtime is short, action is fast, and players are kept making meaningful choices at all times.

A core aspect of PvP is unit customization, and the Unit Design Module allows players to create a huge range of machines both to reflect in-game mechanical diversity and their modelling efforts. The Unit Design Module allows players the freedom to combine Frames, Equipment and Weapons in any way they see fit while working within agreed-upon points limits.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Time Track

name: ULUS: Legends of the Nomads
description:
ULUS is a game aimed at preserving knowledge about Mongolian culture. It is published by the Endangered Alphabets Project, which strives to preserve the many writing systems of the world that are under threat of extinction, including the Mongolian alphabet.

The game is set at the time after Genghis Khan's death, when his successors wondered what form the huge Mongolian empire should have in the future. Should the nomadic culture be preserved? Should Mongols adapt to an urban culture?

Each player adheres to one such idea, asks the support of a deity and a totemic animal and begins to gather the assets that will help their idea to prevail. The game is divided into two phases. The first phase is mostly to gather assets and to attack other players to thwart their plans. Players can choose to play an attack card which the attacked player can defend against. The player of the weaker card will lose strength points which will make it harder to fulfill their tasks in phase two. Alternatively, players can pass or try to force a trade on another player. If they know about a card another player holds, they can ask for it in exchange for any other asset card.

In phase two of the game, players arrive at the great summer festival of Naadam. Here, they compete in three traditional Mongolian sports: archery, horse racing and wrestling. Winners are decided by adding asset modifiers to a player's strength.
After a final round of trading or attacking, players reveal their collected assets and add their strength to determine the winner.

Rules will be included in English and Mongolian.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Flicking

name: Fantascatti Occhio al Tranello
description:
Tommy is a young detective who specialized himself in very peculiar cases.
Despite his age, he is not afraid to explore old abandoned castles, armed only with a camera, looking for scary ghosts. However, the ghost Tommy is looking for is very shy. Therefore, it tries to deceive the young detective with tricks.

Players reveal a trick card, which depicts a different trick among 4 kinds (visual, linguistic, logical, numerical). To solve it, players have to compare the revealed card with the trick deck’s top card. Only the fastest player will be able to catch the right object.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time

name: タビネズミ開拓記 (Lemmings' Frontier)
description:
タビネズミ開拓記 (Lemmings' Frontier) is a co-operative game from Japan, with lemmings exploring and taming a new wild land. The game is played with two phases each round: an Investigation phase of exploring and tackling monsters, and a Base phase of using the resources gathered from exploring to improve the camp and make new tools.

The game has skill cards and item cards, and two boards. The smaller board is the Base camp and a pathway leads on and through the larger board. Here, the path branches, letting the lemmings find different routes through to the final goal. Each location contains a hidden creature and the end goals also vary. Players only win if they complete the adventure and satisfy the final goal's demands.

Players defeat the monsters by combining tools and skills to beat a strength target on the monster's card.
user summary

name: O Petiz Que Mordeu O Cão
description:
This expansion was designed for children. In O Petiz Que Mordeu O Cão, children play it by telling funny stories.
This expansion can be played by adding new cards (with new words) to the base game. It is a family game, which people asks questions like "Where?", "Who?", "What?", "To Who?", "With What?".

name: Munchkin Enhancers
description:
Flavor up your Munchkin games with Munchkin Enhancers, which includes thirty new monster, Treasure, Class, and Race enhancers for use with Munchkin, Munchkins & Mazes, Munchkin Tails, Munchkin Oz, or any set that uses the original Munchkin card backs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Na Babią Górę
description: In the game, players will climb the Babia Góra, observing nature. Taking cards from the common pot allows you to build another level of the mountain and the pawn shows the place of our climbing. The card can be used in three ways: as a part of the mountain, as an element of nature or as an equipment. In order to enter the next cards it is necessary to have the appropriate equipment. Players earn points for the cards they have visited and sets of nature cards (animals, plants). The player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Evergreen Bandana Game
description: The Evergreen Bandana Game is an adventure board game where players roll to race across the state. Along the way players will encounter unique Washington obstacles and have a chance to speed up their advancement when they risk a roll of the adventure dice. The game is comes printed on a durable cloth bandana.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Dark Rituals: Malleus Maleficarum – Horvath and Dagon
description:
Horvath and Dagon (from Black Rose Wars, in collaboration with Ludus Magnus Studio) adds a male Witch to the game! Bound to his familiar Dagon, Horvath drains the Creature's health to keep himself alive.

This mini-expansion to Dark Rituals: Malleus Maleficarum comes with a Horvath and Dagon miniature, Horvath and Dagon Witch ID card, Grimoire, 3 Witchcraft Spells, and a bonus separate Dagon Creature ID card and Summoning card.

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon Sentinels
description:
For most armies, the armor worn by the Baratheon Sentinels would count them as heavy infantry. But for House Baratheon, they only are classified as medium infantry. Still, their resilient plate mail can turn away most attacks, while their warhammers make quick work of enemies out on the field.

The Baratheon Sentinels Unit Box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Baratheon commanders a new melee unit for their forces. Simple and straightforward, the Sentinels head into battle confident in the power of their armor. On the attacking side of the coin, the Sentinel’s double warhammers can crush enemies under the weight of their mighty blows, easily sundering enemy armor.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Moving Multiple Units
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: Murder at the Grand Hotel
description:
During the ceremonial opening of the New York Grand Hotel the actress Monique Moreau is found dead in her suite. How could the opening celebration end so tragically?

New York, August 1962. Welcome to the city that never sleeps! Everybody who was anybody had come to Manhattan to celebrate the opening of the magnificent Grand Hotel – aspiring politicians, powerful industrialists and beautiful actresses. The largest luxury hotel in the United States was set on redefining the term “five-star”, and was also to be the crown jewel in the empire of Frederic Price. The hotel tycoon was one of the richest men in the country. Since his marriage to the actress Dóra Galor, he was now even better known than before.

The opening speeches were full of praise, and the guests ate and drank copious amounts from the five-course menu. The evening had all the hallmarks of an incredible coming-together of American high society. Once the official part of the event was over, the guests gathered for an exuberant cocktail party at the longest hotel bar in the entire city. But the evening took a tragic turn when the young actress Monique Moreau was found dead in the bathtub of her hotel suite late in the evening. The idea that the young woman, described by the media as the next Dóra Galor, would take her own life is rejected by everyone as incredible.

The police were informed immediately. But it will take the authorities hours to search the entire hotel and secure all the relevant evidence. You have all been requested to stay here in the lobby. Until the police have questioned everybody, you are all on your own in solving the mystery, asking the questions: what happened this evening? How could the opening celebration end so tragically?

What is a murder mystery game?

You and your guests slip into the roles of the main suspects of an exciting murder case. The objective of the game is to convict the perpetrator – one of the people sitting with you at the table. This can only be achieved if the players discuss the course of events amongst themselves and compare their experiences of what happened. But be careful: Each character (including you!) has their own dark secrets which they’d be better off keeping to themselves.

You all gather in the wake of the crime and attempt to piece together your memories, with the aim of identifying the perpetrator. In each round, you recall more and more about the circumstances of the crime, as each round deals with a different period of time from the evening the crime was committed. At the end, everyone votes on who should be handed over to the police as the suspect.

Culinario Mortale is a highly interactive game. There are only a few rules, and no pre-prepared dialogue. The focus is on working through the puzzles and discussing the events together.

Alongside a well-structured game manual, each game contains game booklets for between five and eight characters (the number of players for each game can be found on the packaging and here on our website). In the game booklets, each guest will find their personal clues and a description of their role. Each game booklet also includes a brief overview of how the game works. As such, all players can jump right in. The support code included with your Culinario Mortale game will allow you to download the role descriptions in advance from our website in PDF format, and easily send them to your guests via email.

GAME CONTENT:
1 Game Manual, 8 Game Booklets, 1 Incident Booklet (includes of prologue, incidents, solution), 8 name badges, 1 support code

— description from the publisher.
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Evolve
description:
Evolve is an intriguing new family board game for those who want something a little more interesting than traditional board games. It has some educational content too. Its for ages 9+ to adults and can be played by 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6 players in around 45 minutes. Great interaction between players as they try to gain the best habitat (Era cards) for their playing pieces and be first to create a path of six era cards (the habitat of creatures from bygone eras). Win by reaching the end card first with your playing piece. Era cards can gained in several ways including by an unusual auction (bid for habitat). All the while natural events (Thunderbolts) can spring up at random and hinder or sometimes help a player in his quest to reach the end of his/her path.

—description from the publisher

name: Munchkin: Dragones Molones
description:
This product is a compilation of these expansions:

Munchkin Dragons
Munchkin Dragons: Four More
Munchkin Dragons: Dragon's trike
Munchkin Princesses
Munchkin Fairy Dust

It is currently available in its Spanish edition.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: The Cube²
description:
The goal of the game is to make the greatest number of squares of your color on a suggested board of 5x5 or 7x7 squares.
Players have squares representing 4 triangles of 4 colors in one of six possible configurations!
Cube² offers several game modes: with 2 or 4 players, each for himself or in teams of 2 in the 4 player version (2x2), or a more original formula 4 players per team (2x2), the principle of which is: to win the part you must first beat the opposing team (cumulative score), then achieve a number of SQUARE greater than that of your teammate!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: The Eternal City (fan expansion for Charterstone)
description:
This is a fan-made expansion to Charterstone designed to be used after the campaign has been completed. It is highly recommended that you do not use this material until after you have completed the campaign!

—description from the designer
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Worker Placement

name: Quodd Heroes: Tom's Brew
description:
New Food card Tom's Brew
1 2: Jump 3
3 4: Dash 3
5 Q: Teleport 4

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Explorers Pack.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Puzzle, Racing
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Theorem
description:
In Theorem, players will be dealt 7 cards and attempt to get rid of their cards by playing them in sets. Players will follow their own rule cards, but can also use rules revealed by other players. When a player plays 7 cards, then they win!

—description from the publisher

name: De Bellis Renationis version 2.0
description:
De Bellis Renationis is a set of wargames rules for Renaissance battles covering the period from 1494 AD to 1700 AD.
