DBR version 2.0 offers a combination of realism and excitement for this warfare using miniature figures in any scale from 30mm to 2mm.
The creation of experienced wargame designers Phil Barker and Richard Bodley Scott, DBR can be used to refight historical engagements or your own scenarios from small scale skirmishes to the largest battles of the period.
With its command system using "player initiative points", DBR emphasizes the player's generalship rather than his ability to manipulate a set of rules. It allows players to fight actions from the whole period and across the whole world, from Japan to Europe and the Americas and from the Italian Wars to the Nine Years War.

This edition combines the 2002 edition of the rules with all three of the books of Army Lists and includes everything the wargamer needs to refight these battles in one single convenient volume.

—description from the back of the book
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Six Gun Sound: Devil's Elbow
description:
Rob banks like Jesse James...enforce the law like Wyatt Earp...or maybe find something in between. If they did it, so can you with Six Gun Sound. With over 15 unique "professions" Six Gun Sound lets you experience the Wild West to the fullest.

Six Gun Sound is a fast paced set of "cowboy" rules that allows you to refight history or make your own. Whether you choose to fight a "one up" battle or string together a series of adventures, Six Gun Sound can do it all. Six Gun Sound is easy to learn yet entertaining for both veteran and novice players.

Set in the Old West from 1876-85 Six Gun Sound covers the Lincoln County War, the unpleasantness in Tombstone, the "Demise of the James Younger Gang," and the Great Sioux War of 76 as well as the founding of Deadwood and the death of Bill Hickok. And did we mention Apaches?

Six Gun Sound allows you to either fight unrelated gunfights or link them all together with a seamless and easy to use Campaign System. Watch your characters grow as they advance in skill making their way through the Old West. Bank robberies, cattle rustling, jail breaks, range wars, and more are at your finger tips with Six Gun Sound.

Six Gun Sound works with ANY figures you may already have and in any scale! Play solo, play on the same side, or play head-to-head -- it's your choice. So pop in your favorite Western movie and saddle up for adventure. And remember --- JUST PLAY THE GAME!
categories: American Indian Wars, American West, Fighting, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Wtedy kiedy: Szalone fakty
description: An expansion to "Wtedy kiedy" game. It contains 110 new cards.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Wtedy kiedy: Niezwykła Polska
description: An expansion to "Wtedy kiedy" game. It contains 110 new cards.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Blanc-manger Coco Galette Complète
description:
Galette complète is the ninth expansion for Blanc-Manger Coco. It contains 40 question cards and 160 answer cards themed about Brittany.

One player is designated "question master" and reads a blue card with a hole-in-the-wall sentence (s), all other players pose a white card. Whoever posed the funniest card wins the round then reads the next blue card and so on. The first player with 5 points is the lucky winner!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: CNBC Stock Exchange
description: Players make their way around the board as they accrue money and invest it in stocks, responding to positive and negative developments along the way. The first player to reach $1 million wins. If players end the game before someone crosses the $1 million mark, the player with the most money in their portfolio wins. The game is undated, but companies like "e Internet Solutions" to invest in and references to technologies such as a $4,000 handycam suggest the game was published in the late 1990s or early 2000s.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Investment, Loans, Simulation, Stock Holding

name: Schnellen
description:
Schnellen; is a trick taking game with trumps. It is a popular card game in the region of Tyrol, South Tyrol and Vorarlberg. It is played with a set of German-suited playing cards (33 cards) where the 6 Bell-card (Weli) is always trump color and the second highest value. Each player gests five cards and is predicting the number of tricks taken by himself. If you succeed you loose points, if you fail you gain points.
There are variants with exchange (bad) cards and leaving a round.

—user summary

name: Zombie Circus Goats 3000: The Everything Box
description:
Zombie Circus Goats is a 2-4 player game. In it players start with three cards and then, in turn order, draw a single card. Players may play talent cards and then roll dice to collect gold, brains, blood or guts cards based on their talent and roll.

The game includes a trading mechanism where players can trade talent cards with one another.The winner is the first player to amass 5 zombie circus goat cards.

ZCG 3000: The Everything Box is a compilation which includes everything in the base game + the following expansions.

+ 2 Players Pack

RCW 1: Real World Consequences
Warning: There are Goblins
Zombies Invade the Moon
The Zombie Pizza! Token
NSFW 1: The Offendening Expansion Pack
NSFW 2: Fine, I'm Leaving Expansion Pack

name: Bron Pancerna
description:
This is an expansion booklet for The Deluge, 1940: The Fall France, and Fire in the Steppe (all three needed to play).

We look at the tanks that the Poles tried to acquire or produce before the German invasion. Polish industry wasn’t capable of putting the new tanks into series production in time, and the Poles failed in their quest to purchase the Somua S35.

That’s not the case in Bron Pancerni. The Poles get their S35’s, and they also get the 25TP medium tank with a long-barreled 75mm gun, the 14TP cavalry tank with a long-barreled 47mm gun, and the 10TP and 9TP light tanks: the armor you need to stomp the szkopy.

These are very good tanks for 1939; they’re still pretty good in 1941, too. You get 24 new die-cut and silky-smooth playing pieces and new scenarios to use them in battle. The Germans can get the T34 shock two years early; the 25TP is just as capable a fighting machine as the legendary Hammer of the Proletariat (and it’s crewed by Poles).

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Maiden's Quest: Morgan of Draknor Savior Promo Card
description:
Originally available from the Game Boy Geek Season 8 Kickstarter.

New Savior Card with the Flip and Upgrade abilities.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: La Résistance: Gestapo Event Cards
description:
The Gestapo deck adds 9 new, unique events, which make the game more challenging for experienced players.

Use this deck instead of the event deck that ships with the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Breukosaurus Rex
description:
Breukosaurus Rex is an education game that helps children to practise fractions and calculate percentages and decimals.

In the game, players try to get on the other side of the island. Each turn, the active player will roll the two dice and will afterwards see how much they get. The player choses either to step forward, take cards or do both.

On the cards they can either see fractions, calculate percentages or decimals and then they must see if they match several cards to make 1 whole or 100%. If they can do that they win an egg. To win the game a player must get to the other side with 3 eggs.

—description from the publisher

name: Schrödinger's Cat: A Game of Curiosity
description:
Schrödinger's Cat in a pocket-sized game of curiosity that unfolds in ten minutes and stretches beyond the natural lifespan of the players. Equal parts infinite and intimate, two players, or two teams, take on the role of either the Cat Wrangler or the Scuba Master, making permanent, irreversible, life or death choices for their cat. Their goal, of course, is to keep their cat alive as long as possible.
Inspired by quantum physicist Dr. Edwin Schrödinger’s metaphysical thought experiment stating that a cat sealed in bunker with a container of radioactive poison - that may or may not have opened - is both alive and dead at the same time, this destructible game begs the question… does curiosity really kill the cat?

Perfect for curious players who revel in experiences that push the boundaries of what a game can be.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Exploration, Humor, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Connections, Deduction, Hidden Movement, Negotiation, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Real-Time, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Super Roll Writer: Arcade Edition
description:
Created as part of a design challenge to make a roll and write game using only one set of polyhedral dice, Super Roll Writer: Arcade Edition takes the action to the streets with video game-inspired combat in head-to-head and tag team modes.

Players roll their strongest dice and attempt to string together attacks, using weaker dice for rerolls as their fighter fatigues. Dice combinations resolve into strikes on various hit locations on their opponents or into defensive options such as blocking and taunting. A built-in rage meter lets fighters on the ropes turn the damage they've suffered into powerful dice mitigation and combo attacks to battle back from the brink of defeat.

—description from the designer

name: IT Startup: Backend Developers do Frontend Promo Card
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive "Backend Developers do Frontend" card for IT Startup. This action card can be added to the base game.

Card text:
"You get (1) project point for every developer you control. Every PM and Agile Coach in play gets (1) burnout point."

name: Spoiler Alert Mini
description: Can you get your teammate to guess the title without spoiling the story? In Spoiler Alert, each card has a title and a list of Spoiler Words. Each Spoiler Word has a point value, which will be deducted from your score, so be careful what you say! You'll have to be creative to get your teammates to guess as many titles as you can before time runs out!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game

name: Bob Marley: Unity
description:
It’s the 1970s. Hit the road with your band to spread peace, love and unity through the power of music. In this feel-good game, players compete to see who can spread the most global unity.

The game’s currency is love and it is gained by performing at concerts. During a turn, the active player moves to spaces on the board to set up concerts, collect fans and place them on their concerts. The more fans at your concert, the more love you gain when you perform there. Players draft musicians with different abilities depending on which instrument they play. Musician's abilities must be used sparingly, as they fatigue after they perform. Players can use ganja to revive their band members.

Bob Marley is represented in the game and he gives options when you interact with him. Players may also strategically place Marley at one of their own concerts to prompt other players to attend. Two types of cards are gained that either give bonuses that may shift strategy, or give goals to achieve extra unity points at the end of the game.

The end goal is to perform at the One Love concert where you cash in your love for unity. The game ends when all the unity tokens are collected. Then all players tally unity tokens and additional unity point bonuses to see who is the victor. But really, everybody wins in a world with a little more unity!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Crash Factor
description:
Crash Factor is a truly strategic pure balancing game played with calibrated weights.
Players take turns in a race to be rid of their "fleet" of varied weights by playing them onto a balancing gameboard into risk-reward zones.
Causing a crash or being unable to make a play during the game adds a dangerous penalty piece to the fleet.
A concentric "Crash Factor" grid allows players to anticipate the crash risk of any weight placed anywhere.
Playing risky moves away from the center of balance can win advantages or eliminate penalties.

GAMEPLAY BASICS:
A win is triggered once a player has deployed all their spaceships and space junk.

- Flip over a "mission" card to reveal a value.
- You must match that value with the weight value of any quantity of spaceships deployed anywhere onto the solar system.
- The farther from the center a ship is deployed, the greater the risk and greater the reward.
- You may "dock" (stack) them onto any other spaceship to have their values added together towards making the required match.
- Get a space junk penalty piece if unable to make a match or by causing a crash.
- After a crash, the empty solar system gets re-balanced to continue the game.
- Get rid of your space junk or risk being eliminated by getting a 2nd one.
- Strategically manage the deployment of your light and heavy ships as your fleet diminishes while the game advances.
- Look for or create opportunities to deploy into high risk zones to gain significant advantages or eliminate a penalty.
- Tactically play special utility devices anytime during a mission.
- Ruthlessly capture an opponent's resources by docking onto their spaceship.
- You can choose one of three play options instead of choosing a mission:
1) Jettison a piece of space junk.
2) Take back a needed spaceship.
3) Swap an un-deployed heavy ship for its equivalent weight from your lighter ships that have been deployed.

Play at your own risk!
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Stacking and Balancing, Three Dimensional Movement, Trading, Worker Placement

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M4A1 Sherman
description:
The M4A1 Sherman tank was, much like other releases in this wave, one of the most iconic tanks of the war. The Sherman first saw combat in the deserts of North Africa and continued to serve on battlefields till the end of the war in a variety of models.

The M4A1 Sherman Expansion Pack has the same model previously included in the Starter Set, but has been given a new lease on life through the inclusion of some new cards to let you turn this blank canvas of a tank into whatever you need it to be.

Whilst the M4A1 Sherman is a cost-effective tank with fairly average stats, it does have a good Initiative stat and by adding Relaying to your radio operator other tanks in the platoon can benefit from it during the Shooting Phase. Why stack a number of initiative buffs on each of your tanks when they may not need them each turn? When you get just let your Sherman pass information off to them.

Inside the M4A1 Sherman Expansion Pack you will find a highly detailed, assembled, painted plastic M4A1 Sherman miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalized to match your requirements using the five crew, module and upgrade cards included.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Video Game Theme, Wargame, World War II

name: KYNG Pirate Dice
description:
Our take on the classic South American game; Peruvian Lying Dice.

1-X players.

Roll your own dice but keep them hidden from other players as you take turns making bets on everyone’s dice.

Get caught in a lie and you lose a die!

When you’re done to your last die, special rules kick in to help you make a comeback.

Lose your last die and you’re out.

Last player left in the game is the winner!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: The Moon Ant Mow Down at Lunar Base: Dirty Ankle
description:
The U.S. wants to be the first to colonize the moon, but one small thing stands in its way: MOON ANTS. These moon ants will cause havoc on electrical equipment and must be eliminated before colonization. The U.S. enlists the help of Cleephas Spangler, to rid the moon of these pests. With his 1986 mower, converted to solar power, he will be given the task of vacuuming up all the ants and inject the entire lunar surface with a specialized moon ant killer. All within a day. He will have the usual problems associated with having a mower, combined with the problem of the moon's shadow rending his solar powered mower inoperable.

His one requirement for succeeding in his mission?: Changing the national anthem's name from The Star Spangled Banner to The Star Spangler Banner. Sounds absurd? Wait till you play the game, and you will know its absurd!

Overall winner of the 6th Roll & Write Game Design Contest

—description from the designer

name: Cake Toppers
description:
In Cake Toppers, players are apprentice bakers who must use different type and flavours of cake to build an outrageous creation, with each different type of cake providing different ways of scoring.


Starting with the player who most


recently baked a cake, players will take it in
turns taking actions.

They will slowly build their cake and deplete the cake deck.
The final turn triggers once the cake deck is empty.
Players then score their cake.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: 10K Tumble
description:
A dice game involving 6 dice of 6 different colors.

Object of the Game
Be the first player to reach or exceed 10K (10,000) points.

How to Calculate Scoring
Refer to the Scoring Chart to calculate the point value of various dice. To receive the value of a scoring roll the scoring dice must be rolled on one roll.

Three Pairs: 1250 points
Four of a Kind: 1500 points
Five of a Kind: 2500 points
Six of a Kind: 3500 points
A single 5: 50 points
A single 1: 100 points
Three 2's: 200 points
Three 3's: 300 points
Three 4's: 400 points
Three 5's: 500 points
Three 6's: 600 points
Three 1's: 1000 points
Four 1's: 2000 points
Five 1's: 3000 points
Six 1's 4000 points
One each of each Kind: 5000 points
A red 1, a yellow 2, a green 3, a blue 4, an orange 5, and a purple 6: 10,000 points

Getting in the Game
A player must score at least 500 points in one turn, which may consist of several rolls, to get in the game. If a player does not score at least 500 points in a turn, then the dice are passed to the next player to take a turn, and wait until their next turn to try again and get in the game. The 500 or more points necessary to begin are counted towards the 10,000 points goal.

Playing

The First Roll of a Turn
Player rolls all six dice to begin a turn. If one or more scoring dice are rolled, then at least one set of scoring dice must be set aside before rolling the remaining dice.

Keep It or Roll Again?
A player may stop after any roll which scores points, keep the points and pass the dice to the next player. Or, a player may roll the remaining dice in an attempt to increase a score, but risks losing the total of the entire turn if no scoring dice are rolled.
If all dice in a turn score points, then a player may continue the turn by rolling all six dice again, but if no scoring dice are rolled, then the player loses all points for that turn.

Ending the Game
If a player reaches or exceeds 10,000 points, then all other players get one more turn in an attempt to beat the leading scorer's points.

name: Jenga: The Walking Dead Edition
description:
This is The Walking Dead edition of the Jenga classic block stacking game.

Players remove and stack custom blocks, with game-changing actions.

(Back of the box)
mechanics: Physical Removal, Single Loser Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: Artefact
description:
Artefact is a story game for one player, designed for contemplative solo play.

In the classic dungeon crawl, you follow the lives of adventurers as they overcome challenges to gain prestige and, most importantly, magical treasures. But what were those treasures doing before the adventurers came along? How many aeons have passed, in silent darkness, since they were last used?

Artefact shifts the focus to the perspective of a single magical item, and its history as it passes through the hands of many different keepers. You’ll feel the weight of time as the item is lost or abandoned again and again, the dust & decay piling around it until it’s found again by someone new.

It's a great way to spend an hour; sketching, world-building and storytelling in your own company. It's also a fantastic way to generate really unique items for tabletop games like D&D, with detailed histories far more vivid than any you'd typically find in a compendium.

name: Piston Cup Championship Game
description:
Complete the laps in the game as quickly as possible, but watch out for Obstacles!! Oil Slicks (back one square), Blowouts (back two squares), Curves (no passing), and Accidents (skip a turn) will slow you down, but the Acceleration Zone (keep rolling) will give you a boost!

Cars (playing pieces) move clockwise. Players each take turns rolling the die and advancing the number of squares indicated on the die. No more than three cars may occupy the same square at one time. If a fourth car lands on this square or tries to pass, the car must stop one square behind.

The number of laps depends on the number of players. The first player to cross the finish line (checkerboard square) after completing the requisite number of laps wins the game!

name: Campaign Trail (Second Edition): Green Party Expansion
description:
This retail edition of the Green Party Expansion contains voter tokens compatible with the second editions of Campaign Trail from Grey Fox Games.

Note: It does not contain Timed Releases, which were included in the backer game boxes produced by the Campaign Trail: Second Edition and Green Party Expansion Kickstarter campaign.

Campaign Trail is a highly reviewed, card-driven strategy game of electoral politics where players compete to win their candidate the presidency.

The Green Party Expansion adds more action cards, more candidates, new global events, and end game goals that introduce new strategies and allows more players to compete for the White House!

Now playable with up to 4 parties and up to 8 players, the Green Party Expansion allows you to challenge more of your rivals for political victory.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Troy: The Battle Card Game
description:
Troy is an easy to learn and quick to set up 1 or 2 player game of strategy, with the aim of the game being to break through the opposition’s defence and destroy their defences. Suitable for ages 9+. As with the famous Trojan war told through Homer’s Iliad, the game pits the Trojan army against the Achaean army that has traveled far and wide to reclaim their pride after Helen was taken from them. The game includes a large number of the armies that are written about in the war and also many of the heroes and leaders in the battle such as Hector, Achilles, Agamemnon and Odysseus. There is also the addition of the Greek gods that play their part.

Game play: You take charge of either the Trojan or Achaean armies. Defences are set up (both sides have four) and you make the decisions of which armies to defend the wall/stockade. Then you have the option to level your armies up to make them stronger, choose a leader to improve their abilities or attack the opposing armies. Attacking is done through dice rolling strategy as armies have improved abilities when fighting specific enemies. All armies have the ability to defend each attack and this is done through dice rolling. The leader's capabilities can be even better if they are linked to their respective armies. There are also divinity cards which can be played at any time. These can help to improve the strength of an attack of assist with defence rolls depending on their capability.

The aim of the game is to defeat the enemy army in front of their defences and destroy their wall. The first side to destroy all four levels of the defence of their opposition is the winner.

The solo version of the game follows a set of rules for your opposition to follow, using a simple numbered system. Be prepared to not always win tough!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Gretchen Wächter – Star Player
description:
There are some poor souls who find themselves wedded to a Blood Bowl fan of such boundless enthusiasm that it encroaches into every aspect of daily life. Important dates and anniversaries are ignored or forgotten, and family functions are avoided. Before long, the unfortunate lover begins to resent the beautiful game. In time, a strong hatred of Nuffle, and all his wonders, is fostered and domestic bliss becomes a thing of the past! Such was the case with Gretchen Wächter, whose husband was utterly obsessed with Blood Bowl when they were still alive. The Necromancer and aspiring coach Dirk the Abhorrent turned the animosity Gretchen held for the game into a finely-honed weapon and unleashed her scorn against her rival players – the pitch has never been the same since.

The legendary 'Blood Bowl Widow' is a frighteningly solid Star Player, despite being wholly incorporeal. Gretchen's set of skills make it hard for your opponents to get their hands on her, robbing their momentum and frustrating even their Big Guys. She can be Induced to play for any Sylvanian Spotlight team, bolstering their defensive line and skipping right past their biggest players on offence.

This finely-detailed resin model is supplied in 7 pieces, and comes supplied with a 32mm Round Blood Bowl Base. You can find all the rules you need to use her in Blood Bowl – The Official Rules.

-description from publisher's website

The 2016 edition rules for this Star Player can be found in Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): 2019 Blood Bowl Almanac
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Belgian Beers Race: Confrontation expansion
description: 28 cards you can add to your Belgian Beers Race. It is part of the all-in pledge on Kickstarter and a BYR Games exclusive.
mechanics: Area Movement, Movement Points, Race, Variable Set-up

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Wings of Vengeance – Ghost Relic Avenger Card
description:
This is a promo card was contained in White Dwarf #458 (November 2020)
The card offers new stats for Imperial Navy Avenger Strike Fighters that can be used in the Taros Air War campaign book.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Extra Loco (fan expansion for The Quacks of Quedlinburg)
description:
Alternative uses for the Locoweed plant are gaining traction in the medical community of Quedlinburg. Previously understood to be little more than an annoyance, popping up where it was least wanted and doing more harm than good, new developments have proven the Locus Fern to be a potent and inexpensive replacement for many medicinal herbs. Many of Quedlinburg's top physicians who previously scorned the plant as insignificant or even dangerous have recognized the economic potential of harnessing the species for human consumption. The coming days are uncertain for the future of the Locoweed, but only time will tell whether it is a miracle cure or just a flash in the pot.

Extra Loco is a fan-made Print&Play expansion for the Quacks of Quedlinburg and its first expansion, the Herb Witches. No additional rules or modules have been added; instead, there a variety of new ingredient books to explore. Included are 2 new black books, 4 blue/green/red/purple/yellow books, and 7 Locoweed books.

This is an unofficial expansion and is only for personal, non-commercial use. All rights to the Quacks of Quedlinburg name, gameplay, mechanics, and imagery are reserved by Schmidt Spiele, GmbH.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Set-up

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #65 – Guadalcanal #1
description:
Hungry, thirsty, poorly armed and in combat for the first time the brave soldiers of the 1st Marine Division endured day after day of horror and deprivation defending the Cactus Air Force flying out of Henderson Field. Fighting what became known as the key land battle of the Pacific War the marines beat back wave after wave of merciless attackers, their exploits drawing the attention of the world. Recreate the key battles of Alligator Creek and Edson's Ridge while scouting for enemy positions and hunting for Pistol Pete, the Japanese heavy artillery that shelled the Lunga Perimeter with impunity. Fight through historical locations such as the Matanikau River, Kokumbona Village and Koli Point. Command men such as William J. Whaling, the founder of the Scout-Sniper detachment that would eventually go on to become Marine Recon, and John Basilone, whose bravery defending Henderson Field saw him win the Medal of Honor. Meet Sir Jacob C. Vouza, the native who refused to give away American positions to his Japanese torturers despite being bayoneted numerous times and left to die, only to bite through his bindings and return to Marine lines quickly enough to warn them of the Japanese advance and win the Battle of the Tenaru.

Warfighter: WWII Expansion #65 – Guadalcanal #1 adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions.

3 x PS
2 x NPS
2 x SQS
2 x Skills
3 x Equipment
4 x Situations
4 x Missions
4 x Objectives
12 x Locations
20 x Japanese Hostiles

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: PrimEVO
description:
At the dawn of man, tribes fought against both nature and others of their own kind to secure their slim chance at survival. Their ability to adapt and evolve in the face of constant hardship allowed the strongest of those tribes to succeed. You are in control of one of these tribes, and their future is entirely in your hands.

PrimEVO is a miniatures agnostic skirmish system intended to be played solo or among a group of people. It offers quick gameplay (1 vs 1) and offers not only world challenges that all tribes must face together, but also those that they will have to overcome individually. Literally no two campaigns will be alike.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Jenga: Disney Theme Park Edition – Hollywood Tower Hotel
description:
You definitely don't want to be the fall guy and bring down this special Hollywood Tower Hotel edition of Jenga. Featuring a colorful assortment of HTH blocks, it's a fun way to elevate your spirits.

Magic in the details
Created especially for Walt Disney World Resort and Disneyland Resort

Includes 54 hardwood Jenga Hollywood Tower Hotel blocks
Includes traditional Jenga and Disney Theme Park Edition rules
Includes loading tray to assemble tower
Part of the Hollywood Tower Hotel Collection

New rules for the Disney Parks Version of the Game include "Thrilling Directives" which ask you to perform feats such as: each player has 10 seconds to remove and place a block, reverse directions, or even pass this block to another player to stack.
mechanics: Physical Removal, Push Your Luck, Single Loser Game, Stacking and Balancing, Tile Placement

name: Shadow of the Eagles: Wargame Rules The French Revolutionary & Napoleonic Wars 1792-1815
description:
The French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars are one of the most tempting and popular of military periods to wargame.
The paradox is that the period can also be intimidating to those wishing to game it – there is so much to know and understand.

Shadow of the Eagles was written to make the period more accessible, by providing a set of rules a little simpler than many of the popular sets.

Experienced Napoleonic gamers may appreciate a relatively straightforward alternative to the other excellent rule sets already available, and enjoy comparing their assessment of the period with the historical summaries included here.

Size and scales:
10-20 units per side
25-30 mm minis / 6'x4' table (possible at smaller scale)
The basic troop types are:

infantry: 1 battalion 600 men
cavalry: 1 regiment 400 cavalrymen
and artillery: 1 battery 6-8 guns
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Antes del Diluvio
description:
Antes del Diluvio (a.k.a. "Before the Flood") takes place in the year 2070, just twelve hours before the extinction of the last living creatures on Earth. Robots that now rule the Earth are determined to gather different kinds of DNA as long as it is still available so that they can eventually recreate life on other planets.

Each hour is played as one round. On your turn, you have four action points to draw DNA tiles from different bags, put them into their incubator, or move them from the incubator to your habitat. The tiles have different shapes and sizes and must be placed to fit the habitat or the incubator. Each round has a different objective which, if fulfilled, gets you victory points. After twelve rounds, the player with most victory points wins.

name: One Piece: Extension – Pour une poignée de berrys: Les 7 Grands Corsaires
description:
A One Piece expansion that comes with new cards to renew your One Piece board game For a Fistful of Berrys.

The rules remain the same as for the base game (except that you can only play event cards of the same type once per turn). The 7 CHARACTER cards will allow you to play with new powers. The characters remain iconic like Doflamingo.

The new ACTION cards will diversify the game to make it even more explosive! Play for example the "Longue-Vue" card which will allow you to steal the card of your choice from one of your opponents.

Included! A cloth bag with One Piece colors to store your One Piece board game.

Attention! Requires the One Piece game For a handful of Berrys.

name: Recapture the Country
description: A game of fictional battle during the 2nd Sino-Japanese War, based on a Chinese TV drama broadcasted in 2014. The first game of Kilovolt Design's "Mini War" series.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Mixtape Massacre: Invasion – Plasma Gun promo card
description:
Time for a Bug Hunt!

Text says:
Target any slasher or invader card on the board from any distance.
Stats +9/+1/2

Blast your enemies with this powerful Kickstarter Exclusive Supply card, available in very limited quantities from the publisher's website.

name: My Very First Games: Animal Upon Animal Junior
description:
Things are getting wildly wobbly as the animals create a big stacking tower. Who will climb on whom? The die decides. But whether the animal stack stays standing or not is up to the players. They stack Animal upon Animal in three new games for young stackers. In the third game, they work cooperatively to race against the crab, training their dexterity skills with play. May the best stacker win!

Note: Not the same game as My Very First Games: Animal upon Animal. This game has new rules, new name, new art, new pieces.

name: Darkpass
description:
Darkpass is a collaborative campaign-based tabletop dungeon crawler that takes place in the dark and dismal 1854 Paris sewer system. The butcher, blacksmith, alchemist, and host of other characters combat a stream of ravenous beasts as they make their way through the grime and filth, deducing the best way to survive and forge ahead on their journey.

Players must work their way through each chamber by defeating beasts, collecting items and performing tasks. Characters and beasts take turns based on a determined initiative per chamber.

Characters and beasts move and take an action on each turn, through the use of action cards, which include attacks, resting, dashing and exploring.

Items can be collected with the explore action and used to manage obstacles and help defeat beasts.

Throughout the campaign, characters become stronger and more skilled as they progress through deeper, darker and more difficult chambers.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Don't Squeak With Your Mouth Full!!
description:
みんなでいただきマウス (Min'na de itadakimausu) Don't Squeak With Your Mouth Full!! is a card game from Japan.

You’re a peckish family of mice, fighting over the plates of food in front of you! You’ll have to chews your food wisely, because if you take too much you’ll be forced to share. Will you be crafty enough to get the most food?
publisher's summary

The deck has 5 kinds of food, numbered 1, 2 or 3. Players are dealt three hand cards, and cards are turned up in a line, one more than the number of players.

Players simultaneously point at one card in the line they want to take. If they are the only player at a card, they take the food to their tableau. If two or more players point to one card, nobody gets it (unless the start player in the round is involved, they get it). More cards are dealt to the line, stacking up with cards not previously taken.

Once players have built up their tableau, they may have to shed cards to their neighbours if they have too much of one food.

At the end of the game, the mouse with the most points is the winner.
user summary
publishers: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

name: Mythos Encounters: A Cooperative Horror Miniature Skirmish Game
description:
Cooperative Miniature Encounters in the Cthulhu Mythos.

Mythos Encounters is a miniature skirmish game of the Cthulhu Mythos. This is a cooperative game, in which Investigators work together to face the horrors of ruthless cultists, mysterious alien creatures and the elder gods themselves.

Your investigators can face enemies head-on, trusting in your strength and weaponry, or take a more subtle approach using stealth and gathering clues to gain an advantage.

Enemy creatures in Mythos Encounters change from encounter to encounter, and their behavior is determined by a variety of AI tactics.

As your investigators progress through each encounter, they will gain new abilities, equipment and allies that will allow them to face even greater threats. They may also gain permanent physical injuries or debilitating mental disorders.

Mythos Encounters is played as a series of linked encounters using your own terrain and miniature figures. This game has no official terrain or miniatures.

—description from the publisher
categories: Horror, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield Vivid Voltage Expansion
description:
Discover new brilliance and maximum power in the Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield—Vivid Voltage expansion. Even more Pokémon V are lining up to battle, including the newly discovered Mythical Pokémon Zarude! Unique new Amazing Pokémon burst onto the scene with a rainbow splash, alongside more Pokémon VMAX…including the splendor, the majesty, the delightful round wonder that is Gigantamax Pikachu! Put a little color and a lot of spark into your deck or collection with the Sword & Shield—Vivid Voltage expansion!


Over 185 cards
Dozens of recently discovered Pokémon from the Galar region
11 powerful Pokémon V and 6 enormous Pokémon VMAX
More than 15 Trainer cards and 4 new Special Energy cards
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mist Fleet
description:
In Mist Fleet, each player leads a battleship fleet. The object of the game is destroy all of your opponent's ships.
In each turn player fire cannon to opponent's fleet, opponent announce hit or miss, but they can lie.But this game is also suitable for those are not good at lying, because all lying ablity is given by ship itself.

Each player has 6 ships and 6 empty sea cards,place their 12 cards face down to form a 4x3 formation
Each player on his turn has 2 actions.
For each action, player has 3 options
1) Attack directly: attack 1 of opponent's card. The opponent look at his card. If it is a ship, he say “Hit”, if it is not a ship, he say “Miss”. Put “Hit” or “Miss” token on that card.
2）Attack adjacently: attack a space between two cards. The opponent look at both his cards. If either of them is a ship, he say “Hit”; if neither of them is a ship, he say “Miss”. Place “Hit” or “Miss” token between margin of two cards.
Whenever a ship's life point is equal of below 0 (life points on card minus “Hit” on the ship card and around the ship card), the ship is sunk. Ship's owner shall flip the card face up.
3) Radar scan. Scan one cross point of two margin lines. Opponent look at his cards around scan point.Opponent count all this cards current life point and say that number. Put a radar scan number token on that point.

Basic game is for 2 players. Support up to 4 players by using two copies of game.

在《雾海舰队》中，玩家将带领自己的舰队，在迷雾之海中与对手决战。玩家可以通过炮击或雷达扫描的方式，找出并摧毁对手的舰队。最先击毁敌方所有战舰的玩家获胜。

name: Owonikoko (The Money Hustle)
description:
Owonikoko is played over seven rounds in which all players are engaged in the money hustle, striving to be the richest at the end of the game.

On active player’s turn the following actions are possible, however only 3 actions are permitted on active turn. This can be a combination of any action here or a repetition of one totaling 3 actions.
1. Draw card: player draws a card from the top of the draw deck
2. Play an action card (A.C): player plays an action card from hand and resolves said action
3. Play a counteraction card (C.C): player plays a counteraction card to stop or effect current active action
4. Sell goods: play goods card and gain gold accordingly

When not the active player, only one action is possible and permitted during other players turn
1. Play a counteraction card: play a C.C card to cancel effect of an active card, however this can only be done once while that player is active.

End of Game:
At the end of seven rounds, all players reveal their gold and richest player wins. If players tie, player with most goods win, if not they share victory.

-description from designer

name: Sea of Legends: Tantrum House Promo Pack
description:
This promo pack contains two cards and was made available in the 2020 Tantrum House Kickstarter.

Ruffian: Exhaust to discard 1 Crew and gain their Gold value in Bonus dice.

Rogue: Exhaust after you take a Port action to gain 3 Gold.

name: Masters of The Universe: Fields of Eternia The Board Game – Hordak with Horde Wraith
description:
Fear the Horde! Play as Hordak with the Horde Wraith with this limited edition package which contains:

1 x Hordak with Horde Wraith limited edition figure
1 x Game card

No glue required to assemble.
Item is available in Europe only.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Team-Based Game

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Rogue's Gallery
description:
Life among the stars is not for the faint of heart, but the lure of riches and adventure draw from all walks of life. Nobles and scoundrels rub shoulders, while saints and sinners make common cause. On the mains, everyone has an agenda and no one is what they seem.

Rogue’s Gallery is the third Expansion Pack for the Traveller Customizable Card Game. These 60 cards have a special emphasis on new crew with higher cost and more potent abilities.

This is not a standalone product. A Ship Deck is necessary to play the Traveller Customizable Card Game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Elf and Dwarf Biased Referees
description:
Blood Bowl referees carry the weighty responsibility of interpreting and enforcing the sacred writings of Nuffle. They're entrusted with the vital duty of upholding the values of the beautiful game and ensuring both teams strictly follow the rules and compete fairly. Good job so many of them are open to Bribes then, because that sounds a bit boring.

Purchase a Biased Referee for your games and use these awesome models to remind you of any remaining Bribe attempts while making your games more immersive.

These plastic models are supplied in 8 components, allowing you to assemble one Dwarf and one Elf referee. The models are supplied with 2x 32mm Round Blood Bowl bases.

This item is contained in Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Le Tour de France
description:
Considered the classic version. This game has had multiple editions but no known edition has any credits on it. The board features the stages of the 1933 tour.

It is a game of goose. If you land on a field occupied by another player, you throw your dice again, and if you throw less (than the number you have thrown to land on that field), you go back to where you came from. On the other hand, if your throw is equal or higher, it is the other player who goes back to the field where you came from.

The first player to reach Paris wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Battlegroup: Overlord – D-Day
description:
A wargaming supplement for the invasion of France, 1944. A 136 page softback reprint of the “D Day” section of the original Overlord campaign supplement.

Scenarios and Army lists for: British airborne and amphibious assault battlegroups, US airborne and amphibious assault battlegroups, German atlantic wall resistance nest and Ersatz panzer. Extensively researched background and comprehensive equipment data, including specialist equipment for amphibious assaults.

Please note this is a supplement and a copy of the Battlegroup ruleset is needed to play the game.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: What the What?!: The Party Game Reinvented
description:
WHAT THE WHAT?! is a 3-10 person party game where players compete to invent outrageous new uses for genuine old-time inventions. Featuring audacious attempts, fantastic fails, and kooky contraptions from the world’s patent archives.

It’s easy to play. The Investor reveals an illustrated invention card. Players become the Inventor and channel their inner hustler, comedian, and entrepreneur to pitch the most outrageous - or accurate - explanation of WHAT THE WHAT?!! is that?

How To Play
At the beginning of the game, each player is dealt 10 Pitch Prompt cards. Take one Invention Card and place it on the table. The Investor acts like a judge and the remaining players are Inventors, whose job it is to pitch these oddball inventions and impress the Investor to score points.

Inventors have 1-minute to write down their pitches or select one of their Pitch Prompt cards to use as a basis for their pitch.

“What you need when…” or “For people who….” or, “A device for...”

The Investor hands out points and turns the inventions over and reads the back of the card, revealing information about the invention. The next player to the left becomes the next Investor, and so on until every player, in turn, has been the Investor once.

Game over!
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Flames of War: Missions Pack
description:
With the rulebook now adopting the revised victory conditions from the old More Missions pack, we've updated it (now just called the Missions pack) to reflect this. We've also added the missions from the Experimental Missions pack as well, consolidating them all in one place. Includes 6 print and play cards.

The pack contains Twenty missions: • Annihilation • Breakthrough • Bridgehead • Contact • Cornered • Counterattack • Dust Up • Dogfight • Encounter • Encirclement • Encounter • Escape • Free For All • Escape • Fighting Withdrawl • Free for All • Gauntlet • Killing Ground • No Retreat • Outflanked • Scouts Out • Spearpoint • Vanguard •

Each mission has a double page telling you how to play the mission and detailing the mission special rules. You can either print each mission out on a single piece of paper (front and back) or print it as a booklet with each mission on facing pages.

The Battle Plans mission selector allow you and your opponent to choose the most appropriate missions for your forces. Each player chooses a plan (Prepared Attack, Hasty Attack, or Defend) and then you look up a table to see which mission to play and who will be the attacker.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Inn & Stable Owners (fan expansion to Carcassonne)
description:
Inn and Stable owners of Carcassonne are fed up with the thieves getting all the points by owning the road.

In this Expansion the different features on the Carcassonne tiles can be used to get points even if you do not own the road.

A new way to score the Inns and the Stables.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Anno Domini 1666: Veterans of the Tercios – Hidalgos Commoners Set
description:
Hidalgos are an impoverished Spanish nobles. Often all their worldly possessions comprise a patchwork jacket, a rapier by their side and sometimes an old pistol. An old hat and a cloak are their shelter. Their faces are scarred, mostly because of drunken brawls rather than great battles but don't underestimate them - they use weapons with deadly efficiency.

Impoverished Spanish nobles.

3 plastic miniatures
6 Character cards including three cards exclusive for this expansion: 2 x Hidalgo Veteran & Cabo
6 item cards

-description from publisher's website

name: Spacers
description:
You are a spacer; a freelance space traveler in a brand new solar system. You have a ship, a handful of spacebucks, and a wealth of opportunities. How will you become famous?

Spacers is a space adventure game where the goal is to become the most famous traveler in the solar system. You are free to earn fame in a variety of different ways, allowing you to live out the space adventure fantasy that you want. Engage in pick-up and deliver tasks, dice-based combat missions, and even choose-you-own-adventure style encounters!


Trading! Exploring! Smuggling! Pirating!
Evolving supply and demand system
Encounters with varied outcomes
Randomized setup
Virtually limitless ways to play


—description from the designer
mechanics: Events, Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Set-up

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Sherman Firefly Expansion
description:
This tank acts like a tank destroyer with a massive Firepower 6 stat, but benefits from the medium tank rule that allows it to re-roll a blank attack dice! Use the included Heavy (APCR) Shell ammo upgrade to get even more bang for your buck (or points) or the crew card Concealment to buff your defense if you are planning on lurking in cover.

Inside the Sherman VC Firefly Expansion Pack, you will find a highly detailed, assembled, pre-primed plastic Sherman VC Firefly tank miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalised to match your requirements using the five crew, module, and upgrade cards included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Trans-Europe
description:
The game is played on a stylized map of Europe with a printed transport network. Players are given a starting location, a destination, and 4 transportation orders to 4 European cities. Players set a driving route and move their pieces across the transportation network. The movement is controlled by a turntable. Depending on the freight, one of the 8 possible directions and speeds of travel can be selected 4 times truck (slow), 2 times freight train (medium) or 2 times freight express train (fast).
In his turn, the player rolls the dice once and must either draw and execute an event card or turn the turntable to the left or right and move his figure accordingly. Cities with transport orders and the destination city must be reached exactly.
The player who arrives first at his destination city wins the game.

—user summary

name: Monopoly: Leuven
description:
The student city is for sale!
Leuven, city with historical pearls, beautiful shopping streets and idyllic squares and parks.

Monopoly Leuven is the ideal way to (re) discover Leuven in a different way.
Visit St. Peter's Church, build a hotel on the Grote Markt, buy the Arenberg Castle, organize a performance in the Stadsschouwburg, go shopping in Bondgenotenlaan or treat your friends to a café on the Oude Markt.
This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beauty that Louvain has to offer.

For the real collectors there is also the Limited Edition. Only 100 hand-numbered copies of this edition will be made. The box gets a unique, stylish sleeve and contains 6 wooden pawns that are only available in this edition.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Chaos Chosen Team Card Pack
description:
Redesigned for the Second Season ruleset, this deck of 44 cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles for your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Chaos Chosen teams.


5 Player Reference cards for Beastman Runner Linemen, Chosen Blockers, Chaos Trolls, Chaos Ogres and Minotaurs
2 Star Player cards for Morg 'n' Thorg and Lord Borak the Despoiler
8 Random Event Special Play cards
8 Miscellaneous Mayhem Special Play cards
20 Blank Player cards: 13x Beastman Runner Lineman, 4x Chosen Blocker, 1x Chaos Troll, 1x Chaos Ogre, and 1x Minotaur
The all-important card explaining how to use the other cards, with a red card on the reverse


–description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Farting Frenchies: Tiny Pups Fart, Too!
description: Stand-alone game and expansion pack featuring a selection of non-Frenchie breeds of dogs. More stink, good smell cards, and actions cards are also included.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Farting Frenchies: Labs Fart, Too!
description: Expansion pack featuring a Labs (Labradors). More stink, good smell cards, and actions cards are also included.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Escape Room: Das Spiel – Megapack
description:
Can you ceep a calm mindset?

The game within the trend! Cooperativly experience the atmosphere of an ESCAPE ROOM within your own living room. In this challenging game you cooperativly try to solve riddles and find hidden hints. It´s a race against time; you only have 60 minutes to solve and master all puzzles. Your game-master - THE CHRONO DECODER - is counting down mercilessly, provides background sounds for intensified atmosphere and sometimes even provides precious hints.

At this game you win or lose together. Every player has to try his best to reach the mutual goal - nevertheless you will only succeed whit teamwork. Those who never completed an ESCAPE ROOM will realise, how quick an hour full of adrenaline can pass.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Lannister Red Cloaks
description:
When it comes to House Lannister, they spare no expense on those that take up arms for the House. The Red Cloaks are the Lannister's elite guards that patrol the streets in both King's Landing and Casterly Rock. Their resplendent red cloaks, their signature feature, is colored not just because it's a House color, but as a show of intimidation to the populace. "Stay in line, or the Red Cloaks will come after you".

The unit box A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Lannister Red Cloaks gives House Lannister players a new medium infantry unit for their force. The Red Cloaks are armored in half-plate, the best that money can buy for mass production. This gives them a modicum of defense, able to turn away blows from all but the strongest enemy soldiers. Being paid well also serves them on the battlefield, as they know they don’t want to lose that next paycheck.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: WOODS
description:
Everything happened so fast… And even if people could have seen it coming, what could they have actually done? David was one of the ‘lucky’ ones. Far from the chaos, yet he felt the impact all the same. Now, trying to understand everything that happened, he found himself returning to a place that called to him.
A place that offered the best possible chance for his survival… WOODS.

Welcome to WOODS. In the first Part of Woods you have the seemingly easy task of simply keeping a fire going, and protecting yourself from the cold in winter. Chop wood, feed the fire, and survive. A simple task at first, but once Winter wanes, the challenge is increased as David will have to learn to farm, make traps to catch small animals, and eventually learn to hunt to survive. Along the way, learn about Davids story from his past and why he must survive.

In WOODS there are no heroes. Just you, the elements, and the will to survive.

—description from the designer

name: Euclio Bold!
description:
The third expansion to Euclio, Euclio Bold! adds five new scoring boards and accompanying suit cards to make your games even more varied and interesting.

Some of the new boards are a bit more complex, therefore recommended for Euclio veterans, but all retain the general simplicity of play Euclio has always had.

Euclio Bold! adds a race track, new scoring spaces on cards themselves, a shared rondel, and a deadly gamble with the purple skull suit. True to the name, these suits include additional interaction points for players to navigate each other's plans as well as their own. Simply add to your Euclio box and experience a new mixture of boards and suits!

—description from the designer

name: Anno Domini 1666: The Locals – Footmen
description:
Anno Domini 1666 is not only a world of brave, powerful heroes, but also the home of less powerful characters.

Thanks to their breastplates and helmets Footmen can survive hits which could kill other characters. Long glaive polearms provide them advantage in close combat, and pistols allow them to fight from a distance.

4 detailed plastic miniatures
4 character cards
16 item cards

name: Incubation: Promo Card Set
description:
Promo card set adding the following cards:

2 mystery eggs cards
2 hybrid eggs cards
4 objective cards
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Farming

name: Stadt Land Unseriös: SOMMER-Spezial
description:
SUMMER-Special of Take It Serious Stadt Land Unseriös with 72 different and innovative categories for great summer time.

--

Das SOMMER-Special von Take It Serious Stadt Land Unseriös mit 72 unterschiedlichen, innovativen und sommerlichen Kategorien für eine großartige Urlaubs- und Reisezeit.

name: Legends of Gold
description:
In Legends of Gold players are seeking the wealth of a forgotten civilization in an the ancient temple. You and your fellow treasure hunters compete for the most treasure, entering from different corners of the large hexagonal map.

To be victorious, you must make it out of the map with health remaining and the most victory points found on artifact, treasure and item cards. With a limited hand size, you'll need to balance Treasure and Artifacts with the item cards you'll need to get out alive. Navigate through the twisted corridors of the 65 hexagonal map tiles to get to the center where the most treasure lies. Each tile will either present a hazard or a trap sprung by an event card drafted by a player on their turn.

After choosing an event card, players will have one free action per turn, choose to either gather treasure or item cards, heal or move through the map revealing new tiles. On every cave-in event the lowest numbered tile is removed from the map. To hasten your escape, you may wish to trade a health for a second action. If you're not fast enough to be the first one out, you'll find yourself racing to find an exit as the map begins to disintegrate at an accelerated rate.

You may be close to making it out, but managing your health to prevent your elimination may slow you down as you stare down at a pit hazard with no rope item card, but then again, how far are the other treasure hunters? Are there any dangers in the upcoming event cards? Is there a week tile about to cave in on your path? Can you take the loss of health by entering the tile? Do you draw Item cards looking for a rope?

—description from publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Events, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Map Reduction, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Zaka
description:
Zaka is a light-hearted strategy card game set in a magical and monster-filled realm called "Zaka". In this game, players each build an army of whimsical monsters and then battle their way to victory using their monsters’ unique abilities and a hoard of dangerous weapons.

This fully self-contained game provides an intuitively easy-to-learn and party-ready spin on the classic genre of fantasy battle card games. To play, each player collects monster cards, upgrades them with compatible weapon cards, then uses their available special abilities to destroy enemy threats and take control of the battlefield. But players must plan their moves carefully to maximise their loot without attracting the wrath of opponent monster armies!

Designed to encourage lots of cheeky player interaction and treachery, this game suits both skilled strategists and first-time gamers alike.'

—description from the publisher

name: Narratore
description:
Once upon a time ... there was a game to invent stories all together in a fun way! Whoever rearranges a sequence of cards first, tells a story inspired by the images and the structure sheet. Who has more imagination?

The structure cards are placed in the center of the table in order from 1 to 5: these will provide the players with the guide for the construction of the stories. The dealer shuffles the inspiration cards and arranges them face down and scattered on the table.

The aim of the game is to conquer a succession of cards from 1 to 5. In turn, starting with the player to the right of the dealer, each draws a card from the table until he has 5 cards each (uncovered in front of him). If no one has a sequence from 1 to 5, the game continues: each player, in turn, draws a new map and discards one in his possession, placing it face down on the table. If a player rolls a series of 1 to 5, stop the game and try to tell a story by connecting the 4 images with the final map and using the structure cards as a template (on the back of each there is a short description for each phase of the story that helps the player to create the tale). After telling the story, the other players give a score from 1 to 10 to the narrator (the votes add up and form the score of each narrator; the scores can be written on a sheet of paper). he used blankets on the bench randomly and draws five more. The game continues in the same way with the player to the right of the last narrator. Whoever gets to 100 points first (or more or less at the choice of the players) wins. Make up stories A child or adult can play alone by practicing making up stories.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Flying Pig Games Scenario Pack
description:
This scenario pack contains three new scenarios (more could be added):

One for Night of Man designed by Mark H. Walker
one for ’65 Squad-level Battles in the Jungles of Vietnam designed by Mark H. Walker
one for Old School Tactical Vol II designed by Shayne Logan.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Aetherstream: Interceptor
description:
Interceptor is the game of space fighter combat to resolve these conflicts. Pitting fighter against fighter, this is combat to control the local space around any important installation, location or convoy.

Fighter movement is accomplished using a maneuver template to choose a destination hex. If the cost to move to that hex is within the fighter's capabilities, it moves there with no problem, if it is greater, players must choose whether to risk damaging the fighter or injuring the pilot to get into that perfect spot.

All rolls (Combat, Piloting, etc.) are performed using a dice pool of ten-sided die with a limit of 10 dice and rolling against a target number of 7. Every dice showing a "7" or higher is a success and compared to a difficulty number. If the number of success is equal to or higher than the difficulty number, the task resolved successfully.

Players build their force from a point value determined by the scenario. Each fighter and pilot has an associated point value. Victory is determined when players accomplishing the goal for their scenario.

—description from designer

We would like to take a few minutes to address the comments that this is not the original Interceptor:

After many, many fruitless years trying to regain the rights to Renegade Legion, we decided to come up with our own new line. Rather than republish the exact same game system of 34 years ago, we decided to improve Interceptor and make it a better, fun and fast playing game. We believe we have achieved this goal.

Sincerely,

FASA Games

-Comment from designer on Kickstarter

name: My Small Garden
description:
You've got a lot of potted plants for your new flat and you've got to make sure that they're all properly placed.

My Small Garden is a cooperative puzzle game for 1 or 2 players and plays almost exactly the same at both player count. Remember which seeds you've planted and manage your hand to put out the pots and plants you need. This small card game combines spatial card placement with memory, variable goals, and deductive elements to create a unique challenge each time you play.

Players shuffle 2 decks and build a 4x4 grid by playing cards one at a time. Players have multiple goals they can pick to win the game. This is made more difficult as some cards are played upside down so they remain hidden til the end of the game for scoring.

My Small Garden combines memory and strategy in a quick little card game.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Math, Memory, Number, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Grid Coverage, Memory, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Komplize gesucht!
description:
Who would you rob a bank with? Who would be the right partner for a small betting fraud? And who would you choose to get the pesky nightclub bouncer out of the way?

The world is full of criminal challenges, and there are plenty of prominent candidates for your next coup: politicians, artists, athletes, actors, scholars, musicians. In Komplize gesucht!, you get to name who your accomplices would be for these crimes and more.

name: Möhrenjagd
description:
Each child is given a rabbit figurine with which to collect five carrots. The figures move across the playing field, either above ground with the result of the white die or below ground with the result of the blue die. A player has the right to collect carrots on certain fields until he is caught by another player, who then takes over this right. In addition, carrots can also be obtained with the white die. The first player to collect five carrots wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Comet
description: The Comet looks a little like the trusty Cromwell but on steroids. It is one of those tanks that you could run naked without any addition crew or equipment if you wanted, trusting it’s great mobility, above average firepower and mobility and finally, outstanding survivability (for a Medium tank). Of course there is also a school of thought that suggests doubling down on your best tank with a few upgrades will help you squeeze a little more out of it. Adding a driver with Preventative Maintenance will reduce the number of incoming critical hits, whilst a commander with Jack Of All Trades will give you that initiative boost when you need it so help you move of shoot at the right time.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M26 Pershing
description: The M26 Pershing is remembered for being a Panther killer and as a Medium Tank it is all about offence, re-rolling a blank attack dice. Combine that with firepower 6 and the M26 doesn’t really need much in the way of upgrades. What are we saying, it was built for Smooth Ride (which allows you to reduce the penalty of moving when firing) and aggressive players that want to get the most out of this tank should look no further than commander Edward Crane who will grant you additional initiative in the movement phase for every two crew on the tank with his Mentor skill AND if you are feeling confident, gives you the opportunity to roll one less attack dice to modify a hit to a critical thanks to Eagle Eye.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Coalitions: Raison d'Etat
description:
Europe is in turmoil! The fire of the Protestant Reformation has engulfed Central Europe, while the nascent Swedish Empire battles with the vast, populous and battle-ready Poland over the supremacy in the East and the Baltic Sea. Will the Holy Roman Emperor remain on his throne? Which side of this enormous conflict will the nations of Europe choose? And will Poland survive the Swedish deluge?

Raison d’Etat is a board game for 1-7 players. It is a standalone expansion for Coalitions, with its own distinct game board and seven playable nations (Poland, Sweden, Britain, France, Spain, Austria, and the Ottoman Empire) included in the box. Unlike other expansions for Coalitions, you do not need the base game of Coalitions to play Raison d’Etat. It comes with all the components, rules and scenarios necessary to play.

Players engage in an exciting area control game of shifting alliances and coalitions, of intense back-stabbing, diplomacy and bold military actions set in an era defined by the upheaval of the Thirty Years’ War and the Polish-Swedish Wars. As in the Coalitions’ core game, Raison d'Etat’s uses the Wheel of War mechanic to virtually eliminate downtime, while the innovative Activator system introduces a new level of dynamic interactions between the players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Negotiation, Variable Player Powers

name: Canine Capers
description:
In Canine Capers you play as a determined dog who is investigating their neighbourhood, sniffing out clues and to solve the imagined capers going on in their little country village. Work together to reach clues in time and secure them at Canine P.D. to earn points and solve the caper of the day.

Clues will pop up around the village based on the outcomes of dice rolls. Players roll dice to determine their 'paw points' for that turn. Using these they traverse the board, pick up, drop off, give, take clues and even increase the value of their clues.

It's a race to get to clues before a new one would be generate in that spot as if the previous clue is still on the board the new clue will be stolen by a sneaky cat and taken away to their toy chest. Not to worry, with a bit of help from the sly foxes on the board you can enhance other clues by swapping them with higher value clues from the toy chest.

Special Actions linked to each number on the die allow players extra abilities that can allow for diagonal movement, enhance clues, move a clue, jump to home, swap two clues on the board or return clues to the resource pool, which can extend your playing time as once the resource pools are empty it's time to take your final turn then tally up your points to see if you've won this time!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Unfinishabell
description:
Take turns placing a card on the left or right of an ever-growing line. The line must always be a potential word, but if you ever finish the word, your opponent wins a point!

Similarly, if you ever place a card so that no potential word can be made (and your opponent challenges), they win a point.

Each round starts with a tricky attempt to avoid making tiny words, and then usually finishes when you run out of long words to make given the cards played.

Played using the ELL deck (which has 2 letter on each card).

name: Contame: Inicios
description:
You can choose beginnings, settings, objects and characters to create the best stories.
Ideal for collaborative play.

Players must separate the deck into 3 groups: "beginnings", "scenarios" and "illustrations". Whoever starts chooses a card from the “beginnings” deck and one from the “scenarios” deck to begin and set the story. Then it will take 5 "illustrations". With all these cards you must create and tell a new story.

name: Escape Room: The Game – Exp 1
description:
It is a three in one expansion pack for Escape Room the Game.
This expansion pack includes 3 stand alone games: Murder Mystery, FunLand, and a new adventure: Temple of the Aztec.

For each expansion, there are 3 parts. Players need to find the keys to proceed to the next levels. You have 60 minutes, start NOW!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: The Reward
description:
Participate in the biggest auction of all time and collect the most money and other assets to win the game! Make your wildest dreams come true by getting the coveted goods that everyone wants!

The Reward is a game for 3 to 6 players and is intended for players 8 years and older.

At the start of the game, each player chooses a residence, a car and another asset, either a curiosity or a work of art. The time of the game is then determined by the players and added to the timer.

Throughout the game, events will be triggered, allowing players to acquire new goods and expand their collection.

Each player must accumulate the most winnings in dollars and other goods.

The game ends when the game time runs out or when all the real estate is gone. The player who finishes with the most money wins the game!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Events, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Trading

name: Fisheries of Gloucester Express
description:
Fisheries of Gloucester Express is an "express" version of Fisheries of Gloucester. It consists of 24 ocean cards, 1 ship card, 8 bucket cards, and 5 rule cards.

At the game's start, both players have 1 bucket to put fish into. The ocean is a 5x5 grid of ocean cards, with the center space occupied by the ship. On your turn, you move the ship and pick up a card. On the first turn, both players may move only 1 space (from card to card). However, the card you pick up tells you how many spaces you may move on your next turn.

Some ocean cards allow you to pick up more bucket cards. The bucket cards have various scoring conditions (based on different kids of sets). Also, some ocean cards allow you to upgrade a bucket -- to give it more capacity and more scoring power.

After all cards are picked up, the buckets are scored and the player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Pugs Fart, Too!
description: Expansion pack featuring Pugs. This stink-packed expansion pack includes 54 playing cards that can be used to expand your Farting Frenchies game to add 2-3- more players. It can also be played as a complete stand alone game for 2-3 players.

name: Farting Frenchies: Celebrity Dogs Fart, Too!
description: This stink-packed expansion pack includes 54 playing cards that can be used to expand your Farting Frenchies game to add 2-3 more players. It can also be played as a complete stand alone game for 2-3 players.

name: Instant Sync
description:
Can you tell what your friends are thinking or how they think?
In this fun game of synchronization and fun descriptions, telepathically connect with friends

On each turn, players choose game mode and try to synchronize in descriptions to score most points.
Players select two words(one from each card) comprising a modifier and an identifier and write secretly on their sync pads.
Once everyone is done announce and reveal choice of words then score points according to chosen mode.

—description from the designer

name: Chickasaw Bayou: The Battle of Walnut Hills, December 26-29, 1862
description:
Chickasaw Bayou was a grand missed opportunity for the Union Army in its desire to crush the Rebellion. If they had proceeded with haste, the Federals could have captured Vicksburg and delivered a master stroke against the Rebels a sure seven months before Vicksburg surrendered on July 4th 1863.

The Union player is as much fighting against the terrain as the Confederate Army. The third player are the Swamps of Chickasaw Bayou and they are no friend of the Union player.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points

name: Macaron: Kickstarter Expansion Pack
description:
The Kickstarter Exclusive Promo Expansions:


Baristo Expansion - More betting tracks
Emma Expansion - Solo play
Jester (aka Royal?) Expansion - Get a box if the trick has a smaller even card
The King’s Orders Expansion - A quest for royal pâtissiers
Noble Expansion - Events that make every round refreshing
Zero Expansion - Negative cards that will give you points if you have more of them
Sunset wild card - wins any card played by the previous player.

name: Perpetuity
description:
Perpetuity, an artificial star with a system of orbiting planets is misbehaving and slowly sinking into chaos. The inhabitants of the system will soon be lost to oblivion. Time is short, resources are scarce and heroes are desperately needed.

Perpetuity: Grave Descent is a science fiction worker placement game for 1-5 players and plays Cooperatively, Competitively and Solo. Each round players place workers on work tiles to collect resources, repair damaged tiles, upgrade tiles, build ships and eventually fly missions to evacuate alien villages on the dying planets. Players must navigate a quickly changing game where lower level workers become less effective.
