Players must balance choices between keeping systems operational and spending limited resources on ships and rescue missions.

"Perpetuity" itself (the artificial star) can be played by one of the players or a set of A.I. cards. Perpetuity in both cases works against the other players and attempts to hinder their evacuation efforts by unlocking abilities in Gravity, Space, Time and Matter.

In Cooperative play, players race to save all the alien villages and workers. If any are lost when a planet is destroyed, the game ends in failure.

In Competitive play, players vie for the most victory points by maximizing opportunities for points with repairs, exploration, evacuations and collecting resources.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Income, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Top trumps Quiz: Domówka
description: The Top Trumps Quiz House Party game is the best way to get your party going! Test your knowledge in a unique quiz. A house party is as many as 500 crazy questions in categories such as: knowledge, science, names, lifestyle, film, sports, music, numbers.
publishers: Winning Moves International Ltd, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: RollinKrieg
description:
You have just landed form a boat in which you have crossed the Volga river after traveling days and nights in the carriage of a military train. You find yourself in front of a city in ruins and blackened boy smoke. You are handed a rifle with five cartridges and a commissioner orders you and your companions to advance through the rubble among the threatening bullets of the enemy.

Rollinkrieg is a series of Roll and Write games in which you immerse yourself in the scene of the wildest and most memorable battle in human history: The Battle of Stalingrado, during World War II, where the tireless Red Army faced with the terrible Wehrmacht. Barmelej Chapter is the first game in thee series which is characterized by having the emblematic Barmelej Fountain on its stage. The objective of the game is to complete the mission that are given to you before losing all of your Life Points.

1) GAME COMPOSITION:

Game Sheets 1 and 2.
Rules.
Pencil and eraser (or erasable marker).
8 m.m. cubes (optional).


2) GAME SHEET:
Game Sheet 1 contains the map of the scenario where the player will move to complete the mission, as well as Life, Energy and Time indicators. There also the tracks of weapons you got and their respective amount of Ammunition. There are also the track
of Focus, Morale status and record of explored blocks and captured enemy weapons.
On the Game Sheet 2 are the Events player faces each turn.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Die-namo
description:
Die-namo is a quick, fun push-your-luck card n' dice game in which players bet to collect the most cards of a color or number for the highest score at the end of the game.

Game play is simple. On your turn, roll the color die and carry out one of the following actions:

-Collect one card if there are cards in the supply zone matching the color of the die roll.

-Place a bet with the roll of the regular die, if there are no cards in the supply zone matching the color of the die roll, or, if you want to collect more than one card from the supply zone.

If you placed a successful bet you may collect ONE CARD for a single match or ALL CARDS of one color for a double match. However, if you fail, you lose your bet cards.

The game ends when a player completes a set of cards of one color (1 to 6) or before if the supply cards are depleted. The player with the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Matching, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Loyalty or Liberty?
description:
An exciting and replayable DBG and War Game, combined!

It is the late seventeen seventies and the American War of Independence is in full swing. As cannons roar and muskets crackles across the east coast of the North American continent, armies of the Crown and Rebellion clash, and a decisive victory hangs in the balance.

Take command of one or more of as many as seven factions, each with their own traits and advantages as they vie for supremacy in a hypothetical scenario where terrain and unit lists change with each playthrough. Seize the initiative and dominate the field using a unique "Deployment" and "Lady Luck" card-driven system. Master the unique abilities of numerous officers and manipulate events across the battlefields, all while guiding myriad types of troops through varying terrain to victory, achieved by defeating the enemy on the field and raiding their base. Will the French rout the Germans from the field? Will the Loyalists tenaciously hold the line against their fellow Americans in a civil war of their own? Will the Spanish set out to dominate the Natives? Will Britannia reign supreme? It’s up to you, your opponent, and the dice and cards to find out!
categories: American Revolutionary War, Card Game, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Events, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Random

name: Trick Gear: Persona 5 The Royal
description:
A fast paced, action, battle royale game where you face off against 1 to 3 opponents incorporating characters from the Persona video game's universe and power them up using any standard 54 deck of playing cards! Activate special skills and be the last one standing to win!

Players take turns drafting heroes (from the 17 character cards included in the box) that they will use to battle their opponents. Each player shuffles a 54 card standard playing card deck (sold separately) and draws a starting hand equal to the value printed on their current character. They also draw cards equal to that character's LIFE value. Players will then pick one card from their hand to represent their starting POWER (1-10 cards have power equivalent to their numbers, while Jacks, Queens and Kings equal a power value of 11,12 and 13 respectively).

Players then take turns playing different suits and numbered cards in specific combinations to activate their character's own unique battle skills. These skills will either allow you to charge up your current battle power value even further, increase the rate of damage dealt to losing players at the end of the round, or any number of special abilities (like drawing more cards or dealing instant damage to an opponent).

Once all players PASS, everyone counts up who has the current highest power value. That player wins that round, dealing damage to every other player, equivalent to the current rate of damage! Those players must discard life cards equal to the damage rate. If a hero loses all of it's health, that player must switch to one of their reserve heroes. When all of your opponents heroes have been reduced to 0 health, you win the game!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Coalitions: Soldiers of Fortune
description:
This free for Kickstarter backers expansion introduces 6 special non-aligned generals who broadly represent the rulers of minor non-playable European kingdoms and duchies. These generals control certain scenario-designated territories at the beginning of the game. Any nation who captures one of these territories will be able to employ its general as if it were their own – at least as long as the said territory is garrisoned by that nation.

The expansion could potentially change the balance of power in Europe, granting nations such as Prussia or Austria access to additional and much-needed generals. But will that be enough to offset the French military superiority? Quite possibly!

—description from the publisher

name: Los Intocables
description:
Los Intocables is a game of smuggling and chase racing with modular board and houses.

There are 6 board bases to put them together creating a new city each time.
There are different types of cards in a pile: Luckily, record, action, alarm, tip, extra, raid, explosion, incident.
The lucky ones can be kept in hand for later use, the rest are immediately executed and discarded.
There are tiles to place on the board, both police station (secret / fake) and distillery (illegal / fake)
There are 7 buildings, 1 bank, 2 police stations and 2 bars, each building is a player's base.
There are many cars, in cars you can hide tokens as contraband.
The gangsters must obtain as much money as possible through smuggling or theft and the police must intercept them by dismantling distilleries and vehicles
The gangsters win by accumulated money while the policemen do it by the amount of confiscated car-stills.
Control barriers can be placed to prevent exits through certain streets.
Gangsters must flee after delivering contraband or robbing a bank as they are marked until they leave the board.
The strategic placement of the central police and bar buildings and the secret police station and distillery tiles is important as it determines the difficulty of each team.
The police should try to keep distillery tiles away from bars and bars from exits.
The mafia team for their part should try to place the distilleries near the bars and these near the exits of the city to reduce the persecution, always in blocks of buildings and not on the road or street.
The bench is placed by mutual agreement between both teams.
The cars are placed on the board in the module where each player's base is located.
The game progresses as follows, a player draws a card and plays or saves it according to the one that came out, makes a dice roll that resolves how many cars are moving and how much they are moving, there cannot be 2 cars in the same road cell, but it can be overtaken.
The special value die is used to determine how much money is in the bank during a robbery.
The cops must try to intercept all the gangster cars discovered, following a bank robbery or a delivery from a distillery.
When a car passes a secret police station, the police can intercept it by turning the tile and searching the vehicles next to it.
A vehicle with contraband is immediately stopped at the secret police station control and must pay a fine or it is eliminated,
There are letters that give the right to registration and that allow you to see if you are a smuggler or not.
You can also risk losing a police car if you decide to search with a patrol car and there is no contraband, but if there is a shooting of the dice. In the shootout, either party may be arrested / withdrawn or killed depending on the dice rolls and modifier cards played.
You also have to discover and dismantle the distillery tiles, playing the appropriate cards or detect the situation of the secret police station tiles to avoid their controls.
The cards also allow moving the control barriers that close some of the exits of the city, both to one team and another.
The smugglers and thieves achieve their objective as soon as they manage to leave the city and obtain the corresponding economic reward.
The policemen achieve their objectives by preventing the cars from leaving the city, arresting or killing them, and dismantling distilleries.
The game ends when half of the gangsters' troops disappear (cars and / or tiles) or when they manage to accumulate a predetermined amount of money.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Movement Points
publishers: Educa Sallent SA, Sallent hnos, S.A.

name: Go Shopping! ( 購物小達人 )
description:
Get your fists in the air and go shopping! Check your shopping list and put the right items in your shopping basket, and be careful not to lose any unplanned items! At the same time, you should also play the virtue of being kind to others, if you find something that others need, you should be generous to give it back! Free parent-child handbook is included in the game!

Each player takes $10, a shopping basket, a shopping list and a price list.

Players take turns performing Buying items or turning over cards to earn money.

When a player buys all 7 items on the shopping list, the game is over and the player wins and becomes a little shopper!

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Adeptus Astartes – Vanguard Space Marines
description:
The Vanguard Space Marines are the finest reconnaissance and covert warfare troops available to the Adeptus Astartes. Their ranks filled by pious battle-brothers clad in specialised patterns of Mk X power armour and wielding the deadliest weapons available to the Imperium of Mankind.


The book contains a structure and history of the Vanguard formations
A uniform guide and showcase that includes a variety of colour schemes used by Vanguard Space Marines.
A comprehensive range of datasheets providing tabletop rules for every unit detailed in the codex.
Army-wide rules content.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Armada: Seas Aflame Supplement
description:
Ahoy there captains. Seas Aflame is a supplement book for Mantic's game of epic naval warfare: Armada. Take your games of Armada to the next level! With ten new scenarios, rules for fliers and fortifications as well as a full campaign system, the book also expands on the naval background in the world of Pannithor and introduces the next wave of fleets to be released for the Armada game.

Seas Aflame is an exciting new 72-page supplement for Armada. Inside you'll find:


new rules for fliers – take the battle to the skies
rules for adding coastal defences to your games
new upgrades
10 new scenarios
campaign rules that will see your fleet develop over time
background on upcoming fleets (elves, Twilight Kin, Salamanders, Northern Alliance and Varangur)


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame

name: Venice: Da Vinci's Workshop
description:
Venice is at war! The Admiral of the Venetian Arsenal calls for help to fill the armouries. In town, a famous artist arrives from Milan, with talk of flying machines…

In Da Vinci’s Workshop, you can visit 2 new locations. At the Venetian Arsenal, meet Admiral Sebastiano Venier and race to complete communal contracts. At Da Vinci’s Workshop, work with Leonardo Da Vinci and use his newest contraptions to navigate the city with unnatural speed!

With a double-sided extended board, Da Vinci’s Workshop can be used to play the base game with or without these new rules, and is compatible with all player counts – including the challenging solo mode!

name: Biomas Iberia
description:
You are in charge of the repopulation of various biomes of the Iberian Peninsula with its most characteristic fauna: lynx, wolves and brown bears. Each animal has its preferences, if you respect them, meet the objectives of the game and manage to place more animals than your opponent in the biomes, you will earn affinity points. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game is the winner!

—description from the designer

name: Animism
description:
In an uncharted land after a long ice age, players take on the role of one of four tribe leaders setting out to cultivate this mysterious land using the power of spirits. For the prosperity of your tribe, connect the altars left behind by ancient civilizations with pilgrimage routes and deepen your faith in spirits. But be careful of the rival tribes! They may get in your way while taking advantage of the paths you've already built!

Animism is a pen and paper game where you write on your sheet but also other players’ until the game ends.

During the game, each player simultaneously fills in a space on the sheet they receive, then passes it to the next player.
Players fill in the sheet they receive with polyominoes of his or her own color aiming to connect the altars scattered by creating a pilgrimage route. The resources (the power of spirits) needed to purchase polyominoes can be obtained by neighboring routes with other players, but at the same time, there is a risk that your route will be blocked.

Try to get the highest score by connecting many altars on your route while trying to be adjacent to other players' routes appropriately.

The winner is the player with the highest total score on all sheets.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Jaina Proudmoore Champion Deck
description: A pre-built, 60 card deck for WoW TCG, featuring Alliance Human Mage hero Jaina Proudmoore.

name: Relick TCG: Character Deck Osamu
description:
Relic is a card game that recreates the relick manga battles in which you will have to create your deck with one of the characters from the series and fight with different weapons and objects from retro video games such as the power glove and the plumber's star! !

Osamu's deck is based on looking for the cards that you need the most from your deck and bringing them to your hand

name: Relick TCG: Theme Deck Hiperman
description:
Relic is a card game that recreates the relick manga battles in which you will have to create your deck with one of the characters from the series and fight with different weapons and objects from retro video games such as the power glove and the plumber's star! !

The hyperman deck is based on charging your lazer cannon every turn to obtain a very powerful attack.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Bob's Burgers – Quickplay Edition
description: Grill your friends and family's knowledge of TV's fast food-slinging family with TRIVIAL PURSUIT: Bob's Burgers! With 600 questions spanning over nine seasons of the Fox series crude humor and random antics. Players are tested to answer questions from six categories such as The Belchers, Food, Wagstaff School, Songs and Music, Townies and Who Said It to serve up the win alongside a Burger of the Day called the "Bob-B-Que and A".

name: Cross Bronx Expressway
description:
Cross Bronx Expressway is the third game in the Irregular Conflicts Series. It simulates the socio-economic processes of urban development, and the human costs that result, as a competitive city-builder with collective loss conditions. Players control one of three asymmetric factions working in the South Bronx between 1940 and 2000, pursuing their own goals while cooperating to keep the borough viable. Through a card driven sequence of play, they will work to solve the economic challenges facing the area by building infrastructure and organizations, forming coalitions, mitigating the multitude of issues facing the vulnerable population, and managing resources to stay out of debt. Cross Bronx Expressway offers an engaging way to learn about the recent history of American cities, as exemplified by Jane Jacobs’ pivotal work The Death and Life of Great American Cities, simulated through the case study of the South Bronx. Players will experience the conflicting incentives and complex factors shaping urban life, and together determine the fate of the Bronx.

The gameplay is driven by a deck of event cards which determines turn order, and then players spend resources to take actions on map spaces. The game ends after the event deck is exhausted, or earlier if certain conditions are met. Players score victory points at regular periods during the game, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins (unless an auto-loss condition for all players is met).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Action/Event, Events, Sudden Death Ending, Take That, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Rumors and Legends
description:
Rumors and Legends is a new, fun-filled mystery deduction board game. It stars a creepy cast of creatures and Cryptids, like the Sasquatch and Loch Ness Monster. You are investigating the disappearance of Professor Daffle, the world's leading researcher of Cryptozoology, as you travel to legendary locations like The Himalayas and Roswell, New Mexico. You are also in constant peril of getting lost in the Bermuda Triangle!

Rumors and Legends is a light game that can be learned in 10-15 minutes and takes around 30-45 minutes on average to play. You'll find the mechanics comfortably familiar if you have played the usual suspects of mystery games before, but a host of new twists and turns to make the game feel unique, modern and thematically interesting.

A player rolls the dice to determine their next move. Their move may involve moving their mini a specified number of spaces, drawing a Rumor card, moving the door minis, and/or moving to the Bermuda Triangle to end the turn.

The game ends when a player is first to solve the mystery of Professor Daffle's disappearance. There are three components: the Creature responsible, the Location of Daffle's disappearance, and the Incident that was involved.

The player who is able to solve the three components of the mystery is the one who wins the game.

name: Hungry Life: North America
description:
Hungry Life is an environmental education and awareness card game played between 2-5 players and for the whole family, schools and holidays.

It comes in two versions: A Europe continent (English, French, German) and a North America continent (English) featuring species unique to that continent.

Each player starts with their own deck of 20 cards plus five in their hand (player count dependant). You start by placing a primary producer/Base Card to create a new habitat. Each animal card will list what it can eat leading up to an apex predator. Each new habitat is connected as the game goes on, but with human projects such as roads and housing estates these habitats can become disconnected. Animals that could once be moved are now trapped. You must strategically place your animals, human projects and natural events to thwart your opponents.

The game mechanics have been designed to practically demonstrate how humans are causing issues but also how we can help in a simple and family friendly game lasting 25 - 45min.

Each animal card will also feature data about that animal so you can learn things like their weight, population size/trend as well as where they fall on the endangered species list.
In the rules you'll also find a list of organisations that are working hard to protect our natural world.

The first player to place all their cards wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental
mechanics: Chaining, Lose a Turn, Move Through Deck, Square Grid, Take That, Tile Placement

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Night's Watch 2021 Card Update Pack
description: Find all the cards of the 2021 update in this pack of maps intended for players of the Night's Watch.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Expansion counters and rules for Michael Resch's 1914OaO and 1914SmS games
description: These are counters that the designer created as part of an update project for 1914 Offensive a Outrance and 1914 Serbien muss Sterbien games. They include errata fixes as well as new counters to work with the designers additional Optional Rules for the games. A double-sided sheet of explanatory notes and rules is included in this package.

name: Martin Luther, Life and Legacy
description:
Its October 31st, 1517 and a monk in Wittenberg, Germany nails 95 Theses to a church door asking for reform. Soon, you'll be embroiled in religious upheavals, territorial conflicts, and high politics within the Imperial Courts of the Holy Roman Empire.

This card game allows you to make decisions that influenced the political, religious, and economic causes of the Reformation - introducing you to the places, people, and events that shaped history.

You’ll direct the most powerful and influential leaders of the day such as Pope Leo X, Holy Roman Emperor Charles V, and Prince Elector Frederick III - using their talents with care during gameplay.

The game’s simple mechanics combined with multiple paths to victory gives it a fast pace providing excitement and opportunity to the very last play. We believe the unique experience Martin Luther, Life and Legacy provides -- will make it a treasured part of your game collection for years to come.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Matching

name: Pfandstrand
description:
The beach could be so beautiful if there wasn't trash lying around everywhere.

Pfandstrand is a fast and funny bluffing game for 3 to 5 people. The special thing about it: the game consists of only one postcard and can be sent. All other materials needed can be found in a well sorted household. :)

The game is played simultaneously. All players show a number between 1 and 4 with one hand. The numbers correspond to the lanes of the playing field. Only the player who shows a number alone may move his playing piece to the next column; double numbers remain standing.

On their way, the players try to collect as much trash (game chips) as possible. The first player to reach the finish line receives two more chips. The winner is the player who was able to collect the most trash in total.

name: Mole-in-One
description:
Mole: "Ouch! I can dig and build wherever I want, because you won't catch me after all!" Fox: "We'll see which one of us is the smarter one!"

Mole-in-one is an exciting bluffing game for 2 people: One person plays the fox, the other the mole. The mole can only score points by cleverly digging the tunnels. But if the smart fox catches him, the game is over.

Mole and fox start on their starting square. The mole starts and says how many ditch walks he is moving - 1, 2 (3 times in the game) or 3 (1 times in the game) walks. He notes hidden the hill he is now in. The fox may move 1 or 2 hills. If the fox is on the mole's hill at the end of the turn, the mole must admit it and the game ends.

Before his turn, the mole may show himself: he names the hill he is in and notes the points. If the mole has been caught, he adds up the points earned. Now swap roles and see who can score more points.

The special feature is that the game consists of only one postcard and can be sent. All other materials needed can be found in a well-stocked household :)

name: Jenga: Party
description: Gather your friends and get ready to party with this class wood block game. Jenga Party has a fun new element: pull out a block and answer a question, such as: What shouldn't you say to your boss? or What personal qualities shouldn't you exaggerate about? It'll have you and your friends stacking, asking, and laughing, but remember - don't let them topple
mechanics: Physical Removal, Single Loser Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: Brick & Mortar: Promo Starting Stores
description: Pack of 2 new starting stores that provide early access to the jewelry and art markets. Use these alongside the existing starting stores to add more variability to the early rounds of the game. Kickstarter promo
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Market, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Mission:  Ends of the Earth
description:
In this strategic tile placement game, you must help your missionary get to the destination village with the required resources.

During their turns, players:

Place Tiles to travel on.
Stop at Resource Tiles to collect resources.
Surrender resources when Crisis Tiles are drawn.
“Fly” your missionary from one Airstrip Tile to another.
Use your Spade Tokens to move tiles to your advantage.


Players will need to collect 5 different resources to complete their Mission cards. The first player to reach their destination village with the required resources wins this game!
mechanics: Action Points, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: The Net Zero Game 2050
description:
The Net Zero Game 2050 is an event-driven business strategy, sustainability and negotiation board game based on stakeholder capitalism.

The Net Zero Game 2050 gamifies the road towards carbon neutrality in 2050 (or before) by letting each player – four are recommended – become a Business Leader of a portfolio of companies. Each Business Leader may build a team of Green Executives to execute the chosen strategy.

The Net Zero Game 2050 represents a Non-Zero Game where the objective of each Business Leader is to reduce carbon emissions and at the same time increase value creation in order to finance the investments needed to reach zero carbon emissions.

name: Truth or Drink: Extra Dirty
description:
Expands the original Truth or Drink: Extra Dirty deck into a Standalone version. 432 all-new questions guaranteed to shake things up. The set uses the rules from the from the Second Edition of the base game.

Definitely NSFW!

name: A Touch of Evil: Dark Gothic – Hanbrook Manor game supplement
description:
Among the Town Elders of Shadowbrook, none are as influential and secretive as the Hanbrooks. Their grand estate outside of town is known throughout the area for its elegance and mystery.

This 15 card Game Supplement for the Dark Gothic Deck Building Game is themed for adventures at the stately Hanbrook Manor outside of the town of Shadowbrook and adds many new Locations in the Manor, as well as new Events, Gear, the Ally - Lucy Hanbrook, and more! This supplement utilizes the new Roaming mechanic first introduced in the Colonial Horror Expansion. Explore the mysteries of Hanbrook Manor and its surrounding grounds, but beware the Haunting Spectres that roam its regal halls!

- description from the publisher

name: Trick or Treat: The Aftermath
description:
Trick or Treat: The Aftermath is a game where you and your friends split up all the candy you collected on Halloween! Take turns dividing up your Halloween haul and claim the piles that will score you the most points! As you collect your favorite candies, you'll also gain bonuses and tricky abilities to help you get the tastiest mix at the end of the night!

This roll-and-write game uses an "I Split, You Choose" mechanic and takes around 15 minutes for 1-3 players to enjoy.

To setup, give everyone a scoresheet and a writing utensil. Then, pick one of the colors to be your "secret color" and write it on the back of the scoresheet. You will score this color twice during scoring. Now you are ready to roll!

Each round, one player will roll all six dice and divide them into a number of piles equal to the number of players. Then, starting with the next player, everyone will take a pile of dice, leaving the player who split them up to take the last pile. Everyone then writes the die values from their piles in their matching color column and then starts a new round.

The game ends when one player has completely filled two columns. All values are then added up, bonuses are counted, and the person with the most points wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, I Cut, You Choose, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Tramways: Monaco / Chicago
description: Tramways: Monaco / Chicago contains two new maps for use with Tramways.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Shuffle Game & Speed Hockey
description:
Double sided wooden board offers two different games, both based on slinging your pieces with elastic band.

In Shuffle Game players try to move their pieces around a path and land their pieces in a scoring area to get most points. Scoring area is divided in five parts, each giving different amount of points. If a piece lands in "Out" area it scores 0 points. Not being able to land in scoring area results in negative points.

In Speed Hockey players shoot their pieces through small slot in the middle of the playing field. The first player to bring all pieces onto opponent´s side wins the game.

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #73 – Battle of Bir Hakeim
description:
The Battle of Bir Hakeim and the delays which it caused to the Axis offensive contributed to the cancellation of Operation Herkules, the invasion of Malta. The Free French forces fiercely defended the oasis known as Bir Hakeim against a superior marauding Panzerarmee force, taking heavy casualties, but in turn became a moral and propaganda victory in its own right, proving the effectiveness of the French forces.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII North Africa game, including new Free French Soldiers and Squad Vehicle, Germnan Hostiles, Missions, Locations, Objectives, Gear and Skills cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

4 French Player Soldiers
4 French Non-Player Soldiers
4 French Squad Soldiers
1 Squad Vehicle
11 Weapons and Gear
4 Skills
6 Missions
5 Objectives
14 Locations
3 German Hostiles + Events
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: CanDados
description:
Roll the Dice! Open Padlocks! Get Goals! Avoid challenges!

CanDados is a fun game of cards and dice,a push your luck game in which you must manage to open the padlocks of your objectives in order to obtain the score they contain.

Use the action of the special dice to achieve your objectives or annoy your opponents.

Get target cards by rolling the dice. Only one target per turn

On your turn, roll the 5 dice and try to get one of your target cards in 3 rolls. You can roll the number of dice you want in each roll, setting aside the dice that you want to keep, these dice can be re-rolled in the next pending rolls. At the end of your rolls, you can set aside a die with a 1 and then perform its special action (The removed die will not count towards your objective).

Special challenges may also help you get target cards.

The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.



¡Lanza los Dados! ¡Abre Candados! ¡Consigue Objetivos! ¡Evita desafíos!CanDados es un divertido juego de cartas y dados en el que deberás conseguir abrir los candados de tus objetivos para poder obtener la puntuación que encierran.

Usa la acción de los dados especiales para lograr tus objetivos o fastidiar a tus adversarios.

Consigue cartas objetivo tirando los dados. Un único objetivo por turno.

Gana el jugador que más puntos obtenga al final de la partida.

Lanza los 5 dados e intenta conseguir una de tus cartas objetivo en 3 tiradas. Puedes lanzar el número de dados que desees en cada tirada, apartando los dados que quieras guardar, dichos dados pueden volver a relanzarse en la siguientes tiradas pendientes. Al finalizar tus tiradas puedes apartar un dado con un 1 y posteriormente realizar su acción especial (El dado apartado no contará para tu objetivo). Ver dados especiales para saber sus acciones.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Risen Osiris
description:
Help Isis resurrect her slain husband, Osiris and defeat the chaos and destruction of Set.

Solo player micro-roll & write playable in less than 10 minutes. Easy Difficulty.

This game was an entry in the 2017 Solo Game Contest.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Krobe
description:
Krobe is a game that can be played alone or with others.
From 6 years old and over. For games of about 10 minutes.

Krobe revisits the famous game of Memory in a cooperative mode where all the players are on the same team. It takes a playful approach to a hot topic: microbes.
Small but not that cute, germs are everywhere. Use your expertise and intuition to fight contamination.

The objective of the game is to find Patient Zero or save 8 pairs of inhabitants before the team's health is completely degraded.

name: Ich sehe was! Was siehst Du?
description:
A game designed to help children read emotions of people especially during the Covid pandemic where faces are covered by masks.
Made by a childcare worker and designed for use in schools or other educational institutions. Comes with an app and other downloadable games that could be used with that cards set.

The game is more about learning and getting people interested into this topic.
However, the game flow and win condition are as follows:
You have the card pile in your hand and have to allocate the top card to one of the five emotions. Look at the back of the card to check if you were right. If you were right, keep the card and pass on the pile to the next player. If you were wrong put the card underneath the pile and pass it on. If the pile rans out of cards, the game ends. The player with the most cards win the game.

—user summary

Ein Spieler hat alle Karten, nimmt die oberste und rät, welche Emotion es ist. Liegt man richtig, darf man die Karte behalten und gibt die restlichen Karten weiter! Liegt man falsch, legt man sie unter den Stapel und gibt ihn weiter! Immer der Reihe nach! Wenn der Stapel durch ist, schaut man, wer am meisten Karten besitzt. Derjenige hat gewonnen!

—description from the designer (German)

name: The Acts: Persecution
description: The Persecution expansion simulates some of the challenges faced by the early church. Disciples can have their actions limited, and churches can be destroyed, as the forces of persecution affect region.

name: Dwergar: Promo cards
description:
Set of 8 cards available in the English/Polish edition of Dwergar.

4 cards have simply art on them and don't have a function in the game. The other 4 are extra event cards marked 61 - 64:

61. Each player gets 3 gold
62. Each player can light up all his/her furnaces
63. Each player gets 2 stone or 1 iron
64. Each player gets one new furnaces (if available)

—user summary
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Action Points, End Game Bonuses, Events, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #88 – Desert Rats
description:
The evocative nickname "Desert Rats" originated from the 7th Armoured Division, but later expanded to include all the Commonwealth troops - British, Australian, Indian and New Zealand - who fought and distinguished themselves in North Africa. This pack covers the fighting vehicles used by the Desert Rats, as well as featuring the same forces in an adversarial role.

This set includes 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII North Africa game, including:

2 Desert Rat Squad Light Vehicles
1 Skill
1 Gear
3 Action
3 Service Record Cards
44 Desert Rat Hostiles
2 Events

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Khorne Pitch: Double-sided Pitch and Dugouts
description:
This set contains a double-sided, fold-out Blood Bowl pitch and dugouts depicting the home stadium of a Khorne team. One side features the stadium in its standard skull-strewn conditions, and the other the same stadium when the teams have, temporarily, sated Khorne's thirst for violence.

The pitch is made to the same specifications as the board included with the Blood Bowl boxed game, and includes rules for play with each side.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Caucasus Burning: The Nagorno-Karabahk War, 2020
description: An operational design by Greg Porter covering the Nagorno-Karabahk War of 2020. You'll command formations of T-90 tanks, BMP-equipped mechanized infantry, drones, cruise missiles, and squadrons of attack aircraft as you simulate the war between Armenia and Azerbaijan, which took place in the fall of 2020. Units represent battalions grouped into brigades. Maneuver and attacks in the game are done via actions played from a deck of cards, and each pass through the deck represents 2 days and nights of fighting. A game of Caucasus Burning: The Nagorno-Karabahk War, 2020 will probably take a little less than 10 passes through the deck, so it will run a little faster than the actual war.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chit-Pull System, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Endangered: Campaign Cards
description:
The Campaign is a series of up to 5 games of Endangered. Each game must use a different species scenario. Winning a game makes the next game harder, while losing a game makes the next game easier!

Before each game, randomly draw one Campaign card (that hasn't already been used in this Campaign). Each card describes conditions dependent on whether you won or lost the previous game. After reading the condition, select your species Scenario and difficulty, and apply the condition.

Track your wins and losses. If you achieve 3 wins before you suffer 3 losses, your campaign is a success! If you suffer 3 losses first, sadly you have failed in your mission. Good luck!

name: Pentaquark: Campaign Mode
description:
You've just been hired as the new director of the CERN laboratory. Can you guide your team through six experiments and earn enough grant money to fund future research?

To celebrate the return of Pentaquark, Mike Mullins has designed a campaign mode for the original game.

It uses all Colliders – Pentaquark: Colliders (Kickstarter edition) and Pentaquark: Colliders (BGotMC edition) – (also included in the PNP if you don’t have them) and will keep you on your toes. As if the main game didn’t already do that.

name: The Last Tank R&W Version
description:
The Last Tank is a solo game simulating tank combat in the period of the invasion of the German army on the Moscow front in 1941.

Objective: The tank must survive until the end of the tenth turn. When it is destroyed, the game will be over.

To overcome the enemies you need your ingenuity as the captain of the tank, you will make decisions that are put into practice on the battlefield, this is achieved by defending your position and destroying all enemies, using both the cannon and the submachine guns. your tank.
—description from the designer

name: Zip Zap Zop
description:
Zip Zap Zop is a unique combination of deck-building and trick-taking that allows players to play a trick-taking game where they decide what cards they get dealt. This new concept gives the agency and strategy of a deck-building game, while maintaining the quick-paced, tactical nature of a trick-taking game.

The theme is integrated throughout, with players taking on the role of comedians in an improv show. The card play has the players interacting with each other in an improv scene and the new cards they buy are suggestions from the audience for the next scene.

Zip Zap Zop’s trick-taking follows the rules of a standard trick-taker, with a few differences:


You may be able to play more than 1 card to the trick.
Some cards are modifiers that modify a played card.
If a player ever plays the same number as the previous card, then that player may play an additional card to the trick. The played cards then add, forming a new number.
After playing tricks, players will buy cards using the number of tricks they won as currency.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Trick-taking, Variable Set-up

name: Age of Penda: Battle Games In Seventh Century Britain
description:
In this gridded-layout miniature wargame, you take the role of a seventh-century warlord or king leading your army on the battlefield. You must choose where and how to focus your warriors' actions and control the battle’s impetus. The battle is partly fought on the tabletop like other miniature wargames but is also fought just as hard on the Tactics Chart, providing an additional mind-game against your opponent.

Command your units to move and fight in the areas of the battlefield you wish, but leave the actual process of fighting to your units' commanders. This is represented by the random factor of dice and each of your units’ abstract but often-decreasing Battle Rating. Because of this, your focus is kept where it should be – out-thinking your opponent by using superior tactics and exploiting their weaknesses on the battlefield.

Age of Penda is not intended as a heavy simulation of medieval warfare but as an enjoyable, simple, and fast-playing battle game themed around seventh-century warfare.

You’ll find that much of the action is stylized and streamlined. Don’t think of “turns” in the usual wargaming way – in each turn your units may fight or move several times, countered by your opponent after every action, creating a very fluid game but at the same time making cohesive planning difficult to achieve.

name: My Bot Bytes
description:
My Bot Bytes is a fun and fast-paced action programming game that will have the entire family coding without them realizing it! Teaches kids (and adults) some basics of coding!

You are interns trying to impress the Scientist to be the chosen one! Control two Bots to collect spare parts hidden around a Robotics lab. Bots can be coded to move using Navigation control cards but watch out! - the Scientist's Navigation System only gives limited navigation cards. Use logic loops to build logic into the Bots to move around obstacles (which include the Scientist's pets!). Be the first to navigate your Bot to collect all spare parts and complete your assembly board to win!

Game setup randomized so that no two games are alike!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: IQ ringas: Nr. 2
description:
Card game IQ Ring: No. 2 is an educational question-and-answer game. The game consists of a set of 90 cards with questions, 12 special cards to track the score, 4 player figures, 8 surprise cards and an answer book. Each question card contains 3 questions of different difficulty. The first question is worth 1 point, the second 2 points and the third 3 points.
The game progresses in a clockwise direction. First, the question and surprise cards are shuffled into one deck. The player on the left then draws the card. If it is a question card - the player chooses one of the 3 questions and tries to answer it. If the answer is correct, the player goes as far as the question was worth. If incorrect, stay standing or go back if indicated on a special card. If the surprise card is pulled out, what is written on it is executed. The winner is the one who first scores 12 points.
This game can be expanded with IQ Ring: No. 1 and IQ Ring: No. 3 cards.

Kortelių žaidimas "IQ ringas: Nr. 2" – tai lavinamasis edukacinis klausimų ir atsakymų žaidimas. Žaidimą sudaro 90 kortelių rinkinys su klausimais, 12 specialiųjų kortelių skirtų rezultatui sekti, 4 žaidėjų figūrėlės, 8 netikėtumo kortelės ir atsakymų knygelė. Kiekvienoje klausimų kortelėje yra po 3 skirtingo sudėtingumo klausimus. Pirmas klausimas vertas 1 taško, antras – 2, trečias – 3 taškų.
Žaidimo eiga vyksta laikrodžio rodyklės kryptimi. Pirmiausia yra sumaišomos klausimų ir netikėtumo kortelės į vieną kaladę. Tuomet kairėje esantis žaidėjas traukia kortelę. Jei tai klausimų kortelė - žaidžiantysis pasirenka vieną iš 3 klausimų ir bando į jį atsakyti. Jei atsakymas teisingas, žaidėjas paeina tiek, kiek vertas buvo klausimas. Jei neteisingas, lieka stovėti vietoje arba eina atgal jei taip yra nurodyta specialioje kortelėje. Jei yra ištraukiama netikėtumo kortelė, vykdoma tai, kas joje parašyta. Laimi tas, kuris greičiausiai surenka 12 taškų.
Šį žaidimą galima praplėsti su "IQ ringas: Nr. 1" ir "IQ ringas: Nr. 3" kortomis.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: SPLIT
description:
SPLIT is a real-time puzzle game from Japan. Players race to find the two pieces required for forming the shape on the revealed card and score points. The player who gains the most points wins.

スピード勝負のパズルゲームです。目的の形を作るために必要な２つのピースを
誰よりも早く見つけたらポイントを得ます。一番多くポイントを得たプレイヤー
の勝利です。
publisher's summary

SPLIT is a speed matching abstract game from Japan. There is a set of 4 and 5 polyminos on cards. There is another deck with images of shapes. You have to pick which two polymino cards go together to make the shape exactly.
user summary
publishers: Jelly Jelly Games, Musoka Studio, 新ボードゲーム党 (New Board Game Party)

name: Turn Over
description:
In football, champions make the difference!
The club has decided that this will be the turning point, new faces are needed on the pitch and on the bench! The President has left you a nice budget and carte blanche to buy the strongest players, with the certainty that you will do everything to win the Championship (and why not, even the coveted Cup of the Gods).
Turn Over is a solitaire dice and cards game, with a two player variant. Each turn you’ll roll your dice and assign them on the players cards you play to try to score more goals and concede fewer.
Try to make a career in this managerial soccer game.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Economic, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Contracts, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Anno Domini 1666: Dragoon with Blunderbuss and Musketeer with Halberd
description:
A set of special models that can be swapped into the factions in the core Anno Domini 1666 set. A Dragoon with a blunderbuss for the Defenders of the Crown and a King's Musketeer with a halberd for the Musketeers. These characters are considered 'unique' and replace one of the standard Musketeers or Dragoons when deploying a force.

This addition to Anno Domini 1666 was released as a limited promotion during the 2021 holiday season via the Wargamer Games Studio online shops. Both metal and plastic versions of the models were produced.

Contents:
2 miniatures (Dragoon with blunderbuss and King's Musketeer with halberd)
2 character cards
1 rule card
4 item cards
categories: Adventure, Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures

name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Bracer Phoenix
description:
The Shanghai Shield, Bracer Phoenix opens fire! A triple-pilot Jaeger, Bracer Phoenix carries a complement of artillery, including the quad-mounted vortex cannon with a 360° firing arc!

Contents:

1 Bracer Phoenix Jaeger model
1 Bracer Phoenix Conn-Pod
6 x Bracer Phoenix Action Cards
3 x Bracer Phoenix Pilot Cards
1 x Charge Counter
1 x Ammo Counter
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Cherno Alpha
description:
The juggernaut Cherno Alpha joins the battle! This Mark-1 bruiser engages Kaiju threats with thick armor plates and Supercharged Tesla Fists, making short work of careless foes!

Contents:

1 Cherno Alpha Jaeger model
1 Cherno Alpha Conn-Pod
6 x Cherno Alpha Action Cards
3 x Cherno Alpha Pilot Cards
1 x Charge Counter
1 x Ammo Counter
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Raijin
description:
The electrifying monster Raijin charges into battle! This Kaiju’s unique supercell brainstem powers reactive plates, allowing Raijin to store energy then take revenge with deadly attacks!

Contents:

1 x Raijin Kaiju Model
1 x Raijin Kaiju Signature
6 x Raijin Action Cards
3 x Mutation Cards
1 x Rage Counter
1 x Kaiju Blue Counter
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Guardian Bravo
description:
The defiant defender Guardian Bravo has arrived! Packed with the latest J-Tech upgrades, Guardian Bravo uses the Arc Whip to ensnare oncoming Kaiju and bring them down!

Contents:

1 Guardian Bravo Jaeger model
1 Guardian Bravo Conn-Pod
6 x Guardian Bravo Action Cards
3 x Guardian Bravo Pilot Cards
1 x Charge Counter
1 x Ammo Counter
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Leatherback
description:
The rampaging beast Leatherback leaps into action! Leatherback not only has thick skin and terrifying brute strength, but it can also generate an electromagnetic pulse to disable its foes.

Contents:

1 x Leatherback Kaiju Model
1 x Leatherback Kaiju Signature
6 x Leatherback Action Cards
3 x Mutation Cards
1 x Rage Counter
1 x Kaiju Blue Counter
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Earthborne Rangers: Legacy of the Ancestors
description:
A campaign expansion, includes a full playset over 250 new Ranger and Valley cards and 1 campaign guide.

Legacy of the Ancestors features a new story arc that utilizes both the cards and map from the core set as well as the new cards and new maps from the campaign expansion. In it, you’ll journey beyond, above, and below the Valley to explore strange new places and forge new paths.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up
publishers: Earthborne Games, Fantàsia Edizioni, Intrafin Games

name: SuperAce Tennis
description:
SuperAce Tennis is the perfect simulation of real tennis on your table. Instead of a tennis ball, jumping fleas, instead of athletes figurines. To do this, a court with a surface specially developed for this game. Play singles or doubles, organize an exciting tournament with family and friends. The game includes a mobile application that will make it easier for you to calculate the score.

Attack with precise blows or patiently wait for the opponent's mistake. Play, train, improve, win.

—description from the publisher

name: babaOrum: Le choc des chefs!
description:
babaOrum is a board game that plunges you into the world of pastry. To win the clash of the chefs, take your chance and be strategic!

Each player is a baker with a special ability. At the beginning of the game, each player receives an order which is his secret objective and indicates the recipes he has to make to win the game.

Each player is also given face-up recipes that he or she can make.

When it's his turn to play, a player can:

First, validate a pastry he prepared in the previous turn if relevant
Then, try to win recipe, ingredient or action cards, either by betting on luck, or by betting on strategy, or by answering a question about pastry
Finally, he can play action cards from his hand, or prepare one of his recipes with the ingredient cards he has in his hand.


The action cards spice up the game, by allowing to exchange or steal cards, to exchange the chefs' special abilities... In short, nothing is won in advance!

As soon as a player has finished preparing the recipes on his secret order, he wins the game!

name: Karrier
description:
Karrier is a board game where 3-6 players compete. You need to clean up your dedicated area and reach the sacred altar to win. Get rid of all the trash in your land. Beware, some players can be sneaky. Secretly dump trash in other areas or throw it to opponents’ karriers! Blow others’ Karriers up! Form your own strategy and be the first to take all the honor and reward!

On their turn, players draw and play cards, load trash and move around the board.

The game ends when a player has achieved the goal or when the draw deck runs out of action cards.

The first player to clear the Trash token of their own territory and enter the Sacred Altar with an empty Karrier claims Victory.

name: Solluna: Stella Booster
description:
This booster also introduces a new type of card, Stella cards, and a new Heroes of the Legends card, the objective of which is that influence reaches 20, regardless of type.

The 18 new Stella cards and the new Hero card completely change the way you play. You will have to be even more wary of your opponents.

name: Lagim
description:
Explore the magical Filipino folklore of Lagim! Lagim is a one-of-a-kind fantasy card game inspired by Fillipino myths and folktales. Lagim offers a unique and action packed gaming experience made more immersive by its authentic roots and its gorgeous and evocative art. With so many exciting ways to play you deicde your fate-an enthralling game at every turn. Lagim invites you to a fantastic realm of monsters, mayhem, and magic - play the game and discover the thrilling stories and exciting encounters we've carefully woven for you.

No matter who you are and where you are from, an amazing adventure full of infinite possibilities awaits! In this game about strategy and luck. Lagim can be played by 3-6 players. Each player takes turns battling monsters and each while defending their bargyos. During each players turn they are reffered to as the active player. The active player is allowed to play 1 game action each turn and they cannot pass; this action depends on their current cards and strategy and their turn ends once an action has been performed or a battle has been concluded.

The game board is split into 2 realms the forest realm sits at the center of the play area. Each player starts with 3 souls. The last player alive with remaining souls is declared the winner.

—Description From The Publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Mythology

name: La Biblia
description: Students are disappearing in the Cuniculus Academy of Magic. Can you help rescue them from the shadow world? La Biblia is 2 player game of deduction and bluffing. Players try to guess the characters in each other's hand by asking a limited set of questions. The other player must tell the truth unless the Rabi card is in their hand, then they may answer with a bluff or lie.

name: Murder Mystery Party Case Files: Death by Chef's Knife
description:
INVESTIGATE THE MURDER OF A RENOWNED CHEF - Solve a murder mystery with friends. Open the Death by Chef’s Knife Case File to start the crime scene investigation. Famed chef Lorenzo Ritelli has been murdered in his own New York restaurant. The hunt is on to find a killer and it’s up to you to solve this culinary mystery. This Case File includes all the evidence you need to solve the murder. Review every clue and piece of evidence in this unsolved mystery case file.

IMMERSIVE STORY AND REALISTIC EVIDENCE - This Case File includes crime scene photos, suspect interviews, newspaper clippings, and much more to help you determine who committed murder. All the evidence has been curated to present the most realistic experience possible (no fake handwriting). This murder mystery game in a box is the perfect gift for friends and family who love mystery board games and is perfect for family game night, an evening with friends or for date night for couples who love cold case murder mysteries. Get your Sherlock on to solve this murder mystery.

DETERMINE MOTIVE, MEANS AND OPPORTUNITY - Murder Mystery Party Case Files is the only game where players solve the murder the way a real detective would. Players need to hunt through the evidence to find the killer and determine the motive, means and opportunity of each suspect. During a murder investigation, a detective must answer the following 3 questions: 1) Motive: Who had a reason to kill the victim? 2) Means: Who had access to the murder weapon and victim? 3) Opportunity: Who had a chance to kill the victim? Is any particular person unaccounted for during the time the victim was killed?

ONLINE HINTS AND SOLUTIONS If you get stuck anytime during your investigation, you can access misplaced case files online for hints to keep you moving. Once you think you know the solution, access complete solutions online to confirm your suspicions and make an arrest.

Case File Contents:
· 5 Evidence Photos
· 1 Postcard
· 45 Pieces of Case Evidence and Instructions
· Online Access to Hints and Solutions

Crime Location: New York City

Background: Famed chef Lorenzo Ritelli has been murdered in his own New York restaurant just before a big event. There are many motives, but only one murderer.

name: Nein Nimmt!
description:
Nein Nimmt! is a trick-taking card game for two players. Players attempt to score lowest by capturing 9s and avoiding as many other cards as possible.

Nein Nimmt! is played with a 36 card "stripped deck", any traditional 52-card deck that is pared down to Six through Ace in four suits.

Card play is traditional trick-taking must-follow, with cards played to the trick then played to a central display following strict placement rules. When certain conditions are met, rows in the central display "bust" and players are forced to collect cards, which give players points.

The player with the least points at the end wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: London
description:
Quiz game about London landmarks.

The board is a map of the city, with a track wandering through it. If a player is the first to land on one of the numbered spaces, he draws the card from the deck of 30 cards and reads out the information on the green side of the card. Then he turns the card over to see what instructions he has to follow. This are fairly predictable; Miss a turn perhaps, roll the die and move backwards, and so on. The player then takes the card and keeps it in front of him where all the players can see it. The card will have a value ranging from 5 to 30, with the value being commensurate with the penalty value of the instruction on it. If a subsequent player lands on a numbered field that has already been taken, then he treats the space as a normal space without number.

When the numbered space 30 has been reached, that player has finished. The others play on. When all the players have reached the 30 space, the 'won' cards are added up and the winner is the one with the most points.

—user summary

name: ジャムセッション (JAM SESSION)
description:
ジャムセッション (JAM SESSION) is a card game from Japan with cats playing jazz (not to be confused with Jam Session).

Players each uses their own deck of bidding cards to gain musical instrument cards for their jazz band. Each player deck has its own set of numbers.

A selection of instrument cards are made out to be bid upon, and players choose from their hand a number of cards to bid face-down. When the bids are shown, the highest bid chooses an instrument first, then the next highest bid and so on.

The players decks have different sets of numbers, and every instrument card in the game is unique.

There are seven kinds of instruments, appearing in four colours. The more different instruments a player gathers, the more points they score. But after scoring, they must discard the most cards in one colour. So by gathering diverse colours, they can quickly reform their band and score again.

Scoring occurs at the end of each round (a jam session).

If a player gets all seven types of instrument into their hand, they instantly win the game. Otherwise the most points wins at the end.

The way the instruments are selected for bidding also depends on players' hands, so they are not simply appearing randomly.
user summary

名も無き猫達の演奏会

概要
このゲームはJAZZをテーマにしたカードゲームです。
貴重なメンバーが去って行かないように注意しながら、様々な楽器を演奏するメンバーを集めることで勝利を目指します。

ゲームの流れ
〇準備
各プレイヤーは４つのデッキから１つを選んで受け取ります。
デッキはそれぞれ内容が異なるので、デッキによって最適な戦略は異なるでしょう。

進行
基本的な流れは以下の通りです。
　・手札の補充
　・手札を１枚ずつ出す
　・場札を１枚ずつ取る
　・セッション（点数計算）
　・撤収
　・次ラウンドの準備

・手札の補充
自分の山札から１枚だけカードを引いて手札に加えます。
山札が尽きた後は補充は無くなります。

・手札を出す ⇒ 場札を取る
プレイヤーは場に出ているカードを１枚ずつ取るのですが、カードを取る順番を競りで決定します。
そのためにプレイヤーは手札から１枚ずつカードを出します。

数値の大きいカードを出したプレイヤーから順に、１枚ずつ場に出ているカードを取ります。
ただし、最も小さい数値を出したプレイヤーのみ『場のカードを取らない』という選択ができ、戦略上とても重要になります。

・セッション ⇒ 撤収
規定枚数のカードを取ったプレイヤーは、その度に点数計算を行います。
獲得したカードの『種類』が多いほど、点数が多く貰えます。
点数計算の後、最も多い『色』のカードを全て捨てます。

種類が多いと１回に得られる点数が多く、色が多いと点数計算の機会が多く訪れます。
そのため、種類と色の両方を上手く集めることが重要になります。

・次ラウンドの準備
最初にカードを取ったプレイヤーが『リードカード』を受け取ります。
リードカードを持っているプレイヤーが、次ラウンドの最初に手番を行います。

勝利条件
カードを使い切ったときに最も得点の高かったプレイヤーの勝利です。
ただし、ゲーム中に７種類のカードを全て集めたプレイヤーがいた場合、即座にそのプレイヤーの勝利となります。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Selection Order Bid, Set Collection

name: Die Seehunde
description:
Die Seehunde is a solitaire nautical wargame set in the last months of World War 2. You, the player, will be in command of a two crew midget submarine Type XXVIIB called “Seehund” (Harbor Seal; plural “Seehunde, die”) or simply “Hund” (Hound) by its crews. Equipped with two G7e Torpedoes, the Seehund was designed as a short range commerce raider for deployment in the North Sea.

The game play is divided into two games, which are connected to each other. You will start with the Strategic Game, which is played on a geographic map of the British Channel and it surrounding coasts. Here you will be at risk of encountering different events and challenges while searching for
convoys to attack. Once you find a convoy, the Strategic Game pauses, and you switch to the Tactical Game, which is played on a large map, which is centered around the encountered convoy. You will try to maneuver as close a possible to identify the individual vessels
and pick the biggest fish. For torpedo simulation, the game uses a simplified mechanism, which allows you to attack from any angle and any range with minimal restrictions. Once there is no more to achieve against this convoy, you will try to escape the scene by grounding your submarine on the seafloor and hoping for the best.

After your escape, play will continue with the Strategic Game, where you can now choose to continue your journey, or head back to the home harbor of IJmuiden. Once you reach harbor, the game comes to a happy ending. But don’t be fooled, as there is only one happy end, and a dozen ways to die in the cold waters of the North Sea.
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Events, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Mormont Bruisers
description:
House Mormont’s Bruisers Make a Dangerous Foe to Attack

House Mormont’s sigil is a great bear. Strong, tough, and decidedly deadly, the House’s sigil fits well with the troops that they field in war. For example, thought the unit known as the Bruisers are not highly armed or armored, no foe wants to see them on the other side of a battlefield. Their tenacity means that they don’t stop fighting until the very last one of them is cut down.

The House Mormont Bruisers Unit Box for House Stark in the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives players a rough and tumble melee unit for their forces. They eschew heavy armor and shields in exchange for raw attacking power, enough that their ferocity even shows through when defending. Their light shields are equipped with a punching spike, letting them be on the offensive even when on the defensive. Enemies must be wary of missed attacks when going after the Bruisers.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: The Flood: Rising Waters
description: A 5-6 player extension

name: Smart10: Pelaaminen
description: 50 new cards and 100 new gaming related questions. Requires base game for play.

name: Kings of War: Clash of Kings – 2022 Edition
description:
This supplement for Kings of War introduces two whole new armies to the game, the Halflings and the Riftforged Orcs.

As well as all the background and lists for these two new factions. there's a narrative campaign with new scenarios and the annual Clash of Kings game update. This supplement has big changes to magic, new items, and spells, and new and changed units for every army. Formations are back too for every list, and there is a slew of new heroes.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Measurement Movement

name: Reveal
description:
This fun and exciting trivia-style board game will put your knowledge to the test and provide hours of entertainment for the whole family. Reveal is a dynamic and engaging board game with a difference: there are no questions, only answers!

Reveal can be played as individuals or in teams and the object of the game is to guess the hidden movie, TV show and song titles to gain medals and walk the red carpet to be crowned Champion of the Titles.

The answer card is loaded into the Reveal card sleeve and then the card is pulled out to reveal only the first letter of each of the words in the title. The player then has two guesses, or 30 seconds, to correctly name the title and win three medals. An incorrect guess will result in the second letter of each of the title words being revealed but the quicker the title is guessed the more medals that are won! Once a player has scooped 15 medals it is time to head for the winner’s square at the centre of the board via any of the Red Carpet routes. In order to be crowned the ultimate Champion of the Titles a player must solve one final title from a category chosen by an opponent!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Kazuni
description:
Kazuni is a board game that brings all the strategy of building and maintaining supply chains to life in a way that is fun and refreshing.

Players begin by building factories that are used to produce supply crates for a starving city. These crates are delivered as player explore a dynamic, mystery board and purchase the transportation needed to move those crates.

Players are faced with economic challenges while also handling the randomness of an Opportunity Deck that furthers their chains or inhibits their opponents.

Players collect their income for the turn, then take two actions which can be map exploration, supply chain construction, and/or drawing a card from the deck. After performing their actions, any supply crates that currently exist within a player's supply chain will move according to their capacity. After cargo crates have moved along the supply line, players end their turn by building additional supply crates at any and all factories the player has constructed.

Once a player has successfully delivered 25 crates from their factories to the center tile (City tile) they win the game!
mechanics: Events, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Race

name: Ork The Casbah
description:
This game was attached to the ioGioco 18 magazine.

Finally the Ork Pistols concert tonight! In the Casbah, the coolest rock cave of the Desolate Lands, the punk-ork clans are ready to throw themselves under the concert stage in a frenzied Pogo, by dint of jumps, chases and shoves.
Will you be able to make your clan conquer the best places and keep its members as united as possible, according to the motto of “If the kids are united… then we'll never be divided”?
The evening promises to be very, very… eventful!

In this game, the results of the dice are used to make the members of our rocker orc clan reach the best positions. And eventually to displace rival orcs.
There are two sets of dice. One represents the entry queue. The other set, called "the reserve", is used to choose which die to take from the queue and use for our placement. Then rearrange the queue with the die taken from the reserve.
If you don't have 6 pairs of dice of the same color, there are tiles and rules in the magazine for using only 6 dice.

name: Murder Off Miami
description:
Documents, photographs, police and criminal reports, and pieces of evidence presented in the order they are received by Florida detective Kettering contain clues that allow the reader to determine who murdered British financier Bolitho Blane.

An early progenitor of the modern mystery suspect / cold case tabletop games.

name: The Carniverse
description:
Imagine a world where you are no longer the top of the food chain. A world where society has fallen, governments cease to function, and countries fall into chaos. A new primeval world where the surviving members of humankind must band together in order to fight for their existence over scarce resources.
A new world filled with hungry, feral dinosaurs.
This is the world of The Carniverse. Will you lead your team of survivors to victory against their foes? Or will they become just another snack for the new gods of our planet?

This is a scenario-driven miniatures skirmish game played on a 3'x3' surface with terrain features. Each player controls a team of survivors battling against other teams of survivors for resources while trying to not get eaten by dinosaurs. Each team has specific skills and abilities. They are created based on available Resource Points.
Each game is divided up into five phases that make up a single game turn when combined.
The phases that make up a single turn are:

The Dino Phase
The Movement Phase
The Shooting Phase
The Melee Phase
The End Phase


When the last phase is finished, the cycle begins again until any victory or loss conditions for the scenario are met.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: エジプトウォール (Egypt Wall)
description:
エジプトウォール (Egypt Wall) is a game from Japan. Players are constructing Egyptian wall murals. Players can choose cards to add to their panel, or to improve the way their panel scores. Balancing the choices is a challenge.

The game has a set of score cards laid out in a column, and panel cards depicting various Egyptian characters laid alongside each score card. As players take panel cards, they place their own cubes on the scoring section of the score card.

When a player takes a new panel card, it is placed at either end of their display, or between existing cards. But players cannot shuffle the cards around as they like.

The panels depict various figures, some holding decorated items, some showing their eyes, some facing to the left or right. As the panel builds up, players want to optimise their scoring with the right panels in the right place.

Some scoring cards have limits that must be exceeded or restricted, such as more than 3 of one image, or fewer than 7. Some cards have very particular scoring, such as create a line of mummy, eye, eye, woman. The mix of figures on the panels and the mix of scoring needs creates a difficult choice for players.

The game is played over two rounds, and the player with the highest score at the end is the winner.

The second edition had some tweaks to the rules and the card contents to improve gameplay.
user summary

name: The Malinsay Massacre
description:
Crime Dossier 3 of a 4 book set that was an early progenitor of the modern mystery suspect / cold case tabletop games.

The Earl of Malinsay is dead, and ruin comes to an ancient family. Did the valet really murder his master, or did the mysterious foreigner send poisoned sweets to Viscount Raeburn? Whose handwriting is on the label and who put arsenic in the peppermints? Is the beautiful Countess conspiring with her lover or is the secret of the Malinsays hidden in the past?

name: Hello Kitty: The Worldwide Game
description:
Hello Kitty and her Friends in an exciting and adventurous race around the world.
Take a card, move your piece and be the first to reach the Beatyfull Place. Collect fantasy cards and earn precious objects along the way.
Who will be first to end their journey?

name: SHASN: India 2019-20 – Ideology Cards
description: This campaign deck, with an Indian elections of 2020 theme, changes the ideology cards included in SHASN base game to immerse the players in the politics of the modern India.

name: SHASN: USA 2019-20 – Ideology Cards
description: This Campaign deck with the US elections of 2020 theme, changes the ideology cards included in SHASN base game to immerse the players in the politics of the modern US.

name: Dungeonrunner: Lair of Lawnadynn
description:
The tunnels are a network of confusion. Lawnadynn, the seducer, is aware of your presence. Her ensnared minions await to ambush you. Can you both overcome evil and resist?

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dungeonrunner: Crypts of Rojosh
description:
The dark legacy of Rojosh is a tale that few dare to tell. The unholy works of the jaded cleric caused entire nations to perish. Why are you going into his crypt?

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dungeonrunner: Deck of Deadly Things
description:
You angrily snatch the jester's deck. He twiddles his thumbs as you open it. Drawing the first card, you hear his taunting laugh as you are transported into the Elsewhere. You feel the chaos surround you.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dungeonrunner: Ruins of Narr
description:
The site smells of musty ancient lore. Light upon its depths reveal secrets that were meant to stay hidden away from the outside world. But why? Is there more to this than simply an ancient ruin?
