Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dungeonrunner: Caves of Dey'Lithia
description:
Zoltar has undone something deep within the earth. A living society once trapped in stasis, now released by the mad wizard. Can what is done be undone?

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Vendel to Viking
description:
Vendel to Viking is a standalone prequel to Pax Viking for 1 to 6 players. While inspired by the clever mechanisms of Pax Viking, Vendel to Viking includes some significant differences in the game system as well as taking players back to the centuries prior to the Viking era. In Vendel to Viking, you are immersed in Nordic culture between 550 to 800 CE as you build your family’s legacy with every turn.

You represent a family in one of the Nordic cultures that evolves into one of the prominent families of the Viking era. Each turn represents a generation and you seek to include the best formidable persons in your family as you evolve from generation to generation. You place family members on the map and use them for accessing different effects in various locations, such as worker actions or for even elevating them into a formidable person. When elevated to status, the family member is linked to a character card taken from a market and moved to an achievement tree. The Character goes to your family board and both their presence in the achievement tree and on the family board affects your family’s opportunities for the rest of the game.

You must plan well before the centuries run out! The first to hold two Future-level achievements in the achievement tree wins. If no player manages to do so before a set number of turns, the one with the most points wins.

In addition to having a robust Solo Mode, the end state of Vendel to Viking will interface with the starting state of a game of Pax Viking making it possible to play the two games as a Campaign.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Static Capture, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Pharmageddon: Bugs vs Drugs
description:
Pharmageddon is a medical education card game. A fun way to learn antibiotics and microbiology. Play the best antibiotic to kill the most pathogens with the fewest side effects. There are two decks of cards: Bug Cards (bacteria and syndromes) and Drug Cards (antibiotics). Each player uses Drug Cards to slay Bug Cards which slowly fill up a 3 x 3 playing area. If you successfully match an effective Drug to a susceptible Bug you get to keep matching and killing more. If you fail, play moves on to the next player, and the Bug Card may become more resistant. Each drug has its own side effects and flora costs, though, so choose your Drug Cards wisely. Guess wrong too many times and the 3 x 3 playing area will be overwhelmed. If that happens you lose a life. Game ends when either the players survive the Bug Card onslaught and complete the Bug Card deck or all players lose all their lives.

Solo and versus modes, varying levels of difficulty, and expert scoring options are also available.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Take That

name: Six Greetings Card Games
description:
Six games entirely contained within greetings cards.

The game board is the front of the card, with the rules on the reverse. On the back, cut off the component section and flip out the player aid and you're ready to play! When you're finished, use the envelope as a game box.

The games are inspired by classic board games, but re-imagined with a hobby gaming lens. Various mechanics, player counts and complexity...

A closer look at the six games:

Splinter: A resource management, paper-cutting party game (3-8 players)
Enemy Lines: A head-to-head strategy game (2 players)
Guess How: A cooperative legacy game (1-4 players)
In the Dining Room with the Hatchet: A cut-throat programming game (3-6 players)
Snakes, Ladders and a Pogo Stick: A worker placement racing game (3-5 players)
Another Life: An economic action selection game (2-4 players)


These are big games in small formats.
Give a card that's also a game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Movement, Legacy Game, Programmed Movement, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement

name: Fuzzy Mage Fight: Allies Pack
description:
The allies pack includes 6 jumbo size ally cards and 7 new fuzzy mages. An ally is chosen by each mage at the beginning of the game to aid them in their quest. Allies have special abilities such as adding more attack power, slowing down opponents mineons, and forcing opponents to discard cards. Beware, however, as some of them require payment for their friendship.

Allies: Four-winged owl, Raccoon Mafia, Hired Muscle, Skunk Squad, Possum Posse, Jerry

Mages: Tag mage, Yesh mage, Rugged mage, Drabhu mage, Falala mage, Septimus mage, Niú Gá Táng mage

name: Fuzzy Mage Fight: Silver Fox Pack
description: Silver is based on the artist of fuzzy mage fight. Like the mage hunters, Silver has his own item cards and even a personal mineon that aid him in his quest.

name: Fuzzy Mage Fight: Mage Hunter Pack
description:
The mage hunters are fuzzy animals that have no magical powers but wield unique weapons that aid them in their desire to be the most "magical" fuzzy mage in the land!

Each mage hunter has 3 item cards that are played in the battlefield that offer epic abilities for fighting against the fuzzy mages.

Mage Hunters: Kiki Hunter, Wraggles Hunter

name: The Longest Trench: Expansion
description:
This is an Expansion to The Longets Trench funded by a Kickstarter Campaign. It consists of a Battleboard and 10 Minicards delivered in a Ziplockbag.

The Battleboard facilitate the battles due to a better overview for the players. The Minicards add some variations to the existing battles.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Mörderische Dinnerparty: Der Rote Engel
description:
Berlin 1928: In the Babelsberg dream factory, the actress Zarah Leandros is on the verge of her breakthrough with her leading role in "The Red Angel". But then the glamorous film diva mysteriously dies in the Berlin nightclub "Kakadu". Has someone from her inner circle brought her career to an abrupt end? The spiritualist Prof. Magnusson wants to contact Zarah's spirit in the afterlife in a séance and find out what really happened. The Professor comes into play as a voice on the CD (or as an mp3 link).
-from the publisher-

At the start of the game, each player receives an individual booklet for their role. The game is played over 3 rounds. Each round, the players have to share information from their booklet and additional hints they receive. Before the final discussion after round 3, one person learns that he is the murderer. After each one's summation, a ballot is taking place. If the murderer gets the most votes, he loses. Otherwise he wins.
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Rival Panels: Spider-man Vs. Doctor Octopus
description:
Take the famous rivalry between Spider-Man and Doctor Octopus to the table with the new Rivals Panels: Spider-Man Vs. Doctor Octopus character pack! In addition to being a brilliant scientific mind and ace freelance photographer, Peter Parker is the amazing Spider-Man, a hero who gained incredible superpowers after being bitten by a radioactive spider. Swinging through the streets of New York on his web lines and wall-crawling his way to the scene of a crisis, Spider-Man arrives just in time to stop the plots of his nefarious foe: Doctor Otto Octavius!

The man now known as Doctor Octopus was once a driven, ingenious researcher who graduated from M.I.T. at the top of his class. An accident while handling radioactive materials fused tentacle-like metal appendages to his body and damaged his mind, warping him into a twisted criminal mastermind and foe of Spider-Man.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Bells Toll for Madrid: Franco´s Offensive against Madrid, Oct-Nov 1936
description:
The Bells Toll for Madrid is a two player free PnP game simulating the advance of Franco´s rebel forces aiming to capture Madrid in the early stages of the Spanish Civil War 1936/39.

The game includes a rules set, 192 two sided counters and an A2 (17”x 22”) map; all components will be made available in the files section of this page. Only a six sided die needs to be provided.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement, Minimap Resolution

name: Built for War: Solo/AI module
description: This deck of cards adds the ability to play solo and with AI for smaller player counts!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, World War II
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: TérrAq
description:
TerrAq’s eco game goal is to find ecological actions aimed to rescuing vulnerable species and their endangered habitats.
By using different strategies, it will be possible to become guardian of marine and continental regions, occupy sanctuaries and biodiversity’s paths for fulfilling the missions. Victory points will be earned for each of these achievements.

During the game a dialogue is established in which words like Educate, Protect, Recycle... are part of the gaming experience. TérrAq does not explain how to become ecologically aware, instead in its own dynamic various concepts are transmitted through emotions generated by a fun and challenging game proposal.

BONUS: The back of the board presents a second game proposal. A space for debate that expands the possibility of reading and interpreting the information.

SBD.
Argentine Good Design Hallmark.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Paris: Game Brewer Promo Pack
description:
A card that is part of a Promo Pack Game Brewer created to help cover the rising cost of ocean freight.

Description from the publisher:

Adds 1 air balloon card. Players bid to win a prestigious air balloon ride over Paris.
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Post-Napoleonic
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Soldier of the Queen
description: Soldier of the Queen was designed as a fast moving set of rules for Colonial-era battles. Separate tables were created to differentiate between specific combatants in different geographical regions. Tables are included for the Anglo-Zulu War, Sudan, India, the Boxer Rebellion and the Boer wars. SotQ includes rules for movement, infantry and artillery firing, melee, morale and fanaticism.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Canopy: the Table Top Balancing Game
description:
Canopy is a simple balancing game, played with cards.

Players take it in turns to draw a card from the central pile and build out a canopy on top of a stand. The entertainment and jeopardy comes as the canopy grows and gets more unstable.

As the game progresses, the canopy gets wider and wider and more and more unstable until one unlucky player brings the whole thing crashing down.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Card Game
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: Zenda: le maitre du stress
description:
Objective: Understand and manage stress

Answer questions and complete "Zen challenges" to advance Zenda to the temple. But be careful, you have to get to the end of the course before the ninja, who represents the stress!

Zenda: The Stress Master is designed to help children aged 7 to 14 develop their understanding of stress and their ability to manage it in different everyday situations. The game also leads them to realize that stress is a healthy and useful reaction that is different for each person.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Objectif : Comprendre et gérer le stress

Réponds aux questions et réalise des « défis zen » pour faire avancer Zenda jusqu’au temple. Mais attention, tu dois arriver au bout du parcours avant le ninja, qui représente le stress!

Zenda : le maitre du stress est conçu pour aider les enfants de 7 à 14 ans à développer leur compréhension du stress et leur habileté à le gérer dans différentes situations du quotidien. Le jeu les amène aussi à prendre conscience que le stress est une réaction saine et utile qui est différente pour chaque personne.

—description from the publisher

name: El Albañil de Horus
description:
Elkin is a stonemason Horus spoke to in a dream giving him the secret to end the tyranny of his oppressors under his people.

The objective of the game is to get 3 magic bricks to line up in order to collapse the pyramid!

In each turn, the player will have to move forward (orthogonally or diagonally) one of their bricks, capture one opponent's brick (jumping above it, taking it to their opponent's first row), jump over one of their own bricks, or make a wall movement (move or jump laterally) on the fifth row. Movements can be combined in one turn with the same brick.

The game ends when a player wins by getting three bricks on the fifth row, or breaking five opponent's bricks (when they reach the sixth row).

—user summary

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: Soviet – T-70 Expansion
description:
With over 8,000 tanks built during the war, the T-70 was the mainstay of Soviet light tank units. Straight of the box it combines some fairly average stats, but with a little work the T-70 can shine in any situation with specific upgrades available for the gun and engine.

The T-70 adds another Light Tank to the mix. Built in large numbers by the Soviet army it is a blank canvas ready for commanders to tweak to meet their mission needs. It comes with relatively high initiative (for a Soviet vehicle) but this can be improved through use of the M-80 engine which enhances the tanks initiative in the movement phase – it also works on the SU-76 and SU-122A (spoilers!). As a Light Tank the T-70 doesn’t necessarily have the highest number of hit points or defense but a Low Noise System has the potential to give a light tank a nice defensive buff, if the dice are on your side.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Reavers of Midgard: Tafel der Wiedergeburt
description:
Promocard from the Crowdfunding of Support Berlin Con at Spieleschmiede.

Table of Rebirth

Any: Discard this artifact to take one of your Reavers from your Glory Pile and use it as if you recruited it.

Tafel der Wiedergeburt

Beliebig: Wirf dieses Artefakt ab, um 1 Räuberkarte von deinem Ruhmstapel zu nehmen und sie zu verwenden als hättest du sie gerade erst erhalten.

name: Deception/CS-Files: Greek Promo Pack
description:
A new promo pack with eight new Greek Themed clue cards and eight new means cards.

Greek Salad
Bougatsa
Fireplace
Odyssey & Iliad (Homer)
Airline Tickets
Greek Souvenir
Pita Gyros
Ouzo

Animal Trophy
Jellyfish
Band Saw
Fishing Net
Manhole
Procrustean Bed
Golden Larnax
Scaffolding

name: The War Chronicles of Ganymede Zero
description:
ガニメデ戦記Zero (The War Chronicles of Ganymede Zero) is a two player card game from Japan in which Mechs are enhanced with transparent cards.

The battle for new resources discovered on Jupiter's moon Ganymede was fierce: in 208X the battle using humanoid weapons called Mechs began in earnest, and Mechs with various equipment appeared on the scene.

The game is a card game in which players use transparent cards to equip three Mechs and fight battles with the equipped Mechs; each Mech can be equipped with three different types of equipment: right hand, left hand and back.

Who will be the first to defeat the opposing unit?
user summary

The publisher says:
In the year 208X, over the resources discovered on Jupiter, a war broke out between the Nyekundu force and the Vert force.
On the satellite Ganymede, the foothold for mining the resources on Jupiter, humanoid battle weapons called Mechs were engaged in battles.

In this game, players, each as the captain of a platoon, aim to destroy the enemy force.
The player who destroys all three Mechs of their opponent wins.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting
publishers: さとーふぁみりあ (Sato Familie)

name: Ettin: Win a Game at the Roll the Bones Tavern Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Roll the adventure die and then consult the text on the card for the result.

1. Gain 5 gold.
2. You and your ally each gain 5 gold.
3. Call to Arms!
4. You and your ally each Call to Arms!
5. Add the top card of your enemy's nation deck to your War camp.
6. Take the top adventure card of Age II and resolve as if a success.

name: Dungeon Degenerates: Pickle Imp
description:
Exclusive monster card to be used with Dungeon Degenerates Hand of Doom.

Name: Pickle Imp
Class: Weird
Val: 2xp / 3 gold
Target: Lowest MRL
Attack: 2
Armor: 0
HP: 3
Abilities: Annoy / Evade

name: Kangchenjunga
description:
Kangchenjunga is a game for two to five players aged 7+ which takes 15 to 20 minutes to play. Based on the epic 1930 Himalayan adventure which ultimately failed to climb the third highest peak in the world, the game uses original photos and draws on Frank Smythe's book The Kangchenjunga Adventure, written almost 100 years ago.

In the first part of the game the players recruit climbers and sherpas, and gather a range of other resources. These are all represented on the cards. This calls for a mixture of set-building and push-your-luck, as you aim to bring together the strongest expedition possible. Although the game is competitive, there are ways of helping each other too.

The second part of the game sees the players making their final preparations for an assault on the summit of Kangchenjunga. Some cards may not be useable if the set isn't correct. Then the summit attempt begins and players take it in turns to advance up the mountain. Kangchenjunga is 28,156 feet tall, and successful players must achieve this. But whatever the outcome, details of the players' expeditions can be recorded in the 'Hall of Fame' at the back of the Almanac.

Kangchenjunga works beautifully as a 'filler' game for a wide range of ages. Simple to learn, the game-play has surprising depths and re-playability is high. See the Rulebook and Almanac link below for full details of how the game plays.

—description from the publisher

name: Okko: Legendary Journey – Pajan War
description:
This expansion for Okko Oni Hunters takes into account the Pajan War taking place as Okko and his companions travel the roads of the empire. The conquests of the various great families will, of course, have consequences for our heroes' adventurers!
This expansion expands the adventurers' horizons and they will see that everywhere in the Pajan Empire, the evil threat of the Onis lurks.

name: Center
description:
Center is a game with a deceptively simple goal. It was invented by Alek Erickson and Michael Amundsen in 2022. The game is played on the cells of a hexhex board with sidelength 4 or on the intersections of a 9x9 Go board. A Chess board (which is 8x8 squares) also has 9x9 intersections, and therefore works as a Center board.

Rules:
Players take turns placing one stone at a time.
A placement N steps away from the perimeter must have at least N friendly pieces in sight.
The winner is the player who places a stone on the very center of the board.

On the square board, pieces see in all 8 directions.

—description from the designer

name: Borikén: The Taíno Resistance
description:
Borikén — that is, modern-day Puerto Rico — is now home to a people that proudly trace their heritage back to its Taíno, African, and Spanish roots. These three different cultures were brought together by some of the worst measures of the human condition — greed, slavery, and genocide — but the result is a vibrant culture, rich with history and traditions, and known for its beauty and passion.

The Taíno people are gone, but they live on through the people who are trying to connect the broken pieces of their culture almost five hundred years later. To that end, this game tells the story of Borikén through the eyes of the Taíno people, a people who existed and faced their own challenges even before the Spanish arrived on their shores (pre-1493), who rallied together to try to rid their home of the overwhelming invaders (1493-1512), and in failing to do so had to make hard sacrifices so that a few might survive (1512-1529).

In designing and developing Borikén: The Taíno Resistance, we decided that in an effort to convey a holistic picture of the Taíno people, no part of their story could be left out, so the campaign game combines three unique scenarios, each covering one of the three eras of Taíno history, focusing on the type of conflict in which the Taíno people were engaged.

These three game scenarios can be played individually as standalone games or played as a three-part campaign in which the end state of each game serves as the set up for the next. Each game scenario accommodates 2-4 players and takes between 45-90 minutes to play.

—description from the publisher

name: Cedynia 972
description:
This small game covers the battle of Cedynia. An army of Mieszko I of Poland defeated forces of Hodo or Odo I of Lusatia on 24 June 972, near the Oder river. This battle if often seen as the first documented battle in the history of Poland.

Game contains three scenarios, each of them covers one of the stages of battle. They are meant to be played together, one after another to reflect the entire battle. But players are also allowed to play each of these as stand alone scenario.

Game uses Medieval system rules and ownership of one boxed games of this system is required for the rules, tables and markers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Blue Moon
description:
Overview

Getting a great picture of the moon’s phases is a challenging project! But you’ve set aside the time (and the month) practicing with your telescope’s camera in order to get the best shot possible. But there are other members of your astronomy club who are vying for the same pictures! Compete with your fellow colleagues to practice taking pictures of different phases of the moon over the course of the month in order to score the most amounts of points and claim the title of best astrophotographer!

Summary

Blue Moon is a 1-6 player card game involving open drafting; pattern recognition; pattern building; and scoring different shots of the moon. Players represent members of the astronomy club all competing to get the best photos to score the most victory points and win the game!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: OSICA
description:
Osica is a Japanese trading card game which use many popular Japanese anime IP such as yurucamp, miss kobayashi's dragon maid and so on.
In this game, player will use a deck of their favorite charaters to catch the opponent's heart, the player who makes the opponent's heart to 0 and then directly attack the opponent will win the game.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: BattleTech: Gray Death Legion Heavy Battle Lance
description: Unleash the Gray Death Legion Heavy Battle Lance! Included is the new Regent, a re-posed and jumping Shadow Hawk, and new variants of the Gargoyle and Catapult —no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: The Few and Cursed: Encounter cards
description:
Two new encounter cards for The few and cursed.
In the desert you need water, in the ruins there is a murderer and in the ravine there are strange signs.
On the other card you will meet a hunter in the desert, in the ruins you can try your luck at gambling and in the canyon danger awaits.

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Lannisport City Watch
description:
The Lannisport Enforcers Unit Box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Lannister a new, stalwart unit for their formations. Armed with deadly spears and suited in sturdy armor, they may not be the best choice for a vanguard but having them hold a flank is well within their means as they adapt to both offensive and defensive needs. Plus, their resolve keeps them in a fight, especially when outnumbering the enemy.

Contents:
12 Miniatures
‣ 1 Bannerman
‣11 Lannisport City Watch
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Drowned Men
description: Armored with only their faith, and armed only with deadwood cudgels and other detritus from a storm-wracked shore; the Drowned Men make surprisingly effective support for followers of the Kraken banner. Their presence in battle signifies the Drowned God’s blessing, bolstering men to fight past their wounds and strike all the harder against their foes. While few in number, the drowned Men’s faith is such that they can survive even killing blows. That said, strong as their faith may be, a wise commander should not be putting these fanatics in the vanguard. Working with flankers or in direct support of the line ensures the Drowned God’s blessings are shared equally among his people.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Maszat és az elveszett plüssök
description:
Maszat took a trip to the near forest and only at home he realised that his toys must have escaped while resting and snacking. They are lost. Help them find the way home before sunset or Tigriske the housecat will occupy their basket and they won’t have a place to rest.

This is a cooperative memory game in which you have to find the right tiles in the correct order to guide home the toys before Tigriske completes his track. In your turn you declare which tile you are looking for and if you flip the right one you move the toy closer. If the flipped tile is not the one you were looking for everyone tries to memorise it so you will remember where it is when it’s needed later. With each error Tigriske moves. You win if you guide home all the toys. If Tigriske gets back before the last toy he curls up in the basket leaving no space for the toys and you loose the game.

Based ont he Maszat book series by Judit Berg.

name: Spell Write
description:
Spell Write is a light and fun roll and write game for infinite players.
Your objective is to fill in the Play Grid with 2-4 letter words, as well as earn bonus points along the way.
The player with the highest score by the end of 14 rounds wins the game!

Play alone, or with an infinite # of friends.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Print & Play, Word Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: New Corp Order: Deluxe Edition
description:
This is the Deluxe version which was available during the Kickstarter campaign and has items not included in retail version including:

Wooden custom meeples, additional conglomerate cards,
2 additional companies (6 Cardboard Tiles and 6 cards)

Public Service Advertising
Covert


2 additional consultants (8 cards)

The Networker
Merger/Advisor


Play follows the same rules as the retail version.

Players pick a secret objective at the start of the game and then use their card to plot, infiltrate, and take over companies and conglomerates. The game ends when the Conglomerate deck is depleted. Then, players compare their position on each of the Media Conglomerates, and the players with a better position get points according the Companies controlled by those Conglomerates. You can also get extra points by securing your Secret Objectives, and controlling Consultants.

There will be cards in this game that can also be used in Peak Oil. In addition, Peak Oil's barrels may be used in New Corp Order.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Worker Placement

name: Shadowrun Sprawl: Ops – Legendary Edition
description:
Shadowrun: Sprawl Ops is a competitive game for 2 to 4 players that can be played in 60 to 90 minutes. In this cyber-punk worker-placement game, each player controls a team of Shadow Runners that they can send on missions, loan to other players (for a fee, of course), and upgrade with new tech and equipment. Missions are resolved by rolling combinations of custom dice. A diverse team of Shadow Runners gives you access to more combinations of dice, and your upgrades add even more dice to your pool. Take on smaller missions to earn creds. Then, put those right back into more experienced runners, and better gear. Once you think you've got what it takes, send your runners out to attempt to collect one final score. If you fail, don't worry, your doc-wagon contracts will keep your runners in the game. The first player to successfully complete the final mission, and collect that last big score wins the game!

This Kickstarter Collection Includes:

Legendary Base Game
Kickstarter Co-Op Exclusive Expansion
All Kickstarter Stretch Goals
Kickstarter Map Boards
Kickstarter Boards Included:

Toronto
Neo-Tokyo
Berlin
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: Lord of the Chords: Who Let The Chords Out? – 1st Booster Pack: Advanced Chords
description: Prepare to ask, "What chord is that?" with the Advanced Chords Pack's new game mechanic - Chord Extensions! Play crazy 9ths, 11ths and 13ths to spice up your chords and gain buffs to forte-fy your reign as the Lord of the Chords!

name: Lord of the Chords: Who Let The Chords Out? – 3rd Booster Pack: Modulation
description: Crank complexity up to the maximum with the Modulation pack's new game mechanic; Cadences! Only true music theorists can harness the power of the cadence and slay the composition! Those who lack practice will be revealed! All will be enlightened!

name: Sherlock Holmes: Der Tod des Hutmachers
description:
Escape Card Game for up to 4 players

London, 1891.
The highly respected hatter Mr. Kenworthy is found dead. His store shows no signs of burglary, his body no sign of violence. What happened and who is behind the crime?

In this exciting Escape Room game you slip into the role of master detective Sherlock Holmes to solve the case of the dead hatter. Only if you show a sharp mind, ingenuity and a gift for deduction, you can find the murderer and solve the ominous background of this crime.

—description from the publisher (translated)

London, 1891.
Der hoch angesehene Hutmacher Mr. Kenworthy wird tot aufgefunden. Sein Laden zeigt keine Einbruchsspuren, seine Leiche keinerlei Gewalteinwirkung. Was ist passiert und wer steckt hinter der Tat?

In diesem spannenden Escape-Room-Spiel schlüpft ihr in die Rolle von Meisterdetektiv Sherlock Holmes, um den Fall des toten Hutmachers zu lösen. Nur wenn ihr einen scharfen Verstand, Einfallsreichtum und Kombinationsgabe beweist, könnt ihr den Mörder Stellen und die ominösen Hintergründe dieses Verbrechens aufklären.

—description from the publisher (German)

name: Solo Hockey
description: Solo Hockey is a “ROLL THE DICE AND SEE WHAT HAPPENED” type sport game for 1-2 players. The game is designed to provide excitement and realistic statistics while maintaining as much playability as possible. Only main game events affecting the outcome are recreated.
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: two seesaws
description:
two seesaws is a trick-taking game for 1 to 5 players. The card play is a standard "must-follow" game. There are a series of cards which determine how the trick is resolved.

Two "SEE/SAW" cards determine half of the trump suit, the orientation the winner of a trick places it in, and will be flipped to its opposite side if a black card wins the current trick.

Two "HIGH/LOW" cards determine if low numbers or high numbers win the trick, and will be flipped to its opposite side if a red card wins the trick.

The combination of the two cards in play form a single suit icon which specifies the trump suit.

At the end of each hand, players will earn points for alternating winning SEE and SAW tricks, or something similar to that. Unpaired SEE or SAW tricks will lose a player points. The player with the most points wins.

name: Infinity: Raveneye
description:
The assault on the Raveneye Orbital Complex, a defensive military compound disguised as a communications relay station, has been the key to opening the way for the Morat Aggression Forces’ deployment in the Durgama region, and has furthered the Combined Army’s conquests on Concilium Prima, the political heart of the Human Sphere. What could possibly be so important to the almighty leader of the Combined Army? Or could it be just another smokescreen to divert the attention of the Concilium Coordinated Command?

The book “Infinity: Raveneye” is an expansion for Infinity that broadens its universe and background, focusing on the Military Orders of PanOceania, Ariadna’s Kosmoflot and its new territory of Khurland, the Nomad mothership Corregidor, and the Morat Aggression Forces of the Combined Army, as well as mercenaries for NA2. It also includes three narrative scenarios that recreate the assault on this orbital station, which can be played as a campaign or independently, in addition to painting tutorials for the Military Orders’ Crosiers, Corregidor’s Intruders, Kosmoflot’s Para-Commandos, and Morat’s Vanguard Infantry. Connect now and lead your elite force into the most dangerous war zones of the Human Sphere!
mechanics: Action Points, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Order Counters, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Three Dimensional Movement, Zone of Control

name: Different World Merchant
description:
The only purpose of the players is to make more money than anyone else.
With limited information, let's dispatch a person to manipulate the information and take control of the market.
Aim for the legendary Akind that will remain in posterity!

in this game players will obtain a set number of goods and know the value of 1 of the types. players then must use worker placement to trade the goods they have and effect the market value of their goods.
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Worker Placement

name: Eastern Fleet: Gulf of Aden
description:
In the spring of 1942, the Japanese contemplated invading the British-held island of Ceylon. From there they could strike many strategic targets around the Indian Ocean basin, none of these more vital than the southern outlet of the Red Sea, controlling the sea route to the Suez Canal and on to Europe. Far more important to the Axis cause than Midway Island, Japanese control of the chokepoint at the Strait of Bab-el-Mandeb would have broken British communications with India, Australia and New Zealand except for the lengthy and difficult route around the Cape of Good Hope, and made the entire campaign in North Africa superfluous.

Eastern Fleet: Gulf of Aden is a Campaign Study in the same format as Midway: Rising Sun 1940 or Coral Sea: Defending Australia, with 14 scenarios depicting a Japanese campaign in Gulf of Aden and Arabian Sea opposed by the British Eastern Fleet, heavily reinforced to defend this vital maritime crossroads. To play these scenarios, you’ll need Eastern Fleet, Horn of Africa, Midway Deluxe and Bismarck.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Dragstrip Showdown: Roll & Write Drag Racing
description:
Introduction:
Heat your tires with a good burnout, Stage Your car slowly as you pull up to the starting line, wait for the other driver, amber lights start dropping on the Christmas tree……… yellow……. Yellow……. Yellow……. Green……… full throttle as its time to go….go.…. go.
Hope All is Good and No Major Issues Along the Way to the Finish!
Coming up on the finish, it’s going to be close, cross your fingers and pray the win light comes on. The sport of drag racing is one of the most exciting, entertaining, and fastest past-times in history. Dragstrip Showdown- Roll & Write brings this exciting entertainment to your table top in a quick playing one to two player game.

Overview:
This is a roll and write game using dice and offering fun good decisions to try and cross the finish line first before your competition. Each round, a pool of dice gets rolled and players take turns selecting one die at a time marking the results off on the various player mat tracks which can gain movement, events, and other special actions gained. Players have up to six turns/12 rounds to achieve their goal to enter into the finish zone…sounds easy, as you just hope to get the win light.

name: Koi Garden: Solo & Cooperative Expansion
description: A deck that allows you to play Koi Garden solo and cooperative.

name: Dirty Dragsters
description:
Dirty Dragsters is a competitive drag racing card game with a simple play mechanic for 2 or more players

Each player’s race kit comes in its own unique mint tin, including a car, acceleration cards, Instruction booklet and track pieces.

Start by building the track using track cards from two or more tins. Each heat, players choose any acceleration cards in their hand that add up to 10. This represents their acceleration for the current race. The remaining cards (which also add to 10) will form their acceleration for the next heat.

Shuffle all players’ chosen cards together for the current drag race and deal them face-up one at a time. The face-up deal determines who moves down the track, by how much, and in which order. The player to cross the finish line first wins that heat.

The first player to win five heats wins the championship.

Each car deck comes in its own tin for travel. Any number of players can join the race with a different car. Collect them all!

-description from publisher

name: Pajaritos: Tejiendo Nidos
description:
Spring is coming and the little birds must build their nests. You can help them! Gather the twigs and place the floors so they can build their colonies. There are endless possibilities! Cooperative 3D construction game.

Floor cards are placed on the table, and 5 floors are dealt to each player. The player on the right begins to build, who will have to build according to what the card indicates. If you will have to use short or long twig cards, if you have to balance some nest boxes or if you have to receive a message from the homing pigeon. Once that stage is resolved, you will have to roll the dice and see how many floors you have to go up or down with your little bird. So continue the other players. The game ends when the roof card is drawn or when there are no more floors left.

name: Intime conviction n° 4: L'affaire de la Croque-mort
description:
Sick prank or well-orchestrated vengeance? The gala just started and was going so well…

Jurors, will you make the right decision?
Slip into the shoes of a juror, judge a criminal case and deliver your verdict.

Play with friends for an evening by recreating the atmosphere of a closed session! Or make the fun last by revealing only a few items a day!
"Intime Conviction n° 4: L'affaire de la Croque-mort" is the fourthinstalment of the series of murder solving game by Editions Fika

Content:
- 1 Rule of the game
- 1 Board
- 12 Juror Cards
- 24 Final Voting Cards
- 4 sealed Investigation sheets
- 1 FINAL REVELATION envelope

Intime conviction is a craft object entirely designed, made and assembled by hand and in Belgium. The format of the game is unusual as well: the whole game fits in an envelope.

—description of a distributor.

Two ways to play:
- In group: Play with friends at a party by recreating the closed door ambiance (about 2h game)
- in duo: Make it last by revealing only a few new elements every day.

How to play (condensed):
Place the crime scene in the middle of the table and give each player a Juror card.
Inspect the crime scene, then read the defendant's deposition. Reveal the Juror cards one by one.
When the Jury is ready to vote, the final vote takes place. If a majority isn't reached, the debate continues until someone switches sides.

The verdict is announced, a final revelation is unveiled (brand new information is discovered).
You win if you settled on the right decision.
You loose if the verdict was inadequate.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling, Voting

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Aya Lantern Armor Promo Cards
description:
Beta Rules - 1 x Glossary Card, 2 x Gear Card, 1 Specialization Card that were included with the Aya - Lantern Armor First Run Collector's Edition that was not part of the based game.

1 Glossary Cards for new living glossary: Lantern Armor Proficiency.
New Gear: Soldier Lantern Cuirass and Refined Lantern Axe.
New Specialization: Lantern Armor Proficiency.

The First Run Collector's Edition is enclosed in a hand-stamped kraft box, limited to 500 and includes:

Photoresin Aya - Lantern Armor
1 x Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round insert and base
Large Matte Art Print
Character Art Card
Beta Rules - 2 x Glossary Card, 1 x Gear Card, 1 Secret Fighting Art Card
First run collector's edition: Signed and numbered authenticity note
Deathgrey edition limited to 250: Deathgrey authenticity note

With her wish fulfilled and one of the 13 Death Crowns in hand, Aya found herself unable to face her destiny and joined a settlement where she secretly buried the cursed relic. Lantern years faded into the darkness as Aya became a champion among her peers, the Crown calling her back to defend the rocky prison she had made for it.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Wutaki: Expansion Pack
description:
Contains 3 Expansion modules for Wutaki.

Flagposts: Achieve bonus points through majority bonus.
Rooms: New powerful upgrades for your Towers of Power.
Specialties: Unique skills for your special workers.

name: カメとカエルとエスカルゴ (Turtles, Frogs, and Escargot)
description:
In カメとカエルとエスカルゴ (Turtles, Frogs, and Escargot), you are an archaeologist exploring the "Ruins of Escargot". The players earn victory points by finding traces of the Ruins of Escargot, rescuing wild creatures, and completing unexplored terrain.

It is a hex-based tile placement game, where terrain edges must match, but players are also given fence pieces which can be used to allow non-matching edges to be adjacent.

In addition to points being earned for placing animals next to like animals and placing tiles next to at least 3 other tiles, players are given goal cards to choose from which will earn them points. Some goal cards are public and will score the player points during the game and others are secret and will score at the end of the game. These goal cards have to do with completing areas of certain terrain types or creating large areas of certain terrains.

The game includes a small expansion which adds tiles featuring a railroad.

The player with the most points wins.

name: 平遥 (Heinous)
description:
The objective of the game is to develop your business and make a fortune by running a financial business in the ancient city of Pingyuan, where the financial industry developed during the Ming and Qing dynasties.

What we are selling this time is its Kickstarter version of Heiyuan, which is in English, but there are no changes in the rules and other aspects of the game.

Make money through asset management and currency transfers!

Players will operate several branches and thereby make money. Silver bars in the branches generate investment income at the end of each round. Silver bars in the head office can also be loaned to generate income.

In addition, players can make foreign exchange transfers between the branches and the head office. This allows you to earn commissions on money orders and to invest your bullion until maturity.

You can also strengthen your branch by staffing it with personnel or paying money to the government office to obtain privileges.

Dice Placement

Each player rolls a die each round and places the rolled die on the action square. The player with the higher die roll gets to act first, while the player with the lower die roll gets more powerful effects.

If a die is placed on a square already occupied by another die, the player pays the difference if the die is smaller than the previous die, and receives the difference if the die is larger. A die cannot be placed on a square with the same number of dice as the one already placed on it.

The essence of finance, right here!

Heiho" is a game that successfully incorporates the essence of the financial business, such as money management and foreign exchange transfer, into a game.

The silver bars and copper coins are made of metal, and the components have also been carefully designed.

name: TRICKTAKERs Little
description:
This is a new expansion set for Tricktakers.
Little Tricktakers compete in a combination in a battle of tricks.
You can not only select characters, but also strengthen your hand and select items.
Little Tricktakers was released at the Spring Tokyo Game Market 2022.

name: YES or NO: The Game
description:
Bring the show home! With 200 cards and the ability to play up to 9 people at once, it's easy to see why this is the best-selling and most important game at the Daily Wire (according to Michael Knowles)!
Put your knowledge of your friends and family to the test and ponder our time's most titillating topics with YES or NO!

name: Escape Box: Dinosaurier
description: The famous geologist Professor Flynn has disappeared on his last expedition. As his assistants, you enter a strange underground jungle kingdom populated by dinosaurs. A large volcano is about to erupt and threatens to destroy the newly discovered world. Players have 45 minutes to solve all the puzzles and find the professor.

name: Meeples & Monsters: The Four Towers and Solo Expansion
description:
Aside from Locations, the City board holds four great Towers, one in each district. These Towers have also been under attack. Heroes are required to undertake tasks to help recover artifacts, relieve key figures besieged by enemies, and even to understand the very darkness itself that threatens the country of Rowan - and many of these secrets lie in the Towers.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Worker Placement

name: The Farmer and the Deal
description:
The old farm owner at the farm you used to work at has agreed to rent out a bit of land to you at a discount. As part of the deal you must also provide produce for the restaurant he has an agreement with and provide some compost for the old farmer later in the year. In this solitaire standard deck card game, the player holds the deck sideways in their hand while placing cards sticking vertically out of the deck to dig plots (spades), plant seeds (clubs), care for crops (hearts), and finally sell them (diamonds) or compost them. Played over the course of 2 seasons (turns through the deck), the player must weigh choices carefully to ensure that they use their plots before they reach the top of the deck and don't discard too many of the cards they need to sell/compost enough to meet all the farmer's requirements.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Ring Rivals
description:
Ring Rivals is a quick-fire competitive wrestling card game.

Players choose from a pool of wrestlers with differing strengths and weaknesses and play cards to attempt to beat their opponents in rounds of stat comparisons, allowing them to pin and knock their opponents out of the game until they are the last one remaining.

Each player will have a hand of cards with varying effects and usefulness and must also manage their own stamina resource to survive their opponents' attacks.

—description from the designer

name: Three-man Chess
description:
Three-Man Chess was invented by George R. Dekle Sr. in 1984. It is played on a hexagonal board with 96 quadrilateral cells.

For the most part, three-man chess follows all the normal rules of two-player chess. Different rules only apply in the center of the board. There, bishops can change color, and pawns can capture on three different squares.

The game is won by the first player to checkmate an opponent.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Static Capture

name: Panzer Grenadier: Lithuania's Iron Wolves
description:
Surrounded by three hostile powers — Poland, Germany and the Soviet Union — Lithuania chose not to resist their imperialist advances during the Second World War. The Lithuanian Army consisted of but three infantry divisions, a cavalry brigade and a small tank detachment. But many within the political and military hierarchy, including dictator Antanas Smetona, wished to fight.

Lithuania’s Iron Wolves is an expansion book adding the Lithuanian Army to the Panzer Grenadier system. The 18 scenarios are based on the sort of fighting the Lithuanians saw as likely against the Germans, Poles or Soviets. They’re organized into four chapters with battle games, in our popular story-arc format. They’re not playable alone; you’ll need Fire in the Steppe, Kursk: South Flank, 1940: The Fall of France and The Deluge to play them all.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Panzer Grenadier: Legions of Zog
description:
Italy invaded Albania in April 1939; King Zog I’s Royal Albanian Army had been trained and equipped by Italians, who promptly sabotaged their students’ heavy weapons. The campaign lasted for five days, with the Albanians only able to offer resistance in scattered locations before the Italians crushed them.

Legions of Zog is an expansion for Panzer Grenadier: Conquest of Ethiopia, with four new scenarios and 24 new die-cut and silky-smooth pieces. You'll also need An Army at Dawn. You get the Royal Albanian Army as it stood in April 1939, having to face hordes of Italian invaders. The scenarios unfold in our unique story-arc format, with battle games to tie them together. Can you force the fascists to kneel before Zog?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: River Battleships: Blue Danube
description:
The First Great War ended in December 1916 with Wilson’s Peace, a negotiated settlement that left all parties vaguely dissatisfied (except those no longer called on to die by the millions). The Second Great War erupted in August 1940, with Serbian, Russian, French and Italian armies attacking the Central Powers in a naked grab for territory and power.

Armies and fleets were not the only forces the aggressors deployed. Along the broad Danube River, the Austrian flotilla fought to keep their Serbian enemies from pushing upstream into the heart of the Monarchy. The armored riverine warships, known as monitors, featured heavy guns and thick armor, in effect small battleships maximized for the river environment. But Serbia had built its own fleet of river vessels, as had their ally, Romania.

River Battleships: Blue Danube is an expansion set for Panzer Grenadier: River Battleships. It comes with are 84 new playing pieces: 20 “long” river monitors, 16 “short” river gunboats and minelayers, and 48 standard-sized ones for troops and leaders. Plus, you get a set of 10 scenarios so you can play with them.

River Battleships: Blue Danube is a free expansion set download; you’ll have to assemble the pieces yourself. The rules and maps and markers come from River Battleships.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Tank Chess: UT & AO
description:
Two additional tank types for Tank Chess: Ultra-heavy Tank and Armed Off-road vehicle.

The Ultra-heavy Tank (UT) is the strongest and the slowest vehicle. Its max speed is only 1 and its armor values are V, IV and III. On the front, it has a turrent with a double-barreled gun that shoots in three directions and has a value of V and in the back there is a smaller turret with another cannon (III) that shoots in three directions backwards. Like the Twin-gun Tank, the UT can also shoot at two targets simultaneously. On top of that, being a heavy means that it can destroy tree-type obstacles.

The Armed Off-road vehicle (AO) is the fastest piece in the game (max. 7 speed). The AO movement is different from the other pieces: it does not lose movement steps due to turning. Because of this, it can move even further, but at the same time it cannot rotate in place. Therefore, in each step this piece can move to a square that is right in front or to the squares that are left or right to that square.
When moving backwards, just like any other piece, Armed Off-road vehicle can only move once to the square that is right behind. But in this situation it may also turn at 45 degrees simultaneously (left or right).
The AO does not have any armour (0, 0, 0), and it has a recoilless gun that can shoot only right in front due to the mounting. The gun is weak(it has a value of I) and its range is limited to 5 squares (even though it can shoot over obstacles), which is another distinctive feature.

—description from the rules
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Brood
description:
Brood is a polyhex-matching game for two players – Black and White – played on an initially empty hexagonal board.

Rules:
• On the very first turn, Black places one stone on any hex.
• From then on, starting with White, the players take turns placing exactly two stones each on empty hexes.
• A player is allowed to pass instead of placing their two stones.
• When the players pass in succession, the game is over, and the player with the higher score wins.

Scoring and the definition of a brood:
• The score is a function of the players' broods.
• A brood is a set of groups of the same shape, size and color.
• Shapes are considered identical even if they are rotated or mirrored.

Example: A black group consisting of 3 stones in a line makes up a brood together with all and only black groups of 3 in a line.

• The point value of a brood is the number of stones in it multiplied by the smallest of the following two numbers:
(i) The number of groups in it.
(ii) The size of the groups in it.

Example: If Black has 4 groups that are 3 stones in a line, this brood is worth 36 points. That's the number of stones in it (12) multiplied by the size of the groups in it (3).

—description from the designer

name: Blueprint Studio
description:
Blueprint is a roll and write game for 1 to 4 players.

Players take the role of architects who have to draw the plans for a house during the first phase, and complete rooms with the right objects in the second phase.

Every turn, a player rolls 3 dice, setting aside one die exclusively for their use and allowing the rest of the players to use one of the two remaining dice. Each die provides access to a supplier, which allows players to draw rooms on their floor plan, or to draw the objects inside them. Increase the value of the house by completing rooms, customer requests, or being the first to reach an achievement. To complete a room place your particular piece of furniture next to two of your other allowed pieces of furniture.

After 8 rounds, the player with the highest valued house wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Rome & Roll: Characters Expansion 2
description:
Two additional characters (Praetorian and Seneca the Elder) that were created during the Kickstarter-campaign of the Rome & Roll: Gladiators expansion and are sold separately afterwards.

The difference between each character is their starting advantage and the set of 3 advisors every character has.

This expansion also contains 4 alternative Resource trackers.
categories: Ancient, City Building, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Variable Player Powers

name: Ivion: Winterstorm
description:
The Skels are in danger. The destructive, supernatural Winter sweeps across the isles, forcing good folk to do anything to survive. It is a dark age of chaos, magic, and fear. Can you create a hero that will beat back the cold, or embrace its malefic power?

Ivion is a 1v1 or 2v2 dueling card game where players construct decks, or 'characters', to battle their friends on a 4x4 tile grid. Each card you draw is a brutal attack, a cunning trick, or a powerful spell. You must outwit your opponent and stay focused, for one misstep could mean a cruel end.

This first edition of Ivion was released in 2018, and has a different graphic design from the rest of Ivion. This means that it is only compatible with other Ivion products if played with sleeves.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Interrupts, Resource to Move, Take That

name: What On Earth Are You Talking About?
description:
You are an alien.

You and your crew have travelled far and wide in search of intelligent life, and you’ve finally found it! Sort of. You’ve observed these curious creatures on their little rock hurtling through the deep void of space, and now you think you have seen enough. You abduct a couple of humans and are ready to make first contact.

'What On Earth Are You Talking About?' is the brand new party game from the creators of Psycho Killer: The Card Game!

In 'What On Earth Are You Talking About?', two teams race to translate uniquely human concepts into something even an alien can understand.

Compete against your friends and the intergalactic language barrier as your crewmates rush to figure out what on earth you are talking about!

Each round takes between 15 to 45 minutes (depending on how many players you're playing with), and is recommended for both humans and aliens aged 17 and up.

---

'What On Earth Are You Talking About?' is split into two card types:

Earth Cards: Each featuring a peculiar human behaviour or concept. E.g. 'Climate Change', 'Doing The Worm', 'Circumcision' etc.
Alien Cards: Each populated with a string of letters that will make you think and talk like an alien. E.g. O C Q Y S R T Y N

So, with the above letters, a Human might say:

"OCEAN COMING QUICKLY! YOU SHOULD RELISH THESE YEARS. NO BEARS WORLD WIDE"

In this example, the correct guess would be 'Climate Change'.

Each correct guess earns your team 1 point, and the team who completes an orbit of Earth first... wins!
mechanics: Communication Limits, Deduction, Real-Time, Semi-Cooperative Game, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Coupling, the Game
description:
Coupling, the Game is The ultimate party game in which you will discover more about your friends in 45 minutes than you did in your whole life, AND have a blast at the same time! It's a game for stronger friendships, deep conversations and a fun evening, with a healthy amount of competition, lots of laughter, a pinch of tickling and, for the most playful, a bit of singing and dancing.

The basic version of the game contains 10 mini-games on 120 COUPLING cards, which, combined with unique mechanics, make a highly dynamic game. More than 500 combinations of questions and challenges break even the toughest ice and ensure that the game is still fun even after you play it with the same group of friends for the tenth time.

You play the game in three stages:

Like in life, every player starts out as single. Then, through random questions and fun personal stories, you couple up with two players.
These two players now compete for your affection in the second stage through exciting challenges: charades with sounds, mouth reading, recipes and geometric shapes and lines.
In the third stage, it’s Couples Showdown, where each player competes along with their best partner for a glorious victory against other couples through new mini games: multiple choice cards to challenge your beliefs, personal questions that you may have always wanted to talk about, but didn't dare ask, psychological pictures to see what’s beyond obvious, and drawing things and associations to release your inner Picasso.


First couple to get through the FINISH LINE wins and gets to sit in the glorious winning spot!

Two players can use the cards to get to know each other better. Additional blank cards can be purchased to expand the game to 12 players.
mechanics: Connections, Drawing, Matching, Multi-Use Cards, Player Judge, Team-Based Game

name: Age of Steam: England
description:
Because there where a large number of requests for one of Winsome Games' earliest maps, the England map is available again.

The Age of Steam: England expansion map is a big, expansive 3 panel map in the style of the original Rust Belt map, found in every Age of Steam game. It is best for 5 or 6 players. The expansion can be used with every licensed Age of Steam game, from the original Winsome printing, the later Warfrog printings, the early Eagle printings and the latest Eagle printing of Age of Steam Deluxe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation

name: Magic: The Gathering – Dominaria United
description:
This Magic: The Gathering expansion returns to the world of Dominaria just as a new Phyrexian invasion has begun, led by the praetor Sheoldred. Can the heroes of Dominaria unite to fight them back, or will they be undone by the traitor lurking among their own ranks?

Dominaria United is sold in draft boosters, set boosters, collector boosters, jumpstart boosters, and bundles. Additionally, two preconstructed Commander decks were released alongside the main set as tie-ins.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Take That

name: H.D.P.: Tu Vieja
description: Micro expansion with 9 (1 black + 8 white) new cards to finish the phrase Yo Mama...
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Munchkin: Goats
description: Munchkin Goats is a new mini-expansion that adds a herd of new Doors and Treasures to your Munchkin decks. Be sure to wear your More Hair Coat while you try hopping over the Goat Moat on your way to take down Baphomet!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Strange Orbit: Undermine
description:
Strange Orbit: Undermine is an action-strategy game played in quick rounds. Players only have a few turns to get in, secure their haul, and extract their spoils on a collapsing asteroid. Strange Orbit features a tactile world composed of hexagonal resource tiles, which ensures that each game's layout is unknown and requires crafty exploration using each character's unique abilities. The player who collects the most valuable haul after the asteroid collapses is deemed the winner.

On each turn, players receive 10 action points to move, climb, build, deposit, and disrupt other players on a living board that is constantly changing shape. Players search the board for valuable minerals such as gold, emeralds, and diamonds in order to extract and deposit in their personal stashes. Be careful however, as players must be careful around other players who may attempt to steal or destroy their resources.

In Strange Orbit, players will take on the role of a Triffling crew member on The Big Rig, a staging vessel for descents into the dangerous caverns of the asteroids. Due to hefty commissions and the Triffling's quarrelsome nature, miners will compete to be the one with the most glittering gems and gold. Pushing, stealing, or even undercutting the gem market are all tools for the miners to swing fortune in their favor. Don't be the one to dawdle too long, as the unstable cavern formations are soon to collapse into rolling magma!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Contracts, Hexagon Grid, Market, Multiple Maps, Take That, Three Dimensional Movement, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: LaGulch
description:
A cooperative PnP survival game for 1-100 players, procedurally-generated with Go and XeLaTeX. Try to survive eight nights by enduring nightly events, foraging for resources, crafting items, and managing your mental health.

Each time you play LaGulch, you generate a new game using a software program. This program randomizes and generates the game sheet. Print as many as you'd like for however many players are playing.

Each night, roll a die and apply the effect of the event. During the day, roll again to forage for items. Optionally, you can reduce your mental health to gain additional value when foraging.

Players can decide to use their foraged items to craft items that help themselves personally, or contribute them to the group to craft larger items like a shelter or fire.

—description from designer
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Twisted Fables: Mulan Playmat with Stage Card
description:
650mm x 345mm playmat featuring the artwork of Mulan with stage card - Hive Outpost. It offers a glimpse into her bleak, violent interstellar universe, launching you onto the dangerous platform of a satellite outpost where you do not want to fall off the edge.

The Hive Outpost reads: Each time a fable inflicts damage on an opponent, she gains Damage +1 if the opponent is on the edge of the fighting track.

name: Deadly Dinner: Tödliches Versprechen
description:
A dream wedding in the Caribbean: In Deadly Dinner, the small wedding party has arrived to celebrate the most beautiful day in the life of the bride and groom. But before the celebration can really begin, the groom is found dead.

The host invites the guests to a dinner party, where they take on the roles of murder suspects. One of them has committed the murder, but all of them have secrets they would rather keep to themselves. Over the course of three rounds, they try to get behind the secrets of the other players without making themselves suspects. The common goal is to solve the murder case - or get away with the bloody deed.

Deadly Dinner - Tödliches Versprechen is the fourth game of the Deadly Dinner series.

A game of Deadly Dinner consists of three rounds, in which everyone receives new information about the crime. In each round, the players also receive secret objects that can be found in envelopes in the package. The players must discuss their information and clues in the group in order to identify the perpetrator at the end. In order to prepare, the players should receive the starting information about their character a few days before playing.

—description from publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Real-Time, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: Charmed and Dangerous: Finding Gossamyr – Story Pack
description:
Story Packs add new content to your existing FOE decks, allowing you to revisit familiar adventures by adding brand new twists! This Finding Gossamyr Story Pack adds characters and adventures from the hit, all-ages Gossamyr Saga graphic novels. These cards will take you back to the Jade Fortress to face off against the sinister Skaythe Assassin Nerissa inside her unique Lair.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Fantasma
description:
For centuries, Norfolk Castle has been the scene of terrifying events! All because of the ravenous ghost that haunts him. To defeat this evil specter it is necessary to lock it back into the crypt. Three fearless hunters will venture through the castle rooms to end the dark curse. And to do so they will use all possible means ... including magic!
A game of fear and terror A Ghost to lock up, mysterious rituals to perform for an ultimate thrill adventure Use the Decoder Disc to discover the secret elements of the Ghost.

The players will have to move their pawns inside the board, which represents the castle where the ghost roams free.
Using the powers of the cards, players will have to overcome all the obstacles and enemies present in the various rooms of the castle and collect the various elements present, in order to correctly perform the magical ritual, using the decoder disc to know the secret elements necessary to imprison the ghost once and for all.

name: Greenrock Village: Tatort – Schrebergarten
description:
Greenrock Village: A small town never rests.

After the series of murders was finally cleared up in the local municipal theater, it seemed as if the community would be able to go about their daily business without worries. But that shouldn't last long, because a new horrific series of murders interrupts the short period of calm. Who murdered the owner? Was it Mrs. Kunz? Or Mr. Müller? Someone is up to mischief in the allotment gardens. In each of the five gardens there is an object that could have served as a murder weapon. Owners and visitors visit these gardens at different times. But one of them thinks less about gardening or relaxing...

Who will expose the killer? This game for one person with a total of 50 murder cases requires criminalistic skills and a good nose, because the 3 different levels of difficulty are a tricky task for amateur detectives. Who accepts the challenge so that the murders in the allotment gardens finally come to an end?

Match, puzzle and find the killer. Choose one of the 50 cases (these are marked in three levels of difficulty) and use the clues on the card to put the pieces in the right order. So you end up with an accurate picture of who the killer is. This game is just right for all hobby detectives, brain joggers, riddles and riddle friends and can also be taken with you on trips thanks to the practical packaging.

name: Outsphere Fragments
description:
Fragments is a game where you create stories of which you are the heroes.
Immerse yourself in the world of the OUTSPHERE saga from Guy-Roger Duvert.
Draw from your imagination, discover the secrets of Eden, the planet that should host humanity.

The ship went through space in dead silence. It went, smoothly, through skies that no human had explored before. Its hull, of a metallised brown, was in a perfect state.
The passageways were soaked in a cold and freezing silence. Suddenly, the metal and glass cylinders started shaking and the powerful lights installed on the ceilings, turned on. You emerge from your cryo-sleep as the Arche stops in front of Eden
Embody the characters from the OUTSPHERE saga and live an adventure full of twists through 5 secret envelopes to unlock.
Each turn, pick a Word card and tell a fragment of the story.
The Symbol-Icon match will change your adventure in a good or a bad way.
Your mission: create OUTSPHERE and save Humanity.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Legacy Game, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Hellboy: The Board Game – Drinking With Skeletons
description:
The Drinking With Skeletons resin diorama features a removable Hellboy figure that you can use in your adventures. Also includes a brand new Deck Of Doom card that's specific to Hellboy.

Resin model supplied unpainted and unbuilt.

Includes:
- 1 x unpainted & unassembled resin diorama with detachable Hellboy miniature
- 1 x Deck Of Doom card (Drinking with Skeletons)
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Queue 4
description:
In Queue 4, you must go through a standard deck of cards by playing the top card into one of four ordered Queues. However, you don't get to see the card before you play it, and placing a card in the wrong position discards the Queue, bringing the end of the game ever closer. In order to win and score big, you must play the odds, take calculated risks, and press your luck.

The game also comes with three Variants: The Royal Ball, where each face card has a special effect when played; Bouquets, where the player must strategically place and move cards in order to create one long Queue with alternating colors; and a Campaign mode, where several games are chained together.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Drawing, Ordering, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Intime Conviction n° 6: L'affaire des flammèches
description:
Jurors, will you make the right decision?

Slip into the shoes of a juror, judge a criminal case and deliver your verdict.

The Quebec band JAZZEUR BORÉAL is on tour in Europe. Is their backing singer responsible for causing a fire and the death of a show technician?

In Intime Conviction, players embody a group of jurors for an evening or a week. First, they will have to analyze the facts against the accused. Once all the actions of the juror cards have been completed, the game ends with a final vote where the players will have to decide by majority whether or not the accused is guilty in a criminal case.

In pairs or more, the participants will see their opinions put to the test more than once over the cards and the debates! During the final vote, it is alone in the face of their intimate conviction that they will have to find the way to victory.

Play with friends for an evening by recreating the atmosphere of a closed session! Or make the fun last by revealing only a few items a day!

Content:
- 1 Rule of the game
- 1 Portrait of the accused & her statement
- 1 Scene of the crime
- 12 Juror Cards
- 1 Discovery Pass
- 24 Final Voting Cards
- 3 sealed fact sheets
- 1 FINAL REVELATION! To reveal at the end of the game

Intime conviction is a craft object entirely designed, made and assembled by hand and in Belgium. The format of the game is unusual as well: this game is in an envelope.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling, Voting

name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere
description: The Inner Sphere sourcebook provides information on the five great Houses- Kurita, Davion, Liao, Marik, Steiner -as well as the lesser powers of the Periphery. The Inner Sphere also offers general histories of each society, comprehensive maps and a section detailing ten key worlds of the Inner Sphere.

name: Dubble Up
description: In this game, chits with different symbols on them - wheels, anchors, bells, crowns, and stars - are distributed amongst the players, who keep their pile face down. On each turn, a player tries to match a symbol with the preceding one to create a pair or chain for ever-increasing bonuses.

name: Turbo Town
description:
Prove that you are the most skilled mechanic in Turbo Town and repair broken vehicles before your opponents do!
Will you be the fastest mechanic?

In a hectic city with illegal racing and impatient drivers who want their vehicles fixed now, if you want to be the most famous mechanic in town, you must repair vehicles before your rivals, but choose your customers wisely!

In this fast-paced game, 2 to 6 players compete in quick, 30-minute games that can only be won by one player!

You will assign the dice you obtain to vehicles to repair them, taking into account the unique ability of your mechanic and that you can re-roll them up to 3 times.

When you complete your victory objective card, you will trigger the end of the game.

Each car gives you a number of points, but if you get sets by colour, you will also score points!

-description from designer

(Español)
Demuestra que eres el mecánico más habilidoso de todo Turbo Town y repara los vehículos averiados ¡antes que tus oponentes!

En una ciudad frenética con carreras ilegales y conductores impacientes que quieren su vehículo arreglado ¡ya!, si quieres ser el mecánico más famoso de la ciudad, deberás reparar los vehículos antes que tus rivales, pero, ¡elige bien los clientes!

En este trepidante juego compiten de 2 a 6 jugadores, en partidas rápidas, de unos 30 minutos de duración, que ¡sólo puede ganar uno!
